Check in and check out was very easy Paul made it as convenient as possible for us. AND he is very good with communicating with us. Seriously 20 out of 10! Such a great and clean place! Thank you again Paul! :)
Really nice apartment. Ethan is a very good host. There are very goods tacos place near the apartment =), and the neighborhood is fun
Reno's place is beautiful! Very charming and spacious apartment in a fantastic location in Brooklyn heights.

Nick was extremely helpful! My husband and I really appreciate his hospitality and kindness. Nick helped us figured out the way to the apartment and gave us a list of wonderful recommendations of restaurants and cafes, we would definitely stay at Nick's when we travel to New York next time!

Pete & Julie provided us with an amazing first Airbnb experience. We felt warmly welcomed since the initial discussion about our stay through the check-out. Their studio is very spacious in a luxury building with very friendly 24-hour doormen on duty who received us very courteously. Their studio is also perfectly located near several good eateries. They gave us lots of recommendations from transportation, walking around, and places to eat, which helped us get around easily and enjoy great foods in the area.

Pamela's place is the real deal art/music home.  With a variety of instruments and interesting images adorning the apartment, your eyes will never get bored. It's only a few blocks from a great coffee shop that I frequented often. Pamela was great.  Super-friendly and so easy to be around.  I'd stay again, for sure.
Amazingly well situated in downton Manhattan and affordable. . We had a great stay, merci Alexia!

The stay at Eric's apartment was by far our favorite stay on Airbnb. The room was very spacious as well as the rest of the apartment. It's a very short walk to the express A train and lots to do in the area. Eric himself was very accommodating and helpful and an amazing host. We are definitely very appreciative of everything!

Very comfortable apartment that was ready for our stay. 
Unfortunately we were not provided with necessary instructions before arrival and had to wait for wifi access tips. In addition the Laundry machine was available in the basement floor for pay only (what was not stated before). The day before departure we were surprised being warned that checkout time should be 10am.

The location is wonderful, in a charming angle of a real neighborhood. Meghan provided everything we needed for our brief stay in the city; the apartment was clean, well furnished, and even had air conditioning and WiFi. I'm sure we'll be returning on our next trip to NYC!

We had a great experience staying at Ted's place. He made getting the key a simple process and everything was clean, tidy, and ready for us when we got there. The room is small, but not for NYC standards. Don't expect to have someone sleep on the couch if they need a lot of room. If you want to sleep on the couch and can handle NYC living, however, it should be no problem. The neighborhood is the best part of this apartment, as it is 2 blocks away from some of the best dining (especially brunch, try beauty and Essex or Hotel Chantelle!) the city has to offer.

Loren kept in touch with us by text giving us thorough instructions for our arrival.we never got to meet loren as she was out of town
She did keep in touch  via text and her roomate was there if we needed anything.the room is spacious and in a great (Website hidden by Airbnb) is also very handy to the transit system.onstreet parking was easy to find

We loved this place so so much. The apartment was beautiful, Brooklyn and exactly what we wanted to experience. The neighborhood is nice, awesome places to have breakfast, dinner places and party is very near, just a 15-20 minute walk, and its also fairly easy to get into Manhattan. Abby was great when arranging, and Joanna, her roommate was lovely and gave us some very good advice on what to do.  All in all we loved it!

We stayed in here and we liked very much.Sophie's friend Dumebi is very friendly and helpful.The location is very good and building is very safe.Also there are many stores,market and cafes close to here.If we go to NY again we will go to here!

The place is perfectly located, very easy to go anywhere using the subway or walking.
Ece and Brett, the 2 roomates who welcomed me, as Naz was abroad, have been always very nice and friendly. As I was working a lot, I did not get the chance to exchange more with them but I felt welcomed and felt I could ask for support or help if necessary.
Nice to have alse your own bathroom, especially when you need to wake up early.

Maria was a very friendly and accommodating host. The space was clean and tidy with all amenities. It is an incredibly short walk to the g train and not long from the L train. It was only about a 15-20 minute commute for me to get into midtown manhattan. Greenpoint is a great neighborhood, with a lot of restaurants, shops and bars; and it is a short walk to Williamsburg.

Fantastic experience. Host and roommate were both very responsive and helpful throughout my stay. Apartment has fantastic views of the Manhattan skyline. Clean and spacious. No complaints. Fully recommend.
Great place and hosts very friendly and available !

If you are looking for an apartment stay in Harlem, Felema's apartment is a must! From day one her correspondence was excellent. The apartment was very clean and cozy. I could not have chosen a better location.

The communication with Julio was a catastrophe. He answered 8 hours after my request that room is occupied but didn't cancel the booking. So I paid for the room without sleeping there. Still waiting to get a refund!

My wife and I stayed at Yana's place for 7 days. Communication with her was quick and accurate. She provided us with all the information we needed, plus she gave us basic tips on how to explore and navigate the city, a city map, and where to buy our dairies, location of nearest groceries etc.. The neighbourhood is very central and well connected to the main tube lines (you can get to uptown, Brooklyn or the financial district in just a few stops). The apt is welcoming and cozy, with everything you need (from cutlery to bath towels). We had breakfast both at home and in the coffee shops right down the road. I definitely recommend this place.
We had a great time at Maggie's Appartement. Everything as described.

These two girls made my stay so welcoming that it really felt like I was in a home, not a rental (and why I love Airbnb over corporate hotels sometimes). Communication was awesome and fast! Their 2 cats kept me company (thank you Mr. Miffles and Bunnie!). And it's a super short walk to Halsey station that takes you straight to JFK.
Little touches like having towels and a loofah already on the bed for me, the smell of lavender from the candle and string lights on the bed (my favorite!) made me happy. 
I wish my trip hadn't been so short but next time I'll be back to try Saraghina's and say hi to these lovely ladies!
Good rental.
Great host. Responds quickly if you need anything.  Nice space too.

Pierre was a great host! He was very kind and considerate, asking how everything was going and answering any questions I had within a day or so. He was also very flexible with times, which was extremely helpful for me. The apartment was perfect. The subway was only a short walk away and grocery stores, laundry, many bars and restaurants were just around the corner. The apartment came equipped with everything I could possibly needed. Overall, a great experience

Eilon was a great host! He was always available before and during our journey for questions. The apartment and his location was great. We were very close the subway and it was easy to move all around manhattan. We had a great time in New York!

I was honored to be the 1st airbnb guest of Shaun and not a bad start. I gave Shaun numerous suggestions to improve this listing and i hope he follows suit because the potential is there. Definitely a convenient area of Bushwick for those specifically interested to visit this area. Building is quiet and street noise is very low. Good place for a single traveler or very budget challenged couple.

Emma's gem of an apartment was exactly as listed and I had a wonderful weekend there.  The apartment is incredibly well-located, clean, bright, and lovely and Emma and her roommate Priya were great hostesses.  We had some nice chats and shared a beer or two, and they gave me great suggestions for exploring the area.  Very highly recommended!

I really enjoyed staying at Jason's. Never got to meet him but his roommate made me feel very welcome and at home. If you are looking for a true Brooklyn experience this is the place for you. Nice little garden, shops near by and the Subway is very close. If you are very particular about cleanliness, this might not be the place for you. But I enjoyed my stay.
jonathan is very nice, considerate and accommodating. the apartment was spotless and neat!
Quinn's place was great! Very private, and comfortable.Quinn was awesome about communicating anything I needed to know. I'd definitely recommend this room as a place to stay.

A great meeting. 
Kalen is a fantastic person, the apartment is very nice and the location is just perfect.
What i have to say, is that i will go there again.

Thank you for everything.

If you tying to get a prompt response from the host, this is not the place. It took us hrs to try to get in touch with the host after he confirm the request( which that didn't take long at all) to get some details about the room. Room was smelly like old cigarettes and dusty. Until the last moment, the host still had no response after we left. It was not an joyful experience overall.

We had a last minute cancellation and had to scramble to find a place to accommodate us.  We were not able learn a whole lot from the photos but the place looked to be a good size and location for our needs.   When we arrived William greeted us at the door and led to the second floor of his town home. There we were pleasantly surprised what the photos did not reveal, in addition to the bedrooms there was a small fully equipped kitchen a sitting area a large closet that would serve as a Manhattan bedroom.  The apartment was brightly lit with natural light and furnished with restored antique furniture.

We found the apartment to be very charming and William to be very helpful and friendly.  I would definitely recommend this place to a friend.

Great experience. Everything went smoothly.
Anais was very welcoming host who i saw an hour before i checked out. Grazie! :)

Cameron was a great host, unfortunately I didn't get to meet him face to face, but he was always in contact and checking if I needed anything. He welcome us with a nice bottle of wine and his sister who waited for us to open the door was very helpful and smiling. Cameron was kind enough to send an email while he was on his own trip on how to use the TV and entertainment system.  Cameron's place its exactly as advertise; in a beautiful, entertaining and safe area with easy walks to everything. The apartment is a truly New Yorker apartment, that is small but enough for 4 people and all that you need. I recommend Cameron's place and be sure to explore the neighborhood.

My stay at Rebecca's was remarkable. Being my very first Airbnb experience, I couldn't have asked for a better experience. The apartment was just as advertised, clean with lots of natural light and ventilation. I did not need the AC or fan at all. However, the bathroom is very small.

The apartment was super easy to find on my own in a new area. The neighbourhood was very safe (even at 4am in the morning), with lots of shops, markets and friendly folk. The only thing was the length of walk to the subway station (about 5-6 blocks)...but I needed the exercise anyhow, lol.

Although, I didn't get to meet Rebecca in person...she was most helpful and responsive before, throughout and after my stay. I would highly recommend this cozy apartment to anyone. Made me feel like a real New Yorker!
Glenn was a great host and his room was awesome!  The apartment is in a great location and close to the subway. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting NYC!

Great Apt! Great location! And wonderful host :) 
We had a great time,Mary left us a clean and cozy place. Thanks!!!

It was a really cool stay. The building is new than other buildings in the zone. 
The apartment is really cool and it has all the facilities that was mentioned.
We didn't have the opportunity to know Dada, but his roommates are really cool people.
Dada was in contact with us to help with any problem.
Perfect stay at Merritt apartment! Everything was exactly per description and finally a quiet apartment after a busy day in Manhattan. Thanks Merritt!

Olga was a great host. She had prepared all the information we needed for a comfy stay at her place. The building felt very safe and it was a great location, close to Central park and the Metro. The apartment was exactly as expected from the photos. The apartment was perfectly clean and there was no problem staying 2 adults and a baby. I would absolutely recommend this apartment and Olga as a host.
Awesome stay - fantastic location, impeccably clean apartment, no problems whatsoever!

Erin and Sigrid have a very nice apartment in alphabet city. Spacious and comfortable in a great location. 

My only complaint would be lack of amenities. The gas is turned off, apparently has been for awhile, there was only one roll of TP for our whole stay, and the trash was full when we arrived and were given no instruction on how to empty it. 

These things can easily be fixed, I wouldn't let them deter anyone from staying here. Great neighborhood with lots of good places to go. 

Also wpuld have been great to know about the 7 flights of stairs we had to climb!

David and his girlfriend are really nice.  They are very helpful and friendly. David sent the keys by fedex. The appartment is like in the pictures and in a very good location. The bed is confortable and the appartment was clean. I will totally recomend this place, metro station is close and TimeSquare is 20 min by metro. I was really happy in David's place.  I totally recommend. The communication was perfect with David and he was always willing to answer my questions.  Thank you :)

This was a lovely apartment, in a perfect area. We stayed for a week. Stuart had a lovely welcome basket of wine and snacks for us. His place was comfortable, clean, and with lots of room for clothes and stuff . . . and that amazing shower! There are lots of restaurants, cafes, and boutiques in the area. I was so sad to leave!

I really enjoyed Michael as a host.  He was more than accommodating, and  his place is up to snuff.  This is the south Bronx yet the you still feel safe and are within a few steps of the subway, and bus.

Room was lovely and exactly as pictured. Great transport links to pretty much everywhere you would want to go in the city. Harlem is a fun neighbourhood although it can be loud until late at night/from early in the morning, and combined with the fairly ineffective curtains, if you're a light sleeper this might not be the place for you. Didn't bother us however. Biggest issue with the apartment was that the shower takes an astonishingly long time to heat up, but on the whole I wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying here, as it's just as beautiful as it looks, and this is only a minor concern.
Nice gym and laundry room. Other students were very noisy outside during quiet hours. I had some other minor facilities upkeep issues.
Anna was great to work with, very responsive. We appreciated the fact that it was a timeshare instead of someone's personal belongings. The location was very central to everywhere we wanted to visit.

For those in love with the vibrancy of the East Village, this is a fantastic apartment. The street itself is quiet at night, while surrounded by quaint shops and great restaurants and bars. 
My interactions with Aviad were always first rate.

Anthony was quick in his responses which helped us plan our Newyork trip well. He also helped us in providing places we could visit and local restaurants we should try while we are in NewYork. 

The apartment was clean and tidy. It was perfect for two people. But for the noise on the streets(which I believe is unavoidable if you stay in the city) we had a great stay.

I will definitely stay in the same place if I visit Newyork again.

We spent a couple of days at Andrew's place on october and it was great. Her friend Cristine welcomed us at the apartment and helped us with some issues we had with our luggage. Andrew was a great host giving us some information on restaurants and shops in the zone and around the city.

The apartment is in the Upper West side, 10 minutes to Central Park, and 2 minutes from the subway station to the Red line (8 stops to Times Square, 4 with the Express line) which drives you directly to Midtown and Downtown. It's also cool just walk from the apartment to times square to enjoy the city, it take around 30 minutes walking. So it is really well located.

The studio is very nice, with a little terrace, and includes everything you need to enjoy your stay. It is quite, clean and comfortable and has a nice neighborhood. It is excellent for two persons to explore the Big Apple. It is also close to restaurants and supermarkets, and has nice parks around. Definitely, we would love to go to Andrew's place again the next time we'd go to New York. We highly recommend

Noelle was very accommodating and friendly. Bed was comfy. Location was really good. Her roommates were cool, and my only regret was not hanging out with them more. If you're in your 20's or early 30's you'll love staying here. If you're a any older than that this might not be the best option for you.
Great place! Quiet, clean, roommates kept mostly to themselves but were friendly.  Def recommend

Though the house is a little bit far away from Manhattan, it is convenient to go from central NYC to the house by taking free ferry. The house is really large and it is suitable for a group of people. It is an old house but things there are still quite good. We enjoy our stay there for two nights!

I stayed at Ritchie's place for 3 nights. The apartment's location is perfect for visiting the City: most attractions are easily reachable via express trains from nearby stations (ride times are 15-30 minutes depending on where you are going). 
The apartment itself was clean and neat, although very old and in a somewhat come down building.
Check in and out was super smooth and uncomplicated.
Wi-fi was not very strong or reliable, but suited our purposes.
June is a nice girl and her place is very convenient for both restaurants and transport. The R/M subway station is one minute from the apartment which is only 5 stop ride to Central Park.
Really good! Enjoyed the apartment, and the guests were great! Loved Oliver (the cat )!
He was very accommodating and super nice. I loved my time there

The apartment really made our trip! It was so conveniently located to travel both to the center of Manhattan (we usually walked) and to Brooklyn and New Jersey. Plus there were so many amazing restaurants around and unfortunately we didn't have enough time to visit all of them.
The apartment is very big, there were 3 of us staying there and we had enough space for all of us and 3 big suitcases.
Communication was great, guys really made an effort to make us feel welcome - they even left some chocolates and a bottle of wine as well as nicely decorated sets of shampoos, conditioners & soaps.
Overall, amazing place to stay! I'll definitely book again when I come to New York next time.

Anita was great at communication throughout the stay (we had to ask about blankets and raising the thermostat after the first night) and very flexible on arrival and departure time. She is also a warm and welcoming host, meeting us at the apartment and going over WiFi and other details.

The apartment itself is wonderfully located 2 blocks from Central Park, the museum mile and the great shops and restaurants of the Upper West Side along Columbus Ave. We had no issues with neighbors or the building management.

Our one regret was the discomfort of the full sized bed, which creaked loudly and sunk in the middle despite the modest size of the occupants (we are both runners and were eager for a good night's sleep). Visitors should also know that the shower is not a stand-alone entity, but contiguous with the sink and toilet area. We had the impression from the photo of a spa-like shower space.

Otherwise, we enjoyed our temporary nest on the Upper West Side.
Great location. Nice home decor. Always online to answer all our questions.

Lori was a really nice host. She was easy to get in contact with and had clear instructions about how to use the apartment etc... However, the apartment was filthy dirty. Both me and a friend I was traveling with were extremely disappointed and grossed out that there was not any cleaning done ahead of time. Even the simplest of things were not clean. It made the stay really hard so we made sure to spend as little time as possible in the apartment because it was just plain gross. I was really disappointed in this experience overall. Hopefully she will clean for her next guests.

We chose this apartment/neighborhood because I wanted to show my kids where my husband lived when his father was a medical resident at the hospital off Amity St, just blocks away. Also visited siblings in Manhattan. 

Check in was easy. Apartment was clean and tidy. Comfy home with soft sheets and towels. Super safe neighborhood with tons of places to eat. Easily found street parking. Host was easy to reach and reached out to see if we needed anything. Very nice stay.

Anja and Jen were fantastic! I was looking for a place for someone else to stay and they were very understanding and accommodating about me wanting to see it first, etc. The apartment is in a wonderful location and the people I was arranging it for loved it.

Our First Airbnb. Yes, we gave Airbnb a shot! Not certain to take it up again. Unfortunately, this was certainly not the place the Host advertised to be. Completely different address deliberately sent via text after booking poor location littered homeless food desert - no bed sheets - soiled pillow cases - unsanitary bath cat and human hair everywhere AND a clean fee was charged beforehand :/ We booked a room w private bath. Yet without notice the hosts hosts husband walked in on us. They weren't to be in town. Wow. Obviously the room or the apt common areas weren't cleaned. A hassle to sort out. Host bullied, for a positive review. Not good. Embarrassed. Hassle. Positive: Quiet Room. 1.5 blocks from mainline subway. Good trip to NYC though, love NYC.

We had a great time at Nathan's! 

His apartment was nice and perfectly located for us. It is just a short walk (3 minutes) to the Subway station that gets you to Manhattan in about 10 minutes. For example, Times Square is only 5 stops away.

Neighborhood felt very safe, even when returning to the apartment late at night. 

We didn't meet Nathan as he was abroad during our stay, but his friend met us to let us in and we communicated with Nathan using the AirBNB app when needed.

This is a great apartment for a great price and I would definitely recommend it. Thanks Nathan!

Daniela's place is a gem. The location is perfect, a block away from the 30th Avenue in Astoria, so very close to plenty of restaurants and shops. It is a very large studio, with ample storage space, and with the great benefit of having a washer and dryer in the unit. It is very quiet, 100% safe, and spotless. The bed is extremely comfortable. As described in the listing, Daniela's studio is definitely cozy and warm, which I appreciated very much. Daniela was also very accommodating with my check in and check out times. I would love to stay at her place again in the future!

Everything was perfect. The apartment was as described and the area in Manhattan excellent. Roberta sent all details and information.
She was in contact with me prior to my arrival and after to check everything was OK.

Dimitri's apartment was great. It's located at the heart of Chelsea,  and the apartment was very neat and my friends and I were very comfortable during our stay. I enjoyed my time immensely and Dimitri was a phone call or text away if we had any questions.  Thank you so much again for being an amazing host!
Everything was perfect: communication, cozy apartment, restaurant recommendations and district! I would have loved to stay there for much longer.

Joey was a great host although he was thousands of miles away (across the Atlantic in Europe). It was a last minute booking for me since my procrastinating younger brother left me with the hard task of finding him a place to stay while in NYC. But Joey although very last minute made things very easy for us. Communication was excellent and could not have been any better. 

Best thing about his place is the LOCATION.

Area was really great and convenient. 

His roommates were very friendly and helpful.

Don't have high expectations and you will not be disappointed, lets not forget where we are Brooklyn New York.
A fantastic location and a beautiful place filled with homely charm. Angeline was very helpful in all aspects of this booking. Highly recommended.

Un apartamento calido, comodo y bien comunicado. Taylor & Val, son increibles!

I will repeat!

Although I never got a chance to meet Swati in person,  she was capable of making my stay in Brooklyn amazingly unforgettable!  Her place is awesome and clean, the bed was very comfortable! I felt right at home. Swati was nice enough to leave a list of places to eat and everyday convenience. The location was perfect and just a couple blocks away from the subway stations.  Manhattan is just one stop away so it was very convenient and easy to get there and get back to the house! After staying here I don't think I'll ever need to find another place or go to a hotel where I come to NYC! Thanks again so much Swati already missing your place!

Mio was flexible with my check in time, her place is clean and cozy. Mio is friendly and sweet, she made me feel at home and I felt like I made a new friend. Her place is located a block and a half from the MR lines and about 6 blocks from the NR lines. The area offer tons of food options and there's a grocery store located right across the street. I will most definitely stay here again.

The apartment was big in any standard and huge in NYC standards. The room was great and because Judith worked a lot and Mandy was out of town we had the apartment pretty much to ourselves. The train connections were good and easy to use. I can recommend these girls definitely.

Beautiful apartment!!!
Big, modern and clean. Also very close to 4 metro stations, bars, restaurants, stores, the mall and Barclays Center.

Ryan is so welcoming, friendly and open to all questions you might have. He is a great host!

I totally recommend this apartment. Me and my friend had a great time in NYC!

Great place to stay.  Exactly as described and pictured.
Made for a great vacation in the best city in the world.
Hope to come back soon.

Melissa was great to work with and always quick to respond to our questions.  The apartment was as described PLUS a wonderful, wonderful bed to rest in after a busy day in NYC.  Melissa left us plenty of space to store our belongings, and white noise machines in every room to help with the holiday celebration noise.  Friendly neighborhood so convenient to the A, the 1, great restaurants and nearby groceries.  We had a fantastic stay and appreciate Melissa's hospitality.
We all loved the location of the apartment, and the host is very easy to work with. Highly recommend!

Jonathan and Kiira from next door were both very helpful. 

Location of the apartment is amazing, pretty much walking distance to upper sides and east village and SOHO. There's also subway downstairs.

The apartment has a super nice patio which I didn't get quite much time to enjoy. Also the room setup is cozy and nice.

Julia was such a lovely host. She was very welcoming and friendly even before I had arrived at her place. We spoke on the phone and she answered all of the questions that I had. Her space is absolutely beautiful and charming and clean. She did a lovely job with the interior decoration and it has so much character. I was pleasantly surprised with how spacious her apartment is (her living room and dining room are actually separated in different areas) -- I wish I had more time to enjoy it. The apartment is located just one block from the Bedford L which makes it so convenient to get to places, especially straight into Manhattan. Shops, restaurants & cafes line the street both on 6th and Bedford, whatever you need is just steps away. You will not get bored staying here. This apartment is truly a gem and a hidden secret on the corner of 6th and Bedford.

The apartment and location were great! Very clean and organized space. Comfortable bed and nice sense of style. Our hostess was pleasant to work with and made things easy for us. She was caring and very responsive.
Nice and cozy. Feel like home

I'm from NYC & I wanted to find an affordable room in a central location. Priscilla's flat fit the bill perfectly. The room is small but it has a window, a closet, and a very comfortable queen-sized bed. There's also a nice common space off the kitchen to hang out in, with a sofa and an ample table with four chairs. 

The apartment is a 3-floor walk-up in a typical NYC tenement and not the place if you're looking for luxury accommodations, but great if you want to a real experience of living in the city. It's in South Williamsburg three blocks from the JMZ at Marcy or a 12 minute walk to the L at Lorimer, right in the middle of a bunch of fantastic coffee shops, bars, and restaurants. I loved spending time with her sweet cat and the whole place had a really fantastic calm, welcoming, artsy vibe. 

Priscilla was great to talk to and I would have loved to get a drink with her, but she and her roommate were both really busy. But it was great getting to know her a bit & I highly recommend her place to anyone looking for a cozy base to explore the city!

Alex's apartment was perfect for what I needed.  It was clean, contemporary, well-lit, private, and easy to get to and from the city (you can stumble out the front door and onto the subway).  The neighborhood has some nice bars and eateries (Black Swan is a block away).  Comfortable bed with natural light and plenty of space to put your stuff.  The kitchen is well-stocked and perfect for eating in, too.  I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.  Thanks!

We had a great experience staying at Jennifer's apartment. The apartment and bedroom were spacious and comfortable, in a beautiful and diverse neighborhood of Brooklyn. Though we didn't meet personally, Jennifer was a gracious host who left the room supplied with snacks and coffee and tea, which we appreciated after a long drive. She communicated well, and checking in and out was easy.
Alexander was nice enough to host us for New Years. He was very accommodating and allowed us a late check out!

Jessica was a lifesaver after my original airbnb host cancelled on me.  She was a wonderful host and has the cutest apartment.  She provided very detailed info and communicated with me openly prior to our arrival.  She left us a great list of local spots and an excellent info packet on everything we would need during our stay.  The apartment is in a great location that allowed us to explore the city easily on foot and by subway.  Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely stay here again!

Rosa could not have been more wonderful. The place was exactly what we needed and she even went above and beyond to add a few extra amenities to make us feel right at home.  She was extremely communicative and made sure we were 100% happy and comfortable the entire time.  Very cool space and easy access to the subway.  :)

There was a little hiccup initially as the address was incorrect, but with help from Caroline's side,  we managed to successfully get into her apartment. Apartment was not bad other than it being slightly dirty. It was exactly what was stated, with numerous spacious rooms.

Tara's place was decent in terms of comfort. The apartment looked a little smaller than the pictures, but its still pretty comfortable. Tara was a helpful host, despite being away. She helped me figure out the shower system and was generous with her resources. The neighborhood was relatively safe.

Harry's place is just as it looks in the photos and was very comfortable and relaxing.  The location is super amazing!  Great NYC restaurants, shops, live music venues, fun neighborhoods are all less than a 10 minute walk.  Harry is a very responsive and organized host.  We highly recommend this listing!!!

Rodney is a great host. My family was welcomed with a bottle of wine. Apartment was clean and neat and had plenty of space and comfort. Living room and bedroom are big. Rodney was very communicative through the process of checking in as well as during the stay.
Apartment is near many train stations and one stop from the city. 
Would definitely recommend a stay here.

My experience at Katherine's place was perfect. The place looked just like the pictures. There were towels and shampoo/soap for us to use during our stay. The neighborhood was nice and there were many restaurants and cute shops nearby. The apartment is near a couple different subway lines which makes going anywhere in the city very easy.

Danielle was out of town but still made getting in to the apartment easy. The apartment is very cozy, well lit and warm. The bed is comfortable too. The apartment is close to the metro station as well as lots of good food. The curtains, as shown in the pictures, are not light blocking. Good for making you get out of bed even after a long night :)

I definitely recommend staying at Danielle's. Very good value.
The host canceled this reservation 12 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Rahul was very responsive for my last minute booking.  We were not able to meet, but he was able to coordinate a seamless transfer of the apartment keys so we could get in right when we arrived.  The apartment is as pictured and there is laundry in the basement that was easy to use via elevator.  There was a lot to do in the immediate area; nothing was that far of a walk.  And for such a busy area, it was pretty quiet in the apartment, which was nice for sleeping.  Thanks for the hospitality, Rahul!
Thank you very much ,Ms Yule. It is really fit for my purpose in NY. Friendly,nice smile & heart warming there.

The apartment is really nice and cozy. It almost feels like home. The location sis great as well. It's 3 mins walk to G line station although G line is really annoying in terms of being on time. Overall definitely a positive experience.

Our whole group loved staying at Andy's apartment on our trip to NYC! It's a great location, near the subway, and he was very welcoming. There were snacks arranged for us to eat and a great guide to nearby restaurants and points of interest. I would highly recommend him as a host!

Great location surrounded by many restaurants and close to the L train. Hip neighborhood. Good size apartment for NYC. They have a nice big bathroom and shower and a great deck to sit on to enjoy which are both super rare. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would do again.
Great place! Close to subway station, great neighborhood. Recommended

Matt was a great host.  The apartment is spacious and updated.  Matt was always willing to provide information about the local area, restaurants, services, etc.  The room is private and the full bed is comfortable.  Mookie, the french bulldog, is extremely friendly.  I stayed for a month while transitioning to a new job in the area.  The subway is a 5 minute walk from the apartment and right on the F-line.

I had a great time staying at Mark's app. 
The app is spacious, clean and beautiful. 
The neighborhood is my favorite, the location is priceless. 
Its my first time on Airbnb and with such a great and communicative host, definitely not the last!
Good

This condo was fantastic. Spacious, modern, clean and equipped with every amenity (including a built in home speaker system) the condo is located in an ideal section of Bushwick, less than a 5 minute walk from the Jefferson Street subway stop. The neighborhood has an abundance of first rate restaurants and coffee shops. Maggie was a tremendous host and I certainly recommend this property.

My parents stayed at Sam's place for a week when they were visiting me for my commencement. The location is super convenient - close to 1 train, 24 hours market, restaurants and the Columbia University. The building is safe and the apartment is so adorable - we loved the decorations and everything! Sam is also super nice and respond to all my questions promptly, she even left us some snacks and drinks! We absolutely enjoyed our stay!

We had a great stay at Helene's apartment. The description was accurate, the apartment was clean and Helene was very helpful with any queries that we had. The neighbourhood is safe with easy access to great restaurants and the subway. Would recommend this listing.
All "on-board" information provided. Really helpful. Received calls to ensure I was ok. Close to subway to Manhattan. Response time was very short. Thanks, Marlon!

Zach was really helpful and friendly and always replied to our messages fast and with useful information. The location is great and there is a subway stop only a couple minutes away. The roommates were helpful as well. (Although we didn't get to keep the beer that we put in the fridge...) The building has a roof with a beautiful view.

However, there is lots of room for improvement. The overall cleanliness of the room and public spaces was not that good. The first thing we found entering the laundry room was a cucumber covered in mold. And four guys sharing one bathroom... Well, I think we got what we paid for basically. If the place had been a little bit cleaner I would recommend it to others.

This apartment is amazing. Exceptionally clean and very, very well decorated. The apartment is modern but still has a lot of its original charm. I didn't walk around the neighborhood much, I spent most of my time in the amazing backyard. Jason provided me with all of the information I needed and was easy for me to get ahold of when I had a question. Would stay here again, and would absolutely recommend this apartment and host!

The apartment had a bed, bathroom and a minimalist kitchen, but no chairs or table to sit at. There is a coffee maker and a kettle, there was coffee, and we left some sugar. It was clean, but the previous tenant smoked. It is near a frequent bus and there is also a commuter rail station nearby. There are groceries and small restaurants nearby. The subway ride to midtown will take half hour or more, depending on luck.

The host was very flexible with my arrival time and welcomed me very warmly. He showed me around the block and even had time for a little welcome drink!
The place has two separate bedrooms - one integrated in the apartment, and one that you have to enter through a separate door on the same floor. All was fresh and clean, there was even a bathrobe provided for us! The style of the apartment can be described as 'vintage' - not everything works perfectly but it gives you a real Brooklyn experience!
The neighborhood is safe, the metro is really close by and a lot of coffee places and restaurants are around. 
I would definitely stay at this place again on my next (business) trip to NYC!

Eva & Joe were great host. I met Joe only once during my two night stay in NY but he was very nice and friendly. Eva was contacting me through text messages and emails all the time to make sure everything was okay. The apartment is in a very good location in East Village, just 5 minutes walk to subway!

Host & roommate are friendly & welcoming, the apartment is in a good location close to Central Park & Columbus Circle. 
The only down side was there was no room in the bedroom for our luggage & all the hosts personal belongings were in the bedroom, there was no space to put anything while we stayed there so had live out of our suitcases in the living room & the apartment was much darker than in the photographs, there is not much natural light in the apartment
Good apt!

It is in a very convenient location in term of accessing metro, walking to Soho, lower Manhatong, China town. Avi is very accessible. The kitchen utensils, dishes, and glasses are enough. Shower space is small, still comfortable, very nice shower head. If you are very clean people, you might need to be more specific to ask questions to host. People can have different prospective in term of cleanness as we are. It is first time using Airbnb  for us. We stayed for 35 days. We learn better for next long stay. 1200 sqft does not mean much to guests as the function can be same as 300 sqft.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay two-week stay in No. Williamsburg, Brooklyn! The apartment is in a fabulous location just 3 blocks up from the water, in the best part of super cool Williamsburg.   Top floor in a new building (with elevator), it is quiet and comfortable.  Super high ceilings and abundant light add to feelings of space.  It feels much larger than a studio.  Our host, Meghan, is delightful to work with.  Key retrieval, etc. was simple, and if we had any problems ( we did not) she was available to help.  Definitely recommend Meghan's apartment for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Williamsburg!

Great host, nice clean apartment in very good area. Crosstown subway station just outside and Union Square junction 5 minutes walk. Apartment has possibility for two beds in separate rooms. Michelle was very easy and fast to communicate with. Highly recommended!

Jens was very welcoming. The description of the flat was accurate and the pictures gave the correct idea. The neighborhood was nice and Jen provided a good list of places to go in the region and even a certificate gift of a good coffee shop.

Tuva and Misha were very welcoming persons. In general the place was as described. There have been no problems and they always were happy to  help with information about the city and everything else. Even so I didn't really need any information, as my friends showed me around. Definitely a place I would recommend.

My host was great and the apartment was impeccable and freshly repainted very bright and spacious. It was very calm and peaceful. The location was extremely convenient with the subway station 3 minutes away and several stores and eating places close by. The neighborhood was lively but very safe even late at night. The building situated along a one way street was old and fairly majestic with an elevator which was great considering that the apartment was on the 6th floor. The WIFI was nice to have.

The host are very nice and friendly. The rooms are clean, especially the bathroom. The neighborhood is convenient, just around 5 mins walk to the nearest railway station, and 15 mins walk to Time squares. Though it is in downtown, it is not noisy at night.
The only downside of this place is the building is old and has no elevators, if you have big luggages, it would be difficult to move your items upstairs.
But overall, I have a wonderful stay there!

We stayed in Mauricio's Place for 10 Days. Very nice little apartment, exactly how it looks in the picture, very neat. Mauricio was available to us if needed. The location was extremely convenient, we were 6 blocks from Central Park and 15 seconds away from the Metro. We would highly recommend to future customers.

It was only a short stay at Ashley's home for 4 nights. The room was clean, warm and sweet, just the same as the description. Ashley was out of town and her boyfriend Eric waited for us. He was really nice and introduced everything we needed. The only thing we were not so satisfied was the sound outside the window, like the air exhaust system from a parking lot or somewhere. Overall, the stay was nice and will be a special memory in our NY's trip. Thanks for Ashley&Eric. :)
Yety was accommodating and immediately responsive to our needs. Thanks for coming through in a pinch!
Beautiful apartment in a fantastic location!

Nadine was a great host. Even though she was not preaent during my stay she was easy to contact and eager to help in any way she could. The apartment was a lovely little place to stay. I felt fine in the neighborhood while walking to and from the subway which. Was very conveniently located as well. Overall I had a great stay.
Naomi's place was great and she made me and my friends feel very welcome. I definitely recommend this place.

Umberto was not here when we arrived but left a letter with everything explained in it which was really nice of him.
The room is exactly like in the picture and was clean.
The subway is about 10 minutes walk and then New York is yours!
His roommates were nice too!

Hosts are friendly.
The apt is quite and clean. It almost have every amenities you need, very convenient, but no WIFI in the apt. 
The location is convenient, but near University of Columbia, seems not quite safe to walk in the night.

Good place,near the
 bus station,nice hostness!

Sila was such a great host! Super helpful and always quick to respond. The apartment was absolutely perfect. Well-lit and cozy. Located in the heart of Williamsburg with so many cute shops and restaurants around it (and the metro right under the building).

It was my first time using Airbnb and I was a little nervous at first, but Michael quickly made me feel comfortable thanks to our prompt and frequent communication before our arrival. Since Michael was on vacation during our stay, we were greeted by his neighbor Jason who showed us the place, and gave us lots of tips about the neighborhood. The apartment looks nicer than in the photos, and is quiet, clean and cozy. We quickly got used to its designy feel and were happy to come 'home' after a day of touring the city. The windows look onto a small closed courtyard so it is definitely calm at night. Michael was constantly accessible by email, and quickly responded to my messages. The place is only half a block from subway lines E and 7, and about 15 minutes from Times Square, plus we got to see the Manhattan skyline from the Gantry Plaza State Park, which was unbelievable at night! I would however recommend to be cautious if walking home alone at night, as the neighboring streets get kind of empty.

I don't regret choosing this place and I would definitely recommend it to other users. Thank you, Michael and Jason!
Katrina was such a great host! We loved our stay and her home is beautiful and spacious

As a disclaimer, I didn't actually get to meet Laina, but rather stayed with her roommates. The review was accurate as listed and the bedroom was quite nice. The shared bathroom was subpar in terms of cleanliness, however.

Thank you very much for your awesome hospitality. We loved to stay at your appartement :) It was really amazing. Everything was very clean and we had our own toilet with shower . 
Shanna answered very quick and always asked if everything is fine. I can definetely recommend to stay there. The neighbourhood Brooklyn is also very safe and lovely :) 

Thank you!

Oded's apartment was incredibly well located, clean, spacious and a great spot for us to stay in Williamsburg. The building is very secure, the staff helpful and friendly and it's close to amazing restaurants and nightlife in Brooklyn and Manhattan. As it was his first time hosting, we needed a bit more information about the building, laundry and wifi, and had to ask for a lot of help and couldn't do washing as an access key stopped working during our stay. The sofa bed is comfortable but small, so a bit of a squeeze for two people. There are also no curtains in the bedroom or lounge area (where the sofa bed is). Over all we had a great stay at Oded's place.

Martin and Julia's apartment was a wonderful choice for a quick trip to NYC. The apartment was close to a couple metro stops, so transportation was easy. Their place felt like a home away from home. We would love to stay again

They were  very friendly and sociable.Offered help and was interested in our day.Very nice girl.The house was very clean and cozy.the next our trip to new york with great pleasure we will stopat them again because its better than 5 star hotel.and even we will not looking for another lodging.Bed comfortable.Subway close.Thanks for warm hospitality.
Wonderful apartment, very clean and new, excellent location.

I did not met Nick in person, I only talked to him by messages and mails. He was very nice and always answered to my questions. He also sent a few messages during my stay of two weeks to see if everything was alright.

The apartment is well located and extremely close to the subway, which was very convenient to go anywhere, especially to downtown Manhattan. The area is surrounded by groceries, fast-food restaurants, shops... It seemed a safe area to me.
My room was fine, clean, and in accordance with expectations. However, I found the apartment quite messy... The kitchen and living room could have been tidier and cleaner. But believe me, it was okay, I was not disgusted by anything. Also, I had to buy some base products, such as paper towels... I think there should have been some.
The bathroom I used was not bad, with a large shower cabin. But again, it could have been cleaner. Moreover, the apartment is dark. You have to turn on the lights at almost any time of the day, or you don't see anything.

I enjoyed my stay though, as the apartment. Despite those few flaws, it was big, well located and I was at ease. I was alone in the apartment for a week, then some roommates came and were all nice.

Farai's place is great.  It's spacious and the room is also a good size.  She goes out of her way to make sure everything is okay and as far as check in went, I was on a delayed flight and she was great.

Furthermore, Farai is friendly, interesting and smart.  I spent a month in her place and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.  Highly recommended.

The neighborhood is on the edges of gentrification and there are many interesting old and new spots to hit.  It's pretty convenient to both the Q and the 5 trains.  It takes about 30-35 minutes to get to Union Square in the morning.  Furthermore it's close to Prospect Park, which is nice and just on the other side is Park Slope.

Jenny was fantastic. She checked up on me and was incredibly communicative. The apartment is in the best location possible, it's beautiful and clean, right above a cute little book shop with plenty of restaurants. Jenny's roommates are the sweetest, not only did they give me advice about what was around in the area but they also are genuine, driven and caring individuals. I recommend this place to anyone. This was my first Airbnb experience and will most surely not be my last. Thanks girls!

This place is great.  The apartment is clean and exactly as described.  The best part is the roof deck which is in fact private.  The view is incredible, the furniture is comfortable, and the neighbor is also a great guy.  This place was perfect for the fourth of July weekend.

It is really awesome cosy apartment about 5 minute walk to subway station (15 minutes to Downtown, 25 min to Tmes square, 30 min to Central park). So Michel's apartment is a good base to explore city: dive into divercity of Manhattan in the day light and have quiet sleep in Brooklyn at nights. Very decent neighbourhood right opposite the Brooklyn Park.

Apartment looks like on photos: well equipped, well designed, spacious living-room, cosy bedroom. At this flat you have everything you need for everyday life - excellent Wi-Fi, TV, tea-kettle and so on.

Despite we didn't see him (his friend Anna met us) Michel left some good tips: maps with marked places for shopping, eating, sightseeing etc.

We had a great time in NYC.
It was great to spend a month in NYC in a beatiful apartment.  It was convineatly located, well stocked, clean and well maintained.  Thank you.

Your eyes don't deceive you! Yes, you can have an entire apartment in Brooklyn for an unbelievable price. My husband and I stayed here for a week in July and were very grateful to be able to see the city and stay on budget. 

Amino's place is well taken care of and clean. The neighborhood isn't extremely touristy, but we were able to find some yummy coffee shops and cafes within a 15-20 min walk (we really loved a place called the PLG Cafe and went there like 3 different times). And you have the 2 and 5 subway lines only 2 blocks away. 

The one thing I would caution future summer travelers of is the heat. There is a window unit in the living room which works great and gets the room to a comfortable temperature pretty quickly. However, no A/C in the bedroom and the outside temps were high 80s (and even got into the 90s) when we were there. Luckily Amino has a wonderful extreme fan in the bedroom which definitely kept the air moving. Without the fan, it would be pretty uncomfortable to sleep in. BUT all in all, this is a steal of a deal!

Staying here was the best experience I've had. The location was great, the roommates were friendly, and I think an Airbnb in general and this specific one was the best way to get my foot in the door in NYC.
I recommend this place to everyone interested.

I enjoyed my stay with Olga and Bianca! They are pleasant hosts who made me feel like family from the first moment I walked in the door. They offered privacy without seeming like strangers. I was given my own set of keys shortly after I arrived. Their pre-war apartment is extremely clean, impressive, and charming. The room was spotless, spacious, and comfortable. I felt like I was in my own hotel room within their home. It was nice having a refrigerator in the room to keep food and beverages cold. The building is located on a very quiet street, was in close proximity to where I needed to be, and is close to the 1, A, and C trains. I highly recommend Olga and Bianca as hosts! Staying here will give you one less thing to worry about during your visit to NYC!
Excellent. Place matched what was presented in the photos, hosts were very friendly and helpful.

Great location in the heart of Harlem! Supermarket, bus, and eateries just steps away and a laundry room in the basement. Aicha was very helpful and quickly responded to my communications. I would defintely recommend this cozy studio to other travelers. It's a good value and has everything you need for a short stay.

Jilian was very helpful throughout our stay in NYC. The room is big, clean and in a very nice brownstone in Brooklyn. 
It's placed near C and G subway lines which makes it easy to get back to it, if you plan to spend a late evening in Manhattan as we did. :)

Reha was an excellent host considering when we arrived he took time off work to greet us and to ensure that we settled into the apartment okay. We really felt at home during our stay and the listing was accurate. I can't stress enough how cosy the apartment was and it was filled with all the things you would need during a short stay. Not to mention, the location was perfect for us and is situated in a prime location in Manhattan. Perfect for anyone who is visiting New York. The neighbourhood was great and was not noisy at all. Overall, we would definitely take up the chance to stay at Reha and Wei's place again if we were to visit Manhattan in the future. Great hosts and great place to stay. You won't regret it!

Had a great time. Eilis always kept in great contact with me while I was staying there. Even gave me best directions to her place from airport. Provided clean sheets and towel for me. Her roommates are also very nice/helpful. Location is helpful and easy for getting to Manhattan. As an added benefit, it was always quiet when I went to sleep. I didn't hear any blaring traffic.
Jun and Sarah's was a good place to stay while in Brooklyn. Nice to have a private bathroom!
The room is comfortable. The location is very close to Wall Street , which is convenient for tourist. Besides the roommate is friendly. He offered many advices to me about my tour in New York City.

Lisa was awesome!  She wasn't in town so she mailed the keys to my parents that live nearby which was greatly appreciated. Her room is lovely and clean and neat. The bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of space. They were shampoos and other toiletries left for the air B&B guests to use in the bathroom as well as the use of the refrigerator in the kitchen.  Lisa's other roommates were very friendly and very helpful when we arrived. The apartment was quiet and in a wonderful location.   We will definitely stay with her again when we return to New York.
It was exellent. The host was very helpfull! Super localization and communication with the host also.

Leanne's apartment was awesome!! It is in the perfect location near subway that can go straight down to Manhattan, and it is easy to get to JFK airport. Besides, her roommates are as friendly as herself. They had been really kind to me for the last 6 days. Plus, the room was so cozy and comfortable that i could fall asleep in peace every time! If i ever visit NY again, i will definitely choose here. The one thing i wanna thank her is that she was flexible enough to let me stay for more days if i want to. I had a great New Year's trip thanks to them~ Highly recommended~~^^

Natalie's apartment is in a great (adorable) neighborhood in Brooklyn very close to public transit.  She was a very accommodating host that was very receptive answering any questions about that place immediately.  And the place was perfect to come back to after a long day of walking around the city!

Great space. The apartment was a short walk from public transportation, very conveniently located near a shopping center. The apartment was warm and cozy and perfect for two people. Quiet, clean space that has everything you'd need for a comfortable stay. The host, Chris was out of town during our stay but was very helpful, cordial, accommodating  and replied promptly. It kinda felt like crashing at a friend's house.  Would recommend highly!
I didn t see Yehonatan, but he always answer to my requests at any time. Everything was all right, the appartement was very clean, and pleasant. Close the Subway, thanks Yehonatan,

I loved my stay here. This apartment is in a prime location. You are literally near everything walking distance. There are also several subway stations just a few blocks away. The J-train dropped me off from JFK one block from the apartment. I had a meeting near Wall Street and the 6-train took less than 10 minutes. The 6 in the opposite direction too me to central park in 20 minutes. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The apartment is shared but the roommate wasn't there at all. The kitchen was stocked. 

The Apartment is in a prewar building so you'll have to walk up 4 flights of stairs, which wasn't bad at all. 
 I will definitely stay here again on future visits. I have stayed in other areas of the city but this is by far the coolest and most convenient area; there are tons of shops, restaurants, film theaters, art galleries, groceries, bakeries, etc etc

 Vanessa was also very responsive. She even left a guide book for me! Thanks for all your hospitality, will be back soon!

Danny was already out of town when we arrived. However, he was very communicative and easy to get a hold of even though he was busy working out on the west coast. We arranged to meet one of his neighbors - who are all awesome people - to get the keys.

The apartment is as-described in the listing. We didn't spend too much time in the place other than sleeping and changing clothes, but it had everything we needed. It was clean, spacious, and the bed was super comfortable.

The building is on a quiet one-way street in upper Manhattan. It's about a block from any sort of grocery or convenience that you might need and about two blocks in either direction to the subway. I'd totally stay here again if I made the trip back.

I loved the house of Dana, very spacious and light. Dana is very friendly and I felt very much at home. The neighborhood is calm and very residential, something I very much enjoyed. Everything is close, and it is very easy to get to the city. Also there are a lot of things to discover, so walking around if a definitely must do.
Arnell's place was great. He answered very quickly, and was flexible with the meeting time. The apartment is a nice, clean studio with everything we needed.

Great location. Super convenient to multiple subway lines. There is a laundromat with wash and fold service only a few doors down that is great. Lots of good restaurants and shops within walking distance. Pete was a great host, quick communication and very helpful.

Mariana is a very lovely and welcoming host with a beautiful, modern, spacious and squeaky clean apartment that's tastefully decorated. It's also located in an excellent location in North Williamsburg / Greenpoint. Mariana made me feel very comfortable while I was in NYC working on an incredibly stressful project. Overall, the experience far exceeded my expectations for an Airbnb.  She's the best!
Todd Morris

Hello everyone, I would like to say that Sarah is the nicest person you would like to get to know.  She was very nice to have opened her doors to us.  The place was clean, cozy and the room was good size with a comfortable bed.  We were there in January for 7 days and the place wasn't cold at all because we had the heater there; which wasn't noisy.  I felt safe in the neighborhood and the 2, 3, 4 & 5 trains were extremely convenient; a skip and a jump to get there.  We were in Manhattan within 30 to 40 minutes.  The bus stops were also close.  I would recommend her place to my friends and would definitely stay there again.  Also, her roommates were really nice.  
Thanks Sarah for your hospitality and a great stay in NYC.  
Hope to see you again soon  :)
It was a pleasure staying at Kody's. Kody easygoing and was very responsive to questions.

The host welcomed me, showed me how everything worked. Provided tips on all of his favorite places - the juice shop, the grocery store, his favorite restaurant and even a great drycleaner. The neighborhood is really fun with lots of shops and restaurants. Close to all public transit. Would highly recommend!

My friends and I stayed at Ely's apartment over New Years and had a great time! Ely is an amazing host! Great communication and gave us local tips. Her apartment is in an older New York building in a quaint neighborhood. It was a prefect place to warm up and relax after a cold day in NYC. Thank you!!

Margot went above and beyond our expectations! She provided recommendations, was very accommodating for check-in/out, was communicative, and a general great person! 

The place is beautiful and way roomier than I expected to find in the area, it was clean and Margot made sure we knew multiple people to contact should anything go wrong. Of course nothing did, but it was great to feel secure in what to do if we needed help.

I would highly recommend to any respectful folks to feel confident in rooming through Margot. She is great, location is great, place is great!

Dear Fiona, Geoff & Jet
Thank you for being such fab hosts. We had a truly incredible experience. 
The loft is spacious, clean, well decorated (I love mid-century) it has a wonderful energy. The place is will stocked with plenty of pots and pans, and your organizational skills are very impressive! 
The location - WOW! So many amazing restaurants and shops. It was so easy to get around with loads of subway stations nearby.
Jet - thank you for your message and for sharing your toys and books with the twins. They really loved your neighborhood  especially Vesuvio playground and Neson A. Rockerfeller park. 
Thanks so much for having us.

Amazing place. Wes was so nice. Perfect location and only one block from subway. Bedroom was super quiet and bed was really comfortable.  Really well designed place too. Coolest coffee shop around the corner, BK SPEED COFFEE, and gave me the best latte and breakfast burrito before exploring super cool Williamsburg. Thanks so much. Would visit again!!!!

The apartment was super clean and the view definitely didn't disappoint. I stayed for several weeks (work and personal), and being right next to the metro was a huge plus! Tarun was friendly and expedient in all of our interactions.
I really liked Laura and Jason's place. They're very laid back, nice people. The apartment is clean and they have a cat, Biscuit, who is really cute.

We had a great Airbnb experience here. The apartment was cute, clean, and in an awesome location. Lori was very sweet and flexible (plus provided some great restaurant suggestions).  Would come back in a heartbeat!

This place is a gem and Nancy has been a very wonderful host, although she was on travel. Thank you Nancy, be prepared to hear from me if need a place to stay in NYC again! ;-)
The apartment is not huge - as most in NYC - but very cozy and very quiet, especially in the night. The bed is absolutely First Class and a pleasure to sleep in. 
The large TV is nice to have, too.  East Village is also a good area for a stay, you can walk in all directions or will find subway stations within 3-4 blocks (the subway is fast!). 
For going out I recommend "Veselka", Ukrainian Restaurant, on 2nd Av/9th Str. "Trader Joe's", 142 E 14th Str, might be the best option if you want to fill up the frig.
Thanks again Nancy, already looking forward for my next trip to NYC and hope your place will be available again!

Alec arranged our stay perfectly since he was away at our arrival. The room is just great, well situated close to the L and M lines. There are shops and restaurants around. We really enjoyed our stay there.

Great value at a great location with a fantastic view.
Very close to subway and bus lunes, so getting around is very easy from here, as is getting into Manhattan.
Also, a very friendly, ethnically diverse neighborhood and building.

Very nice stay in carmen's flat: clean, comfortable and relaxing 
Carmen is a very nice host
I really recommend her lovely place 
Thanks Carmen !

Great place to stay while in NYC! I didn't spend much time in the apartment, since I was out exploring the city, but it was clean, safe, and in a very convenient location. The host was fantastic and the roommates were really nice, too.

In fact, Vaida is a very nice person. I met her a couple of minutes two weeks after I moved in her room. As far as I can say, she loves to travel around the globe, what made it a little bit difficult to communicate from time to time. But in general, everything worked out in the end.
Neda's place is in a quaint quiet neighborhood perfect for a few days or a week or more.  This was her first airbnb experience and mine as well.

Finding Katherine's (Kitty's) home was no trouble what so ever and upon arriving, I was greeted by Kitty and given a tour.  Kitty really emphasized feeling at home in her place, and made sure I felt comfortable adjusting her home to my own preferences.  The apt  itself is lovely and cozy - we could find no fault with the space.  The pictures are accurate and I personally think the space looks better in person!  We really enjoyed the piano and being able to sit out in the backyard space.  Kitty herself was incredibly accommodating and prompt in communication.  She was always available by phone or text if we had any questions.  On the day we were supposed to move out, our next host cancelled our stay and Kitty was kind enough to let us stay a few extra nights to give us time to make new accommodations. 

Overall, a great experience and highly recommended.

This place worked really well for me. Apart from the 6 flr walk up & a bit dirty of a bathroom it was an amazing location, comfy bed, & quite quiet for where it is. Also lots of kitchen supplies which I loved.

My recent stay in NYC was great. It was my 1st experience utilizing this site. Vanessa was great. She was out of town at the time of my visit but, was very welcoming & attentive. The apartment was gorgeous, spacious & exactly as described. Location was convenient. Subway was less than a 5 minute walk (4, 5 & 6.) Shop's, grocery store & restaurants were easily accessible. Overall great experience, couldn't have asked for better.

I was able to get into the house even though my bus arrived in New York City at 4:30 in the morning. It's a nice house. Loved the big screen TV. The house is within walking distance to the subway station and bus stops.  Downtown Brooklyn isn't far away and there are lots of discount shops there. I even found a hair salon nearby to get my hair done at a reasonable price. I was having problems with the microwave and the computer so Tom sent his nephew over to fix things. I left my watch on the kitchen counter when I washed the dishes and Tom mailed it back to me. If you're planning to spend a lot of time in Brooklyn this is the place to stay.

Hien is a great host, very quick in responding, helps in anything she can, and very thoughtful. Had a great experience and would recommend this place to anybody looking for an affordable and convenient place in nyc.

We rent Laura's apartment for the New Year Eve my husband, dad, step-mother and I. We had such an incredible experience!! Everything described in her listing is accurate and the price is unbeatable! We first started our search in New York City Center. Everything was really expensive because of the location and the time of the year (around $500 - $800/night).  Then, we expended our search to sorrounding neighborhoods and that's who we found Laura's apartment. Just 15 minutes North of Time Square by Express Metro and only $150/night. The location fit our needs perfectly.  

Highly recommended!

Antal was a great host. We didn't actually meet, but communicated through messages. He arranged for the keys to be available to us so we could check in late. He answered all our questions promptly and gave tips and advice on how to get there and about the facilities in the neighbourhood. During our stay he also answered messages quickly and took action where needed. The apartment is ideally located very near Central Park and main shopping avenues. It looks out at the back onto a closed courtyard and is not very bright but we were out every day anyway. The apartment is exactly as described, with lovely high ceilings with details and a beautiful wooden floor. We would definitely stay here again.

I didn't get to meet Ali in person,  but our correspondences were very pleasant. He was quick to reply and helpful. The listing was accurate, the apartment was comfortable and clean, he even provided towels :) The neighborhood is lovely (a little far from the trains, but not bad). By far the best price around, really a great experience. His roommate was absolutely lovely, she helped me get where I was going and was super friendly.
Great location, nice home. Good communication.
Dan's place was perfect and as described. It's in an ideal location. I had a great stay.

Katie's place in the East Village was wonderful - and she is an amazing host!  The apartment was clean and tidy, with plenty of amenities and a detailed list of ways to make our stay relaxing.  Additionally, it is in a great location.  All around great stay!
Great apartment in a great location.
Morgan made everything clear, the room was nice, roommates were friendly, good price for a good location.

Darcy has a fine place. Walking distance to M and J train. The loft has two small bedrooms and a large living room which can accommodate 4 people. Not very clean but it was very fun space. If you love this Bushwick neighborhood, this loft suites you.
Place was very neat and clean. Also convenient for anyone rotating at Kingsbrook

Not a fan. 

Host was helpful, communicative, and flexible, but I was not happy. Place was a mess. While the host mentioned she wasn't able to take care of her cat, the cat smell was pretty pervasive throughout the main room of the apartment. I have cats, and this situation was pretty noticable. Overall, the apartment was tight and grimey: moldy shower curtains, filty bathroom mat, and broken bedroom door knob. 

While the location is great and super close to the Bedford station, the L line runs directly underneath the building. It's not loud enough to bother sleep, but you will notice the rumbling throughout the day.

Host phoned-in the hand-off and turns out the house key was not in the lock-box as mentioned. 

Roommate also asked me to stay away for one weekend afternoon. Very uncomfortable.

Brett was a great host. Although he was not present during our stay communication was never an issue (despite being in a different time zone). The apartment is really well located. 5 minute walk to the Bedford L which takes you to Manhattan within another 5 minutes. Nearby you can visit the 'zoo' of Bedford Avenue - full of bars and people at the weekend. We preferred quieter and cooler places. Just 1 min from the apartment is Spuyten Duyvil for great beer, St Anselm for great food, and Fette Sau for both!

The apartment was exactly as expected. Plenty of little attentions that made you feel at home, lots of detailed instructions about the neighbourhood, how to use the apartment, and so on....

Michael and Andrea answered all our questions - before and during our stay - promptly, in length and in a personalized way. That already made us happy before our arrival, and everything went well.

The neighbourhood is also great : a village and at the same time so close to manhattan.

In a word : we would gladly go back there if we ever come back to NY.

Note : the kids loved the TV and its million channels...

We had a great time there. The location is perfect, really close to the subway, and times square. It's the kind of place you want to head out after a long walk over Nyc. 
Andy was really helpfull and thoughtfull. He set us an extra matress with just 2 days of notice. Great guy. Cheers from Argentina.

Farah's place was wonderful and so was she. Her place is  super clean, and accessible. Her hospitality was great, she was quick to respond and provide directions. Chewbacca her dog is super sweet, calm and welcoming. They both made our trip memorable. We would love to stay at Farah's again if we are ever in New York. Such a delightful stay.

Anna is a great host. she is kind, responsive and responsible. She offered useful tips on restaurants and bars, and they were all great! She was out of the town while I stayed there but she made sure I have every info I need and the checkin process was a breeze thanks to her and her father's help. The room has plenty space and the bed is big and so comfy. Her roommate is also very easy to be with and made my stay very comfortable. It was like staying at my own friend's house. Her place is so quiet at night out of the bustle and chaos of the NYC but still close to everything in Midtown. I strongly recommend her place since it is a person(host) who makes a place to stay special.

Emily was extremely nice, easy to talk to, accommodating, and she made sure that we had everything we needed and what her own rules were. She even had a little basket in our room with towels, some toiletries, and menus for nearby places which was a sweet touch. The room was delightfully cold after walking around in the summer heat, very clean and tidy, and extremely comfortable. She also gave us some great recommendations for places to check out nearby which we also enjoyed quite a bit. The neighborhood was quiet and we felt very safe being out and about late at night. Overall this was an excellent experience and we definitely recommend it to people who want to visit NYC without being right in the thick of Manhattan. The two of us would happily stay again.
Mckendree was very welcoming and the space was neat

Our stay at Jaclyn's and Mancel's apartment was one of the best AirBnb experiences we've ever had. The apartment was beautiful, spacious, and immaculate, with many large windows, providing much more natural light than most apartments in NYC do. The location couldn't have been more ideal, as it is situated on the main commercial avenue in Park Slope, with close proximity to the subway, Prospect Park, and numerous amenities. Our check-in experience, facilitated by Jacklyn's and Mancel's helpful, accommodating, and patient neighbors (Jacklyn and Mancel were out of town when we arrived) was as smooth as could be, in spite of our flight's nine hour delay and late arrival. I would absolutely recommend staying at this apartment, with only one caveat: the apartment is on the fourth floor in a building without an elevator. This was not an issue for us at all, but it might be for some visitors with ambulatory disabilities.

I work in NY midtown, and was between apartments for roughly a month, during which time I stayed with Sha in her midtown east apartment.  The apartment is very conveniently located, with access to various train lines and restaurants.  There is also a Whole Foods around the corner.

The apartment was quiet, clean and spacious. Manhattan is noisy, but the apartment was surprisingly quiet with the windows closed, and I never had any noise related issues during my stay.  The room was large and completely private, and had ample natural light during the day.  The entire stay was exceedingly pleasant. Sha was always friendly and courteous, and frequently asked me whether I was comfortable and happy with my stay.  The few requests that I made were quickly addressed (e.g. more hangers)

The building was newly renovated with a charge card operated laundry room in the basement. The doormen were very friendly, and never gave me any issues during the entirety of my stay.

I was a little uneasy with going through Airbnb for an extended stay, but this turned out to be a fantastic experience.  Sha is a caring and friendly host, and I am very grateful for her warm hospitality.
Amazing energy, ambience and space! Great location next to Central Park and Columbus Circle!

Maryam was a great host and the place was also awesome and comfortable. She kindly provided me extra towel, blanket and pillow sheet and was also very helpful upon request. She texted me everyday to make sure everything is fine and if I need anything which was so nice of her.
 I wish I had a chance to meet her in person cause she seems so nice and friendly. Hope I get a chance to meet her on my next trip to New York.

Viviana and Lauren were very friendly and welcomed me warmly into their apartment. It was a great space, and exactly what I was looking for. The decor matches the photos very well, and everything was provided generously.
