Everything was very convenient, I enjoyed the neighborhood very much, with the exception of the noise at night, but otherwise it was very pleasant.

Sarah's apartment is very nice, clean, comfortable and quiet. 
We did not meet Sarah personally but her flatmate Angela was super friendly and welcoming! She gave us many tips for restaurants and bars around the area. 
The metro stop is just one block away, which makes very convenient to get to Manhattan.
I totally recommend to stay at Sarah's place!

Everything was great! The communication was good.
The location is just what we were looking for. Close to the subway. Next to beautiful prospect park. A nice area. Andrew is also very nice.
The apartment is huge compared to Manhattan apartments.
It could have been a bit more tidy. But that was not really an issue. This also depends on the subjective expectations. And sometimes also expensive hotels are not that clean. I highly recommend his apartment and I hope we can stay there again. It is really great!

The apartment is placed in a really great district.
Akshay helped me with everything I needed to stay in comfort in NY.
So, great place, great area, great host.

Thank you)

Heather's place is really cute and cozy with easy access to the S train (which connects to the CBQ234&5 trains. The area is buzzing with restaurants, bodegas, bars and live music venues  Prospect park is a few blocks walk (or warm-up jog). Kitchen doesn't have a microwave but is otherwise well equipped. Really enjoyed our stay!

I didn't meet Jeffrey but had a wonderful stay in his house. His room is super cosy (the bed really is comfortable), it's right next to some awesome restaurants and literally around the corner from the L station. 
His roommates are also really cool and they were really helpful when I had questions about where to go and what to do. The house itself is really nice, super chill vibe, instruments everywhere, I loved it!
Doris was a superhost, her place is close to subway and local places. Great value.

We loved Austin's apartment. The location was perfect, walking distance from many restaurants and shops. The only thing you may want to bear in mind is that it is four floors up, but my mother and I didn't have any issue regarding this -it's really not so bad. Also, Austin was very flexible and open to any concern we could have. Thank you!! We had a great time.

Max left us the key in a lock, making it much easier than usual for us to check in.  The apartment was clean, cozy, and very welcoming.  His family has a child and there were plenty of toys for our children to play with.  The view was of the main street below and not really much to look at, although it's NYC and you're not there to sit in the apartment and stare out at the view!  The elevator to the apartment was perfect, and MUCH needed.  Every time we've stayed in NYC we've made the mistake of not having an elevator, so this was definitely a huge plus.  Honestly, this was our favorite place we've stayed in NYC so far, although it's a little distant from all the cool stuff to do.  If you have kids, this place can be kind of far.  If it's just you or a couple, then it'd be perfect!  It's about 2 blocks from a subway station and you can pretty much get anywhere in the city within 30 to 45 minutes.  I loved Max's place and am so glad we got to stay there.

Taylor was a great host. Giving us advice about where to go around. Neighbourhood is full of small bar and restaurants. It is really easy to catch any public transportation from the appartment. Appartement was very very clean. Thank you Taylor!

Nice apartment with a very nice roommate. I didn't see Auminea as she was in in Australia but she was very nice and helpful over email, as was her roomate. He helped me with my bag upstairs, he lent me clean sheets when I arrived as the ones on the bed weren't clean, and he answered any questions about the area I had super fast. 
Fantastic location, literally 2 mins walk to the L, Bedford Ave is one stop from Manhattan. 
The room and apartment were not that clean, a lot of dust and hair.. more than I would find acceptable, others may not.
The person in the apartment above sounds like a herd of elephants and seems to walk across her flat all night. There was a rave outside the window which started at midnight and was still going when I left for the work the next morning which meant zero sleep. There is also a high school opposite the window, very noisy if you want to sleep in on a week day. Not a great apartment for sleeping. 
The room doesn't look quite like the photo as there are packing boxes lining the wall, plus there is no way to hold the curtains open so it was hard to let natural light in.
Excellent location for Bedford ave, if noise and super clean don't bother you it's a great room.

Daniel's apartment is located really close to the station and is really easy to find. It was in a convenient location for me while I traveled around NY. The apartment was clean and had everything we needed. I would definitely recommend this place to others! Thank you for your hospitality!

Fillip is an amazing host. He took initative to contact me and make arrangements for my arrival. The room was neat and exactly as shown in the picture. The other guests in the house were friendly and non-intrusive. I will definitely stay with Fillip again. 5 stars!
They provide me with a lot of food juice or breakfast, and the host is very considerate!! I like that ! The house is very quite and the decoration is very good

Well what can I say! If your looking for place that is clean and situated in the heart of NYC then this place is it. Not only was it a two bedroom, had a gorgeous rooftop deck but is literally 4 blocks away from Madison square garden and time square. If you are a restaurant guru then eataly in the flat iron district will certainly suit your needs which is only about 2 blocks away. This place is perfect for a trip to NYC I would definitely give this place 5 stars. When we needed assistance at the beginning we had no trouble contacting Adam, he was always a phone call or text away. This is my first time using Airbnb and all the host are like Adam I will definitely be using this service again!! Plus he offered us the beer that was in his fridge, how awesome is that!

This location is AMAZING! 

Close to transportation, so clean, super eclectic and cozy! There are so many awesome restaurants around the corners! The girls are MORE than hospitable! Anything we needed they sent out an sos if they didn't have it and got it to us! This was one of the best places we have stayed! 

The best was the apartment felt secluded and tucked away with a gorgeous back yard to chill! Then you step out the front doors and you are in NY again! 

Definitely will stay here again!

Richard is an amazing host. Very attentive and thoughtful. The house is beautifully located near the park and two metro stations. It has everything one needs for a comfortable life. 
It's a wonderful place to stay with a family or friends. 
It's my second time and I for sure would like to stay in the house again when I have a chance.

A wonderful space in a lovely location. I stayed for three weeks in June/July '16.
Jana let out the basement apartment area of her Fort Greene house while she and her family were away. The resulting space has its own access from the street and includes a large bedroom with huge bed, a bathroom with bath/shower and a kitchen/living space that opens up onto the garden. It's a very quiet apartment with plenty of room for a couple or an enormous amount for a solo traveller! For visitors in summer, there is a/c in both the living room and the bedroom. 
I loved the Fort Greene neighbourhood; it feels like a real community. There are plenty of nice restaurants and food shops within 5mins and it's a very green area with Fort Greene park is just around the corner. It is a short walk to numerous subway options to get to Manhattan should you wish.
Overall, this was one of my best Airbnb experiences and I would certainly stay again if possible.
Nice room in a great building with a super accommodating housemate.  He's the best.
The room was very big with a comfy bed. Don was nice and provided me with enough information about apartment and area. Overall a good experience.
Amazing experience! Arpan was so nice in letting me stay at the last minute, and waiting up for my when my plane was delayed. The bed is super comfortable and the location is perfect.

Sehrish was very accommodating with my last minute request. Her room was very clean and spacious. Her roommates were so welcoming and kind. The apartment is very close to a subway and Laundromat and a short walk to lots of restaurants and bars. Had a great stay, thank you Sehrish!
Awesome place in a really nice neighborhood, was a great host! Recommend to all very friendly and nice!

Host did not provide internet for entire three week period - despite promising to do so in the listing. In addition, the apartment was completely unfurnished (no silverware, plates, microwave etc.) and bedding was only provided begrudgingly. I was not made to feel looked after by Tianhui at all.

Carol was amazing.  I had a last minute trip come up and arrived in New York to the terminal being evacuated which delayed my arrival time to Carol's place by 2 hours.  Carol waited up for me and was so nice - she didn't care about the time being past 2:00am.  The room was very nice and cozy, sheets and towels of high quality and a nice complimentary assortment of toiletries.  The kitchen was stocked with tea, coffee, cereal, eggs and milk for a quick on the go breakfast.  Great location about 15-20 minutes walk to the train to downtown Manhattan. Close to shops and restaurants.   Everything was clean and very tidy. I highly recommend Carol's Beautiful Private Room and will definitely stay there again if i'm in NY.

Liza, thank you so much for having us in your apartment.  It was only a last minute booking from our side, but you arranged everything to be perfectly all right.  You have a great place in trendy and fantastic neighborhood.  Thanks for everything !

Catie's apartment was in a great spot. Super close (across the road from the 181st A train station) which is a half hour ride into the heart of Manhattan.

The room was large and we were able to make ourselves at home right away which was great. The kitchen has a lot of utensils which we really appreciated as it's always nice to buy groceries and prepare some meals and not have to eat out all the time.

We didn't meet Catie but she was quick with communication and left helpful notes. There was a housemate staying at the time who was friendly (although a little bit messy at times - he moved out though).

If definitely recommend staying here to the self sufficient traveller.

Nette ruime kamer. Alles was schoon en netjes achtergelaten. Leuke buurt en een directe (metro) verbinding naar Manhattan. Warme douche en geen last gehad van huisgenoten of overlast. We waren erg tevreden.

The host is welcoming.
The neighborhood is okay.
all perfect! the room very nice, very quiet place, the roommates friendly, the neighborhood and near the center. I hope next time.

Emma was prompt in all communications and provided all of the information required well ahead of checkin. Everything felt like it was going to be in place prior to arrival and it was.

The place is amazing! Fantastic location with stunning river views, Williamsburg bridge views and views over to Manhattan. Beds were comfortable, kitchen was well appointed and lounge was nice and cosy.

Great, quiet neighbourhood with the place being a short stroll to all of the action, restaurants, bars and shopping that Williamsburg has to offer. Also convenient access to both the L train and the JMZ train.

Staying in this apartment made us feel like true New Yorkers and felt like we were at home.

Highly recommend this apartment!!

Thanks Emma!

HIGHLY, HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!!!! I booked a 5-day stay at Adam's place about 2 weeks in advance, as I found this place to be one of the best deals in terms of location, price, and quality. 
Adam left two fresh towels folded on a neatly made bed, and his roommate was there to give me a set of keys.
The place is BEAUTIFUL without feeling luxury so you get the homey vibe, and huge for a NY apartment!! 
The only warning is that it is located on the 4th floor, so you will have to climb 3 flights of stairs each time you come in but that is in no way a deterrence. The location is prime for any Williamsburg/Brooklyn exploring, a quick 3-5 minute walk to the train stops to get into Manhattan, and there are tons of bars and food places nearby so it's always bustling. 
I saw Adam's roommate Todd (who was also there at the time) one time in the 5 days I was there. But Todd is a super chill guy who is easygoing anyways, so it wouldn't have been a bad situation if we were home at the same time. 
The bedroom has a great view of the neighborhood and the exposed brick gives such a great feel to the place. The bathroom is extremely nice and clean, and nothing is cluttered so it was great for my friend and I who stayed there.

The bed is comfy and the living room is a great place to unwind at the end of the night and watch TV.

Next time I'm back in NYC, I'm definitely looking to see if this spot is available!

Overall this room has a lot of potential, but the negatives outweighed the positives during my stay.
Upsides:
1. Very cute, nicely-furnished apartment.
2. Nana was very helpful with check-in/arrival, friendly, answered texts promptly and was very flexible with check-out, which I greatly appreciated.
3. Pavlov, the dog is super sweet.
4. The room itself was pretty spacious for NYC.
Downsides:
1.  Apartment is very small and both bedroom doors are large, glass French doors that face each other and open onto the very small main living areaa (which includes kitchen and dining table), so absolutely NO privacy unless you are in the bathroom.  Some sort of window coverings on both bedroom doors are badly needed.  From most places in my bedroom I could see directly into most places in the host's bedroom (and vice versa of course)! 
2. The bed/bedding situation was far from ideal.  The bed is a twin daybed, so it has a head and footboard and may be cramped for anyone over about 5'5".  The bed was made when I got there but was very uncomfortable - turns out I slept the first night on a boxspring, not a mattress, with no mattress pad and only a thin sheet to cover it.  The next day I noticed that the mattress was actually UNDER the bed on the floor, and I had to pull it out and put it on top by myself and remake the bed - again no mattress pad (I asked), so only covered with a thin sheet.  There was a "feather bed" to put on top of the mattress, but it also had no cover.
3. Beware the bathroom door lock - I got locked inside one night while I was showering and it took me 30 mins to "jimmy" the door open with my nail scissors and my tweezers.  I didn't lock it again after that!
4.  The rug in the bedroom needed a good cleaning/vacuum.

Christina and her place were amazing. Christina was on her own holiday on another continent but without fail every question we had was answered through messaging straight away. Our arrival was delayed by 5 hours meaning we couldn't pick up the keys until midnight, christina's friend met us at the appatment without any issue. The appartment is perfect for a couple and in the best part of New York with the subway line just around the corner that will get you uptown and downtown without needing to change trains. We would definately stay here again and couldn't recommend christina or her apartment highly enough!

My stay in Greenpoint could not have been better. First, my flight was extremely delayed coming into NYC, and Jennifer quickly adjusted plans and made arrangements for getting the keys. When I walked into the apartment at 3am, I was welcomed with flowers and a VERY clean and beautiful apartment. Jennifer left detailed instructions for me about trash and recycling, contact information for neighbors, the wifi log-in and how to work the AC. She came over the next day and walked me through how to have a successful and enjoyable summer in the apartment. She was a very gracious host and left no detail undone. The apartment is stunning...a very large 2 story apartment, 2 full TEMPURPEDIC beds (comfy!), 2 bathrooms, AC in bedrooms and books for days. I even had a lovely office space to work from. The apartment gets great natural light and is a super inspiring space. The neighborhood also provides everything you need - laundry, deli, restaurants, good coffee, bars, subway access, etc. I couldn't have imagined a better place to spend the summer. Thanks for everything!

The apartment was well described and I enjoyed my stay. It was clean and had everything I needed.The bed and furnishings were comfortable and the two windows kept it light and gave it a more open feeling during the day.
The building was quiet and well maintained and the  neighborhood is lively and close to the park and transportation.
I did not meet Alexandra but the transfer of keys was easy and she responded very quickly to my questions.

I truly can recommend Jiaying, she is a very nice person. I loved my stay in NY the location was perfect. Very safe, even when I came home late by Metro I was not scarred to walk to the apartment.  It was nice to have a home away from home.

Karen was great. Responsive, reliable and decent. She was willing to help with everything toward my arrival. She accurately described the apartment for its pros and cons so I didn't find any bad surprises when arrived. 
I will definitely want to stay again in her apartment on my next visit to NYC.
Alleyne is a very nice host. The place is just like the pictures. There is nothing to do in the area but very close to public transportation. I recommend.

Malcolm was a great host. I had contacted him extremely late and he was able to accommodate us right away. He was also really great with communication and getting back to me quickly. 
The house was very similar to the pictures. The room was simple yet very comfortable and Malcolm and his roommate made me feel extremely welcomed. Although a short visit I would recommend this place for someone who wants to be close to what's happening I'm Brooklyn.
Alyssa was very nice and able to help with our requests. Her place is nice and conveniently located to explore Williamsburg and Brooklyn. I'd recommend this place!

I loved my weekend at Annie's apartment! The place was so comfortable and welcoming. Great neighborhood and easy to get to as well! Communicating with Annie to arrange the weekend was down-right-pleasant :) I would definitely stay here again!

Prerna was a fantastic host! Her responses prior to our visit were fast, informative, friendly, and thorough. From the very beginning of our conversations to the end of our stay, she was helpful and available. Prerna went above and beyond by giving us numerous local recommendations for attractions, dining, etc...and even left some yummy cookies for us upon arrival with our check-in information! The apartment was clean and as described in the listing.  We were happy to have a doorman and an elevator in the building - very safe and convenient! Everyone we encountered on building staff were also very helpful and friendly. The apartment was a perfect fit for my husband and I. It was extra spacious for an NYC studio apartment with a well-appointed kitchen, dining, living, "bedroom", and bathroom. Prerna has done a nice job of creating separation and privacy between the bedroom area and the living area, which was a plus! The bed was comfy. We had all the linens we needed and access to dishes, internet- based TV services and wifi without any problems. There was a lot of natural light, and the apartment was centrally located within walking distance of Times Square (7-10 blocks), Central Park (about 7 blocks) and theatres (1-8) blocks. We walked or took public transit everywhere. No need for cabs unless you just want to use them. Overall, a wonderful experience and would recommend this listing highly to others!

Excellent location, lovely host. Carmelle replied promptly all our messages and made sure we had all we needed for our stay. The place is calm, clean, and well located. The subway is a ten-minutes walk from the apartment.

I needed to reserve a place in Brooklyn very last minute (since another host canceled my first reservation last minute) and Kristina responded to my inquiry right away to work out the reservation for my family. Everything about our experience with Kristina and her apartment was superb, from communication to cleanliness. She was super fast in answering any questions, and even took the time to advise on the best route from her apartment to my sister's place in another section of Brooklyn.  She went above and beyond by recommending her favorite coffee/breakfast/pastry shop in the neighborhood (which was AMAZING, by the way!) and leaving out hotel size toiletries for our use.  
The apartment slept all 5 of us very comfortably, and since our group was all girls having 2 bathrooms was a huge plus! No trouble finding street parking. Smooth and easy process of getting keys, connecting to wifi, etc. 
Superb host and excellent experience all around. I would definitely request this apartment again for future trips to Brooklyn!
Room was just what I needed at the price I needed. Everything was clean, comfortable, and there is an adorable cat.
Couldn't have asked for better hosts.  I really enjoyed the immersive Williamsburg experience!
Ensure you get a proper phone number from the host prior arrival. Talk to him before and make proper key handover arrangements. Not a bad deal overall if we didn't have the issue with mold.

I unfortunately did not meet Cliff as he was traveling himself; I rented his room, which is an amazingly spacious and comfortable bedroom and attending office. The bedroom itself had great light and I slept most nights with the windows open, which was refreshing and breezy. The apartment takes two floors of a typical Brooklyn brownstone that I loved - and walking to the subway / running errands / going out took the shape of an amazing stroll of some of the most beautiful architecture Brooklyn has to offer. I met Lanneau, Cliff's roommate, a couple of days into my stay - an amazingly creative, chill, warm, welcoming, open, smart, funny man who recommended a wine store and hung out with my friends while we all listened to music. We even found out that through the magical network that is Brooklyn, his friend is the twin brother of my friend's neighbor (if that makes sense). I spent too much time out to really make the best out of their great backyard, but maybe on another visit ;) the cats, Food and Menu, come and go as they please and are very low maintenance. I had a very good time and got to know some of the neighbors, which was great and really helps feeling at home in the neighborhood. From what I could see, Cliff is an outstanding photographer and I would have loved to meet him. Highly recommended!

Lindsey was great, very nice and understanding (we arrived way later than we said we would and she didn't make a fuss at all, even though we had to wake her up in the middle of the night). The apartment was very nice and comfortable and the rooftop terrace has an amazing view and is a great place to relax when the weather is nice, all in all a great stay!

Perfect location! The place is very close to the subway and you can take any line you need and go whereever you want without transferring to another line. There are also lots of super nice restaurants in the nieghbor. The place is also cool. It was even bigger than i expected. I would totally recommend the place with no question and stay there again.

Sarah was a wonderful host and her apartment was awesome. She was easily contactable, reliable and friendly. Her apartment is in the best location in the LES. The subway and all the fab spots in the LES are literally just steps away. Everything that I needed for a comfortable and hassle-free visit to NYC was provided. Thank you, Sarah!

The place is in a beautiful building, nice stone architecture. It's a walkup, up three flights, so keep that in mind.

The neighborhood is beautiful. It's quite gentrified, but there are still some cheaper food joints. It's not totally soulless. Park Slope is also about as safe as you can get. It feels more that way than much of Manhattan.

The place is in the middle of the neighborhood, so it's a 7 minute or so walk from any of the three train stations, which is a bit far.  But those three stations offer five unique lines, so you can get to many places without transfers.  Certainly to the major stations in Manhattan. 

The roommates are extremely nice and welcoming. We chatted a few times and they do their best to make the experience a pleasant one. They said I could use their dishes, eat their food, watch Netflix on their PS4, and all that. Very nice, and not really expected from strangers!

The room is small but just fine. The main problem was that it didn't have air conditioning. There's no AC in the apartment as a whole, and nor is there in the room. There's a fan, but that doesn't go very far when it's over 80 and the air source (an alley) doesn't get wind and tends to stay warm. AC would make this an excellent listing.

Jeffrey was wonderful, apt was very clean and we had plenty of space in the closets and drawers. His wife made a very helpful list of anything we may need to know about the apt and helpful hints. I very much look forward to renting from them again.

Well what can I say.... "Fan bloody tastic" does it me thinks.

We have done 12 plus Airbnb's all over Europe and 3 now in the 'US of A' and for a host of reasons this is by far our fav.

Great communication.....
Great house notes.....
Great house - just as pictured, very clean, very well kitted out- Nespresso and Sonos..what more could a fella want...
 
To 'do' both Brooklyn and Manhattan it's a great location. Stylish local street 50 m from Carroll Gardens Subway so very easy to get to Williamsburg, Brooklyn Bridge etc and into lower and upper Manhattan  for all the iconic sight seeing that you could want. Very safe area and actually if you decided to only eat locally then in 8 days you would never need to go back to somewhere twice ( within 3-5 mins are Italian ( of course as almost Little Italy) Greek/ Vietnamese / Thai / American /seafood/pizza, more pizza/ Fine dining / wine shops/ supermarkets ( incl Whole Foods, which if you have never been...prepare yourself for extraordinary displays/ ranges of grocery foods 

Anything negative? Yes....I cant live there.....

Would strongly recommend this to any friends thinking of doing NYC

Thank you Beth children and of course Kevin the Cat. In the words of an Austrian fella with designs on being Mr President ( wrong nationality Arnie ) "We will be back "

I recently graduated from college and received an offer to work at a company in NYC. I rented a small room in Aristotle's three bedroom apartment to help during my transition to the city while I found a flat for myself. Aristotle's apartment is very well located in close proximity to the J M and Z lines. The G line is just a 10-15 minute walk away. It takes about 15-20 minutes by train to get to Manhattan, which is very nice! The room was cozy and had everything I needed for my two week stay. The living room is nicely decorated. Aristotle often has people around, so it's a very lively apartment! I personally thought it was a nice touch, but if you mind some noise, then this is not your place. 

His dog Ishii is the cutest!

Thank you Aristotle!!

Great place to stay, and great to do 'business' with Wes and Tracy: they communicated easily and quickly, and the loft was exactly as described: a quiet and cool zone in NY's coolest neighborhood. Would love to live there!

we were really pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The apartment is even better than photo.propre tidy and well decorated the terrace is really a big plus. Andrew and his roommate were super friendly. the communication was fluid since the beginning. he told us a lot of places to eat or make small purchases were super accomodating to check out it was a pleasure to stay in this apartment thank you very much Adrew & thais

Judy's place was awesome. The bed was really comfortable and facilities were more than easy to use. Communicating with her was really easy, she was receptive to texts, emails, and phone calls. I have extensive airbnb experience and Judy's place ranks among the highest in terms of great value, awesome location, really friendly host, and overall awesome airbnb stay. I would definitely stay again at her place with no issues whatsoever.

The home and experience were just as advertised and pictured by the host and exceeded my expectations. The home was very clean and quiet in a very safe neighborhood and located near many stores and public transit. The host was very communicative, professional, understanding, and hospitable. She went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. She was very willing to answer questions and provide suggestions. I give this host my highest recommendation and would rent from her again if the opportunity arose.

If you want to stay in Park Slope I can't imagine a better place to stay.  Warm, immaculate and spacious apartment.  I think we were Beatrice's first AirBnB guests and she was very attentive and offered great tips on the neighborhood.  The gourmet espresso machine was well used.

Wing-Yee was a very welcoming and gracious host. The apartment is very clean and beautifully decorated, and is located in a quiet neighborhood with views out the back of the building into a tree-filled patio space. The location also provides quick access to multiple bus and subway lines, as well as green spaces like Riverside and Central parks. Highly recommended.

It was definitely a good experience living in the apartment. The apartment was tidy and comfortable, and the view was great. Shehzad was very accommodating. The transportation was also convenient. The subway station was Just in walkable distance, and it was easy to Uber. My friend and I had a really good time there.

Our entire experience was amazing!  The apartment was perfect - comfortable, clean, and roomy (even by NYC standards) and exactly as the listing stated.  The location was great - the neighborhood was safe and clean and had tons of shops, restaurants, etc.  We were 2 short blocks from one subway station (the one we used most) and only 5 short blocks to a larger station for more choices of lines.  We were a couple of blocks from riverside park on one side and the amazing Central Park on the other!  We are already planning out next trip to NYC and will absolutely stay in this location again if possible. Our host was also amazing.  Very pleasant to communicate with - very quick to respond - and very welcoming.  I would highly recommend Gat and her apartment - you will not be disappointed.
Wonderful home in a safe neighborhood. Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for a few days, tealeda is the sweetest

Kim was an amazing host. So sweet and considerate. She made sure my stay was comfortable and that I had everything I needed. She checked on me periodically, which I had no other host do. Her room was spacious, relaxing and clean. I highly recommend Kim as a host. Five STARS!

The apartment was in a superb location in the heart of Wall street, with subway stations very close by! The pictures showed exactly what I was to expect at the place and it was very clean. Communication was pleasant with Mary with very quick responses, would definitely stay again!!

Beyond a pleasure staying with these guys, I needed somewhere to stay pretty last minute and for just a night, I received speedy response to all messages and help beyond expectation!! Total boys pad complete with bar!!

Julianne's apartment was a great place to stay in Greenpoint. It's clean, a fairly large one bedroom and nicely decorated. The apartment is near McCarren Park and close to Williamsburg; it's also close to the G line and not far from the L. For my wife and I, it was a perfect location while visiting my two daughters.
Ali was the perfect host. She made me feel really welcome and wad very helpful with everything. Also her roommate Jay was really great with everything.
Great host and best ever!

I really had a nice time at Kat and Jesse's place. They're super nice hosts, and they helped me hugely on my quest to visit the cool art spaces around Bushwick. The location is primo for hopping around Brooklyn or popping into Manhattan on the metro. I hope to return soon! 

If you visit, please know this is a real, live artist's residence -- it's not Martha Stewart's estate with staff buffing every faux painted surface and vacuuming twice a day.  I love the romance of the elevated train running close by, but light sleepers might struggle a bit on their first couple nights.  And bless the hosts, they provided air conditioning in my bedroom -- yay!

Also, it's very easy to get to JFK airport from their house via the J/Z train. That made my departure easy.
Billy's location was conveniently located near NYU campus. Very navigable on foot!

Maurine has a very cute apartment in a great location in NYC.  Check in was at 12pm and we told her we would arrive around 1:30pm. The night before our arrival, she asked that we come at 2:30pm.  We arranged to drop off our luggage and return later since we were coming straight from the train, but this was inconvenient.  When we met, Maurine was very friendly.  Unfortunately, after she left, we realized that the shower was not very clean and not draining correctly.  There was also a lot of mildew.  My husband tried to take a shower but the water would not drain.  The neighbor downstairs actually had a leak into her apartment. We moved out after 1 night and found a last minute hotel room.  We agreed to pay for one night + cleaning fee. Maurine was understanding, however when it came to refunding us for our stay - we were only offered 68% of our fee back when we only stayed 1 of our scheduled 6 nights.  This is very disappointing given that the hotel room was much more expensive.  I would not stay at Maurine's again.  If you do, bring shower shoes.
Had a great 10 days, great location.
Had an enjoyable stay at Barrs place whilst he was out of town. Everything accurate as per description, super convenient location and easy communication with Barr. Recommend.

The flat is located is a very nice areas with bars, groceries and restaurant.
The apartment is clean and comfortable.
Mary Kate is welcoming.

The room was exactly as described. Great experience. His roommate was very accommodating and I had everything I needed. The backyard area was an unexpected perk, and the proximity to the R train really made this a great place to stay for a couple weeks in South Slope/Gowanus. 

The room had AC, a Fan, good internet, pretty much anything you could need for a short term stay in the summer, and Alex bought new bed sheets for the bed which was also great. Noise level was never problem. Overall it was a very welcoming and comfortable experience.

My friend and I loved our stay at Casey's tidy and tasteful apartment!  The kitchen and bathroom were immaculate, we loved the easy-to-use projector in the cozy living room, and both the bed and modern pull-out couch were very comfortable.  Everything was as pictured/described, and Casey was in good contact before and during our stay.  His recommendations for how best to take advantage of all the great eats and drinks at our doorstep were on point, and the easy stroll to the subway made the apartment a great base for exploring the rest of the city.  Thanks, Casey--I'd happily stay here again!
Very nice. Was courteous, kind, easy-going. Nice place, clean and just what I expected.

Leroy was the most helpful and gracious host. The apartment was bright and convenient. The location turned out to be great: close to Brooklyn Heights, Fort Greene, and a few stops away from Union Square.  My wife and I enjoyed our stay and are grateful to Leroy for making us feel at home.

I actually didn't get to meet Sean in person because of flight delays, however he was really gracious about it and flexible about getting the keys to the apartment to me.

The apartment was pretty much exactly as described in the posting. It was small but not too small, and it was right off the 1, which made it easy to pop in and out of Manhattan.

Overall, I had a great experience!

My stay at Kyle's place was a really great stay. I needed somewhere to stay at relatively short notice and Kyle's place was more than what I was looking for. Great location, great shops/restaurants nearby... all in all I had a great stay which allowed me to experience NYC in an authentic way. The home is a great space for two. I felt really at home at Kyle's place, his balcony space was a great added touch too. Kyle is a great host, very quick to respond and easy to communicate with even though he was travelling out of town as I was checking in. Would defo book with Kyle again!

The flat is perfectly located as in the middle of all the metro stations and walking distance to Central Park and lots of "best-to-do" of New York City. Moreover, I arrived from the train station from Canada (Port Authority) so it was very easy to find.
Jen left the key to the doorman of the building so I was able to pick it up at the time I wanted, quite andy.

However, I was very surprised when I realised that the flat was dirty. It looked like Jen was moving with boxes and dust all around. Airbnb should be a win-win situation and in that particular case, that wasn't. I am perfectly conscious that this is not a hotel but what i do know is that cleanliness is basic. I don't get paid for having to clean myself the appartment. 

This flat has a huge potentiel, so has Jen as she was very reactive but she has to be VERY careful with the way she leaves the appartment. Simply by respect.

C.

Whitney's place was exactly what we needed to enjoy a week in New York! She was very prompt and helpful from the start and provided us with everything we needed to enjoy our stay! As she was out of town when we got there she arranged for a friend to meet us, get us the keys, and show us around the place. Her friend checked up on us throughout the week and, although we never needed anything, we felt we could have gotten the help we needed! We met Whitney when we checked out and she was fun and a great person to work with!
The studio was described well in the listing and had plenty of room. Whitney was nice enough to clear out lots of closet and drawer space for us so. The AC unit worked great and kept the place cool. Overall, the place was comfortable and perfect for our needs. 
The location was great--walking distance to some major museums (The Met, Cooper Hewitt, Guggenheim), the park, and the 86th street subway station, which made it easy to get from A to B quickly. The neighborhood wasn't as busy as other parts of Manhattan so it was a nice escape from the noise. The apartment kept quiet at all times and we never even heard any neighbors. Great first airbnb experience!

Listing description was accurate.  Donna was helpful and easy to communicate with.  We had a late flight in, and she made sure that we could access her apartment.   Also - The apartment is in a GREAT location.

Dwayne and his roommate Carl were an absolute joy to stay with. The place was exactly what we were looking for while we stayed in Bushwick. Close to bars and restaurants and easy to commute in and out of the city.

Leonit was a sweetheart. The location was great, close to the public transportation and what's most important safest family neighborhood in Brooklyn. Enjoyed staying there very much. Thank you so much!
Great location and the home had a cool vibe. Emeka was a very accommodating and responsive host. Friendly and easy going, was always helpful and showed me around the area.
it was really good! good and quiet locality and metro was 3 min by walk

Stephanie was extremely helpful and clear to communicate with. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The house was clean and tidy and the other (Hidden by Airbnb) were lovely and super helpful and friendly. 
Location was handy - very close to subway and easy to get anywhere. 
I highly recommend Stephanie and her room.

Megan's place was great! Very comfortable space, easy access to several of the subway lines, and in a great location with lots of food/shops in the area. Megan was very friendly and great about communicating/coordinating check-in/check-out. No complaints! Would stay here again for sure.

Nicholas was a great host during our weeks' stay at his beautiful, clean  apartment. He accommodated us for a late check-in by sending a friend to greet us, show the apartment and hand the keys. Nicholas communicated with us through text and was always available.
The location in Harlem is very convenient. My wife and I would stay happily at his apartment any time again.

I had a great stay at Anastasia's place. It's a cosy, clean and quiet place. The mood lighting is impressive and makes evenings beautiful. There was no problem arranging a late check-in (after 10pm). The fridge greeted me with a selection of yoghurts, an orange juice and bottled water. I felt like at home. Thank you!

Sarah's apartment was clean, cozy, and comfortable. They have a lovely open space with all the basics. All the rooms receive lovely light and is located in a very convenient part of Brooklyn. The amenitites and decor are minimal without sacrificing personality. I felt welcomed to her home without feeling like I was completely invading upon her life (as a former New Yorker I can understand how sacred your apartment space can be). Overall, my stay was perfect and I couldn't have asked for more.

Jim was an amazing host and his apartment is truly spectacular.   He was extremely friendly and communicative.  The apartment was recently fully remodeled and has amazing views.  I can't recommend Jim's place enough.

I had a wonderful time staying at Justin and Rowen's apartment. It's definitely spacious by NY standards. Right across the street from McCarren Park. Pet friendly building. 10 min walk from the L train. 10 min walk from Greenpoint. A block away from Bedford Ave. A few doors down from McCarren Hotel & Pool. All around great location. Justin was great to deal with. Very friendly and always responded quickly any time I had a question. I would absolutely stay here again.

This room was perfect. Dave & Nat were great hosts, very welcoming. I stayed there during the week and was off doing touristy things, so I didn't get to see much of them because of their busy work schedules. They installed an A/C window unit for me the night I arrived. The location is awesome, right near tons of restaurants (including one just opened by Top Chef Dale Talde!), shopping, Prospect Park, and small markets. The room is spacious and cozy, and the bed is very comfortable. Thanks, Dave & Nat!

Perfect stay! Awesome location. Chris was quick with communication and left some thoughtful guide books and such that was much appreciated.  I'm glad this was my first air B and B experience and would recommend to anyone else in a heartbeat.

I had a great stay at Danny and June's 2 bedroom apartment. The apartment was comfortable, and warm, which was great, given the cold outside. The neighbourhood was full of life and had all the cafe's, restaurant and food shops I could ask for. Plus it was only a short walk from the subway to the city, the Barclay's center for the basketball and Williamsburg. Danny was very responsive whenever I had a question about the apartment, and I wouldn't hesitate to book this place again for my next trip to New York.

The apartment was well decorated and very comfortable.  Tracy and mark were extremely helpful and friendly.  Although there is construction going on around the building, it did not affect us or our experience.

Chris was a really great host! He kept in touch often and made sure all the necessary arrangements were made. His place is very nice and a great place to relax at night. He has a TON of books all over his apartment that he's very generous about sharing. His place is in a great location and near tons of great restaurants. Overall I had a great time staying at Chris' place!

I had a great stay!  The place was so clean and cute, the bed was super comfortable, and the apartment was really nice.  The area is perfect!  Right in the heart of Williamsburg and so close to the subway to get into the city.  Such a nice spot!  And to top it all off there were two cans of beer, cookies & OJ for me in the fridge...what more can you ask for?!  I totally recommend staying here:)
Great experience, nice place and friendly tenants. Conveniently located RIGHT next to the metro, but miraculously, you never hear the train while in the apartment, which is awesome.

We had a wonderful stay at Francesca's townhouse.  She was very responsive in every way and the house was fantastic... very clean and beautifully decorated and close to many good, affordable restaurants and shops.  Getting in and out of New York was simple, by car and by metro, and we were always able to find a parking space on her street or a nearby street.  The are was safe and very enjoyable to walk around.  Having Prospect Park very close was wonderful for those who wanted to go jogging and there were good free concerts.  We hope to repeat someday!

We loved our host. Her house was beautiful. She made us feel like home. The area was good... She had all the facilities for us... We cooked together. For the days we spent there we felt that we were just at our aunt's house. She is very friendly, smart, knowledgeable, and funny. Even her husband was very good. Being international students, I would suggest every other student of our kind to choose her for the most safe and best experience. If you slightly feel bad and lonely in new york after coming back from a different country then i guess you need to meet Aunt Pauline. She is our second mom... Thanks alot Aunt Pauline.. we will miss yu ... :* And if next time we plan a trip it would definitely be you.. god bless yu :)

Steven and I had a great experience for our first air bnb adventure. I had my flight time mixed up and arrived a lot earlier than expected and Isabel (Katie's roommate) was accommodating, understanding and very nice! Katie was out of the country but left us useful instructions to take subways and wifi information! The location wasn't bad at all. It's about a $30 uber ride from LGA. Taking the subway is the most convenient way to transport to the city.. It was only a couple of stops to Central Park and just a couple more for Times Square.
All in all, our stay was fabulous and perfect for our visit! 
Katie and Isabel, thank you so much for allowing us in your home.

We had a great week in New York staying here. Good neighbourhood to be based in with lots of amenities and a close subway stop to whizz downtown. Jeremy and Liora couldn't have been more helpful and the apartment was exactly as described. Having two bathrooms was brilliant with there being four of us and the two who had the sofa bed were perfectly happy on it! Thank you for a fabulous week.

Great apartment in fabulous location.  4th floor and no lifts so be prepared for the stairs! The apartment was very warm and with no aircon or fans in the bedrooms it made sleeping a bit uncomfortable bc it's too noisy to open the widows. But I have to reiterate that you can't beat the location - a short walk to Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre, Circle Line Ferry terminal, The Highline and Broadway. It meant we could come back to the apartment and freshen up before going out again in the evenings bc it was so convenient. We used key cafe to pick up the keys which was very easy with no issues.

I had a great stay at Natasha's apartment. Upon arrival I was met by her husband Dan who welcomed me in to their beautiful studio apartment. The place is in a great location just a short stroll away from some great restaurants and bars in LES, seconds away from getting on the subway. The place was modern and clean and really suited my 3 day stay there. Would definitely recommend and definitely be back
Nice clean room, exactly as pictured. Samuel was quick to reply to all messages and was very accommodating in regards to check in/out. I had a great stay and would book this room again in the future.

I stayed at Matt's place for the NYC Marathon as my original AirBnb host cancelled on me weeks before the race - I'm glad she did because Matt's place was amazing. The pictures perfectly capture the studio - it's cozy, extremely clean, and has everything you need. The location is great and it's close to multiple subway stations. Though the studio is on the first floor of the complex, the street it's on is relatively quiet and the fan near the bed acts as a pretty good sound machine.  Matt responded quickly to my e-mails and texts, and he made checking in/out super easy.  His fiance prepared detailed instructions for the apartment which helped me settle in quickly. I really appreciated their warm hospitality and I would definitely stay here again.
Loved the fact that Carole made me feel like home! It was a pleasant and cozy place to stay! I usually don't sleep well but the bed was great!The surrounding area Was Fantastic
Great

We had a fantastic 4 week stay at Ben and Alissa's apartment. Although we didn't meet Ben and Alissa, they were always very easy to communicate with and went out of their way to ensure everything was adequate for our stay. The apartment is perfectly located in a nice neighbourhood with everything located nearby. The apartment is nice and spacious and well appointed. The fact that our daughter could use the multitude of toys, books and games that were in the apartment was a lifesaver! Thanks Addie! We highly recommend this apartment and hope to stay again when we come back to NYC!

Nora's apartment is a very pretty, comfortable and bright place, from which is very easy to get to Manhattan - excellent location near the subway.
As a host, she was easy to communicate with, always helpful and left us with a list of great recommendations.
Would definitely go back, given the chance!

Iris was a good host and made the check in and check out process very smooth for her nice small Cozy apt.  
Nice safe area with everything you could need around you from supermarkets,restaurants,Malls,Subway, LIR . It's just a walking distance.  I would definitely recommend her place.
Great experience! Just as described.

Ryan's space was great for my 1 month stay in the city. It was in a very diverse and fun area. He was not there for the duration of my stay, but his roommates were very kind and I had a nice quiet stay in his sunny, neat bedroom. I would definitely recommend it to anyone, as it is a very short subway ride into the heart of Manhattan.

I didn't meet Megan but she was available through email if I did need anything, as well as her friend Laura who handed off keys to me. I instantly felt at home in Megan's place. I like to read and to browse through her collection was- along with the paintings and artifacts- a real treat. I'd definitely like to know the stories behind the art she owns. There was a heatwave the week I was there and the air conditioning made the whole time there even more comfortable. Other than that, Meagn's place is as it is pictured and huge!! For me, it was good to be able to spread and not have tip toe around roommates at home in Chciago. So if you have a week, want to stay in Brooklyn, and literally 5 mins away from Prospect Park, book this place. And lastly, I was grateful for Megan to accommodate me for two extra days when my plans before coming to her place fell through. I'd book again!!

Big, sunny and spacious apartment that's central to the best restaurants, bars and shops Williamsburg has to offer and super close to the subway into manhattan. Ali is super cool, friendly and communicates really well with you throughout your stay. The room is huge for NYC standards ;-) and has two big windows and a big comfy bed. Hoping to stay there again next trip.
Perfect for a small family. Awesome location, awesome apartment, awesome hosts. Could not have had a better experience.

Patrick was a wonderful host! His apartment is in one of the most vibrant neighborhoods in NYC and is a short walk from anything you might need or want. My time there was great! Very comfortable & convenient! Loved it! Thank you Patrick!

Tanni was such a great host! She was very communicative, and made our stay very comfortable! The location is very accessible via public transportation, making it easy to get around to different boroughs. The room was beautiful! It was filled with many plants, and neat trinkets! Gorgeous overall!

The check in process was very very hectic, the maid did not show up so the property managers were scrambling around, which is out of their control. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but the bed was extremely uncomfortable, hard as a rock and the tub consistently dripped and when you first turn on teh water in the tub it comes out brown and it did not drain well. The kitchen and living room were great.

STAT living is a ideal choice of any medical student rotating in the area! The apartment is lovely and equipped with all and more of anything that the busy student may need during their clinical training.  I had a great time, and it was so convenient to be so close to the hospital where i worked.  The area is very convenient, with many food spots and grocery stores nearby, as well as easy subway access.  I would highly recommend STAT living!  They also have NFL Sunday Ticket and many kitchen supplies for the inner chefs in all of us.  Thanks for providing a safe home during my training in Brooklyn!

The apartment met all of our needs. The host was very responsive with messages and her friend that met us at the apartment was very kind, particularly as he waited until almost 1am for us to arrive at the apartment. Located less than 5 minute walk from nearest subway so getting around the city is no problem whatsoever. Would recommend!

Sammy is a really considerate host. I arrived a day earlier by accident. He generously offered that I can check in earlier. The place is really close to the train and there are several grocery stores next by. The place is really tidy. The kitchen had everything I needed. I cooked several times. His roommates were really nice as well. I enjoyed staying.

We spent the entire month of August 2015 at Naum and Alexandra's apartment in Greenpoint, NY.  The apartment was great, lots of light, incredible high ceilings and a big terrace. The location is great, a block away from the subway, and close to great restaurants and bars. Naum and Alexandra were very pleasant to deal with. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place in Brooklyn.

The place was a great space to spend a week in NYC. It is close to the subway in a fun and safe neighborhood. Vanessa provided a lovely home space for us to occupy during our stay, including lots of thoughtful details, from beautiful candles to light to a large basket of clean towels for our use. The space was very cozy! Also, if you're interested in art, this is a phenomenal artist's space, decorated with fascinating pieces and art books. We can't wait to come back!

It was just wonderful. Adriana is a super hostess. Her prompt replies, knowledgeable tips and welcoming friendliness, made our trip everything we wanted it to be. Adriana patiently bore with all our excited newbie questions, and always made time for us, in spite of her busy schedule.She was so easy to get on with, clear ,but flexible in her expectations. She knows and loves her New York, and is the most reliable source of information one needs.  The amazing views from the  apartment,in itself a wonderfully comfortable,topnotch,yet inviting domicile, are worth the trip (Website hidden by Airbnb) is truly in the center of the city, so that everything is basically a walk away.  Most, if not all,electronic and technical  accessories (wifi  5G, printer, TV,etc)are available, as well as, to my husband's delight, an extremely well-stocked gym.  Adriana is definitely a keeper!
The best I host I could have had for my first time in NY!
Great area, affordable and easy to find parking, super convenient experience overall.

Issa was a great host and very helpful! We had to check in late at night and Issa made it possible for us. 
The apartment looks much better in real life then in pictures - it has a certain charm. Location is very good too, near two metro lines and Central Park. 
Me and my aunt enjoyed our stay in New York very much!
Nice location. Many bars, markets are here. Clean appartment. Give everything what you need for take a rest. Very fast asnwered at phone

Arrived late at night, which was no problem with the host, and everything that was listed was included. A great room, in a great location, and at a good price. I had a great stay, and would recommend Peter to anyone using Airbnb in the future!

The room and accommodations were superb! The apartment was clean, organized and cute. The location is right on the N train and provides access to anywhere you need to go. The bed was extremely comfortable and I appreciated having so much privacy.

Staying with Monica was great! Not only was she very flexible and accomodating in every way, she also helped me out when another airBNB canceled on me last minute... As a musician, I felt so welcome amongst fellow musicians! 
The room is clean, spatious, sunny, warm and accomodating in every way. The shared spaces are the same. The bed is warm and neither too hard nor too soft. Privacy is no problem at all.
The apartment is in a quiet neighbourhood, the nicer side of Brooklyn I'd say. The subway is only a 5 minute walk away, you'll be in the center of Manhattan in less than half an hour. Just take care that the trains have a different schedule during weekends (well advertised, but pay attention).

When I'm going back to NYC, I'll be sure to contact Monica again for another stay, I really had a great time and it was a wonderful experience overall!

Our family enjoyed our stay.  All was as represented by our hosts. The home was clean, spacious, secure, and convenient for all of our needs. Alison was very responsive and available to answer any questions or concerns. We appreciated the opportunity to spend our week in this lovely home and would recommend to others without hesitation.

I rented the room for my friend, she was visiting me from Hungary. I met the host Krissy a week before to see the room and she gave me the keys a week ahead which was very nice and trustful. The apartment is super nice, clean and quiet. Her reoommate was very friendly and helpful. The L and M subway was close to the apartment. My friend had a great time and a very smooth stay. Thank you girls! I would definitely recommend for everyone!

We stay in this apartment for one month. The apartment is exactly of the photos, the location is great and the neighbors are super friendly and helpful. We didn't meet Mathilde, but she is very responsive and promptly communication. The house is full of books, we had great time to stay there as well as our baby.

Gregory was a very nice host. His place was really comfortable to stay at and very clean. We used the kitchen often which was very convenient. Also my stay was very affordable and accommodating. Very close to buses and the subway.
Jullian's apartment was amazing. Great location, large clean and very nicely decorated. I would recommend Jullian's apartment for anyone staying in the city.

De ruimte is precies zoals vermeld in de advertentie, ruim, kleurrijk en niet gestript of ontdaan van de persoonlijke spullen van de verhuurders.
De koelkast was gevuld met lekkere dingen (met als enig verzoek om aan te vullen wat we gebruikten voor de volgende verhuurder).
Het gaf ons het gevoel van een warm welkom, alles mogen gebruiken in het vertrouwen dat we er goed mee om zullen gaan.
In die lijn was ook de communicatie met Sari: aangenaam vriendelijk, flexibel en behulpzaam, snelle reaktie.
Bijna jammer dat zij zelf op reis waren, zulke aardige mensen hadden we graag ontmoet.
De buurt vonden wij fantastisch, veel straat (en park)leven, veel hippe koffietentjes, winkeltjes en restaurantjes, mooie oude pakhuizen, kleurrijke graffiti, vriendelijke mensen.
Alleen al in Williamsburg hoef je je geen seconde te vervelen.

Our experience with Katie was very accommodating. She provided us with everything from toiletries to kitchen spices and utensils to beer!  Even though we did not cross paths often, Katie set us up and took care of us as if we were family.
Great check-in. Had keys sent to me. Some miscommunication on who other roommate was going to be, but overall Toma was very responsive and room was a good value.

Everything was great! The apartment was in a great neighborhood, with many different options for restaurants. I like the way the apartment was decorated. For some reason, it made me feel much more welcome. Nikima and her roommate definitely set me up to enjoy my stay at their apartment.

Carly is very responsive to any questions and helpful.  

The place is in an awesome neighborhood and right by the train.  Lots of cool restaurants nearby.  Parking on the street wasn't too hard either.
Faiven was a great host. She left easy to follow notes throughout the beautiful, clean apt. If I stay in that area again I would most certainly stay w Faiven.

Eden and Kami were great hosts. They answered all our questions quickly and were very organized.  They have a really nice spacious apartment right across from Prospect Park which we loved. The neighborhood has everything you'd need a couple blocks a way and the subway is super convenient to the city. Everything in the apartment was clean, with enough storage place and all the necessities you'd expect. Their place is close to the subway so there is some ambient noise during the day, but the subway runs with less frequency at night so it was never an issue. For the money this was the best value we found on Airbnb and would definitely stay again.

Nice appartment in a lovely and quite neighborood

Our hosts were very arranging on the check-in and check-out, they left us a lot of nice messages to help us during our stay in their home.
Nice appartment and good location. It was very clean and very comfortable. Moreover the appartment is closed to the subway, so you can easily reach the center of Manhattan!

I had such a rich and fun experience at Mike's place. This was the perfect Bushwick/Brooklyn vibe that I was after. This Artistic loft apartment was a little like in the movies; art on the walls actually painted by Mike, a true and talented artist. A view down a classic Bushwick Street, a huge rooftop to chill on and watch the sun fade down over Manhattan. The location is perfect. 3 minutes from Morgan Station which is the cultural hub of this place. Healthfood stores, Galleries, rad bars and cafe's abound.
Mike is an awesome friendly and chilled guy. He's also an expert on the area, and will direct you to all the local hangs and events as they happen. He'll show you a glimpse into the art-culture of the area and the best dive-bars or good eating venues around.
I supremely recommend enjoying the flavours Bushwick has to offer, and this is the perfect apartment to do it!

Jocelyn was a welcoming and ultimately outstanding host--we truly enjoyed our stay here! The apartment is just as pictured, and everything was neat and easy to find. The area has a great neighborhood feel. There are so many restaurants and shops within walking distance, and the building itself was quiet and its other residents extremely friendly. If you want to live like a New Yorker during your stay in Manhattan, this is the perfect place! Thank you so much for everything Jocelyn!

Eric and his loft made our trip to NYC so incredibly special! Eric was such a professional host and great guy! Eric thank you for your recommendations and letting us stay in your beautiful home. 

As great as the pictures look, this place is even better in person. The West Village is one of the best areas in the entire city and you feel like a king in this apartment. It is this incredibly spacious loft with a big open bedroom overlooking the apartment. Such a clean and comfortable apartment. Floor to ceiling windows with a view of a beautiful, tree-lined and QUIET block in the middle of the bustling West Village.  It is rare to be right in the middle of the best shops, restaurants, comedy clubs and bars NYC has to offer and also be above it on one of the only quiet street in the West Village.

Eric gave us great recommendations but was out of our way for the rest of the trip unless we needed to get in touch with him via text. Through text he was very responsive and helpful.

This apartment is right next to the W. 4th subway station offering access to the A,B,C,D,E,F and M lines and half a block away from the Christopher street station offering access to the 1 and 2. A block away from the amazing Washington Square Park, this is the absolute best location to be in downtown NYC.

Thank you Eric x10000 and we are looking forward to staying at your apartment again again soon!!!

-Brad

The apartment is really cozy, elegant, well furnished and in a beautiful building just before the 9/11 Memorial. 
You can find everything you need in the neighboorhood (excellent restaurants, supermarkets and stores, especially at Brooksfield Place) and the proximity to Hudson River was fantastic for my daily run.

Christian has always been very responsive and helpful in planning my stay in NY.
Idil is a very kindly girl and very accommodating. The room was clean and she provided me with anything I needed. It had been a very nice experience.
Beautiful home. Very cozy and great hosts

Matthew has been an excellent host and very responsive to any questions/needs. The apartment is lovely, very quaint and charming and in an AMAZING location right between Greenpoint and Williamsburg. It's a great haven, and I would love to stay here again.

I stayed here with my girlfriend over a weekend and had a very pleasant experience. The room and bathroom, along with the rest of the house, was very clean and well maintained. Ryan, our host, and his roommate John and everyone else we met in the house were very cordial and helpful during our entire stay. The location is also situated in a very hip place of Manhattan, close to delis that are open until late as well as great bars and restaurants within the same block (if you like bars that play good 90's hip hop and r&b, Harlem Public is a must visit and less than a block away). The metro/subway is also close by and we took it daily during our stay to venture out to the rest of lower Manhattan for the usual sightseeing. All in all, we would definitely consider coming back again when we visit NYC in the future. Thank you again to Ryan and John for making our stay memorable and comfortable!

Although I couldn't meet Mike because he was out of town, he was very attentive. 

As for the apartment, it is very close to Gates subway station, which is 25 minutes away from Manhattan. The place is exactly as it looks in the pictures, but a lot cluttered. From Mike's texts, I assumed he was sharing the apartment with one roommate but the first day I realized the space was shared with three more people and a dog. Even so, the place was very quiet.

The room was cleaner than the rest of the apartment, and the space was pretty comfortable. It is a simple room: one bed and some space to leave your stuff on the floor. The ad didn't say that the room is in the basement and has no ventilation at all.

This is the right choice if you just need a place to sleep and have some rest.

Ehsan's pad in Greenpoint was a wonderful haven to relax in after a long day exploring the world's most exciting city!! Exactly how it looks in the photos, clean & easy to get to. Greenpoint is an awesome suburb to explore in its own right & also close to the hip Williamsburg. Ehsan was a great host, really helpful giving us plenty of advice & some great suggestions of places to see, cafes, bars etc... Super easy going we felt right at home straight away. I'd highly recommend this place for your next NYC getaway.

Staying in Rob's apartment wasn't as pleasant as I expected to be. The description was accurate, except the "clean" part. Unfortunately, Rob wasn't present (he was in a Brazil) and his roommates were a little bit messy. 

When I first come to his apartment, there were some stains on the bed sheets. Rob responded to me that it's a sweat stain probably. Luckily we had our own sleeping bags so we don't have to deal with this. 

The bathroom was simply disgusting. The toilet wasn't working at all. I had to fix it twice BY MYSELF because Rob's roommates apparently didn't care. Once, someone peed into the toilet but didn't bother with flushing it. So I come to the bathroom and there was a toilet full of urine. I know that's not Rob's mistake, but he's the one who's renting an apartment and if he can't assure that his roommates are neat, he shouldn't rent the apartment at all.
I had a great stay at Laura's. It's a beautiful place in a good location. Lots of things within walking distance. Laura was helpful throughout and everything from booking to handover went smoothly.

Jakob's place was wonderful and his roommate was a wonderful resource! He communicated fully in advance so I knew what to expect. The place was super close to transit, and extremely clean, safe and comfortable. It was also super easy to get to La Guardia when it was time for me to go. I would totally recommend it to anyone visiting Manhattan!

The host was barely around but was helpful at making sure we had access to the place upon arrival. Place was super close to the L train entrance. The room was spacious and bed was comfy, but no space to put our belongings and and the Bathroom and shower were great emphasis on great shower! The Kitchen was perfect had everything we needed. The only complaint was the floors were mad dirty and the place could be a little more clean. Great trip and would recommend the spot to anybody who needs a spot to crash and doesn't mind the little things.
Raymond was an awesome host.  He was friendly, generous and wonderful in every way.

Sebastian (and Danielle!) are truly responsive, friendly, smart hosts.  My stay at their place in wonderful Windsor Terrace was just what I needed... simple and bright large room, peaceful street near restaurants, fresh air coming in my windows and an excellent bed.  The room even has its own entrance.  I hope to return soon.  Thanks!

I stayed here for 3 months doing rotations at Wyckoff hospital. The location is very convenient, close to the hospital, the subway and many restaurants and grocery stores. The room I got was true to picture and description. the kitchen has all the necessary utensils. The bathrooms are descent. The rooftop has the most gorgeous view of Manhattan. All my roommates were awesome people and I will miss them. Overall I enjoyed my stay and I think this is a great choice of residence for any medical student looking for housing in this area.

I had an amazing time in this place and would highly recommend to anyone. The apartment is in a fantastic location and has an amazing view of the Manhattan skyline. What's more the people that already live there made me feel so welcome and I even ended up going out at night with them all at the weekend. Everyone was really helpful and gave me great suggestions of things to do, places to eat and more. 

This was my first time in New York and I had gone on my own and I could not have asked for more: great location, really comfy bed and great housemates.

Thank you to Nora and everyone involved that made my trip great. If you're considering this apartment,  just book it you won't regret it!

Great apartment in a fantastic location! Brittany was a gracious and responsive host, and helped make our stay a wonderful experience!

I highly recommend a stay here and I would definitely book the apartment again next time I'm in town.

Aude and Kellen were fantastic hosts, they were so quick to respond and made sure everything was as easy as possible for us on arrival.  The apartment is absolutely fantastic, really nicely decorated and spacious and the terrace is a lovely bonus.  The location couldn't be better, it was right by the G line to get across to Penn and central Manhattan quickly and easy walking distance through the park to the L stop at Bedford.  There are so many great cafe's, bars and restaurants on the doorstep and Williamsburg is a 10 minute walk to even more.  Amazing stay and will recommend it to friends in future!

Thanks again!
Mark and Robyn
Alexia and her roommate were lovely and have a wonderful apartment. I'm looking forward to staying here again.

Erika was a kind host, whose space exactly as photographed. She recommended some great restaurants in the area, helped me out when I had trouble with the apartment keys (they weren't cut quite right and she wasn't able to give me a spare so we got the lock changed), and invited me to use her spices when I wanted to cook.

She came by a couple of times to pick up things she needed from the apartment while I was staying there, but she always gave me a heads-up first.

Last but not least, Erika is a good judge of character. Her flatmate (who stayed in a bedroom down the hall) was good company, conscientious, neat, and fun to talk to.

John treat me very nice, and his roommate also nice person, they always answer if I have questions because I'm new in NYC.
They even worry about if I found the next place. The area is very convenient also, they pretty safe. I had a great time here.

beautiful situation !! andre sebastian and are kind and helpful to every request ! the apartment is perfect for enjoying the city . the subway is around the corner , Central Park 10 minutes walking distance and the nearby offers everything . We had a great week and would recommend it .

It was a wonderful stay w Andre, Sebastian and Oscar! My puppy Peanut Butter had an amazing time as well. The space is private and just as described in the listing. Oscar, their Frenchie, and Peanut Butter, my Frenchie, were well suited play mates. Both Andre and Sebastian were very kind and helped me with any need. Their space is so convenient! There are plenty of food choices, convenient stores, entertainment options inc. movies and live performance. Central Park is close and your just steps away from the subway. Because I was between spaces in my way uptown, this was an amazing choice. My only regret is that I didn't ask about an elevator but Senastian was very generous to help me get up the stairs w a months worth of luggage (that's how long I'm upstate) but that was my fault. Everything else was perfect. The room is well designed and can accommodate most travelers. I was able to unpack and keep up with my things. It was peaceful stay and I'm grateful for their kindness.

Mathew provided a very accurate description of the room, the building and the neighborhood.  He was very responsive in addressing my questions and requests.  I had a very good experience with Mathew and his room.  I would stay at his place again.
Our stay at this apartment was wonderful. Fabiana left specific instructions to help us through and the apartment was clean and inviting. Not to mention it was in the best location.

Good appartment, little far out of the city but still manageable. No problems with host Rabie was accompdating even offering extra. Appartment was very big for one bedroom, all in all great appartment

Thomas left us lots of good local info including guest passes to the MOMA. :) The apartment was clean, comfortable and happy. The neighborhood was full of families and a great place to relax. Thanks to Thomas and his family for lending their house to us!

Gaby was very responsive and helpful during my stay there. Since the room is actually her room, I didn't have a chance to meet her directly.
Overall, the room is exactly the same as the picture displayed. The apartemen also only 5-6 walk from the nearest subway station plus only 30 mins to times square. Her roomates also very helpful and friendly. I will absolutely stay in Gaby's room should i visit NYC again in the future.
Ryan's place is absolutely great! It is totally worth the money, and you will have a great time.

We LOVE this apartment. Honestly, we felt lucky to be able to stay here. It's so well decorated and has all the amenities you could need, or want; a balcony and roof both with view of Manhattan (more than we've ever seen anywhere), elevator, modern bathroom, spacious bedroom, comfy living room. After a long day of slogging around NYC, this mini-deluxe apartment was a dream to walk into. 

The location is perfectly situated for getting around north Brooklyn; Williamsburg, Greenpoint, Bushwick. The area is so easy to walk around in. There are adorable boutiques and restaurants everywhere. My favorite were Wolves Within, Homecoming, Le Gamin, The Bounty and Diamond Bar's backyard. 

We hope to stay here again next time I'm in New York! The experience couldn't have been better. Thank you Peter & Stephanie!

David was travelling so his brother Jacob was in charge. I had a great time in their apartment. Jacob was a very good host, very friendly and helpful. He gave me a tour in the apartment at the first day and his phone number for any question. The room is comfortable, it has good light and air conditioner (very important during summer time).  The kitchen is comfortable and well equipped, definitely a plus.
The neighborhood is safe and quiet, it has stores and good areas to walk around. The building is very well located and close to transportation (bus and subway).

Host was very helpful. 
Neighborhood was great! 
Apartment was cozy & cute

This apartment was exactly as listed: cute, cozy, spare, airy, lovely, and in one of the best prime locations in Brooklyn. It was a perfect little crash pad for our quick stop in NY. It was small but had everything we needed, even space in the closets and cabinets, which made it feel welcoming. I loved the lush plants, white walls, and tasteful contemporary furnishings. We enjoyed the coffee provided. It felt like we were staying at a friends house. Enjoyable stay.
Keith's place was great. Charming, clean, tastefully decorated and comfortable down to the quality bedding and towels, a great value proposition. Keith was a pleasure to deal with, also.

Comfortable, clean, and a great location. So many good places for food near-by, shopping, and bars. Of course there's Central Park just a short walk away, and it was very close to the Natural History Museum, NY History Museum, and just across the park from the Museum Mile.
