Transit is close by too... Louise is a wonderful hostess, offering us many great suggestions and very responsive to our questions.

Robert was a great host! He always replied to our questions quickly and made the whole process as smooth as possible. Pictures were accurate and the apartment was clean and tidy. The neighborhood and apartment building felt safe and secure. We were very pleased that the apartment had more than enough room for two couples. During our stay on labor day weekend, there was quite a few street parking spots near the building, but Robert also let us know of a couple parking garages nearby in case we couldn't find a spot. The subway was within walking distance and we never felt unsafe walking at night. Overall, we had a great time and I would absolutely recommend Robert to others and would love to stay again sometime!

We arrived to a warm, cozy house, which was neat and clean. Tiffany was there to greet us. She has been great at communicating and let's us know about any other guest arriving. Although, we haven't seen her much, she has been great at answering texts and calls immediately. The building is clean and safe and transportation is plentiful. The subway is 2 blocks away and bus stop just outside. She has been a wonderful host!
the host was out of town and I didn't meet him.
Excelente el trato con Jeanny, siempre se preocupo por todo lo que necesitaba. Super recomendable!
Rebecca's place was amazing. She left us some great ideas for food and activities taking into account our kids too. The location was fab and would go back in a heart beat.

Sara has replied to my very last minute request very quickly. She and her boyfriend were really nice and friendly. The apt is conveniently located in a very nice neighborhood. I enjoyed my short stay, thank you!

Mifan's place had everything necessary, was accessible, quiet and private. I had a last minute change of plans and was unable to return the key on time, and Mifan and her roommate were understanding and accommodating, which I really appreciated. I would definitely recommend staying and would stay again!
The host was easy to contact via text and had the room cleaned for a comfortable stay. Location in the neighborhood was conveniently close to the train for easy routes of transportation.
Joyce was really nice and super friendly, a great host. She showed us Brooklyn and we were out in super cool places. Joyce did her job just perfectly!

Our experience was great. We stayed at the apartment for almost three weeks and we really enjoyed. The space is more than enough, kitchen has sufficient appliances, bathroom great as well with a powerful water flow. The surrounding area is vivid, with lots of things to do in all terms. Shops opened 24:7. Another good thing is how close to the metro station is the apartment. In less than 5min we could reach the station. So yes, we would definitely recommend the place to someone else.

We enjoyed our stay at Olivia's place, although she was travelling she assured all my questions were answered in timely fashion. The room is spacious and the location is fantastic to walk to local bars and restaurants and very safe. We enjoyed the basket of fresh fruits and energy bars left for us, came in handy as we were in a rush to head back.

Sasha was really friendly and gave us all the information to have the access to the flat.
The flat is really nice and has everything you need!

Javier's little gem in east village was fantastic! Couldn't have asked for more from a host, he went above and beyond to make sure our experience in NYC was memorable. The apartment is fantastic, always warm and cosy,  perfect for up to 3 people. The location is great, with shops and restaurants everywhere! Great place to stay if you are looking around the East village area. Cheers again Javier it was perfect!

I had a fantastic experience staying in this apartment and the Tribeca area.

The room and apartment were spacious and very clean, detail was taken to provide toiletries and drawer space for clothes. Dani answered every inquiry I had, including the iron location.

The apartment was very secure with the doorman 24/7, and very quiet. On the doorstep of the bustling and trendy Tribeca area, with cool bars and great food. 

Would highly recommend.

First off I just want to say that this was the most amazing first Airbnb experience.  Our hosts (even though we never met them, due to them being on vacation) were super sweet, helpful, responsive, and overall amazing. If I ever come back to NY there's probably no other place that I would look besides this cute little apartment!  I was scared that it wasn't going to look as advertised but it was exactly that!  The subway was literally right up the steet and food places were right around the corner (: A+

My experience at Dan's place was extremely enjoyable! His apartment was awesome, and made me feel like I was living in New York (although the 6 flights of steps got a bit exhausting). The place was super clean, and exactly as described. The location is unbeatable, just blocks from the shopping on Broadway.

Nice clean place, quiet, and the great location in Murray Hill.  Never met Olta, but she worked with me closely on getting the key and getting into the unit.  The roommates were polite and friendly.  The location was very convenient. I only give 4/5 because of storage space, you're expected to live out of a suitcase in this one.
Fantastic

I did not meet Amber as she had to go out of town during my stay, but she was very responsive in arranging the dropping off of the key prior. The room is spacious and clean, with a window facing *gasp* actual trees and nature, not another building. The place is very close to subway, about 2 minutes walking to 1 train. The common area is also huge and has a kitchen. Overall I am very satisfied.

Anna's apartment was absolutely fabulous. It's huge, extremely clean, bright, well equiped, but above all, we absolutely felt like at home the first seconds we came in. Everything we needed was in, including toys for our two daughters ! Anna was very responsive and helpful whenever I had questions. I would highly recommend this apartment, it was a real pleasure ! Thank you very much Anna !
The room was lovely!

Hila was a gracious and attentive host. She was quick to answer questions and check in with us during our stay to make sure everything we going well. The neighborhood is great, just a block from Fort Greene Park, the C and G lines, and walkable to downtown Brooklyn and all the subway lines at Barclays Center. Great restaurants and cafes, too. The apartment itself is small and basically furnished. This was fine for us as we did not spend a lot of time at home. It would work best for a couple or a small family with a young child.

The apartment is very nice and cozy. Great location with only 3-5 mins walk to subway station. Christina and her friends are super nice and friendly. Even though it's short, I enjoyed my stay in NYC with them ;)

Merit's place is great for a budget stay in New York. When my lodging fell through, Merit was very accommodating and helped me get set up at the last minute. If you don't mind commuting from Brooklyn, this is a great way to enjoy New York on the cheap.

Our family had the best time staying here. The views are beyond amazing, prime excellent location, and very large, comfortable & gorgeous apartment. We couldn't have asked for more for our stay in Nyc. And Dana is an amazing host, responds within seconds! We would definitely stay here again.

Elizabeth's apartment is exactly as pictured--Big, beautiful, clean, and bright. The view is leafy and green in both directions, and the neighborhood is perfect--close to lots of subways, easy to get to Manhattan, everything you could possibly want within a few blocks' radius, and very safe and friendly. Elizabeth was also an amazing host. She even left us a delicious chocolate bar, and extra toiletries in case we didn't have.

Everything was good. I liked the room and the location. 
I can defenitely recommend Rachel's room.

Brooks and his roommates were very friendly and helpful. The room was better than I expected and I would definitely recommend this listing. A great location in a great part of town and close to subways. Great experience.

Had an excellent time staying at Sarah's place! She was very communicative and sweet (I just missed meeting her in person), and made sure I was comfortable throughout my long stay. The apartment was clean, modern, spacious, and absolutely lovely. I was so happy with the apartment and Sarah :)
Wonderful experience.  Couldn't have been better

I couldn't reccomend Yasmin's place any higher - it was a perfect location and a beautiful home. Yasmin was quick to respond to any of my questions, and if I had any problems (which I didn't) I am confident she would have been quick to help. The perfect Airbnb experience.
Great, calm place to stay. Was happy with everything. Recommending to everyone.
Room was just as he described and the host was nice and well communicated.

I stayed in Justin's place for about a month. I had a wonderful time in Justin's studio apartment. It is located right on the Columbia campus, opposite the Law School - thus the location couldn't be better. The studio was spacious, had a nice kitchen (which I didn't use though), a large fridge, a bathroom with bath tub, and a large bed. There was also a fan-tower that I could use when it got a little hot outside. 

Justin was a great host. Upon arrival, I found a bottle of white wine as a welcome gift. Whenever there was an issue, Justin always responded very quickly and helped me resolve my questions. Justin also provided clean sheets for the bed, a pre-charged laundry card that could be used with the washing machine in the basement, and soap and shower gel for the bathroom. 

In sum, I would definitely stay in Justin's place again next time. It's a nice studio perfectly located and reasonably priced. Thanks!

Our hostess, Jue, was very friendly and hospitable for us.  The rooms were comfortable and her cat was quiet and friendly.  The location is near the subway and is great.  I recommend this place to all!

John was a very nice host, He made the checking very easy and the house had a great location. Very flexible check in and out time! The only problem I had was the house should have been more cleaned knowing u had a guest coming. But overall it was ok as I only spent few hours in the studio.

Emma was kind enough to let us check in early, and showed us around the apartment. She also was flexible when it came to check out time and let us stay into the evening. It was not the cleanest,, and the building is a bit run down. There was no A/C and it was quite uncomfortable to sleep on a 90 degree day in the summer. Apartment was close to multiple metro lines and located near many restaurants and cafes. The apartment complex was quiet and safe.

Hope is a wonderful host. Even though I only met her briefly she was very friendly and it was always easy to contact her when I needed. The room is very nice and cozy. There were 4 other people in the apartment but you barely noticed them. The location is wonderful, very easy access to public transportation. I loved staying there. I definitely recommend it.

I had an amazing time staying in Bushwick, Brooklyn and it only heightened my NYC experience. William and his flat mates were a pleasure to live with and extremely welcoming. The apartment is easily accessible to close transport links and the local surrounding area is a great vibe. I would recommend staying here for any fist timers in the city!
The room was exactly as described and you'd be hard pressed to find more welcoming, accommodating, and non-judgemental folks than Gus and his roommates.

Ana was a wonderful host! She greeted me warmly and gave me a tour of her home. She had a busy schedule as did I since I was in the process of getting a new apartment, so we never really saw one another. Her bedroom was huge and had AC which was great for the heat wave we had been experiencing. Overall a great stay! Large and very clean! A very rare find in NYC.

The house is in a good location
I only met Claire once and she
Seemed nice 
The only issue I had was there wasn't a lot of space as the longue is being used as a bedroom
Great location, nice place very homey! Only down side was when the landlord came in unannounced... Other than that it was fine.

The apartment is lovely and really comfortable.
Trixi was very welcoming and helpful.
I 100% recommend this listing!

We had a great stay here. We're from New York and were in-between apartments so what we needed may be a bit different from other vacationers, but it suited out needs perfectly. Very comfy, clean, and well-kept.
Suvi is easy-going and kind. This house is wonderful that full of family warmth. I had unforgot memory in NYC and funny trip. I looking forward to living your house next time! Thank you so much!
Excellent apartment/location. Friendly host. Would definitely recommend.

Ashley was a great host! She was able to meet me exactly at the time I requested to pick up the keys, and she happily accommodated my need for a last minute extra day. The room was completely private with a big closet and two windows for good circulation. We even had the chance to sit and chat a couple of times, and I really enjoyed that too! Great location, literally steps from the train (if you don't mind the noise, about which Ashley was up front). I would definitely stay here again!

Clara was awesome. The room was spacious and sunny. The neighborhood was safe and convenient. The bathroom was stainless. I had to make the reservation last minute, during a hectic interview trip, and Clara was leaving for vacation. But she was very prompt in responding to my request, very considerate of my needs, and very patient in discussing the logistics. I would highly recommend this place to anyone traveling to New York and seeking a quiet niche for a few nights.
I had a good stay
Don was a great host, would definitely stay there again.

This is great apartment. Very nicely equipped in particular the kitchen has everything a serious cook would want, including a Nespresso machine. We felt right at home. The view is great. A nice feature is the 24 hour doorman. We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful.

Sandra and Ignacio are great hosts and left very detailed instructions. In particular their media center guidelines were the best. Sandra was very attentive with several emails to ensure all was well.

Sandra and Ignacio are clearly well travelled and interesting people and the decor reflects this.

We would love to stay at Sandra and Ignacio's again.

My host Gil was great! I only met him once during my two week stay though. I was desperately looking for a nice and cheap place to stay during my vacation to New York. I was so happy when I found his listing. It was like a miracle. Great apartment in Brooklyn. It was very clean and neat. I had the whole place to myself for the first week! (Sister-in law came back from her vacation.) I got to stay in his big room. Gil made me feel right at home. He cleared his desk, drawers and closet for me to put my things. He provided me with everything I needed and even welcomed me to any food he had lying around. Communication with him was a little slow since he was on vacation but I still received a response within a day or two. The neighborhood was okay. I never felt threatened in any way. This place is better than any hotel you can find for the price. My only complaint is that my visit was during winter so the heater had trouble keeping his room at a nice warm temperature. If you're lucky enough to be able to book Gil's apartment do it! I would definitely stay here again if it is available during my next visit to New York. Thanks buddy!
The house description was very accurate, the back yard is beautiful . Irma and her husband were very helpful and gave me some restaurant suggestions. Great house , great neighborhood.

Hanna was wonderful planning my stay at her apartment. We were able to communicate via facetime as requested by me which I appreciated. There were two other people living there and they were very helpful regarding any questions I had with the apartment or with the area. Her  room is quite spacious, can fit 2, but perfect for 1 person. The kitchen was stocked with great appliances, which made my stay a lot more comfortable and easier. I highly recommend her room!
Nice apartment in lovely neighbourhood.john was very polite.

The host was very responsive and welcoming despite traveling overseas during our stay. Communication and questions were answered aptly. Great location - between the L-train and JMZ trains. Locally lots of great coffee shops around and street art - the Bushwick Collective was only a few blocks away. Loved the apartment itself - kitchen, living space (with sofa bed), a work space and full size apartment.

This place is the perfect crash pad.  Andrew is amazing.  Everything was quick, easy and hassle free.  

If you're afraid of a "private room" booking, don't be afraid of this one.  

You'll be happy you booked here
The host definitely made me feel welcome. The place is walking distance from everything. I was well accommodated and would definitely recommend.

Michael was great with communication and gave us some recommendations in the area.  The location was fantastic - easy walk to the train and to restaurants, shops, etc. on Bedford.  Apartment, rooms, etc. were as described on the listing.

I had a wonderful stay at Nicholas' place! Communication with Nicholas was great from the start, and he was understanding when I was a bit late. The apartment was spotless and is beautifully decorated. Like any comparable place in Manhattan it's small, but it's very pleasant and functional. Despite weather in the mid-90s it stayed comfortable without AC.

The location is excellent -- easy subway access to Downtown, easy bus access to the Upper East Side, and right on Central Park for a nice walk in the evening. I also enjoyed being able to walk into Morningside Heights and Harlem for some different restaurants and neighborhood feel. Highly recommend the Hungarian Pastry Shop! Overall this was my nicest stay in NYC in many years and I'd be happy to return.

Very convenient location. Right in the middle of the city - Manhattan. Minutes away from Fifth Ave, Empire State Building, Time Square, Central Park and else. I can eagerly state that the place totally met all our needs and requirements. 
Clean apartment with all necessary appliances.
And Alex is very kind host, that replies messages in minutes.

Guys! This place is STRONGLY recommended if you want to visit NYC and stay in Manhattan... Price/Convenience ratio is way low :)
Hey Alex, please keep it as is - LOL :)))

Sabri

Staying at David Nimmo house was great! I has a perfect location in a great neighbourhood.
He provided new seets, towels and shampoo and other stuff.
I will recommed to anyone to stay in such a central location with a lovely terrace. The apartment is very close to the Bleecker Street/Broadway-Lafayette MTA subway station too!!

I stayed at Pippa and Asa's for a long weekend with my father and brother. We really enjoyed the apartment because it was clean, uniquely decorated, comfortable, and conveniently located near several bars, coffee shops, shopping, music venues, and the Hudson River. 

The bathrooms were clean and the shower had great water pressure. There was a kitchen for cooking, which we used to store snacks in. The beds were comfortable. The living room is open with high ceilings and lots of light. 

The hosts were available by phone and text message for questions. We thought it might be nice to watch a sunset on the roof deck of the apartment building, however after walking up to the top floor we found the door to get onto the roof deck was alarmed. I called Pippa to question whether the roof deck was open and if it was okay to go out on it. She informed us it was actually closed. It was nice that she was so responsive. We also had questions about the wifi which were solved right away with Pippa and Asa's swift responses.

I have been to New York City several times and usually plan an annual trip. We usually book a hotel, but it is often difficult to find hotels with three separate beds so we decided to try airbnb this year for the first time. This was a great first experience. 

I would book this apartment again because our stay was a pleasant one! Thank you for being great hosts! 

If you book this location, some of my favorite coffee shops were Black Cat LES and Cafe Vita. Black Cat LES had an interesting speakeasy style decor and is only a block away from the apartment. They make their own oatmeal which was filling and delicious. For an Italian coffee experience, I would recommend Cafe Vita, where you stand to drink your coffee. If you love donuts, you might want to check this place out because they were huge! I imagine you wouldn't be hungry for lunch after one of them!

We loved our stay!  Communication was great, by text and email.  Everything was ready for us on our arrival.  We loved how clean and bright things were.  We loved the location, how safe we felt, an enjoyable short walk to the subway, and right across the street from the river and the park.  The bed and pull out couch were comfortable.  The laundry room was right down the hall.  Also, a short walking distance to a couple of grocery stores.  Our hosts gave several recommendations for affordable activities near by.  We loved our visit to New York, and where we stayed really added to it!

We never met Sam.  He always responded quickly to our texts however, never showed up when he stated he would stop by.  This was the worst experience I have ever had traveling.  I was alone with my two preteen daughters.  So I was nervous.  There wasn't a chain on the door.  Just one lock on the door and the door to the lobby as well as the garbage door were always propped open all day.  So we never felt safe.  When we opened the door we couldn't believe how dirty it was.  There was even mold hanging down off the fan.  Sam reported to us that it had just been cleaned.  When a cleaning lady finally did arrive three days into our stay she reported there was no way anyone cleaned that apartment.  The kitchen was not stocked as reported.  The TV did not work as described.  The bedding and towels were not new or even gently used as described.  The windows look out into brick walls on both sides so it is dark.  It was quiet only because of the constant hum of the air conditioners which were nice.  When they were off though you could hear the neighbors conversations.  The Internet was strong and worked well.  The beds were comfortable once we had replaced the bedding.  The bathroom was nice once we bought new towels and had scoured it.  The chair in the living room was torn and dirty.  I would encourage Sam to do some work on his place before he rents this space again.
Nice place, and it was great meeting Jana. The area is close to some really nice parks and paths. Got some suggestions on what to do in the area, and Jana gave me a suggestion of a book to read.

The location of this apartment is truly amazing, literally 2 min walk (if that) to grand central station amd walking distamce to major shopping areas like 5th ave and times square. 
The apartment is set back of the road and so is wondefully quiet. The elevator is a bit slow but much better than walking up the stairs! The laundry facilities are easy to use and it is nice to have it in the complex. 
The apartment is big enough for two to three people, but the beds are uncomfortable... Maybe a softer pillowtop or overlay would improve this. The pictures are provided are indeed what the apartment looks like.
All in all we had a great stay and i would stay here again if the oportunity arouse.
Thanks
Kestrel's directions and the flat were amazing! The pictures did not over promise and the location was great. I definitely recommend this listing.

Great experience overall, the flat is exactly as the pictures show it, Dean wasn't here at the time but had arranged his neighbours to check us in and assisted us, and they were really friendly and nice. They waited until 1am for us to check in. 

I had to call Dean 2 times during my stay and he always promptly responded. 

although it was his first time hosting I highly recommend his flat ideally located in harlem. The metro runs 2 block away from the flat. 

Dean is a great host, his flat was super clean and organised, very confortable and I really recommend using his place if you are visiting New York.
Jason is great as well as his room. I have a very great experience in his place. He is so considerate and the room is very vey tidy and large. Highly recommend.
Keisha was an amazing host!!! So friendly, sweet, and accommodating! Cool neighborhood too!
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Super clean and big, awesome shower, hosts were friendly.

We stayed 3 nights with my friend. 2 people can fit in that twin bed but my friend slept on coach. She also made the coach for him. We could see her 2 days after we settled but she always texted us and ask what we need! At first the street seemed very dangerous but it was not like that so don't worry about Harlem. Subway is 3-5 minutes away from apartment. Lastly she didn't make any problem about our check-in and out times. So I recommend her hosting. Thank you for everything Anna!
Truly lovely home with lovely hosts. We had a great time!

Hannah and Michael were great hosts! it was my first time using airbnb but i am so thankful to find their place for the whole experience. the apartment is well furnished and the location is perfect for someone to visit manhattan and explore brooklyn. i feel like i owe a lot to them :)
We had a lovely stay at Gennadiy's apartment! The apartment itself is beautiful, spacious and spotless, in a quiet area in Brooklyn with easy access to Manhattan. Would definitely stay again!

Miyako was a fantastic host. Great spot, perfect location in Williamsburg. Amazing view and porch was fantastic! Easy communication and her place fit our needs perfectly. Would highly recommend for a small group needing a centrally located spot in the best part of Brooklyn!

We would like to thank Nicole for her beautiful, conviniant and cozy home. It was good 4 days. Nicole left for us useful advices about transport, restraints, shops and sights. 
Thank You very much one more time! From Russia with love :)

he was on a vacation when I arrived, so I couldnt get much feedback
But after he came back he sent some feedback texts.

Kori saved us from a disastrous situation (we had to leave our original airbnb that was NOT what was listed). She confirmed our last-minute booking and was EXTREMELY sweet and helpful. Her place was beautiful and she gave us great recommendations. Thanks so much!!
My hosts where very kind and nice and communication was easy and they really do have a nice and wonderful place plus the Apple TV was awesome I felt like I was right at home.

Host was out of town but roommates were very welcoming and friendly. The neighborhood was busy during the day with everything you need in walking distance but very quiet at night. Parking was terrible but ti no fault of the host. The room and home is as described. Very spacious and comfortable. Access to kitchen and utensils was a plus since I love to cook. Would definitely recommend,and stay again.

Well, this definitely has been the most challenging place to stay that i have found thru airbnb.

First, the apartment is small but enough to fit 2 or 3 people. Small kitchenette, one sofa at the living room, and one air mattress that we could never set up to work right. No space to hang anything, and actually, looked like they didn't expect to receive anybody even though we confirmed booking since first week of the month. The place looked messy, with stuff lying around everywhere, but the worst part is, beneath the messines, it was dirty. 
Even though i priorly asked for a set of clean sheets and clean towels, i got them, but definetely not clean. Had to bought new towels, because the ones we got smelled funny.
Every space of the house was at best dusty, at worst filled with women hair. By the second day we had to sweep and mop the entire place to feel a little comfortable, but really didn't help. We left by the 4th day. I know the price wasn't high, but to pay 25US for the cleanliness was a bad joke.

On the bright side location is awesome. Harlem is a really nice place to stay. You will find a store or bodega in every corner, the 16th st subway is a couple blocks away, and around on Frederick douglas Av. you can find a bunch of restaurants, bars, cafes and some stores, great place to hang around at night. Central park is 10 min. walking distance.
You see a lot of locals hanging around on the streets all day and night, but nobody messes with you, i never felt unsafe or threatened. If you want to meet the real harlem, walk up north some 5 minutes to 125th avenue where you can find cinemas, stores and chain restaurants, and mostly the local harlem flavor.
Noel was extremely welcoming and told me a bit about the area.  The room and apartment was very clean.  Thanks Noel!

Perfect location near my workplace in Midtown East. Very convenient to get around, with E and 6 trains a few blocks away. From JFK Airport, it was fairly easy to take the E train to the apartment (I only had carry on luggage). Chisom wasn't there but I interacted with her (Hidden by Airbnb) , who were easygoing and helpful, though I seldom saw them. It was high summer and with no AC it was rather warm so I was thankful that one of the (Hidden by Airbnb) kindly lent me 2 desk fans.

Although Fatima was not in NY when I visited there, she asked her roommate to help me check in. We communicated through text messages. 
The place was awesome like the description. It was big, bright and artistic. It was convenient to catch the F train (just 2 minutes walk) and D train (less than 10 minutes walk).

John was a very welcoming host. We spoke before our arrival date and John gave us clear driving directions and advice on where to park.  He showed us around his home that is meticulously decorated and kept.
It is a nice two block walk Yankee Stadium. Subways to the rest of the city are right there.
Johns place is certainly better than any hotel room we've ever stayed in.
The next time we stay in NYC, we want to stay in Johns cozy large studio.

Sam's place is fantastic - close to Central Park and Riverside Park (and the Hudson). Best of all its so close to the subway which takes all of 8 minutes to be at Times Square. The place is modern and the residence has a great pool and gym.

Although I didn't meet Sam, he was very easy to communicate with and was always very helpful.

I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay again!!

We couldn't have hoped for a better stay in New York! Tal's place is spacious, light, very clean, and extremely conveniently located, close to express subway lines. The kitchen is a true find for someone who cooks - very roomy by New York standards, lots of countertop space, and fully equipped! Tal thought of all the details prior to our arrival and made sure we had everything we needed. Despite being out of the country during our visit, he was very responsive to a few minor questions that we had, and the whole experience was smooth from start to finish. We would stay at Tal's again, if we would have a chance!

Joshua's room is located in a good and convenient area. He is a great host and has taken great care of me during my stay, which is helpful. I had a great time during my NY trip. I certainly recommend this.

Nick was wonderful and went the extra mile to ensure I had everything I needed. The area is lovely for the most part but can be a bit interesting at night time.. (so travelling with someone is ideal!) Lovely place and brilliant host x

We were courteously navigated to the apartment and given all the information we needed to maximize our stay. The apartment was well presented with all the amenities of a modernly equipped home. The location is central, with plenty of food and drink within a very short walk. We were a party of five and had room to spare. For those looking for a clean, modern and refreshing place to relax and enjoy the neighborhood of Chelsea, we would give this apartment a very high recommendation.

We had a great time at Lea's! The apartment is pretty big, especially for NYC, and the other inhabitants were friendly and easy-going. We had the downstairs living room (!) basically to ourselves as some (Hidden by Airbnb) were on vacation. It has a kitchen, washing machine, everything. It has a garden out back, but we didn't spend much time there as it's through someone's room (and honestly it's not really cultivated). The room was pleasant and cosy and Lea really made it nice for us, even giving some tips about the neighborhood. It has A/C, too.
The neighborhood isn't the "nicest" one, I guess, if "nice" means wealthy, but it felt super safe, and a flatmate told me it's around the corner from where Jay-Z grew up, so that's cool. It's literally thirty seconds to the G subway. 
Lea was great, we mostly communicated through texting as she was on vacation for the largest part of our stay (which is why we could get her room). It was just so nice to get an AirBnB in someone's actual home again, we had a couple of apparently dedicated AirBnB apartments in Turkey which was a bit odd.

John was a very good host and made sure that everything was set up for my arrival.  The apartment itself was a cool 5 bedroom place and the room that they are offering was very comfortable, had A/C, and a surprising amount of privacy for having 5 people in the house.  Everyone was really nice and it was definitely a positive experience.  If I find myself in need of another room in the area I wouldn't hesitate to get back in touch with John.

The apartment was as pictured and the location is fabulous.  The apartment could use curtains particularly in the bedroom which gets direct sunlight each morning. Costas was very communicative and the apartment was clean except for the shower curtain which really needs to be replaced! 
It is indeed a comfortable space for two - four people and the neighborhood is great.  There is lots of great shopping, restaurants and transportation near by. Keep in mind, it's a bachelor pad and while it's comfortable it's not like at your cozy aunts place.

Although Max was not there during my month long stay, he was very open with communication and checking in to see how I was doing. Max is a great host and so are his roommates. Neighborhood was nice & safe, and has a bunch of cool bars & restaurants popping up. Also close to the L train and a short walk to the J/M/Z. Overall, great stay and would do it again.

Danielle was an awesome host, she made the room extremely comfortable and the transition easy. She is very easy to communicate with and coordinate the whole process. I would highly recommend renting through her.

I really enjoyed my stay at Max's studio. When I arrived the studio was very clean, and had fresh sheets and towels. The studio felt very spacious with the wooden floors and large windows. The staff at the building were very friendly. The subway stop was one block away, so the location was optimal. Furthermore, Max gave me restaurant and attractions recommendations prior to my arrival, which made my stay very enjoyable. The rooftop offers great views.  Max was very courteous. I would stay at his place again.

James is a really good host and the place is so cool!! I travelled with my dad for a weekend and James really was willing to help with everything we wanted or needed. I was lucky to be his first Airbnb and Harlem is so happening right now, we felt in a really nice and secure neigborhood (day and night), close to the Central Park and to the subway station. I totally recomend you to stay at James's.

Lucas place was great, I did not get to meet him but his flat mates were a good help in finding things around the place.
The room was big and everything worked as it should.
A really good overall experience, thanks Luca.

Nicole and Androo's place was the perfect place for our week in New York. I could have easily spent the whole week in the lovely little reading nook - but the apartment is also in a great location for exploring Brooklyn and Manhattan. 

Nicole was really welcoming and left us great notes on the local area of Bed-Stuy, as well as much appreciated coffee and wine. Everything was clean and cleared for our stay. Thank you! We happily spent a couple of evenings in when we were tired from sightseeing.

The apartment is on a fairly quiet residential street, but there are some great places to eat and drink close by - we liked Peaches for brunch, Rabbit Moon for coffee and Bedford Ave for drinks. 

There's a CitiBike stand at the end of the block which we used pretty much every day to get to the subway (A and C trains are 5 mins cycle/15 mins walk and is just a short hop to Manhattan). We even took CitiBikes to downtown Brooklyn and Williamsburg - there are loads of cycle routes and the quiet streets are wide.

Basically a great location in Brooklyn and a perfect base for exploring the rest of New York.

Jessica and her roommates were all very kind and made my stay very comfortable. The train station is very close and convenient. Prospect Park, Brooklyn Museum and Brooklyn Botanic Garden were very close. The listing was accurate and I'm glad I stayed there.

I was basically looking for a place to keep my things safe while I explored New York for a day. Chris was very accommodating and welcoming. I arrived earlier than our discussed time and he was available so I can check in. He show me the place when I arrived. His place if very tiddy.

The experience was honestly amazing! I felt really at home in Brooklyn despite never having been to New York in my life. Caitlyn was away on spring break during my stay, so unfortunately we didn't get to meet but her room mates (and kitty!) were extremely helpful and the apartment felt very cozy. When we arrived, there was a really sweet letter on the desk with lots of advice and tips, along with the key I kept on hand during the week to let myself in and out of the apartment. If I had to make a complaint to give advice to other folks looking at this listing, (I don't want to! I loved my time there so much!) the wifi was pretty lousy so maybe don't stay here if internet is a must. My iPhone didn't seem to really pick it up most of the time and we weren't able to stream any video without pretty extreme difficulty and lots of buffering so we gave up on trying to connect to it altogether. Also some friends of a roommate came over during our stay, which I totally didn't mind, but one was sorta bothering us in our room and then got pretty sick.  I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're an adult or are bothered by drunk/high folks, but it was the perfect place for two young people visiting the city to check out colleges. The J train was a less than 10 minute walk away from the apartment, so getting in and out of Manhattan every day with our 7 day metro card was a breeze! Didn't take a single cab the whole time we stayed. Please stay with Caitlin if you can, it's a great deal and a lovely spot!
Can was a great host and was reachable all the time. The place was exactly as pictured and the location was great. Would definitely stay in one of his places again.

Big room, bathroom, no windows  but lots of space.  Nice sitting in garden.  You must like cats as they are there all the time and a walk to subway, then 30 mins to center, but I enjoyed my stay.  D was nice host.

Nice room with a comfortable bed located in a trendy, safe neighborhood.  Very close to subway system and a short trip to Manhattan.  Matthew was kind enough to accommodate my request to bring an air mattress and his roommates were understanding to have it in the apt's shared space.  Definitely recommend this place to others.

We had a great stay at Miles' place. The room was as described; clean and spacious enough for 2 people, shared bathroom was also kept clean during our stay. The place is about a 10 minute walk to the subway station/s and the area was quiet and safe even when we had to walk late at night. Miles was also very accommodating and flexible with our check-in/out times.

We arrived at the location after midnight due to luggage issues at JFK. Thanks to Manuel's partner for waiting with the key. She showed us to the apartment and inside as well as few information about transport etc.
PROs: Three blocks from the subway and bus stop and shops are close by.
CONs: 
Rough Neighbourhood. People lingering around the entrance of the building, wasn't very encouraging to go out at nights. Once we were in for the evening we never went outside. 
Surrounding is dirty. The building, staircase etc is very dirty. Not a property ready to accommodate guests. The inside of the apartment needs a lot of fixes before ready for renting as well. 
The bed is noisy and uncomfortable. The couch is dirty, I suggest proper cleaning or a couch cover, we just put towels over it. We could not sleep the first night due to the noisy smoke detector so we took the battery out. The kitchen was equipped with the necessary but we ate out at all times. 
The couple tried to make contact but we were either out or had an international number. There is NO WIFI , so starbucks, BK and McDonalds were our best friend.
The area was just not the best for our first trip to New York and the walkways and walls are very dirty. Could use some maintenance.

The hosts were amazing! Great neighbourhood where you have access to everything. Also have view of the water. Close access to the subway station and everyone is super friendly. The hosts were on vacation and still managed to keep in touch which was great. The place itself was really pretty and nice. Comfy beds, great ambiance and just a good time. Definitely recommend this place! Great place, neighbourhood and great hosts.

I needed a convenient place to stay in New York City on short notice. I reserved the night before and it worked out great. The apartment was clean and quiet and very convenient. The hosts were very gracious and helpful.

Our stay in Harlem was a truly memorable experience. From travel advice to get to his place from the airport, to advice on food in the vicinity and being available via text at almost any time of the day, Grayson is a host who anticipates the guest's every move.

There was no question left unanswered, even before our arrival, and his apartment was exactly what made it a true New York experience. With a subway a block away, downtown was a quick ride away and everything worth seeing became accessible at any time we wished.

I would recommend staying in this cozy studio apartment to anyone who wants to have a true New York experience with a host that cares about making your experience as pleasant as possible.

It was the first time that I used airB&B and I have to say I got so lucky! Juliana was really nice (very easy going, had clean blankets and towel available and was very communicative throughout my stay!) and her apartment is one of a kind, probably one of the nicest ones that I have seen in NYC. The room does have a balcony which is really nice and overlooks Bedford (I heard there is a terrace too but I forgot to check it out). The bed is super comfy, and the kitchen is to die for. Then the bathroom (or shall I say bathrooms, there are 2) and shower is the nicest I have ever seen (seriously). Oh and there is a washer and dryer in the apt that I could use! There was also a really nice dog that kept me good company! The only downfall I would say, for those who are sensitive to light, is that the door has a blurry glass window in front of the living room so it won't be completely dark (or quiet) if there are people hanging out in the living room. Then, Crown Heights is an awesome up and coming neighborhood with nice cafes around, several supermarkets closeby, subway station a few minutes away, and Eastern Parkway which is a really nice street to walk (~18 min) to prospect park and Grand Army Plaza Library. I would totally recommend it!!

Description was accurate. The arrangements were easily made. The apartment is 5min from the subway. I didn't meet Mala, but her roommate (she was respectful/professional and her girlfriend very welcoming).
Sue is nice.
Beautiful appartement, matt is very nice just as his housemates, the subway is front of the appartement. Good times

I used Grahams place to base my photo shoot out of. It's a great location in the amazing part of Harlem with restaurants and bars all around. It looks like a great spot for parties or jam sessions.. really cool experience!!  thank you!!!

We didn't meet Catherine but she did her best to give us the keys and explain everything in the apartment.
The apartment is very close to the subway. We had a good stay except in website that said 2 bed and the second bed was just for one person, so one slept on the couch which is not very confortable and for use the washmachine it cost $15. And we had the good surprise everyday to find a cockroach in the bath.
The neighborhood is very quiet and safe
Anne is an attentive, kind and considerate host and her home is cosy and nice.
My host was very friendly, made me feel at home.

A great space in Brooklyn, close to the subway & super quick to get into Manhattan! 

Really comfortable, although in the heat the AC wasn't quite cutting it! 

The bagel shop below had us covered for breakfast almost everyday for such a good price also, what a bonus. 

All in all we had a lovely week in a bright, spacious apartment- exactly what we wanted!

I think the basement room is a great value for someone valuing privacy and with a sense of adventure - more ideal for someone who is short. First of all Jarred is a really nice guy and I enjoyed all my interactions with him.  As Jarred stated, the ceiling in the main area is 6 feet. I'm 5'10 and 3/4 inches and didn't have any issues there, although I had to duck when entering through the main entrance and entering the bathroom, and going to an area where there was a fridge available. Getting into the basement takes some getting used to - you descend descend down some steep stairs and go through an ante chamber once you open the metal door.  The bed/futon creaks a bit when you move. I didn't sit at the desk because I though I would forget about the pipes and stand up, hitting my head. The neighborhood has a latino flair and is vibrant. This room is a great value for the right person.

Great place. Room has a comfy double bed with a TV and digital cable and a study desk. There are a five other bedrooms and two bathrooms to share, plus a kitchen and living room. Overall a solid place. It's clean and quiet, and the subway is just a block away.
Probably the best stay I have had with Airbnb so far. I didn't meet Biran as he was away for Travel but hanged out with Daniel, his room mate. Great guy. Will definitely stay again

Cecile, is an excellent host! She responds quickly, let's you know all about the area and the home is lovely. She truly makes you feel welcome in her home. This large apartment is in a nice neighborhood. Has all the amenities you will need. We did have one problem on the night of check in, but as soon as Cecile found out she made it right. We would definitely stay here again!!

Shan was very hospitable and accommodated our timing with picking up the key. He even left a few beers in the fridge and cookies on the counter to greet us upon arrival. He was very responsive with any questions we had during the stay.

Reymon is a good host. My flight was preponed and I reached NYC one day before my scheduled arrival. When I informed him about this he was more than helpful, not only arranging the room but also changed the reservation with Airbnb to reflect the correct dates. His roommate Josh was also helpful.

The room is as described and Reymon has a lot of stuff especially books ;-)...

Perfect room for a person visiting NYC. 6 mins walk to Times square and very safe during the night. 

This was my first time in New York and I loved it. Will definately visit again and book Rrymon's place...

The apartment was not so bad, if it were not for fourth floor no lift. The location is great at soho and very close to blu and red metro. But I rented the apartment for three, as she wrote on airbnb, and there were only two towels and no sheets to change, for ten days! Nothing to eat or drink (no coffee, tea), nothing to cook...Fifi was out of city and she said that usually the apartment is for two, but she rent for three! One day my boy-friend saw a mouse and I a (Website hidden by Airbnb) good just for the location

Jill was a wonderful host! She was very accommodating with our request to host a client for a month. Jill's neighbor was also very kind and helpful in coordinating our key handoff while Jill was out of town. Her apartment is in an awesome location in a great neighborhood - it's located very close to our office, the L subway, and tons of great restaurants, bars, and stores. We'll definitely look to have Jill host us again in the future!

The apartment is located in between Bushwick and Williamsburg, great for those who want to explore these areas of Brooklyn which are full of restaurants, bars, thrift shops, etc. It's also close to three different metro stops, making it convenient for travel into Manhattan. We only met Charles once when he let us into the apartment, but he was reliable through messaging and responds quickly. I should mention that someone had thrown up on the staircase in his building, and it had not been cleaned up in three days - this was, however, not his fault. Overall, I would recommend staying with him and had a great experience otherwise.

We stayed at Kevin's place around New Year and it was great! The apartment is very clean and spacious and looks better than on the pictures. Due to weather conditions we couldn't make use of the lovely terrace on the third floor, but I guess on sunny and warm days it could be a delight to have your breakfast or lunch there! 
The check-in and check-out were very flexible and went smoothly. We received 2 sets of keys.   The apartment is on the 5fh floor and there is no elevator, but the building itself is modern and clean, located in a nice area, 2 blocks away from the metro station. 
I would highly recommend this place.

Luke is a very gracious host allowing you full access to his place. He lets you be on your own, as if it is your home. Place is very stylish, after a tiring day you will be greeted by his charming place- where you can relax!
Darsell and Laura were great hosts!  Communication was easy and they were very welcoming and helpful.  Couldn't have asked for more - would highly recommend to future travelers!

My girlfriend and I stayed with Caitlin for our first visit to NYC, and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  The apartment was very clean and well-decorated, and the room and bed were both as large and comfortable as described!  The room also definitely has great transit access.  Caitlin was very accommodating of our preferred check-in and check-out times, and in fact we never actually met - instead, Caitlin's friendly mother met us at the apartment to check us in, and she helpfully provided us with advice about the area and how to get around.  Given how responsive Caitlin was in all of our other interactions, I'm sure she would have been happy to meet and chat if we had asked, but we mostly kept to ourselves and often felt as though we had the apartment to ourselves, which we were quite happy about.  We also fell in love with her fun and friendly cat.  All in all, a very positive experience that I would definitely recommend.  An important thing to keep in mind for future guests would be the means by which the room is separated from the rest of the apartment - the "thick curtain wall" described in the listing.  While certainly effective at partitioning the room, it's obviously not quite equivalent to a real wall in terms of privacy, which is worth bearing in mind if that's something you absolutely need.
The room is perfect, the bed is comfy and the whole apartment is clean. Good location of course. I would highly recommended to staying here.

The apartment was absolutely beautiful, perfect for two people!! Small but average by new york city standards! Location was on the border of soho, super safe, quiet street and walking distance to all our favourite spots!! Fully equipped, kitchen included, we would definitely come back to stay with Ashley on our next trip! No elevator made it even better buring our lunch calories on the way up to the 4th floor! Thank you Ashley!

A very nice place in a quiet neighborhood. Room exactly as described. Friendly roommates. Miles was nicely accommodating in meeting me in Manhattan to give me the key earlier than check-in time.

If you're traveling to Manhattan: with the F line it takes about 40 minutes to get to West-4 station (or longer, if there are delays). Not a bad commute considering the location.

Dominic was very accomodating, allowing me to check in two hours earlier than initially planned because of an event I had.  He was always very communicative and responded very quickly.  The room is very small, just as advertised and the bed was comfy.  There is no AC (as advertised)  -- it ended up being so hot/humid that I checked out the first night and booked a hotel because I felt nauseous. I also had some issues opening/locking the door into the apartment - twice it took 20 minutes to lock, which was a bit stressful.  I had asked one of Dominic'a roommates to help me lock the door once but he was very rude and completely ignored me.  Dominic said that'd he would talk to him about that to ensure that it wouldn't happen again.  He also said he'd double check that everything ran smoothly for future guests and that my experience was completely unlike that of previous guests.  I would consider coming back, though not in the humid summer months.

Preston + Co. presented an honest and no frills description of the room. It was easily booked and I appreciated the quick response and turn over rate to confirm the plans. When I arrived the room was clean with towels and keys were on the dresser for the apartment + the main entrance. I didn't get many opportunities to interact with Preston + his roommates, however Andrew was a nice guy. The Crown Heights area is full of public transportation options and areas are pretty to walk around. If you need a easy place to stay and find your schedule is full during your time in NYC, Preston + Co. can help you. I would stay with them again when I am in the Brooklyn area.
Exactly as pictured - beautiful apt. with great decor. Location is close to a ton of great resturants. Nothing negative to note whatsoever.

The neighborhood was good, 2 blocks away from the Subway Station.  Few restaurants around.  The property was as described.  The host was an excellent communicator; he and his G/F offered to help and show me around.  He was also willing to find me a solution even though I arrived after midnight; left the keys with a nearby friend, which was really nice of him.  Overall, the experience was positive.   The rate was also reasonable.

We had a great time at Carroll gardens.  The room was nice and clean. And has a perfect airconditioning. 
The roommates are very nice and helpful 
The rooftop has an amazing view over Manhattan 
The location at Smith street is near the subway to Manhattan which is perfect
Khalid was a nice and caring host, the flat fitted with the description, in a nicely located area to explore Harlem and central New York. Good experience.

Ben is a great host, always replies with lightening speed and checked to make sure my stay was comfortable. The place was very clean with everything we needed, from cooking utensils to toilet paper. Highly recommend to stay at his place!
The flat is in a fantastic area, very close to lots of great bars, restaurants and quick transport into Manhattan. Has all the equipment and amenities you need. Great place!

Andee was a great host, i was really nice welcomed in the apartment. The room was convenient, and the neighborhood perfect ! A nice place to stay if you want to discover the real brooklyn ! don't hesitate !!

My son and I had a pleasant experience at Natasha's apt.  The bedroom was big and clean.  The host was very accommodating and friendly.  The neighborhood has a lot of restaurants and very close to the subway. We would definitely come back.  Thank you again for nice stay. Ariel and Renzo

Apartment was just as described, and surprisingly bigger than expected. The location is absolutely spot on as it was only a 15 minute walk from time square. Nice and tidy and a Starbucks was located beside the apartment which was a bonus. Furkan was polite, professional and friendly, would definitely book again.

Meredith and Chris were the perfect hosts - so welcoming, friendly and organised. They were easy to contact, quick to respond with help and advise, and they gave us their very friendly my neighbours' contact details too. The apartment is fantastic - clean and cosy, and the location is so convenient for walking or getting public transport. Couldn't have had a better stay in New York. Thanks guys!
I greatly enjoyed my stay at Kelsey's place. The place is very spacious, clean, and the location is absolutely fantastic. I would gladly stay here again!! I highly recommend this place!

The apartment is so neat and clean - almost feel like a hotel. In-house laundry and dryer was really convinient. Austin was not around as he rented out his room as leaving Boston but he made a good set-up before he left so everthing was good. It is a bit distant from downtown but if you think the price it's a no-brainer.

The apartment is very spacious for NYC standard with a tasteful deco. The location is very convenient to the subway, coffee shop, and anything. The host is very friendly and is very responsive at messaging.
The host canceled this reservation 22 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The location in the lower east side was great and close by to the subway. Our host was unavailable to meet with us but was responsive via email and answered our inquiries promptly.
The room was was  not as large as it appears but just enough room for  2 people to sleep. The room has good air con unit.
You are just renting 1 room and sharing a bathroom and kitchen. Hardly seen the other 2 room mates and minimal contact with them. Bathroom unfortunately is not very neat.

The location, Suraj's communication, and the studio itself all made this an excellent place to stay. This particular block in Alphabet City strikes a fine balance between peaceful and lively. Packed with seemingly endless restaurants and bars, the largely residential neighborhood also offers conveniences such as laundromats and stores. The apartment was a good size for a couple. We found it clean, comfortable, and up to date, as well as reflective of our host's personality. It didn't take long for it to feel like home. Suraj was very helpful from the beginning and handled everything in a professional and friendly manner. Check-in and check-out were simple. Guests should expect to walk a couple flights of stairs and a short distance to the train, but this probably comes as no surprise to most people visiting the city. We definitely hope that Suraj's place will be available on our future visits.

Leonie was very responsive and accommodating.  She usually responded within a few minutes.

Her location was ideal to our needs.  It was a stone's throw away from Purple Yam - a wonderful restaurant where we had our event.  

Her place was nice, clean and comfortable and the private bathroom was a huge plus.  We'll definitely stay here again.

My friend Camille and I stayed at Miranda's apartment. It was wonderful. Miranda was very friendly. Although we just rented out the one bedroom, she allowed us access to her kitchen, bathroom and living area as well. The apartment is decorated nicely, it is also very clean and cozy. This experience was nothing less than perfect. The location was great, it's three blocks from Central Park, in a quiet neighborhood. It was just lovely. We will definitely be staying her again!

We didn't have the pleasur to meet Bev but Cherry (A friend of Bev) was there to give us the keys and introduce us to the Brooklyn Life. She wanted to show us Brooklyn with her car but we were tired. Bev let us some recommandation. We had a lot of goodies on the bed as gifts is was very nice from Bev to do that. The place is big with a cool garden. A lot of technologie in there you can connect everything to the TV or listen to music without cable. 
We were to the new mexican restaurant "Tepache" it was very good you can also ask them for delivery. 
The bathroom is small for a big appartement like that but for 2 is it more than perfect.  

We had the chance to met the brother of Bev the last day, he is very Cool too, he booked a taxi for us. (Taxi took 30min to JFK, so it is perfect) 

Exactly the spot we were waiting for to go eat in all thoes Haitian Restaurant not far away. You can also make some shopping in the Atlantic Center at a few minutes from there.

Will recommend this place for 2 or 3 persons.
Left very clear notes about keys, metro, food and laundry options. Room was clean, sheets were changed, roommates were very welcoming. Great apartment, exactly as listed: spacious, clean.
The experience was amazing I had a good time the place was perfect for the type of trip  I was on everything turned out great

Lauren was extremely sweet. The place was well maintained and she actually got some stuff for us ( water, welcome muffins etc). Though its small, the place is super clean. Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are at a walking distance. The subway station too is just round the corner.
Would definitely try booking this place again if I were to come to NYC again !

Adrianna's place was perfect for what we needed. It was near the M and the J train and had a market across the street and coffee shops within walking distance. The neighborhood was definitely not  gentrified, which I appreciated, and I felt very safe walking even at night. The apartment is incredibly bright. This was great for me because I love getting up early, but if you like to sleep in bring some eye covers! The bed was comfy, and despite the heat (ridiculous heat wave for the beginning of September), the apartment stayed very cool. Her cats were SO SWEET. The black one was particularly feisty and talkative and slept with us in the bed, which I adored. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was that we couldn't use her TV. She left a computer but we couldn't access any of our Netflix on the tv. Hopefully she'll get that figured out for the next guest. Adrianna was very available, even though she was in Berlin. She answered all my questions and was extremely helpful. Getting and returning the key was a breeze, too. Thank you for the best New York trip I've made thus far! Would definitely stay there again!
Issa was a great host, very flexible with check in and check out times. The apartment is pretty close to bars, restaurants and the L train. Would definitely stay again there

Beautiful and spacious apartment in an amazing neighborhood. I stayed there for a month and definitely recommend it to anyone visiting New York. The loft is enormous will of beautiful art and photography. The neighborhood is full of street art, bars and restaurants, but it's not yet commercialized.

My host Bethel did make me feel welcomed. Also appreciated that she could have been reached whenever needed.The listing was everything she showed in the pictures and described in the description box. Very accurate I must say. The neighborhood is very quiet and also close enough to the subway and restaurants. A cozy apartment.

Arielle was a great hostess, and so was her roommate Geoff. The room was really clean and bright, as expected. I would definitely recommend Arielle's apartment since it was such a pleasant experience!

Siebren was very attentive and helpful. He agreed to meet me at a certain time and it all worked great. The room is exactly the way it looks of the picture and I was very very happy to have chosen this place. Overall, a great experience. The location is very convenient, a few blocks from the L line and it only takes 15 min to arrive in Manhattan. The neigborhood is very residential but a few blocks away, there's the bars and graffitti buildinds of Bushwich. I loved it.

Owen was a very good host! He made me feel very welcome into his home. His roommates were extremely kind and were very helpful on giving me tips on where the happening spots in NYC are. I would recommend Owen's place to anyone who is going to NYC.
The floor plan and location could not have been better. We felt at home the minute we arrived.  Thank you, Rachel. We had a terrific time!

Amazing stay! The room is spacious and the bed is very comfortable. Great and safe neighborhood full of energy. Lots of restaurants and bars around, and only a few minutes to get to Manhattan. Ben is awesome; very friendly and the communication was easy. Totally recommend.

Giovanella was very friendly and the room was truly very spacious.  The window provided a lot of natural light and I had plenty of space to spread out and prepare for my day.  The location was very close to the Columbia campus (within just a couple of blocks) so I had a really easy time getting to/from class.  The location was also a short walk to the subway so getting around the city was also very easy.

The host was very polite and on very on top of getting things situated upon our arrival. The apartment was very large and spacious, the location is great and directly across from Prospect park. Will say that as she did state her apartment is literally right next to the Q train tracks, it runs frequently and loud so be sure you wont mind the noise.

Great, spacious, clean, private room in a lovely, large, open apartment.
Extra points for accommodating my very late check in time.
Matthew's roommate is an awesome, chill dude. 
The neighborhood is vibrant and close to the subway.
If you're not a fan of Caribbean music, then this might not be the place for you, as the T-Shirt shop across the way plays it very loud, all day long. And sometimes at night.
Other than that, awesome stay, great hosts, highly recommended.
Cass was completely helpful, communicative, available and attentive. The flat is great, beautiful and comfortable. The room is very comfortable too. And well equipped.

Jamila was not here during our stay, but she had prepared everything so our trip would be great (maps, guides...). Her roommate Anthony was here, he is very friendly, we really felt like home. He was always ready to help us and give us some tips about the neighborhood.

The apartment is beautiful, very cozy and it looks even better than the pictures. The room is small but very nice, and the bed is AMAZING !! The only negative thing is that it is noisy, but it is hard to find a silent room in New York.

Danny was a wonderful host. He was very friendly and helpful during our stay, responding quickly whenever we had any question. The apartment was clean, tidy, exactly as described, and right next to a train station. We would definitely recommend him as a host.
Miriam was a great host who left super tips for the area and NY. We felt really welcome ! The neighborhood is really nice and a great starting point to explore Brooklyn and Manhattan !

Paul initially thought he would not be able to meet me in person when I arrived so he provided all the details for me to get into the room in an email. When I got to my room Paul left a note with all the details I needed (Wifi Name/Password, Towel, etc. ). I ended reaching the apartment at the same time as Paul so he was able to greet me in person. 

The apartment and room were as nice as advertised. It was a pretty spacious room/apartment for NYC. Given the price point I can't really complain. I wish there was a lamp in the room and the pillow was very stiff.

Ann was a very accommodating host who constantly kept us supplied with check-in details. The apartment is very roomy and boasts wonderful views of NYC. The kingsize bed is very comfortable and the the kitchen and dining area are well equipped. Overall, our experience was great.
Lovely room in a lovely neighborhood. Everything was much better than described. Thanks so much Erin!
Check in with Nealy was lovely and easy breezy. What a great apartment, it was exactly as described and worked out perfect for our stay!  Great location and close to trains!  Wonderful stay!

Eddie and his house mates offer a rare combination of awareness, creativity and human warmth. I've not only had a great home to sleep in but forged genuine friendship with them and heartily recommend that you cease this opportunity in the Heart of Bushwick next to the great local Tandem bar.

Ryan was very easy going about us arriving later than planned (due to delays driving from Canada). The contact we had with him was when we met and he gave us the key. The best things about this place is the location-it was extraordinary for us. It was a 5-10 min walk to the L (grey) line-Morgan station-easy access to everything and about 20 minutes to Manhattan and Willimsburg. It is also within walking distance to a wonderful Mexican/Latino neighbourhood along Myrtle Av/Knickerbocker Av. Great Mexican food and natural juices for cheap. It felt safe around the neighborhood at night. There was free parking on the street.  The pictures are accurate. The apt was very clean. The room is small but was adequate for our needs. The bed was comfortable. Ryan provided towels. The room is on the main floor of a building. It was a bit noisy at night/mornings when other tenants of the building were coming/going as the entrance door to the building slams pretty hard, and you can hear walking/talking in halls . The building attached was being renovated so it was quite noisy a few mornings. Ryan has 2 roommates whom were hardly around.  Overall for us it was a great first trip to New York City.

While Vishnu was away, I stayed in this brownstone apartment with Melanie. She is friendly and accommodating and my three week stay there was a pleasure. I arrived in the evening, and she had put a nice sandwich in the fridge for me. Being new in the city, it was nice to know someone else. She actually organised various meals and drinks out with friends and myself also which was really great. Even though we both had similar weekly schedules, it was not a problem sharing the facilities. I got to meet Vishnu the day before I left and he is a great guy also. Both are easy to talk to and will go out of their way to make your stay easy, comfortable, and enjoyable. 

The listing has a whole bunch of details in it which are accurate. The photographs represent the place accurately as well. I stayed in the main bedroom which I imagine is pretty large for NYC. Added to the various subway options and proximity to many shops and food options close by, Boerum Hill is a cool neighbourhood with a laid back feel. The street is quiet, with people who would say good morning. Natural light comes into the bedrooms as well as the house through a central skylight, and the kitchen looks back out over a green garden area. At the front, they have a stoop for chilling out. 

Out in the city, in and out on work days, or just hanging out in Brooklyn, it was a nice place to come back to and there were never complications.
I had a very nice quick stay, the room is small but lovely and the girls are very friendly and helpful! Thanks a lot

Pon was a great host, and was able to accommodate my last minute reservation after my original booking cancelled. Even without an elevator, the apartment was great - and very conveniently located - and I would happily stay again!

I had a great time staying at Chris's place for 8 days.  
He was very nice and responsive, we met and chatted for a little before my move-in. 
His room looks exactly like the pictures. It is quiet, airy, spacious, has a lot of sunlight. I had really good sleep there. Apartment is quite big and is located on the third floor. There are four people living there, I didn't see them a lot as they were either not there or kept to themselves, but all seemed friendly and respectful. 
Location is very convenient, only two blocks to Montrose L station, many bars, delis and restaurants nearby, and 15-20 mins ride to Manhattan. 
Overall a very nice Brooklyn experience. I would definitely recommend.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I had a great time at Tasia'a place. The room is comfortable, warm and welcoming, the apartment cozy and very well kept. 
Communications with Tasia have been outstanding, and everything in the apartment is working just fine.
The neighborhood is quiet with several shopping options, the apt is conveniently located with the F line just 1 minute away from the apt!!
Great host, nice place, i will definitely book it again if available and totally recommended!!

Being my first airbnb trip, I couldn't have asked for a better experience. From checking in, to checking out, I had no issues. Their apartment is very clean and homey - it was a comfortable environment that lets you unwind after running around all day. I stayed at the apartment with their roommate who is very nice and accomodating. The location is also perfect for getting anywhere. Highly recommend! So happy to have found this place :)
Great! Lovely place!

Wonderful top-floor apartment in a nice neighbourhood! Very comfy. Good subway service (quick trip to midtown and downtown on 4 and 5 express lines). Shea responded well to messages and was flexible and accommodating with check-in. AC, which was nice. Highly recommended!
Lovely flat - spacious and very cozy. Lots of nice restaurants and bars in the neighborhood and very practical in terms of public transport - would definitely stay there again.

We had such a lovely time staying at Tasia's beautiful home. It was conveniently located right next to a subway stop that we used to take us everywhere. Tasia was so kind and welcoming and also helped us out at the last minute! We really felt at home here and would recommend it to anyone.

Jocelyn is undoubtedly a nice host. She served me a bottle of water the first day I came here. And she let me to use her kitchen and all ficilities. She is so generous and friendly during the days I live here. The room has enough place for one person to live. There is a huge window, which provides a fascinating view of the riverbank and Queens. The bed is comfortable and the chair and desk are convenient for study and work. All in all, the room is perfect and Jocelyn is good person you can make friend with. This period of time has been an unforgettable memory in my life.

Gina was so kind and accommodating. It was like staying with a friend I had known my whole life. She went out of her way to make sure I was happy and satisfied my entire stay. Gina is a treasure and made my vacation a great experience.

Highly recommend this bNB. Hosts are delightful, kind and extremely welcoming. At the same time, I had my own space. Location is central if you're willing to explore. Great restaurants just blocks away.

I met Yonatan once to pick up the keys, he was very pleasant and helpful and a great host.
The apartment itself is exactly the way described, very new and spotless.
Me and my brother enjoyed every second staying in Williamsburg and we recommend this apartment to anyone who wants to enjoy a great stay in NYC without spending a ridiculous amount of money!
TODA RABA AGAIN FOR EVERYTHING!
Great location! Lots of good restaurants and cafes all around the neighborhood and the ferry station is a block away. Will stay here again!!

Sophie,
Thank you for the wonderful stay at Brooklyn #2. It was very comfortable and easy to get to everything.
Daina and Jillian

Mariam was so nice and kind and I had a great stay. Check in and check out was flexible and that was so convenient for me with the flight schedules. She gave me all the tips that i needed to survive my holidays. She was always contactable and I did not have any issues during the stay. I am not commenting on the place, as she will be moving out from there. All in all I had a great stay and Mariam is a super host. Highly recommend.

Host was awesome, super accommodating for a last minute inquiry, and very communicative.  Amazing neighborhood, one of the best in the city - walk anywhere, and you're close to everything.  Favorite was the view out the across Park Ave of the beautiful Episcopal church. Secure building with great doormen, roomy kitchen, and super comfy couches in case you have a friend pop in from the Peruvian Andes last minute.
it was ok. Bathroom could be cleaner, and the room could be better. Price was ok and near the underground 5 mins away from Manhattan.

Dee's apartment is lovely. I was truly blown away how much care she took for my arrival. She welcomed me with flowers and tea! Dee has been living in Greenpoint for long enough to know the best of everything. Plus, she's just genuinely cool. Merci un mille fois for everything.

My staying at Mostafas was amazing, his Roommate was very friendly and helpful, the neighbourhood is closed to everything, you can do everything in Lower east side walking ... the room is exactly what you see... I would like to thank him for everything...
Frank And Anna are very nice and friendly host. The house is definitely more than it's worth, highly recommend!

Just one word:
AWESOME!
...because EVERYTHING was simply awesome:
Doug was out of NY - but left us a welcome letter with a little chocolate present and good beers in the fridge.
We were welcomed by a friend of Doug that was very kind to suggest us some place to go eat in the neighborhood.
The apartment is very cozy and absolute clean, filled with a lot of comfort: wi fi, netflix and a huge Tv :)
The house is in Hell's kitchen (one minute to Central Park) and it's a really cool place to visit.
I've been in Ny twice before
and I can say for sure
that thanx to Doug I really appreciate this other neighborhood I didn't know well :)

Thanks Doug!!!!

*LiNDa e Giacomo*

Very well located appartment and very friendly host making his best to give me access to the appartment asap.
BUT:  I had just one sheet on the mattress and a small blanket. I asked a sheet to cover me, but they hadn't any :( When I arrived, the bed wasn't done and had always the sheet of the previous person ...
Towel was of a ridiculous size (I couldn't dry myself after shower)
Curtains were too short to cover the bottom of the Windows.
Bathroom is in a pity state: mold in the bath and the host let tons of hair in the bath after washing her hairs which was quite disgusting.
