Great place.  Stereo in every room, lot's of natural light and a well equipped kitchen.

Christine and Ali were excellent hosts! My husband and I stayed with them for a weekend of exploring NYC and their place was perfect for our needs. We stayed in their extra room, which was a cute nursery with a couch bed; there was also a nice private bathroom across the hall. The condo was well decorated and featured an amazing balcony and even better views from the rooftop of the building! They have an adorable, active 2 year old who I befriended when we checked in. :) Our hosts were gone for much of our stay (including one night) but we didn't have a problem with their toddler son's occasional noises while we were there. Christine and Ali were easy to communicate with and very gracious, offering us coffee, Turkish delights and other food. All in all, great experience and we'd love to stay with them again!
We loved staying in Gabriela's place - it was clean, modern, in a great neighbourhood and we felt right at home. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone interested!

Ellona was wonderful host! She was always very helpful and ready to answer any questions. The apt is cozy and comfortable, spacious for a family of three. We stayed there for a month and loved it. The neighborhood is safe. Close subway access. Minutes to shops and restaurants! The Coney Island and brighton beaches are within 2-3 stations. All in all we loved this airbnb experience. Many thanks to Arthur and Ellona!
Andrew is a kind, thoughtful, and experienced host and this location is really terrific.

Shwetha was very accomodating during my whole stay. She kept asking me whether everything is fine. Her apartment is very convenient and the neighborhood really nice. You can find everything you need nearby for instance grocery store and restaurants. Will stay again next time!
Peter is a great host, the place is good, location is stellar, would love to be back soon

Clean and nice apartment located in East Village with very friendly host. Many wonderful restaurants and bars within walking distance, as well as subway stations (6, N, R, F, L). If you are visiting NYC and try to find a place near to public transportation, restaurants and nightlife, this is definitely one of the best choices. 

P.S. There are different kind of shampoos offered by the host, try to figure out which one is your favorite :)

My family really enjoyed our stay at Sami's apartment! He was a great communicator and the apartment was clean and comfortable. It had lots of modern finishes and conveniences and a really great projector. I would definitely recommend his place.

My stay at Iram's place was great! comfortable room in a clean and well-kept apartment building, in a great and central area of Manhattan, and extremely close and convenient to several metro and bus lines.

While Iram was out of town during my visit and I didn't meet her personally, she had everything set up for a smooth check in/check out for me, and was extremely accommodating with my schedule, letting me leave my bags in her place early for check in and late for check out.

there's no window in the bedroom and much of the apartment which isn't a huge deal (and pretty common in NYC), but good to be aware of if you need light to wake up in the mornings!

Gabriel's apartment was clean, spacious and perfectly located in a fantastic area of Brooklyn. He was very responsive, accommodating to my check in time, and has a tremendous space. Thank you for proving such a great experience!
Super nice amenities and luxurious apt. Amazing location and new clean building.

Kathy's apartment was exactly what we needed. We moved here after a bad experience in an East Village one. Kathy's apt was quiet, clean, secure and modern. Kathy was great to communicate with. She's friendly and helpful and answered all questions immediately. Would definitely stay here again. PS, she has a gorgeous fluffy cat named Bailey that shares the apt.

Cute little place with all the necessities for a comfortable stay. Safe location, even at night. And steps away from public transportation that will lead you anywhere in the city, as well a direct bus to LGA. Overall an awesome stay and a lovely host.

Staying in Lisa' s apartment was an absolute pleasure.  From helping my group of 4 work through logistics to making sure everything in the apartment was turn-key, Lisa was a great host.  I'd definitely recommend her modern, spacious, very comfortably furnished apartment for anyone looking for a well situated spot in NYC.

El had over-booked his place but had a backup plan. His friend, Djili, happily hosted me at his place on 132nd and Lenox. Thus, I was not as far downtown as I had anticipated, but it worked out nonetheless. Djili picked me up and took me to his place the day I arrived. He made sure that I had everything I needed and his place was is great condition.

Everything was excellent, the apartment was clean, and Abraham left all the things we could need for our week at the place (including some cold beers in the fridge) location was perfect for us (the friends we were visiting were just a few blocks away) and moving around Manhattan and the airport (la guardia) was fast for NYC standards and New Year's Eve season. If me and my girlfriend come back to NY we would definitely stay at his place again and would recommend it 100%.
Thank you Abraham!!!

Sam was a great host!  Very communicative and responsive and the overall place was nice to stay at.  I loved how each room had an ac unit in it each, along with the living room.  Would definitely recommend to everyone.

We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay in Randy's home. It is spacious, well located close to shops, restaurants and the subway and is a very cosy family home.  We would definitely stay again if we are in New York!

Elliot is a great guy and host. He is sensitive to your privacy, while being a pleasant conversationalist - not to mention he knows everything about NYC. Great experience. The room was small but clean. He has roommates but they live downstairs. Highly recommended for a inexpensive room in the awesome neighborhood of Fort Greene.

Raphael was a really great host. Easy going, easily accessible. Any questions he was always available. The apartment is exactly as pictured and in a really safe and good area. Our family enjoyed our stay at his place. Recommend for sure.

Stayed in Bleik's home for the weekend. It was beautiful with an amazing view(enormous windows in the living room), loved the private door/balcony/stair/fire escape entrance from his room! looks exactly like the pictures! Bleik welcomed us and his roommates were friendly! Glad to have stayed here and hope to stay here again on our next visit!

Jack was a lovely host. He was on time and great with instructions . His room and linens where very clean and so was the bathroom. The apartment is In a great area and just a few blocks away from subway and amazing cafes and bars . I would for sure recommend this to a friend .

My wife and I had a great time in George's apartment. The location is perfect and the apartment is simple and very pleasant. My wife particularly appreciated his scientific decorative items. Georges, whom we have not had the opportunity of meeting, seems to be very kind and helpful in his messages. The doormen were very respectful. 
We loved the apartment, we loved NYC ! We highly recommend it !

Zach's place is the perfect home base -- clean, cozy and RIGHT on top of the L and M trains. Can't stress that enough. We were only in NYC for 4 days so we didn't spend much time in the apartment, but te neighborhood is vibrant and it was incredibly easy to get to Manhattan (about 20 minutes) and Williamsburg (10-15 minutes) that I would definitely stay there again. Thanks so much Zach!!!

Alisa and Dante's place is situated in an excellent part of town, a stone's throw from Prospect Park and in a neighborhood with a lot of activity.  Their home is spacious and has a nice view of the inner courtyard.  Great place to stay, would recommend it!
The apartment was lovely and very near Central Park., which made for a lovely walk each morning. We enjoyed our stay very much and Charlie was quite helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Noelle's place was awesome. She got in touch with us throughout the trip and gave us fabulous recommendations. Her place was clean, nice and cozy. We felt welcomed. Everything was nearby and close to the subway if needed. When I come back to NY, I hope I can stay at her place again.  We really enjoyed our trip and Noelle made it easy to communicate back and forth if we needed.
Accurate information. Fresh flowers in apartment.
Great apartment in a great neighborhood!!

Loved my stay here. The apartment is clean and bright. We were met on arrival and everything was explained perfectly. If we needed to ask anything we could email and there was a response within minutes. Would recommend to anyone.

Where to begin? Nicole & Emiliano were angels because my prior host had cancelled my reservation the day before i was flying out to NYC due to construction issues so when AirBnB recommended me this apartment, I was so happy to hear that it was available! The apartment is very spacious for a NYC apartment which is better than getting a small overpriced hotel. The bed was so comfortable and the apartment was SPOTLESS, smelled AMAZING as soon as you walked in. The area CAN'T be beat! You are literally in the middle of everything within walking distance to transportation and famous NYC sites! As a female traveler, i felt very safe in the neighborhood & in NYC in general! Thank you again E&N!
Had a wonderful time and really felt at home. This was my first extended stay in NYC and I couldn't of made a better choice. Ian was very helpful and got me feeling like a New Yorker in no time!

Gina's place is the perfect way to experience New York. It is ideally located, near to the best cafes, shops and bars of Bushwick and 2' from the subway station. The place feels like a hotel room- clean and new, with its own en suite bathroom. It also has access to the building's rooftop which has the most amazing view you could ask for. But the best part of it was Gina herself. She sent us a long list with her favourite spots in the neighbourhood and the city and she made sure we felt welcome. We'd definitely stay there again and we recomend it to anyone interested in experiencing the creative part of NYC.

I spent 1 month at Natalie's place and it was great ! Everything was accurate with the listing on the post and she was so helpful. When you have a question she was just a phone away and answering me asap. Also her (Hidden by Airbnb) were so cool and was helping me all the time even with my stupid problems like laundry :) Neighbourhood was also good located to reach Manhattan or Williamsburg night-outs.  I recommend this place to everyone who wants to have an unforgettable experience in nyc !!

Your apartment is clean, spacious and well equipped for any travelers needs. This area is clean, quiet and safe. Sophie and her friend Lussie are very attentive to us. The subway is near for this appartment. Everything was amazing!

My girlfriend and I satyed in this warm, hip, and artsy decorated  basement apartment. Mike was a great and thoughtful host who  accommodated our needs for our trip accordingly. He was flexible on our arrival and departure times, and that was very much appreciated since we drove over 6 hours from Buffalo, NY. The area of Brooklyn where this place is located is great. Close to the markets and subway station. We felt at home in the area and the surroundings had a welcoming feel. The wifi worked great, and we had a very comfortable stay. Thanks again Mike!

The neighborhood was great and it was nice of them to give us some recommendations in the area. The bedrooms were good sized with comfortable beds and clean sheets. I do wish they had mentioned that there isn't a living room. There's not much space to hang out if you're with a group but it did the job for our trip. For the most part the apartment was pretty clean but the hallways leading the apt smell like you're in a swimming pool. Rachel was great to communicate with and it was a seamless process getting into the building.
Tina was a great host. She has a super  apartment and keeps the apartment in great shape. The back bedroom is spacious and quiet. Would definitely stay there again.

Charisse was a wonderful host, who made sure that we found the place very easily, she always replied promptly to our questions. The flat was really neat and spacious and only a few minutes walk to the metro. Had a great stay in NY! Thank you.
Excellent!  Back porch was hawtt

Laura was great. She met me handed me the key, made sure I knew where everything was and let me to my weekend. Always being available if I needed. The apartment was bigger than anticipated and the garden was an awesome perk. The apartment was neat and organized and we had everything we needed. I felt comfortable and safe. The 24 hour doorman and elevators were also a nice convenience. Also the location was perfect being central to everything. Blocks away from union square, greenwhich village and meet packing (just to mention some favorites). Was a perfect apartment for a weekend getaway for my boyfriends and I. I would definitely come back:)
We so enjoyed our stay at Lerny's bnb!! She's delightful, our room was tidy and comfortable and breakfast was delicious. We hope to see her again!!

The place was exactly as described. Very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Great location with lots of street parking and nearby restaurants and cozy coffee shops. Christina was a great host and provided lots of useful information. She was easy to reach and replied to texts/emails right away.

What an awesome host!  Super friendly, very communicative, excellent apartment.  Clean towels, brand new soaps, and beer in the fridge! What more could you ask for??  Awesome Williamsburg location--shops, dining, and metro all in walking distance.  Would definitely stay again.  Thank you, Chris!!

Valeria was a great host! Her apartment is in an ideal location in Astoria. It's a third floor walkup and the room is medium sided for NYC, with a desk, monitor and comfortable twin bed. No cable in the room but i don't watch TV anyway. She provided a continental breakfast new towels and personal items. The shower was nice with plenty of pressure and hot water. Check in was no problem.

She is a lovely host and a good conversationalist.

Lovely experience at Mary's! She was so accomodating on our check in time and check out time. Room was lovely clean and bed was so comfortable. The whole place was very clean and location was awesome! Definately would reccomend! If you have difficulty with stairs this might be a problem for you as its 5th floor no elevator but we got some exercise in so all was good!

Host is really welcoming, available and quick to respond.
The apartment is spacious and perfectly connected to downtown with the green and red metro lines. 
The entrance is on Central Park side. Recommended.

It was a pleasure to stay in Lucy's apartment. Her location was perfect and one of the best buildings in New York. If we had questions or need help, she was always there for us and helped as much as she can. The roof and the view was a dream! We will miss it ! Thank you for making our trip unforgettable 3
Near the subway station just minutes of walk

Dorthy's place is great - large and spacious, quiet and great location too. Dorthy was waiting for us when we arrived (even left instructions in case she wasn't there to meet us).  She was a great host too - easy to reach and even let us leave our bags behind for a few hours before check-out.
never saw Katie but met her roomie Nicole who was awesome...if you like Williamsburg this is the best location in the town

Our stay was just perfect! The description of the flat is absolutely accurate. The location is great with the subway a block away. Even if we didn't meet Alexis, he always made himself available  and did everything he could to make us feel at home.  I would definitely recommand this place!

Jason is a awesome host. He picked me up in Newark airport. 
His apartment is clean and great. The kitchen is nice if you like to cook.
Upper east is a nice place, good environment, good restaurant and safe. 
You can easy to get to the train. 
I will stay in his apartment if I go back to New York.

Alex' place was extremely cozy and clean. The first night I arrived she made me feel very welcome in her home and explained everything to know about her place and the neighborhood in detail. The flat is extremely well located, you have 3 subways really near by that take you anywhere in Manhattan in no time! 
She usually replied to my messages during my stay very quickly and helped out where she could. The only thing that was missing was basic kitchen equipment, but I guess since you're in NY you're gonna eat out most of the time anyways ;-))

Did not meet the host during month-long stay but Adishwar was available by phone and email for any issues, he was very prompt in responding to questions and provided everything I needed.

Bedroom is large and has ample storage space, the apartment is simple with clean bathroom, kitchen, and onsite laundry. Location is close to subway station (Roosevelt) and very convenient, the only drawback is the noise from train passing through that may be loud at times.

Everything was perfect.  I did not meet Thomas , but I did meet his roommates , and were very friendly .  They are great.  especially Louis (the cat). The bed is very comfortable.  Good ubication.  Quiet neighborhood.
The room was nice and comfortable.

Everything was perfect, nice quiet neighborhood, beautiful atmosphere, bars & restaurants in walking distance, 
The Host Justin is amazing, provided me with EVERYTHING, and was pretty easy to communicate with.  I will definitely be back to NYC soom & would love to stay here again.

Jk is a nice girl and her cat is very cute. The place is located on a walk up building second floor with a shared bunk bed. Location is great with lots of restaurants and cafes. Typical lower east side living environment.
Good room mates. But I'm used to live in different more luxury conditions, so I changed accommodation. But I arranged on refund my money with flat owner and it was ok.

Amazing experience! I have a second family in New York now
roommates are so sweet and clean. The house is regularly cleaned and you feel welcomed from the moment you step in. 
Neighborhood is very safe and everything is easily accessible.
There's a supermarket just a few blocks away, a library, many Deli's, C and 1 stations very close by, pharmacies everywhere around the house.
Amazingly comfortable place and host:) Obi is very friendly, accommodating and a great host. The space is just as described, very clean and so easy to relax. I highly recommend!

Though we didn't have a chance to meet, Emily was extremely hospitable and made our stay super smooth. Her space is beautiful and in a great location- we were able to get around NYC very easily and enjoyed the culture of the area. Thank you Emily!

Freda was an absolutely delightful host, she really goes above and beyond to make you feel welcomed and at home. I couldn't of asked for a better first Air BnB experience! This is the perfect place for a person who is looking for a homely experience.

Freda begins your visit with a tour of Astoria where she tells you all the places to eat, shop and where the subway is located (this was so helpful). I could not fault my stay with her and her house was so spacious and comfortable. I would recommend this place for a longer stay as there is a really comfortable bed, spacious closet space and air conditioning for the hot NYC summer nights.

I would highly recommend staying with Freda at her house. She is a woman that not only invites you into her house but her heart! I would definitely come and stay with Freda when I come back to NY again! :)
Very nice place and district, 2 min from subway. Big hall and kitchen, in the same building modern cafe. If you waiting comfort and good location in Brooklyn that it's the best choice.

While at our stay in Times Square in Nickes apt it was fabulous. Really a great host and takes care of your comfort level. Great apartment with security and very safe location. Could have swept the apartment a bit more but overall a 9/10, she is a great tenant.
Great place to stay in Brooklyn for creative people! Set up with up good taste, very large and functional space. Comfortable bed and very friendly atmosphere. Had a great time staying there!

What a beautiful experience!!.
Darlene is such a loving soul and so hospitable.
I loved my stay!
I will always lay my head in her home whenever Im in town.
Thanks Darlene

I had a very pleasant and peaceful stay in Michael's apartment.  Michael was highly considerate and made it all very easy, and he even facilitated my last minute request (within 24 hours). 

One unexpected pleasure was his outstanding book collection (in English and Russian). I discovered "World War Z" and after the stay was over promptly bought by own copy !  

I'll also say that the memory foam mattress in the master bedroom is really comfortable (even though for most nights I was in the other bedroom). Another notable benefit of this place is the desk which made working extremely convenient (it even has a printer!). Also, I enjoyed feeding the fishes !

There is a brand new laundromat two blocks away at the corner of Bedford and Union, which is very easy to use. I also recommended using Martini's Dry Cleaner's on the other side of Eastern Parkway. They did an excellent job on a number of different orders over the two weeks I was in the neighborhood.
I was very grateful that Himanshu accepted my reservation when my flight got cancelled last minute.

Lovely, spacious historic apartment in Brooklyn. We had no problem finding on-street parking right outside apartment. Just a short cab or bus ride to Prospect Park and several great neighborhoods in Brooklyn area. Easy subway access to Manhattan. Apartment had all the necessities and Genea was quick to respond to any inquiries. Highly recommend staying here if you want a quiet place to stay in NYC area!

We arrived late at night to do the check in and it was not a problem at all for Paolo, who welcomed us warmly. The apartment is exactly like on the pictures, very spacious and clean. It's located in a perfect area of Brooklin at 2 minutes of the subway station that take you directly to Manhattan in 15 minutes.  The roomates are very discrete and quiet but always available to give you information or share discussions. I totally recommend this place and would choose this flat for my next trip in NY!  Thanks for everything!!!

Kacy and her roommate Hannah were really nice. Their apartment was lovely as well. Even though it was not my first time to NYC, it was my first time being like a New Yorker who actually lives there. The location of their apartment is very convience. There are many restaurants in the area, especially Japanese restaurant. We all enjoyed staying there!

The listing can't really do this lovely place justice - it is full of light, has a private deck and roof! and is a wonderful space to retreat to. The open layout also gives it lightness and the furniture here is bright and elegant. I cook a lot, so loved how the kitchen is in the center. Oh, and this shower is the best! Wonderful host - communicative and gracious. Thanks!
We booked this place at very last minutes. However, Brain prepared everything efficiently! Quick refund after we checked out. Place are very nice with great view!

This place was perfect for my friends and I!! It is very spacious and the 5 of us didn't feel like we were sitting on top of each other our whole stay. The three full bathrooms was super convenient for 5 people getting dressed and ready to leave. This unit exceeded my expectations!!

We loved the neighborhood and the fact that it was so close to the subway, lots of restaurants and Central Park. We felt comfortable and fully explored the area while being close to take the subway into town. Emma and Liad were so friendly and helpful in our arrival and made it easy for us. We had a great time!
Great place!!! So clean, so peaceful, the backyard is the best part!!! So much communication. So much interactive information and she made adjustments for me. Wonderful host and great location!!!

I really enjoyed my stay at James's apartment, I didn't have the pleasure to meet him but he was very nice and helpful. His roommates are great too, they helped me a lot, they are extremely friendly.
The appartement is awesome, good location, about 5 minutes by walk of the subway, lots of bars and restaurants around. Moreover their rooftop is amazing! I recommend it

Antonio and his family were in Europe when I stayed at his place around Christmas.  He told me by texts and telephone many useful things about his apartment and the surrounding neighborhood, and arranged for me to get a key for his apartment.  Antonio's apartment has two bedrooms (one with two bunk beds used by his children), which can be more convenient to a family than a hotel.  The building is in a nice neighborhood, fairly close to Central Park, and is quiet.   The apartment is comfortable.  I liked the experience of living like a New Yorker for a few days, rather than as a tourist in a hotel.  I have mentioned to Antonio about a couple of small things that needed attention.  I was not surprised by these things, since this is a family home, not a hotel, and I was Antonio's first Airbnb guest.   Antonio is a very good host and I enjoyed staying in his apartment.
Alexandra's place was great, clean and exactly what the photo represents. I would stay there again.

The location was perfect for me and my kids. There is a park and a children museum just across the street.

The apartment was excellent. Modern and clean.
Safe neighbourhood

The host was away but was responsive to my request within a very short time.
My family was very satisfy and we would stay there again also recommend this apartment to others.
It was a great time. He and his roomates helped me a lot at the first time to get around. Nice place and awesome people. I can only recommend people to stay.

Andrew's apartment is great! The bedroom is a good size and perfect for one or two travelers; it was very clean and on a quiet street. He and his roommates are friendly and helpful. He left clean towels, which was an awesome perk! The apartment is close to a few great coffee shops and is a short walk from several convenient train stations that lead directly into Manhattan (generally around a thirty minute trip). Bushwick itself is also fun to explore. I would definitely recommend staying here, it was a great experience!

My husband and I had a wonderful weekend in Brooklyn and truly lucked out finding arrangements with Maggie (somewhat last-minute!) and her beautiful apartment. The apartment building is an old brownstone in a neighborhood of other unassuming brownstone homes. And though the front of the house and the entryway are nothing special, Maggie's actual apartment is beautiful and very tastefully decorated. She has wonderful style! The apartment is clean and comfortable, and the bedroom is private. Maggie stayed in her own bedroom on the end of the hallway. I felt as though she was accessible if needed, but she gave us our privacy during our weekend stay. Maggie is very kind and a welcoming face to meet in Brooklyn - would be happy to stay here again!

The location was perfect for our needs. The neighborhood was safe-enough. There was plenty of on-street parking. And we really enjoyed running to Prospect Park on Saturday morning for the farmer's market (about 2 miles). Highly recommend!

I stayed in Walter's place for 6 months and it was perfect for me whilst I bedded into working life in the city. 

The apartment and location are fantastic, the area is full of bars and restaurants but never too loud. The people who live in the apartment are great guys and Walter is a great host who ensured things were always fixed.

I would highly recommend a stay here. It was like a first home here in the States and I'll have great memories of my time here

A few days before arriving, Rebecca asked if would mind staying in her other loft space down the street from where this listing was. No problem, she sent pictures and the place looked clean and fine. So this review is about her other place on Seigel St in Brooklyn. 

The good: Rebecca is a friendly person and good at communicating with her guests. Booking, coordination and checking in and out went fine. We stayed in Rebecca's room in a shared loft space with 2-3 other girls. Her room was tidy and looked fine. 

The bad: Her place is one of those Brooklyn loft spaces which have been cheaply converted into shareable spaces. The bedrooms are basically made up of super thin dry wall construction with no windows (except small windows in the top). There is no sound isolation so you can hear everything. We woke up several times in the night when her room mates would come home drunk and re-heat food in the microwave. Even though they tried to stay quiet. You just hear everything. The rooms don't have any windows, except a few bizarre small windows in the roof into the living room and the other rooms. This mean, if any of the roommates turn on a light in their own room it will light up your room and keep you awake. 

The ugly: The place is a complete mess! There is trash everywhere and I have no idea when they cleaned the last time. There is a trashed ikea bed in the living room and beer bottles, plastic bags and trash piled up everywhere. 

I didn't rent the living room so in my opinion they can do what they want in their shared space. But you would have thought they would at least want to take out the trash or something when having AirBnb guests over. We were really disappointed by the state of the bathroom since it was a room we actually had to use; it was disgusting. We called Rebecca out in this when we checked in and she did a brief clean up the day afterwards. 

I am sorry for this negative review but I believe it is important to be honest towards the host and future guests. I would not recommend renting this place as it is not ideal for hosting guests and the people living there do not seem to make an effort to keep the place tidy and welcome for guests. Maybe you would like it if you are in the beginning of your 20s, looking for partying in New York and don't care about where you crash at night.

Razan was a great host!  She was flexible, friendly and easy to communicate with.  This was my first time using airbnb and it was a great experience.  Her place is warm, cozy, very clean and in a great location! I hope to be back soon.  Thank you Razan!
Nice apartment on a quiet block, cosy feel; Cihan is a great host and very helpful

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Brandon's apartment. The place was nicely furnished and spacious -- there are high ceilings and a loft level with an additional bed. The neighborhood is great and very convenient. We felt like we were at home! Thanks, Brandon!

I had a great time staying at Lizzie's place. It is exactly as it looks in the pictures and I thought it was great value for money. I was very comfortable. The location is very near to the subway (A/C lines). Some dodgy characters on the main road but they didn't bother me. 15 mins to Manhattan (world trade centre).

Hosts were out of town so I didn't meet them, but they arranged to get us keys. Nice apt well located near Chelsea Market and 1,2,3/A,C,E subway. Easy to arrive on E subway from JFK. Apt is as described per the photos. Comfortable bed and quiet building. It's a 5 story walk up.

My friends and I really enjoyed our stay at Meg's place. It was more than enough space for the 4 of us and the location was great for us. While we weren't able to meet Meg in person, she was always readily available via phone/text if we needed to get in contact with her for any reason.

Beautiful Brooklyn Brownstone is indeed a beautiful Brooklyn brownstone!  
The home was perfect for our family Christmas gathering, with a 10 day old grandson and his parents living only a 10 minute walk away.  The other 8 of us and a 10mo old grandson stayed comfortably at the home, and the large kitchen and living area was a wonderful gathering space for all of us!
With two babies, we mostly ate in, enjoying all the bakeries, butcher, cheese and wine shops in the area.  Dining out a little was too much to pass up, though, with all the great little restaurants within walking distance.
The home itself was immaculately clean, and Odette even emptied closets for our use.  Key transfer was simple, and the downstairs tenant was available when I forgot my purse as we locked up!
I only wish I could give this beautiful home more than 5 stars!

I had the most pleasant time in lianas  cosy queens apartment, safe area in just the right distance to Manhatten, which is easy and anytime to reach. 
Thank u very much and anytime again!

Host: 
Sean is a great host! He is one of the rare few hosts I've actually met using this app. He was very easy to communicate with, and went above and beyond merely relaying text messages. Everything had a personal touch. Sean did everything he could to insure the utmost comfort level for his guests.

Space:
This space is cozy and romantic. I loved the highlights and shadows theme of this apartment. Everything was clean and modern. Great floors and the bed was SUPER comfy. The perfect size apartment for 2 people. Sunny and inviting. The location of this space is walking distance to where the fun is!

I would highly recommend this rental. You will be so happy here :)

The place was as described in Brenda's posting. Great location and it suits our needs very well. Brenda was very patient with my inquiries prior to booking, which made me much more comfortable with proceeding with her unit. She made everything easy.
Bobby was a great host!

Staying in Eric's Big Ass Room in Brooklyn was a great contrast to the hustle of Manhattan. On arriving we were able to meet Eric and his friends, they were all so welcoming to us both; interested and polite, even after we'd arrived later than expected.

We had no problems, whatsoever, with the apartment/room or location, everything was incredibly easy to commute back and forth; Metro stop, literally, steps from the front door. The local area is nice and I never felt it to be unsafe, even when I was wondering around after midnight to find food I ended up having a nice chat with people.

Eric was accessible throughout our time in NYC, even making contact to enquire how our days were going & open to any queries/advice, and his flatmate was always polite and cool whenever we saw one another.

Experiences like this are the what AirBnB is about!...I'd recommend this place highly and look forward to staying again in the future!

If there were 6stars then i'd give them.
The apartment was exactly as described.  It was a pleasure to stay here.

I had a great experience at Philipp's beautiful home. It's the perfect size for a couple, stocked kitchen furnishes and comfortable bed. Philipp keeps his home very clean, but isn't crazy about it. He was very good to communicate with. Highly recommended!

Zan was a great hostess. She was responsive and very accommodating. The house is in a lovely and safe neighborhood. The bedroom is actually quite spacious and the bed was very comfortable.  This was a perfect place for an overnight in Brooklyn!

Really nice apartment that fit perfectly the description. Really well situated (near subway and in a great neighbourhood). Jazil was a great host making sure everything was okay. However the apartment could have been cleaner (linen, and global cleanliness) and we didn't even have a space in a closet to put our stuff.

Had a great trip. The host was incredibly helpful with everything. The apt is in a quiet neighborhood 1 block from Central Park, and and a few blocks from the subway. I would definitely use them again.

Had a very nice stay at Alexis' apartment.  Alexis was very welcoming and helpful, accommodating me on a very short notice for same day booking.  She's been responding very promptly to my inquiries, and stayed in touch till the booking was complete, providing all the info about the location, keys, etc.  and was very flexible accommodating my schedule with the late arrival.   The location is very convenient - 5 min walk to the 2, 3, 4, and 5 train station with easy commute to downtown and both East Side and West Side of Manhattan.  Brooklyn Museum, Botanic Garden, and Prospect Park are just a couple of train stops away - or a short and pleasant walk in a nice weather along Eastern parkway.   The apartment is in the first walk-up floor of a small apartment building - a quite location on a side street.  Alexis put some very nice touches on the interior design, making the place very comfortable, pleasant, and cozy.   The high-quality pull-out sofa in the picture is European design and manufacture, providing great support and comfortable sleep.  Alexis provides clear and helpful instructions for the wireless connection, general apartment use, etc.  She's a very welcoming hostess with a very pleasant and cheerful personality, and a comfortable and tastefully appointed apartment in a very convenient location, making it a great place to stay in the area.

The apartment is in a fabulous location and suited me perfectly.   I would like to give it a top rating but the description "sofa bed" turned out to be a sofa, not a bed.  The fittings are a bit tired but full marks for being perfectly clean and it really is a little slice of New York life.  Brian was very good at communicating, friendly and helpful.

Although I only rented for a month, it was the best accommodation experience I had in my 6 months of stay in New York. Our first three months was jumping from hotel to hotel.  Our 4th and 5th month was at an extended hotel at W94th. That was a great experience.  Somehow, we got lucky on our 6th month when we found Sarah's apartment. Had I known that apartment accommodation is this pleasant, I should have looked for apartment from day 1.  Sarah's place was perfect. 

Transaction with Sarah was easy. She is very professional and always just a phone call away for any questions.  She  somehow made me feel like a friend too.  The easy, smooth transaction with her  made everything really pleasant. 

Her apartment is in the Columbia University housing.  It is spacious, functionally decorated which to me was perfect, in a building with nice and very helpful personnel.  Location wise, it was perfect for a quick walk or jug by the Hudson River and  close to buses particularly for LGA.  It was within an easy access to train 1 which made commute to anywhere easy.

Thank you very  much Sarah and Lesh. Tony and I  very much enjoyed our stay at your apartment.  You guys are the best!

Best regards,
Stella

Thyago is a great host! He is super awesome with communication, which is the most important thing! If you ever have a problem he will fix it asap. The room is nice and big, and has lots of space. It's a great location, being on Bedford Avenue, because there are lots of restaurants, and coffee places nearby. Getting into the city is quick and easy with the L train. I really enjoyed my stay here, Thyago made everything super easy, and awesome!
This place was so comfortable, clean, bright! It was in an ideal location for everything I had to do with amenities close by. I absolutely loved staying here.

This place was great !   Zoe made sure all the arrangements / directions were clear and was very attentive.  Housemates were very open and welcoming and it was a perfect location in Williamsburg only 2 blocks from the Subway.   Awesome view to wake up to in the morning, a great cup of coffee on the corner and a perfect neighborhood to explore the All the groovy stuff happening in Brooklyn.  AND an easy Line into the heart of Manhattan.   Loved it and Loved Brooklyn.  Thanks Guys !!

The apartment was exactly as described and perfect. Great location with the park directly across the street. Transportation was heavenly. There was a bus stop right in front of the building and several bus stops as well as the subway around the corner. Tine was great. She was quick to respond to my questions and she was extremely understanding when I had an issue with the mover (who was 5 hours late!). Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend her place to everyone.

After a week in a pretty decent flat in Flatiron, moving to Elizabeth's flat in West Village seemed like a real upgrade to our two week holiday. The location is fantastic. Quiet and leafy brown stones. The flat although small is perfect for two. Elizabeth gave us a personal welcome upon our arrival and also provided us with a number of local recommendations which we tried and greatly enjoyed. The days spent here made us feel like actual locals. Highly recommended.

We had a wonderful time at Piero's apartment! The location is just wonderful, right in the middle of wonderful cobble hill and the apartment is huuuuuge! The apartment has been recently renovated and everything is top quality. You'll love your stay at Piero's!
The apartment was exactly as described and actually has a view. The host was very accommodating.

The host, Tide was nice and cooperative. He had his friend handed me the keys the night before. The place looks exactly like the pictures. The bathtub was really clean. Overall, he was nice and accommodating.

Thank you Martina for a pleasant stay in Brooklyn and for the kind care of us! 
We found the the apartment nice, clean and spacey. A large living room, comfortable bath and a good kitchen. Nothing to complain about.  
The area has a lot of  shopping opportunities and nice restaurants. We would definitely stay with you again, next time we get to NY.

Had an amazing time staying at Nathan's place. Stayed there for about 2 months and wouldn't have minded staying longer if the room was available. The bedroom is incredibly spacious, bed, chair and desk were extremely comfortable and very useful during some evenings when I had some work I needed to finish, there's a big kitchen with all the appliances you may need and a nice big TV where I re-watched Star Wars 1-6. Outside the apartment everything you may need (subway stops, food, grocery stores, delis, laundromats, even hospital/police) is within a 5 minute walk, The best thing about staying at Nathan's place though, are the really cool roommates. They're super friendly and helpful. I just moved here from another country, so it was great to at least come home to other people who are nice. One of them ended up having a spare ticket to the new Star Wars movie, so I even ended up seeing it with him. All in all, I would definitely recommend staying here!

Miranda's apartment was quite lovely and exactly what was listed. We felt welcome with a nice letter from her telling us to make ourselves at home. The apartment was clean and beds were made with towels ready for our use. Would absolutely stay there again.

The apartment was a great option for me during my stay in New York. Close to subway stops that can take you pretty much everywhere. Food options nearby and an opportunity to see the nearby Wall Street area. Everything was easy to find in the apartment and the gym in the building was a plus. I'd recommend this place indeed for business trips or family visits.
Abbie is an amazing host, she made us feel like we were roommates. We had coffee with her and her roommate and had a chat. It was really nice of them.
The place is great! The location is excellent! I recomend it! We had a wonderful experience in NYC

Ricky was great and beyond accommodating (if I could put 'beyond' in bold, I would).  He was quickly available if I had any questions and responded promptly.  Overall, he's a spectacular host.  His home was very comfortable.   Location is just right.  Heading up north on Eldridge dust a few blocks is The Bowery CrossFit (if you're into that).  If Chinese food isn't your thing, head further north and you'll come across Houston Street where up'll find different types of restaurants: Tapas, Burgers, Italian.  Even more selection going up 1st Avenue.  Best of all it's all walking distance.  Going further north isn't a problem since there are couple subway entrances near by.

Diana and her husband (and their adorable son) were great hosts! We were able to chat with them a bit before they left. Diana even went above and beyond by providing my sister with a ride to the start of the NYC marathon. Their apartment was clean and cozy, just what we needed for our one night stay. It is, however, located directly on a busy highway in Staten Island, so the traffic from there can be a bit noisy and annoying, but we slept just fine regardless. Would definitely stay here again!

Robyn's place is perfectly located if you want to explore Manhattan and the rest of NYC. There are two subway stations near by. We enjoyed walking around the lively neighborhood with its old buildings and beautiful tree-lined avenues. There are many cafes, shops and restaurants in walking distance. The apartment is on the 4th floor and quite small. However, it is perfect for two people. There is an elevator. The bed is very comfy and the view is a nice one (even without getting up). We really liked the way it is decorated (exactly as in the pictures). Since it is an old building the sink and the shower were a little worn. Communication with Robyn was easy and very clear. We had all the instructions needed. I highly recommend her home to everyone who is looking for the real NYC experience. I would definitely stay there again!

I was superhappy with my stay at Elan's place. Working in Manhattan it was great to come back to Williamsburg and a nice flat at the end of the day. The apartment is well planned, with great morning sun (and blinds for when you're sleeping in).  I was in town on business for a little more than a month and Elan's place really felt like coming home which was just what I was looking for. The buidling has everything you need (and then some).  It's in a great location near McCarren Park, restuarants, bars, grocery stores, the subway and the ferry to Manhattan. 

Elan is an excellent host, attentive and easy to communicate with. Don't be deterred by the application, the process was smooth and Elan was very helpful. I warmely recommend staying here!

Despite my brief stay, Lerny was an absolutely lovely host. The room was spacious, clean and provided a much needed good night's sleep before running the NY marathon. I would repeat my stay next year!

I had a great experience staying at Eric's place. I never met him but the instructions for working out the keys were so simple. He was very flexible about the check in and check out times and the place was exactly like the pictures. They have a beautiful home with a kick but kitchen stocked with everything you could ever need. Great location near the train and plenty of bars, easy street parking if you are driving and a pretty awesome TV if you need to lounge. All in all a seamless trip and perfect apt.

It was our first time with Airbnb and our experience was very positive. Laura is very nice guest. When we arrived, she had written a long letter with information and a few address restaurants in the neighborhood. The apartment is very close to the subway and we were able to park in the street for free very easily. 
The apartment is nice as the pictures show it on the website. 
We will definitely recommend this place. Thank you Laura!

The room was spacious as decribed, and Alex and his wife were very nice. The location is also great. The only problem was that the room is directly connected to the host's bedroom, so you have to go through the host's room to use bathroom, living room, etc. If you don't want to do that, you should walk out to the hallway and enter the living room through the other door.

Monticha was a lovely host. As she didn't have any other guests staying in one of the other rooms, she allowed me to sleep in the bedroom instead. Both her and her room mates were warm and welcoming, and they were also very quiet, which was exactly what I hoped for after a long day of walking around the city. The neighbourhood was completely safe, and I didn't feel afraid to walk around alone, even at night. The apartment was very clean and I felt very comfortable there. Monticha was very accommodating, and she was flexible with my arrival and departure time. I loved everything about my stay here and if I ever return to New York I'd love to stay with her again :)

Location of the apartment is located 20 minutes away from Times Square via Metro. 
1. Quiet neighbourhood.
2.  Convenient Stores located within the vicinity of the apartment.

I had a wonderful experience staying at Homero's studio apartment. It was close to the subway as described as well as being clean and neat upon arrival. It was small of course being a studio. So I wouldn't recommend it for groups of 4 unless you don't mind all sharing a bed or using sleeping bags. The fidge is a mini fridge so be mindful of that, as well as for some reason we couldn't get the oven to work. Not sure if that's because we are not experts on gas ovens or if that needs to be fixed. The only other possible issue was the super of the building. He didn't seem quite happy that we were staying there, and almost in shock. However, reluctantly he let us continue in the building after we first arrived. Overall if you are looking for a reasonably priced stay in New York this is your ticket.

Mary is such a welcoming warm pleasant attentive host , communication from the start was great. She welcomed me on time that was arranged , and the building is so nice! The room huge, clean, plenty of closet and drawer space, water bottle offered to me right as I got in the room, comfortable queen size bed, super private room w amazing view! Building has doorman /security 24 hours super safe w elevator. Once you are in the room you feel like you are in a hotel room, bathroom is right across from the room and even though it's shared it's maintained extremely clean and throughout apt , and I felt like it was my own private bathroom. As a matter of fact once I was in the apt I felt like I had so much privacy given the layout of the apt and my room being so big quite and so private. This is def a place to stay when in New York and given the value also just amazing! Oh and the subway is just one block away, so close to many restaurants and ground zero and so much, definitely a super prime great location. I recommend this place extremely highly, and with mary as a host is just a plus!! :)  oh did I mention that this is actually in Manhattan, cause I saw people advertising in Harlem for even higher price and putting headline " Manhattan " that's not fair, so everyone be careful . This place is legit , accurate and really in Manhattan :). Thankyou Mary :)

Miranda communicated very well with us ahead of time and answered all of our questions right away.  She made sure that everything was ready for us and created a very welcoming environment.  We loved the neighborhood in uptown Manhattan.  It was about a 15 minute ride north on the Subway from Times Square and one block from Broadway where there are a lot of little shops (grocery stores, beauty salons, local restaurants, etc).  The apartment building was quiet and the apartment was very comfortable.
I had a pleasant stay at Kai's. The room was nice, the place is pretty big and has very good energy. It was very easy to go anywhere and the neighborhood was awesome. I highly recommend this place.
Eric's place is wonderful! It's a large apartment with all the amenities you need in NYC--and not to mention two full baths, pretty rare! It's clean and comfortable.

I did not get to meet Jac but she was very helpful and answered all my questions through text messages. Her roommates were friendly and the cat was adorable! The location is great and 1 train (145th street) is just a street away. However, it was very hard to get the water temperature (shower) right like most of the old buildings in NYC. Nevertheless, an enjoyable stay! 

P/S: Thanks, Ashley, for passing me the keys!
Caleigh was great and very trustworthy. I would definitely recommend this place for a long term stay and she is great with getting back to you on time. Thank you again for hosting.

Our host (Marco was out of town, so his brother had us) was very nice and communicated well during arrival/departure. 

The experience pretty much matched the price. A heating problem caused the room to be very hot, even with the window open. Loud noises from the street plus the open window made it hard to sleep. The door to the apartment was very difficult to use; we were able to make it work, but it took some practice. If you're a single female, I'd advise you to be careful in the neighborhood; it isn't a safe part of Bushwick.

On the more positive side, the room was clean and thoughtful accommodations were provided.

It was a fair price, but I'd pay a little extra for a more relaxing experience next time.
Unfortunately, I was unable to stay because the apartment did not suit our needs. Its a great location but noisey as its on the first floor above the train station.
Matt is a really nice person. He is eager to help me to solve every problems. The apt is pretty and clean, and it is in a decent area. The only drawback is the rent is a little bit high.

The apartment is lovely, spacious, comfortable and well equipped.
It is located in a beautiful building in a very nice neighborhood, 

Very convenient  and comfortable whether you are in a business trip or  vacation.  
A word of warning (out of the scope of responsibility of the apartment's owner): the phone networks in all the area work pretty bad, especially ATT and T-Global.  If your task depends on receiving calls at your phone you might have a problem.  If you can connect through  WiFi/internet then it's fine.

I would certainly recommend staying at the apartment if you are in NY

super cool!!! Denise leave us a tidy, clean and beautiful apt. Everything is great especially bedroom with a big and comfort bed and nice decoration. The location is close to the tube station and there are supermarkets shopping malls near the apt! Anyway, it was a fantastic experience for us living in NYC. Thanks a lot!!!

The apartment has an affordable size, a comfortable bed and it is very close to the subway line. However, we had many difficulties with this subway line, because at night it changes its schedules and it presents delays. There were days we have to get five different subways and spend three hours to get at the apartment. The apartment is on the top floor (4th floor) and the building has no elevator, so if you take a lot of bags, it will be difficult to get around. About the cleanness the score is zero. When we've arrived at the apartment there were two owner guests in another room and they left a very dirty and foul-smelling environment. This smell settled into our room and it was not gone. The bathroom was very dirty and the room we stayed in had signs of dirty that I believe have never been cleaned. We made the claim via airbnb to the owner, with the expectation that at least he would send someone to clean the apartment, but it did not answer our complaint.

This was a great place to stay! The location was perfect, the apartment was clean with all of the necessary amenities, and Rob was a wonderful host. He accommodated our arrival time, was quick to respond when we had questions, and provided a great list of recommendations for the city. I would return and recommend for others.
It was a beautiful apartment with a gorgeous view. Great location. Communication with Maya was perfect. I'd definitely stay here again.

Soph was an absolutely lovely hostess! She was very organized and clear with me about arrival, answered all my questions, and was very kind. Her beautiful apartment was perfect for my trip, quiet and very conveniently located to the trains. The space was peaceful and relaxing, and the kitchen easy to use. I loved her sense of style and slept wonderfully. I would love to stay again! Thank you Soph!

And was a gracious host, who welcomed us with full access to his apartment. My guests and I loved the diversity of the neighborhood, the additional loft feature, and the apartment's close proximity to public transportation. We would definitely stay at Andy's in the future!

Lovely New York apartment with all the amenities you need.  In a great area and walkable to so many places. Anna was informative and responsive about my New York stay. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Lisa's place was perfect for our needs.  The location was good but it was quiet sleeping which is not always the case in NYC.  Our room, and private bath were clean and comfortable.  Prior communication was excellent and timely and Lisa'S elder daughter welcome and settled us in graciously.  I recommend Lisa's place and would stay here again if I needed to be in the Gramercy neighborhood.

The sofa-couch was broken the entire summer. A replacement was promised but never fulfilled. I had to sleep on the broken sofa couch all summer unfortunately. The wi-fi never worked, although was also promised. I called Lior and Nissim the entire summer and the issue was never resolved. The TV worked for the first half of the summer, then one day that got replaced by a cable box that only got about 4 local channels. My roommate and I would also occasionally get texts threatening to call the police if we don't keep the noise down, although we wouldn't even be home at the time. Failed promises and faulty assumptions all summer. Aside from the issues listed above, everything from the posting met its description. Hopefully the next guests don't have the same issues.

Ye was the consummate host. Everything was prepared as she said it would be. I didn't have any trouble picking up the key. The room was clean and neat and exactly what I needed for my short stay in Manhattan. She was readily available if I had questions and the stay went off without a hitch.
Grayson was very helpful and everything went very smoothly. Would highly recommend!

Agnieszka was very organized in arranging the smooth running of my arrival and departure. Even though she was away on a business trip (due to my arrival timing), her friends and colleagues were able to meet me at the flat to collect and retrieve the keys.

The listing is as described and is ideal for one or two people. I didn't make use of the kitchen but it was ready for use. The flat was clean and warm. 

The neighbourhood was great. There are a few nice spots for breakfast and diner a stone throw away from the flat. 

Overall, it was a great experience and I would recommend this flat if you're looking to spend some time in NYC.

Jacob was very helpful from start to finish. It was very easy to pick up the keys and the apartment was easy to find in a great street/block of East Village. The place was nice and clean and for new york was a good size for me and a friend to stay. Jacob was also very kind on check-out day to allow us to leave our bags there until later on in the evening for a late flight. The best part about the apartment was the location, lots of coffee shops, bars and restaurants on the doorstep! Would definitely stay here again when returning to NYC.

Really great clean apartment and a great value for NY.  Only a block away from Lorimer subway station so easy to get to anywhere in NYC   Amazing views of NYC skyline.  Mohamed was really communicative and available whenever I needed any help
Nice neighborhood.

We enjoyed our stay at Nima's comfortable, tastefully appointed apartment. The apartment is conveniently located in a charmingly gritty Brooklyn walkup a block from one of the main thoroughfares in Carroll Gardens. The subway runs on an elevated track at the level of Nima's third-story windows less than 100 yards away. It is neither quiet nor especially loud. We happened to find the passing train soothing as well as nice piece of authentic New York scenery. Nima was an excellent, generous host. We did not meet, but he was a prompt, clear, thorough communicator. His apartment was very clean and tidy. He left us a lovely stack of towels with soaps, stocked basic provisions (coffee, milk, bread) in the fridge, and even left a toy for our young son. We would not hesitate to stay here again, and have no reservations in recommending Nima as a host.

I didn't liked my stay on Megan's house. I told her that I was going with my girlfriend and she never told me that was only one single bed, we slept in a air mattress because of that. The shower is horrible, or is too hot or too cold. unfortunately I  don't recommend.

Christina was very kind and responsive when we needed her. Key pick up and drop off was a breeze. Her place was very clean and tidy and the neighbors were quiet. It was high enough off the street we didn't hear much street noise. The subway was only 2 blocks away so traveling downtown was easy.

I absolutely loved staying at Debra's beautiful brownstone in Harlem. Her apartment is bright, spacious, clean and comfortable. Debra is a wonderful host and was able to answer any questions very quickly. She made me this really cute little artistic map of all the good spots to eat and drink. It really was the most wonderful stay and I recommend her place fully and without question!

Tegan's place was the perfect place to spend the holidays. It is a very large, homey, and well-kept 1B apartment. As an Airbnb host, Tegan was very attentive to our needs, and responded even on Christmas eve to one of our inquiries. The apartment was right by two separate subway lines that run into the city, and Astoria itself is a very quaint neighborhood full of old school charm.
Egor was really helpful and met up and showed me around. The apartment was clean and comfortable and in a great location for Columbia. I had a great stay!

Alexandre's apartment was a great spot for our trip between Christmas and New Year's.  Our other rental fell through a shortly before our  trip, and we were very happy to find such a great replacement on relatively short notice.   The apartment is exactly like it looks in the photos, and is in a great, safe and fun neighborhood.  3-5 minute walk to subway, groceries, and lots of restaurants.  We were able to quickly get to museums, sightseeing, and it was just a few minutes to walk to Central Park.  The bed was very comfortable, and the sofa bed was great for my teenager.  We didn't get to meet Alexandre as he was out of town while we stayed at his apartment, but we had great communication before and during our stay.  He arranged for a friend to meet us at the apartment to pick up the keys, and Alexandre checked on us during our stay.   I would not hesitate to stay here on a future trip.
Elene was very easy to reach and left me plenty of helpful info regarding travel, food, and leisure in the area. Would ABSOLUTELY book this room again.

If Kristine isn't a hospitality professional, she could certainly be one. She left incredibly detailed and thorough instructions for enjoying the house and neighborhood. And the place itself is every bit as fantastic as it looks in the photos. Dream kitchen-- we made Thanksgiving dinner for 5 there without breaking a sweat, it is so roomy and well equipped. Biggest bed I ever slept in and very comfy! The place was spotlessly clean when we arrived. She was prompt to respond to a question I had about the dishwasher.

The neighborhood is great. as well. A lively street life in the nearby business district, plenty of ethnic food, residential streets are quiet and friendly, close to the subway with an elevator at MacDonald and Church (front of the train if on Coney island bound F or Church Ave bound G train) if you have luggage.

This place rates an 11.

I loved the apartment. Ricardo did an amazing job of taking photos of the place. Yes, you do get that beautiful scenic view! The place is an artist apartment/ studio (Ricardo's room is a normal bedroom) so it has its unique personality. Ricardo's room is spacious and well maintained.  If you're interested in architecture and retrofitted loft, here's definitely the place!
It's a really fantastic experience living in this apartment with comfortable environment and convenient public transportation. I will choose here again if I come to New York in the future
A beautiful and comfortable room. The location is convenient (walking or taking the subway). A good experience in New York.
Everything worked out smoothly, starting from check in to check out! the neighborhood was very nice, safe and quite lively - just what I needed :)
Great spot in the Upper West Side

RJ was an amazing host and this place was beautiful. Everything about this place was amazing especially the gorgeous art work everywhere. If you're looking for a great place to stay then BOOK THIS PLACE NOW!!!
Jonathan's place was wonderful. Although he was not there in person, he made sure that me and my friends had no discomforts. I would definitely recommend his place to people who go to NYC.

Greeted by a Christmas tree and a plate of cookies , making us feel welcome. Spacious for our extended family of five. Terrific location -- subway entrance, bagel shop and wine store all few steps away.  Whole Foods only 2 blocks. Assistant was helpful in getting us a 2nd key.
Awesome time and amazing location. times was super helpful and very accommodating. His roommates are all cool people as well.
this apartment is super cool and is really good. host is really nice and always answer back .
The room was exactly as presented in the photo. It was very clean and quiet.
True hobo atmosphere as promised, really felt the vibes of Brooklyn would recommend to anyone looking for a real Hobo experience

Fabulous central and lively location. We were able walk to most destinations but subway at Astor only a few minutes away. Warm, cosy and comfortable studio. No lift and is on 4th floor, not a problem but be aware. Olivera arranged for our 8pm arrival, was responsive and managed the booking well. An enjoyable trip.

Julie was beyond generous accommodating for a friend that was visiting NYC for the first time from Colorado. Her apartment is extremely clean and extremely spacious!!! Space is definitely a luxury in this city. The neighborhood (upper east side) is also very clean and family-friendly. A train is super near by making it very convenient to travel downtown. Also, a great selection of restaurants and museums within walking distance. And Central Park is nearby also! I would definitely recommend the apartment to anyone! (However, it is a four floor walk up in case of any disabilities)

The apartment was amazing and was so easy to access. The host left us notes on just about everything so we never had questions on what we could use. Everything was very neat and well kept and it was a great start to a vacation to be able to settle in there! I would 100% stay here again.

Couldn't be happier with my month long stay at Benjamins place. The location and amenities were top notch. Everything was as pictured and described, and Benjamin was a helpful and delightful host. He's a friend now, to be honest. Best welcome I couldn't hoped for to NYC. Highly recommended!

This was a last minute booking, the area was good, the price was good, but the room was Not clean at all. Major dust bunnies all over. My cousin had a severe allergy issue with all the dust. The room looked like it had not had a once over cleaning in awhile. The neighborhood was Very loud early in the am. Also, the add says a shared common areas but we were told right away to basically keep to the bedroom. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

This was our first AirBnb experience and we weren't sure what to expect.  Conor's apt was perfect for our stay!  It was a cute, clean, and modern apartment just blocks from Times Square.  Not an issue for us, but be aware, you do need to walk up 4 flights of stairs to get to the apartment.  Conor was more than hospitable!  We were welcomed with a bottle of wine and he quickly responded to all of our text messages.  We had an issue with a breaker switch and Conor immediately contacted the landlord.  It was fixed by the time we arrived back that afternoon.  I would absolutely recommend this stay for anyone venturing into NYC!

Ian was an amazing host!  He was kind, responsive and helpful in every respect. His property was immaculate, perfectly situated, spacious and incredibly comfortable. I recommend this rental to anyone visiting the Williamsburg/Greenpoint area. In fact, I think it would make a great home base for anyone visiting NYC in general.  Thank you Ian!

My stay at Kyron's place was perfect. The place was really clean and extremely comfortable. Kyron was always attentive and he was always offering his assistance in case it was necessary. He left clear instructions on which areas to use and how to use the appliances. I'm very grateful I found this place because it made my stay in NY perfect. I had a lot of fun. Thank you.

Chanel was such a great communicator, and couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.  The apartment was exactly as described, very clean, and comfortable.  Check in and check out were seamless.  Thank you so much, and look forward to returning!
Talia's place was great. Super close to two subway lines so there was easy access to Williamsburg and lower manhattan. Lots of space and and art! Very cool! Thanks Talia.
The host canceled this reservation 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
nice place

The room was super cute and the airconditioning was amazing during a hot summer. The bed is the best, it's fluffy and feels like you're sleeping on a cloud. Even better than my bed back home! The entire apartment from when you first walk in is suberly decorated. It seems like Manny takes a lot of pride in his living space and made it into a really chic place to live. 
Location was also perfect, only a 10 minute walk to Broadway subway which had a straight train into Manhattan. The bathroom was really modern and spacious. There is also a really cool rooftop that we used a lot, great to relax in the evenings and you can also see the Empire State Building from where we stood. All in all a wonderful experience in Brooklyn and I'd rate it 5/5 stars!!

Our stay at Connor's was wonderful!!! Our original host cancelled days before our trip and in a panic I messaged him to see if his place was available for the weekend. He responded within the hour and was very responsive throughout our whole trip. Last minute he made all of the arrangements for us to stay at his place and everything worked out perfect without any issues at all! 

The place was is the BEST location! We were able to run around all day and then swing by the place to freshen up before stepping out the door to Times Square!  The apartment was close to the subway so it was super easy to get there from the airport and was easy to get to all parts of the city.  

The apartment itself was great. For the apartment being right in Times Square it was so quiet and the bed was really comfortable! The apartment and building itself were very clean and safe.  

I would definitely stay at Connor's again and I would recommend his place to any of my friends.  He was pleasant and so easy to work with! Thanks for everything Connor!

First of all we had a wonderful stay in Anhads apartment. The location is great, you never need longer than around 20mins by metro to go somewhere in Manhattan. We didn't meet Anhad by himself and we had the apartment for our own for the whole time. It was clean, but unfortunately there is not a lot of stuff in the kitchen which you can use to make a real meal for example no plates or pots. Moreover the announcement says there is room for 4 people but on our mind the sleeping coach would be too small for 2 people. There were also no real sheets which was still okay but I experienced better ones. All in all the apartment is great if you don't want to spend too much money and have a great location. :)
The apartment was really nice, perfect location in New York near the subway.
Beautiful apartment and room in a very good positon in Manhattan. Kelly is very nice! For any kind of questions, he gives you the answer quickly!

The apartment is fantastic value, a great deal. 

Perfect location, 10 mins to 1st Ave on the L. The apartment is 2 a minute walk to Grand St subway. The area has plenty of character, isn't as sanitized as Bedford Ave. 

The apartment is spacious, well decorated and equipped. We had four people staying here and it was barely a squeeze. Bathroom is nice, water pressure a little low, but workable. Both bedrooms were nice, AC in both rooms plus ceiling fans (if you're staying here in the winter I have no idea what the heating situation is like). There's a huge pull out couch in the living room as well. Kitchen is well equipped although no microwave. 

We stayed here for almost a month and were certainly able to make it our own. The building is nice, very quiet - a few floors walkup. Lucy and Louis were wonderful, and easily contactable throughout our stay. We looked after their cat whom was also very nice. If you're a clean freak, the apartment might appear a little dusty/messy but we had no problems. 

Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a spacious apartment in a great location at a fantastic price.

It's difficult to write about Andrew since he was actually not there during my trip. The only thing I can say is that he was very prompt to respond to my messages!
So I was staying in his room... I was sharing the apartment with his roomate, who was apparently not very pleased to see a stranger in her place. I barely seen her for the two weeks I was staying there since she was working all the time, which is not a bad thing! When I did see her, I cannot say that she was particularly friendly though. I was not expecting to socialize extensively but, I mean, she barely said hi... We also communicated via text messages, but once again, it was mainly passive/aggressive directives about the apartment.  As a result, I did not feel very welcome in this apartment.
As for the apartment itself, it was not very clean, there was a pretty bad smell in it... I did not have much space in the room for my stuffs. The bed was great however! Very comfortable! The bathroom was like the rest of the place: small, a bit dirty... I was also unpleased to discover that I had to pay for the washing and drier machines (they are not in the apartment itself by the way, but in the basement, and they are shared with the other inhabitants of the building) that were supposed to be part of the offer! When I asked about it, I was basically said that the price was not "exhorbitant". Of course it was not ($2.50 each laundry), but I was supposed to be included...
The location of the place was definitely the best thing about it. It was about a 5-minute walk from the north part of Central Park - and pretty much the same amount of time to access the two different subway lines that are around. Regarding the neighborhood, you will find many places around to eat or to shop but otherwise, it is not the best part of Manhattan.  
To conclude, my stay in this place was a mixed experience. I would say that if you intend to find a place only to sleep, a place that has good transport links and that is not so expensive considering its location, Andrew's apartment might be a good solution. Otherwise, you might have to find something else...

We had a wonderful time staying at Tom's place. Location is great. Everything was exactly as pictured on the website and the place is very clean. Tom was very good in communicating with us for all the questions we had prior to the visit and arranged key pickup and drop off nicely. We highly recommend their place!

Not satisfied with the service. The host was not in town and was unreachable. He only contacted me ones to ask whether I could check in late. I had to check in at 8PM and had to make 2 trips to the host's house to meet his roommate. I had to spend the entire day without a place to put my luggage.
The room was kind of clean but very messy.
The bathroom was horrible as it was shared between 4-5 people. I had to wipe the bathroom floor myself so that I could stand on the floor.
I would not stay here again and I am going to ask AirBnB to refund my cleaning charges for this one.

Eric place was amazing everything clean and modern!
We have a great time in his place!!

I had good experience with this dorm. Roommates are friendly, and location is really good! Basic facilities are available and you can enjoy a self tour to Columbia university and tuning in Central Park easily!

This was the perfect location because we were not too far from anything and it was such a cute street. The townhouses in Gramercy park are adorable. Cindy was always quick to respond to any of my questions and I felt very comfortable staying here for the weekend! Having a washer/dryer, a shower and wifi included was a nice touch as well.

Rin's beautiful art filled and sunlit apartment is on a quiet street in a lovely part of brooklyn 2 blocks away form prospect park. It's a real home and she really makes you feel at home. She's super easygoing, patient and generous with her time. Her pup Mies, who she says is named after architect mies van der rohe is also really easy and sweet. Great stay, HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Functional things: Room is massive, bed huge, linen lovely and the kitchen is fully stocked. On the map, lefferts looks far but the Q train which is a block away gets to Canal street in 20 minutes.

Stay in Gamar's room was totally amazing. She and her flatmate are very clean and he was very helpful giving tips  and telling me and my girlfriend nice places to go in NYC. It takes about 20 minutes to go to times square and the neighborhood has some food places and markets to go. I recommend to everyone!

We love New York and we recommend Brooklyn as an excellent alternative to staying. Veronica was helpful and our experience at his residence was very good. The location is phenomenal - very close to the subway and various markets. We will definitely go back to stay at his house in the future! Thank you, Veronica.

Lorien's place was wonderful! I had a great stay. The location is perfect; right in the middle of alphabet city it is easily accessible to the  great bars and restaurants of the east village but also a short walking distance to the lower east side! About a 10 minute walk to the 6 or F train. Lorien was so helpful and the roommates were great! 
I had a great experience and would recommend this place to anyone!

Great location. The appartment is close to the Subway and the neighborhood is very enjoyable with lots of restaurants, bars,..
