When we arrived to the house, it was extremely clean and very well decorated. We had everything we need Inside: towels, bed sheets,.. We really felt like home and Alex was a great host and give us some advice before we arrive. 
I highly recommand this place!

Our stay with Philipp was amazing! We stayed there for a weekend to do some sightseeing and enjoy the city. The room was very clean and comfortable and the situation of the appartment is ideal to do sightseeing, but still very quiet and in a safe environment. Philipp is a very welcoming and helpful host and we can recommend a stay with him at any time. Thank you!

Jack's apartment was a great place to stay! It was very comfortable and cozy. The location was great too. It is very close to subways and bus stops. Also, it is next to many good restaurants and bars in SOHO, Chinatown, and Little Italy. He was super nice and friendly. He answered to every question very fast. I will definitely recommend to anyone who wants to have a great time in New York.

The girls in the apartment were very sweet and welcoming. The host typed up a list of cool things to do in Manhattan for us, since it was out first time in NYC, which was really nice and helpful. The room is cute and cozy, and it's just a few blocks from the subway which was very convenient for us. It was also located a few blocks away from a cute coffee shop and a great pizza place! We had a great time!

I got this apartment for my parents who were visiting from Alabama for the holidays. Jessica and her husband Alex were great. I met with them before hand and they explained everything about their apartment and neighborhood that we would need to know during my parents' stay. Jessica was very available during the stay as well even though she was traveling out of town. The apartment is lovely and well decorated, and the area is pretty convenient to the 6 train. My parents enjoyed their stay. Thank you for having us!

We learned about this website from watching shark tank so we thought we'd try it, at first I was uncomfortable thinking what if the apartment has issues or what if what if what if..?? However this was truly the best and most fun experience ever. Across the street was whole foods so every morning we lived like true New Yorkers and got a fresh bagel at the other corner was the best pizza place ever.. A block and a half away was the subway, down stairs is the drug store it was just a perfect fun location.. Kevin is an awesome host we arrived to his adorable girlfriend it just felt like we had always known her.. They were both alway a text, email or call away.. The apartment is very comfortable and it was plenty of room for 3. Kevin went out of his way to make videos of everything which was extremely helpful and I was able to refer back to when we had a question about the shower and the coffee maker. The apartment was clean, warm and most of all the bed for so comfortable I came home and bought a new mattress.. I would rent this apartment again in a minute.. Best host and experience ever

Actually, I couldn't meet him but he really cared about me and his roommate was nice to me, so I had really nice stay! He has a cat, she was super cute and she was around me almost all time. I'm really appreciate.
Great place. Close to subway line 1. Great roomates also.

Jennifer & Alex were great! The apartment is incredibly conveniently located and they are very organized. As soon as we arrived we found a list of everything we needed to know about the apartment as well as some recommendations of where to go around there. They even left us a bottle of wine and Christmas hats! Adorable apartment, great people. Would definitely go back!
Great! Grace is so amazing! Best experience I've ever had in Airbnb. We became friends then. The place is decorated beautifully and warmly and she prepares fruit and candy and cakes for me
I spend 13 nights in her apartment. I didn't meet Julia, but Everything  was organised and her roomate was kind with me. Safe location close to subway. I recomand!
Nice place, very cozy and very convenient location.
We stayed only 1 night but it was great! The place is gorgeous, even better than appear on the pictures the building has a lovely staff and the location is pretty good 3 blocks from subway.

Scott was excellent with communications. Friendly and helpful! 
Tiny apartment but clean and adequate accommodations for our 4 night stay in NYC for the New Years. The location was fantastic for shows and access to the many great entertainment and dining spots in Greenwich Village. Throughout our stay we kept saying "what a great location!" Also easy access to subways for a quick ride north or south. 

Thanks for everything Scott.
We had a great five night stay in Dimitri's Apartment. It looked exactly like the pictures provided. The location was perfect and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go.

We had an amazing time at Fernanda's. The place was as described: cozy, clean and sunny. She left clear instructions for our arrival and the keys were easy to get. Her two cats were very funny and fun to care for. The train station was nearby. She left nice suggestions of bars and restaurants so we got to eat and drink at amazing places. We just adore spending time in Brooklyn! Overall we really appreciated our stay and would recommend anytime.

This was the WORST airbnb or any living situation for that matter that I have ever experienced. First of all, the host was impossible to contact, having to communicate through a third party. Second of all, the whole apartment was disgusting and unlivable! It was dirty all around, the bed had no blankets, the washroom was unbearable, and there was a layer of mold on the tub. My friend and I had to go out and buy cleaning equipment to disinfect and scrub their entire bathroom before even stepping foot in. The price DOES NOT justify the condition of this so-called living space.  It says one star because it is required to give something, but if I could, I'd give 0.
The host is really friendly and helpful:)

We Stayed at Bonnie's for 9 days and it was great. We had the whole apartment and it was like it was described. The subway was close to us which was very convenient for moving around as it goes directly to downtown. Our host was traveling but we were greeted by a friend of theirs, he was very nice and welcoming. There were 3 of us. Bonnie provided us with 2 more mattresses to sleep on which was really nice of her. We met Bonnie and her husband before we left, they are nice people. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in New York.

This was my first time using Airbnb, and together with my husband we spent amazing New Year Eve holidays at this apartment. It's very clean, cozy and nice apartment. And we totally loved two kitties living there! The location is good, about 30 min from downtown, there is also amazing Fort Tryon Park near it. Amanda is a great and hospital. We haven't seen her, but she was always reachable by mail and answered fast and detailed, and also gave us a great list of NYC tips, which we liked a lot! It was great experience :)

Beautiful & Spacious Apartment at an Excellent Location....

Tess, is an Excellent Host...

Piero & Andreina R.
Great location and the apartment was clean and spacious.

Ben was a great host, he did everything possible to help accommodate our arrival/departure schedule and stay with a short notice booking. The flat is clean, spacious, and has everything you would need, great location and access to transport. We very much enjoyed our stay here and in NY

Great apartment in the hearth of Park Slope. Very well equipped, kitchen equipement, TV, bedding, etc...
Tim was super easy to deal with and perfectly organised. One of my best airbnb stay.

Nick was a great host. He was friendly and welcome when I arrived, attentive when I needed anything. I felt very "at home" in his place.

What I really liked though is Nick's enthusiasm for the neighborhood - he recommended a bunch of cool places to me and seemed really interested in showing off the best of Prospect Heights. It was my first time so I really appreciated the tips on restaurants and bars. 

Would definitely stay at Nick's place again!
I loved the location and Bridget/Christine's prompt and attentive hosting. They are such sweet hosts.  This listing has a great kitchen and a common space that is rare in Upper East Side spaces.
Lucia was very helpful and really REALLY nice! The room was lovely, tidy and spacious! It was a great experience!

Nice, clean, affordable room in Brooklyn.  I was in the area one night for and interview and this place worked out great.  Bedroom was clean and quiet and had it's own bathroom.  Neighborhood was very nice and felt safe.  I was able to park directly on the street in front of the apartment for free but there was also a parking garage at the end of the block.  Isabelle was friendly and helpful.  Recommend for anyone needing a short affordable stay in Brooklyn.
Chris was very welcome on our arrival, he already has everything on place.

We stayed in his room for 5 nights and loved the appartment. His roommates were very friendly an helpful. We contacted them to plan our arrival.
Vince took care of us even though he was not in NY this time. He helped us to find another room because we were too much people for one room.
We would come back. It was a nice time there.

We're doing a renovation of our own apartment since December 2015... We initially stayed at an Extended Stay America hotel near where we live (Hoboken, NJ) but soon figured that it wasn't for us. So we decided to look into Airbnb and we came across Anu's place. 

Our stay at Anu's was awesome. The view was beautiful and seemed to change every hour. It was quite an experience to fall asleep gazing out at the city lights every night and waking up to huge barges pushed by tug boats meandering down the East River... 

Anu's place was super quiet. You literally can't hear neighbors. The floors must be 18" thick concrete or something... 

Anu's place was clean and warm (it was winter) and welcoming. Every night we stayed truly felt comfortable and nothing like in a hotel. We really felt at home and this had a lot to do with the way Anu set us up and made sure that we knew hot to navigate the building and introduced us to the doormen etc. 

I highly recommend the experience of and Airbnb to anyone, especially if you're doing your own renovation.... It's definitely the way to go. 

We moved out of Anu's place to relocate back to Hoboken to be closer to our on-going renovation... 

We'll let you all know how our stay is at our new Airbnb home once we finally move back into our own (real) place. 

Thanks again Anu!

Cheers

Clarke & Angelique
Awesome Host, great experience.

Andrea's place is exceptionally clean, comfortable and perfectly located on a quiet Bushwick block. There must be a dozen excellent restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk of the apartment. Communication, check-in and check-out were all handled professionally. 
I would happily stay here again. Highly recommended.

Lakan's apartment is in a hip part of Brooklyn close to the subway and a short ride from Manhattan. The location is wonderful and it's fun just to walk around the neighborhood. I greatly appreciate Lakan's flexibility when we requested earlier check-in and later check-out times. We were welcome upon arrival and our communication was smooth and efficient. When we discovered a problem with a bathtub, it was immediately fixed. One thing to consider for older guests--the apartment is on the fourth floor and there is no elevator.  
Highly recommended.
Yi-Chen's room was spacious and quiet. We enjoyed our stay very much.

A great place to stay!
Close to the subway. Sunny private room with a full bed, quiet location. Lots of artworks in living room.

Great cozy home. Really enjoyed the space. Helen was very helpful and accessible. The location was wonderful, it was so fun being in SoHo and having great tips about great food in the area. We had 4 people in our group and were very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again!

It was a wonderful experience to explore NY from Joel's room. I never met Joel, but he did arrangements for my check-in though he was flying same day. The apartment was nice and quiet. I did walked to brooklyn bridge and ground 0 easily from there. Rest of the NY I explored from Delancy subway station (5 min walk).
Overall I enjoyed NY in those three days!
Thanks Joel and Airbnb
Vivek

Alisa was very welcoming and helpful! She was great in answering any questions before our stay. Her apartment is lovely -- comfortable and clean. It's in a nice building in a great location. Her roommate was nice, friendly and accommodating even when we arrived very late. She helped recommend some good places to go in the area. Great hosts!

Weijia's place was awesome. Good view of the empire state building, big TV, laundry room in the building. Everything was clean, kitchen had everything you need (pots and pans, toaster ect). And very close to the B, D and F train, perfect for getting around the city. 

Weija was easy to contact and communicate with. Would stay again!

The accomodation is clean and large enough for two. It's as described in the announcement. The building is clean and recent and we were always welcomed by the doorman. The organisation for our arrival was perfect and we were allowed to arrive and leave at very accomodating hours. The studio is very closed to the subway and it's easy to reach many attracting places in Manhattan or Brooklyn.

Judy is as very kind and thoughtful hostess. She helped carry our bags when we arrived and were exhausted.  We were her first listing and there are several things she might want to change.  The listing is not accurate on several items.  The listing says it is 5 minutes from Times Square.  It is more  accurate to say it is a 5 minute walk to the subway entrance, then a 15-20 minute train ride to the Times Square subway stop.  There is no mention of a cat or a fifth floor walk up with no elevator.  There are no real cups or glass for water, only a bowl.  We ran out of toilet paper. There was no trash can in our room or the restroom. There are many personal items left out in the shared bathroom and the hall way. The cat uses the same toilet that you will and you will need to move the litter box out of the bathroom in order to use the facilities or shower.  The neighborhood felt safe and residential. However there are not really very many places to eat close by.   A clearer idea about what to expect will help a traveler feel happy when they book.

Max's place was in a great location, just blocks from the L-train subway and thus a single stop to Manhattan. Outside the hustle and bustle of the city there is room to breathe and walk around unhindered to nearby coffee shops, bars, and restaurants galore. (Don't miss affordable bottomless brunches all around this spot on the weekends!). The room was small, admittedly, but what do you expect. Though Max was out of town his roommate was able to show us in and et is situated. Max was never more than a message away throughout. It was his first time listing the place, but he was more than willing to work through a few hiccups and make our stay enjoyable and worth while. If you're looking for a place to be that's not overwhelmingly big city, this is it. And don't forget that amazing view from the rooftop terrace (extra bonus - it's closed in and toasty in the winter)!
The place was fantastic. Great location, beautiful, big apartment, and fully equipped kitchen so we were able to cook easily. Eli was super reliable and easy to get in contact with. Perfect stay.

Our stay at Ding's place was great! The apartment was clean and spacious, exactly as what was described. The location was great! We were able to walk to Empire State Building and Time Square. Metro stop was 2 minutes away, easy to go to downtown or uptown. Ding was a great host, very kind with us and responsive. We definitely would recommend it!
Muy util si solo quieres un lugar centrico donde dormri, mas barato que otros,

Kaitlyn's apartment is great! It's cute, small, cozy and very clean and especially its location is perfect. Short bus/metro rides to all major sights. I didn't meet Kaitlyn, but her roommate Maia welcomed me nicely and I could contact Kaitlyn anytime. I can fully recommend it!

Annie's place was lovely, comfortable, and in a very nice neighbourhood. Annie was a great host and gave us lots of info about the area and a detailed guide about the house. We would definitely stay at Annie's again :)

the apt and location were awesome. we had everything we needed from netflix a ps3 and a really good knife set for cooking. Mellisa was great and made sure that we didnt need anything. if you love great restaurants and want to be walking distance from the best shopping the city has to offer this spot is perfect. #LES

Noelia was the best host !
Really available and eager to help in anyway she could !
The appartment is great, really clean, really luminous, and decorated with great taste!
The neighborhood is also great to discover Harlem, and all the other neighborhood of NYC.
Yes I would do it again.

Amber was a great host! She was very welcoming, and even invited me out for a drink with her and her friend. The room was amazing; very comfortable, private, and with its own patio. There was wifi access and Amber gave me full use of the kitchen and bathroom, as well as provided a towel! The location was perfect, right near the centre of everything. All in all, a great stay! Thank you Amber :)

Henriette was very helpful and promptly responded to questions. The apartment was better than I expected. Simple, & with everything that I needed; white walls wooden floors, modern kitchen. The apartment was warm & cozy. There is no view from the bedroom window as the room is at the side of the house, but New York is a place to be out doing and seeing all the time so I wasn't concerned. There is a lovely front room with a view of the street. The apartment is brilliantly placed in the area, a great base to travel the city. I felt welcome on arrival with the charming touch of some chocolates on my pillow and a welcome note. I would definitely book with Henriette again and recommend to others.

I've spent more than 1 month in this cozy apartment. It was the best way to approach the big apple. The flat is located in an unreal quite neighborhood full of green and squirrels just few stops away from downtown.
Houston was always available when needed.

Amazing view from the studio. Great location. Just 1 stop from Grand Central, 2 stops from 5th ave and 3 stops from Time Square if you take 7 subway. Super convenient. There's a food market and DR on the other side of building. And lots of nice restaurants in Long Island City. Elva is super nice and very communicative. Highly recommend!

My friend and I had an excellent time staying at Bretts. The apartment was as described and perfectly located near a subway so if you wanted to get into Manhattan it was quick and easy. The apartment felt like a home from home and had all of the amenities you need and great restaurants, grocery stores, diners etc close by. Brett kept in touch throughout our trip and was happy to answer any questions.

We stayed at Juan's place 10 days.
His appartment is really well located. It's close to Columbia University and only 5 min walking from the subway !!
The area is safe.
The appartement is clean and cosy. Juan wasn't there but always asked if he could help.
I would definitely recommend !!

That was my first time in NYC, and Lina's place was just perfect! Everything was the same way as shown in pictures! And the roommates are just awesome people! They helped out me to find the places around Brooklyn and Manhattan. The room is bright big and cozy. I felt like home!

Laurence and Brandie were attentive hosts. Their home was a perfect setting to celebrate the holiday with my son. The neighborhood is awesome, near the park, shopping and transportation all in walking distance. I had a great time and would consider staying again.

The room was very nice. The host prepared lots of stuff for us, which was extremely useful as I've never been to NY before and had just traveled from abroad. The picture accurately pictures the room (except for the macbook of course). I mostly interacted with one of his roommates, who was fantastic. I did not see the host in person much, but we did connect online, and he is very thoughtful. The place has a nice coffee shop next door and is extremely close to the subway station. There are also many other food places and grocery stores within a 10-15 minutes walk. Overall it was a wonderful experience.
The listing description was very accurate. We were allowed to use the space freely and appreciated how accommodating our host was!

Rebecca's roommate Robin received us when we arrived.  The house is cozy and in my opinion, looks like the place of artists.  

The other roommates are warm, friendly and welcoming.  Robin gave us guidance on how we can spend our time in New York, and was happy to help when we needed.

The room was reasonably cozy, however the bed could have been more comfortable.  The amenities were as listed, and the bathroom was clean. 

I liked how passionate the housemates where about their art and what they do.  It was a cultural exchange for me more than anything.

The neighborhood looked safe, and we got back past midnight almost every day while we were there - there was no obvious danger or annoyance.  The place is very close to the subway station, and that made commute easy.

On the budget, it's a delightful stay!

Anna, who was handling the reservation for Natasha, was extremely helpful and welcoming.  She made sure to meet us at the apartment, and even came over later in our stay to bring us a DVD player!  She helped us with directions, and oriented us to the neighborhood.  The apartment was very clean, the shower great, the beds quite comfortable, and we really appreciated the fruit and chocolates Anna left for us.  

Before we arrived in Brooklyn, it was tricky connecting with Anna.  There seemed to be some glitch with email and texts between Natasha and Anna; but once we connected, communication worked very well. 

The apartment is basement-level, which wasn't clear from the listing.  The entrance is under the front stoop.  We missed having a microwave, as we cooked in several times, but otherwise, the kitchen was well outfitted.  The subway to Manhattan is a half-mile walk.  Everyone we met in the neighborhood was very friendly.  The neighborhood itself is a little run down, without many amenities.  Nearby restaurants are pizza, etc.  The absolutely excellent Pilar  Cuban restaurant is 2 miles away.  We had a great meal there one night.

The apartment is very spacious, in a safe location, close to stores, cafes and supermarkets. The hosts were very nice, made us feel at home and had everything in the apartment ready so we could enjoy our stay.

My stay at Felicia's was nice, I enjoyed the area, and felt very safe walking around at night. The room was very clean and spacious, very accommodating for my one month stay. Felicia and her roommate were gracious hosts, and I had a great time.
Great apartment for great value. Very close to public transport. 24/7 key availability. Definitely recommend.
Very cute house.thank you so much our family have a nice NYC tour.

William was extremely prompt with his replies and checked in on us by text on our second day. The room was exactly as it is depicted on through the pictures; very neat and orderly. Although we didn't actually get to meet him, his roommates were wonderfully welcoming and even drew us a map of the area to get basic toiletries and groceries. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here or even return for another visit soon!
Great location. Alex and roommate were really hospitable had a great time staying there. Recommend

The flat was really a pity. There were some hairs in the beds, not enough towels, glasses... Indeed it was so dirty whereas the flat was modern and well located. We are really disappointed to conclude.

We spend an amazing week end at Becky's ! She has been a perfect host, waiting for us with a breakfast and telling us the best places to go in Manhattan. The apartment is perfectly situated (right next to the metro 1), big, confortable and really nice, just as the pictures. It was a really good first AirBnb experience that I will repeat thanks to Becky :)

Good location in Williamsburg with restaurants, bars and shops nearby. Perfect also for visiting Manhattan (two subway stations at walking distance and just 1 stop to Manhattan). Cillian was a great host, even if he was not there he provided us with clear information before and during our stay and a useful list of nearby places to eat, drink and spend the night. Also Cillian's roomates were nice and helpful in giving us information and advices.
We had a great stay at Carina's! The apartment is well-maintained and had everything we needed. It's also in a great location. Would definitely stay there again!
The location was great and safe. The room was enough for two people. I had a good time there.
Friendly host, great place. Entire room was clean, the place is so near to a station, the host showed me the city around before he left. I really recommend that you use this place.
Enjoyed my stay at Deniz apartment, perfect location, close to everywhere.
It was a nice experience! A clean and well kept place! Thanks!

My brother and I had the pleasure of staying at Ali's apartment for two weeks. We, fell in love with Brooklyn!

Ali's apartment is everything and more that she described. Her apartment feels like a home away from home, and it is a warm comfortable space. The neighborhood is  lively, friendly, and everything you could need is conveniently located nearby. 

I can only describe my experience as superb and I cannot thank Ali enough for being such a gracious host.

Sasha's apartment is amazing, located very conveniently in the Lower east side near the F train (perfect to go everywhere in Manhattan and Brooklyn). The place is brand new with 2 nice bedrooms and a comfortable pull out couch. All the equipments are new as well. Sasha is a perfect hostess very sweet and available anytime for questions. I would definetely go back to her place!

Bailey went above and beyond to make sure our arrival and stay was well informed and easy, leaving us a detailed information sheet about all of the apartment and neighbourhood amenities. The apartment was as described, very clean on arrival with fresh sheets and brand new towels for us. It was the perfect size for two people in a quiet neighbourhood easily accessible by the subway. I would highly recommend staying here IF you yourself are a cat owner and fully comprehend what living with a cat in a small apartment entails. We were unpleasantly surprised by the amount of cat hair that gathered all over our belongings and selves, despite daily cleaning of the apartment and brushing of the cat. As it is a very small space, the odour of the cat food and litter box was very displeasing and made for a stuffy stay at times. However, cat owners would have been more prepared for these factors and therefore made for a more comfortable stay.

Bailey did everything in her power to ensure we had a nice stay and left her cosy home open to us.

John's place is the epitome of minimalist style in an amazing part of NYC. The apartment is incredibly spacious, clean and welcoming. Though my time with John was brief, he was a really cool guy and very accommodating. I highly recommend his beautiful apartment to anyone who is visiting the city!

It was only 4 days but was incredible.
Thank's to John and James, you have been the best hosts ever.
I went running with John like a friend, then taking a brunch on sunday, watching soccer games together and speaking about so many different things. It's like you are in your own house.

Doors always open and smile everytime.

The studio was exactly like the description. Amazing view of the Empire State Buliding, especially in the evening, and close to many touristic attractions. I had a wonderful stay and would definitely recommend this studio.
Justin's apartment is beautifully designed, decorated and maintained.     We had a fabulous time.

Cozy home in best location with all facilities and nice host! 
100% recommended
Stephanie is a great host and her roommates are very nice! Everything was perfect!

Our experience were less pleasant that we had expected. The room was smaller than we expected but that is because the owner had very few pictures. There wasn't bedsheets that we could use. The common bathroom was unkept. Location was difficult to access especially during nights, trains do not work as often. We waiting for an hour and the train to brooklyn still did not arrive.
She was a nice host and the room was cozy and comfortable :-)
Lovely host with an apartment to die for, located at best possible location! Will definately try to come back next year.

Gislaine's place is wonderful! Her mother, Leide, welcomed us when her Gislaine was out of town over New Year's Eve. Convenient location, comfortable space, and generous host. Would gladly stay again-- thank you!

Our hosts were very nice and helpful. The room is small, but totally fine for two people since we didn't spend much time inside at all. The description of how to get there is very good and the neighbourhood is lovely.

Friendly guys, still working out the kinks. A few things i would recommend. Make a list of house rules and have it printed in the room, the bay doors to the room need to be able to close and lock properly, the room needs a power strip as only one socket works, and some sort of space heater. Would stay again provided the adjustments were made.
We were constantly in touch through email.that made things really easy for us.
Lewis was great, listing was as advertised. Everyone in the apartment was incredibly nice and welcoming. Great folks to be around.

Mohannad's place can boast an absolutely perfect location (in the heart of Greenwich Village, steps away from Washington Square Park and NYU) and a really great host. Mohannad went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and to make sure I had everything I needed for a pleasant stay. He was always available and was always happy to help. The room is clean, air-conditioned and comfortable, and so close to everything in Downtown Manhattan that you really couldn't find a better place to stay and explore the city.
The room was quite cozy and nice. The apartment was in Hell's Kitchen, among shops and restaurants, and it was walking distance to subway station and Times Square.

I enjoyed my stay at Yingyuan room throughout my 4 days in NYC. The room was clean and spacious. Most importantly, Roosevelt Island is safe and really accessible to the city attractions to Time Squares, meaning short travel times. A useful information would be that there is an island shuttle that is helpful in transporting your luggage to the apartment block as it is quite a walking distance to carry heavy bags from the F subway.
Amazing stay and Crystal was a great host!

Sofia is a great host, very responsive and always ready to help out with anything. She was't in town during our staying but he provided us with alle the info we needed to get to the flat and use everything it provided. She also left us some food and snacks for our arrival! The place is VERY clean and organized, 3 people can sleep and live very comfortably. Overall a great experience, in a great flat with a perfect Host!
Good neighbourhood. Close enough to Manhattan. The apartment its perfect for 3 people
Great location and awesome amenities! Washer nd dryer are a life saver! The apartment itself is beautiful ! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone

Staying at Joe's Williamsburg apartment was truly enjoyable. Joe and Sabrina have created an atmosphere where you can feel truly at home. The apartment was very clean, modern, and comfortable. We also liked the neighborhood and the close proximity to the train station and restaurants. Would definitely stay there again if in the area.

Jorges Place is 3-4min from the next sub-station. In the neighborhood there are different stores, banks and places to eat. The rooms are good for 5-6 people.
Jorge kept us up to date and was very fast in communication, perfect. 
We enjoyed our stay and recommend it!
Everything was OK, very quite neighborhood, nice and cozy room. You have the subway just a few steps! Good (Hidden by Airbnb) . I really recommend this place to other people.
Great room, nearby everything, clean, well organized and the bed was really, REALLY soft. Brandy is the  perfect host, we will definitely recommend and, who knows? Come back...

The description of the lof was faithful to the real and Bekah had prepared, with a real kindness, every things for our arrival. 
We didn't miss anything and we could enjoy our journey in Brooklyn/NYC serenely.
We are so thankful for that.

Although there was a miscommunication between host and his friend(I had to wait for more than 1 hour), the place was pretty nice and very close to station. The host's friend was very nice, kind, and friendly. The neighborhood is pretty quiet and safe except for subway sound. 20 minutes away from times square.
We had a wonderful time for a budget price at Piner's studio with great view. We hope to be back sometimes. Thank you Piner for hosting us in your apartment!

The house and the room was very comfortable and cozy.We had a really nice New York experience there. It was near the main subway lines which we used almost everyday. Stephanie was easy to communicate and helpful about everything.
Tyler's place was great, so close to the L train and 1 stop away from Manhattan. He was very cool and helpful with everything, I would totally stay there again :)
Beatriz had super awesome place. The room was very spacious and felt very relaxing. I hope the next time I'm in Brooklyn the room is available and can stay again.
Matthew is a wonderful host and has a fabulous apartment with unbeatable views. A++

Very accommodating host. Very helpful with every question I asked.  Visited NYC for the first time and he was very friendly and even took time out of his day to show me around the city and tour the subway. Would visit again.

The apartment is very cute, nicely decorated, even a little bigger than it looks in the pictures, spacious, has everything you need ans the bed is very comfortable. It is conveniently located one block you can take buses and the subway is (although the nearest station was closed in the period when we were us). Very close to the central park and places to eat.
Rachel was always attentive to what we needed and was very flexible for our creo out . 100 % definitely recommended.

Pierre's apartment was very comfortable and in a great location. 5 minutes from the subway, 15 minutes on the N or Q train to Manhattan. There are plenty of places to eat and 24 hour supermarkets and pharmacies nearby. Pierre was a great host and messaged us regularly to make sure everything was going OK. I would definitely stay at Pierre's place again.
The room is really nice. The owner's sister helped us to check in and introduce the appliance to us. Well location. Five minutes' walk to subway and bus station. Safe and quiet place.
Host wasn't home during our stay but his roommates greeted us nicely. Privacy granted, access to balcony, and close to subway station L train
This place is lovely with a great host, we felt welcomed and the place has what is described. Definitely recommended!

I lived in Williamsburg Brooklyn for almost a decade. I like to visit my old neighborhood after spending the Holidays with my family in PA, before heading back to Austin. I wasn't planning on making the trip to Brooklyn this year, so I was happy to be able to book Jeff's place rather last-minute. He answered all of my messages right away (while he was traveling in Europe *VERY impressive). Although we did not meet in person, I can tell Jeff is a really cool guy with great style. His place was nicer and more spacious than a Hotel. I especially liked the private balcony and SUPER QUIET block. *No sound of sirens or passing traffic. The decor is modern and the building is very trendy. There is a Door Person 24 hours; They're all very friendly and helpful, which made the Check In/Out process super easy. I felt very safe at all times. You can not beat the location! Jeff's place is only a block from the L Stop at Bedford (one stop from east village)... take it from a local... it's doesn't get any better than that! *It was freezing temperatures during our visit, so it was a relief to not have to walk any distance to the subway. The hip neighborhood has everything, while maintaining a mom-and-pop-shop feel. You can wine and dine on any types of cuisine. I suggest Happy Hour at Le Fanfare (new location branching from Manhattan'd EPISTROPHE), DuMont Burger for lunch, Beacon's Closet for thrift shopping, Brooklyn Brewery for local beers, and House of YES! for dancing and late-night entertainment. Enjoy Williamsburg! And don't forget to tip your servers and bartenders ;)

I rented Sam's small but comfortable one bedroom apartment for a week during the 2015-16 winter. The place was very clean and tidy when I arrived. Space to put my clothes was provided for. The kitchen had all basic utensils and enough space to make it easy to cook meals. The bed was big and comfortable. 
I encourage single travelers and pairs to try Sam's place as it's very conveniently located, as far as the East Village is concerned but also when it comes to walking to the Subway, just 3-6 blocks away, depending on the line. The apartment is very quiet also since it's at the last floor of the building and at the back of it. 
 Please be aware that the floor is slightly slanted, as the flat is part of an old condo (the bed is even, no problems there).
We had an amazing time in David's place. The location is amazing and the flat is not only lovely but super comfy! Our hosts were responsive and thoughtful.

I felt great being there! I felt like I had the place to myself! i was able to come and go without hassle.  We were SOOO Close to everything, it was fantastic!!! Everything was sooo clean and I had plenty of space. close local bars nearby as well!!!  Very very cool. we definitely go back here again!!!

Apartment was very cute and beatiful, we really liked it, a part of some things, like broken sink (we couldnt use it because all the time was a water inside), no internet, no mirrow under sink, only one towel and apartment was a bit dirty.
We found this period of stay not comfortable enough.

Laura was an ABSOLUTE fabulous host. She left the place immaculate for us, responded to our messages quickly, and anything else you could think of. She left detailed instructions for us about everything in the apartment. Apartment sleeps 4 comfortably. Spacious, cozy couches, big TV with awesome TV selection channels. Place is hands down in the best location in NYC, upper east side, safe and walking distance to a lot of cool places. 0 Complaints here!
Great! Good contact, good week and good flat
Wonderful stay, the location is the best, cosy place, Ther is adorable. I was very happy there.

Nice flat, easy to find.

Easy to communicate with Daniel great hoster.

It was an okay experience. We've visited with family and our biggest concern with the apt was its cleanliness! Some of the comforters and linen looked dirty and the sofa bed wasn't usable at all. We had actually grossed out by it as soon as we unfolded then put it back the way it (Website hidden by Airbnb) of us just slept on the sofa with a bed sheet on.
Even the extra mattress was dirty with stains on it!
Kitchen was pretty functional but no microwave. The stove smelled like gas leaking when lit first but was okay afterwords. 
And because we were there with family, another concern we had was that there was no lock on the bedroom doors.
Not so convenient for parking if you're driving.

We absolutely loved staying at Michael's. The apartment was well stocked, inviting, warm, and very comfortable. Michael was very responsive to our questions, and made great recommendations about the area. The area itself could not have been more convenient, with access to the park, BBG, museum, and subway. We will absolutely be staying here again, the next time we are in town. Thank you Michael!
Nice and clean appartment, really functionnal, Matt was really helpful with everything

Amelia's place is perfect! So charming and cozy, perfect location and super clean. Communicating with her was always super easy and she was very kind to leave a map, a  NY travel guide and some chocolates for my mom to enjoy.  Amelia is one of the best hosts I have ever stayed with through Airbnb!

My sister Natali and I loved staying at Shirley's...the room was very basic but clean and tidy and provided us with most of what we needed during our 6 night stay in the Big Apple! Shirley wasn't there at the time but her roommate Brian was super lovely and helpful! The location was perfect for immersing oneself in all that The East Village has to offer with shops & bars/restaurants. The subway was right across the road so getting around Manhattan and the other Burroughs was not only easy but quite an enjoyable experience!

Everything was very easy, from initial contact to follow-up emails and calls. The apartment was large and comfortable. We had a couple of minor problems which were fixed immediately, and it was the weekend! The building is in a great neighborhood within easy walking distance of theaters, restaurants and shopping and the subway. The building has a doorman and concierge and it is very quiet. I would definitely rent from them again. An A+ experience.

Amazing apartment and every amenity you could think of!  Thomas and Connie are great hosts.  I am testing out the waters in Bushwick to possibly move there and they showed me all the hidden gems this vibrant neighborhood has to offer.  I enjoyed the gym and even caught a movie in the buildings movie theater.  There is great food nearby and lots of vintage shopping.  Thomas showed me some of Brooklyns best music venues and Connie gave me a DJ lesson in her music studio!  I will 100% recommend to anyone looking for a real Brooklyn escape!

Heather was very accommodating and responded quickly to my text messages whenever I had a question. Her apartment was nice, clean, and exactly how it was described in the pictures she took. The apartment is in a quiet part of the city and is located in a very safe neighborhood. I would recommend this apartment to a friend if they were looking for a place in the city and would love to stay here again in the future.
Great value, super easy checkin/out!

Aditya made arrangements for his roommate to make sure my stay went well. Upon my arrival, I was given access to the room without a wait. The room was neat and tidy with great motivational decor on the wall. The host was happy to share the wifi login and password, the shower was clean with had hot water and there was toilet paper! 

The Bay Ridge neighborhood was a pleasant place to stay. During the day it was busy with small business owners and commuters walking up and down 3rd Avenue. At night the streets were quiet and the overall feeling was one of safety.

The closest subway station was 3 blocks away, which made commuting into Manhattan from the R line quite easy.

I highly recommend this room!

Jennifer's apartment was very nice: great location, not far from subways, lots of place to hang out around... and Netflix! The common space was very big and nice to be in. 
I just met Jennifer the last day, she was very nice and thoughtful. All along she was very responsive whenever I had a question and arranged my arrival so her roommate could welcoming me.
Sierra was so nice, she left the all details even with emergency call number:) her place is so cozy and I really felt very happy staying her room.

Liliana (Ricardo's girlfriend) was the one who I was in contact with my whole experience. She was really attentive and was very detailed when it came to directions, suggestions, and placement of things. It's a humble place, and the loft bed feels so cozy and personal. Sharing a bathroom was no hassle, and all the tenants were very friendly and respectful. I enjoyed the location where the bus stop was to take me to Manhattan, and I felt safe and secure when I was there. Liliana was great, and I appreciate her opening her doors to me.

Very nice, spacious apartments. Nicely furnished. The location is great in terms of being near Central Park, grand central, subway stations etc. but that comes at the price of it being extremely noisy, even on a night. But I suppose that comes with the Times Square territory!
Appartamento ben tenuto e puliti con tutti i servizi disponibili molto vicino alla subway

It was indeed a nice place, with very fiendly and welcoming hosts. The place had all the amenities listed in the description, although the heating system made some strange noises at night which was a little irritating. There were two subway stations close by, so it was easy to get to Manhatten most of the time (except for the weekends and late nights, when the trains worked with some delay).
Mehrnoush is very kind and friendly. When we arrived at the apartment at 7am, she was there at the door to guide us to the apartment. Very nice gesture and will definitely stay there again.

Taylor is warm and welcoming and so is her place. She offered all the information and help that I could need and I had a nice stay. The place is homey, quiet, and right off Broadway which has so much great food.
Great little space as it said. Nice apartment. Good guy. Thumbs up!
Diana was an excellent host, providing a welcome gift and detailed notes about the neighborhood. Her place was clean, comfortable and I would definitely stay here again.
Great appartment and excellent location ! David was very nice helpful abd available for all questions...

Siavash's home was beautiful!! Really comfortable, clean and full of good vibes. His housemates were totally accommodating, we didn't see them much after we arrived, but had a lovely chat with them on the first night. I couldn't recommend his place more (also the location is perfect for trendy Bushwick!! :)

Beautiful apartment, spacious and well decorated, with nice furniture and everything you may need for a relaxing stay. The views on the river and on the skyline are just amazing. Check-in and -out was very easy. Good communication with Selin. Higly recommended!

The house was perfect for our stay in New York City. Very clean and comfortable, with more than enough space for four people between the queen bed, pull out sofa bed, and the air mattresses provided. The close proximity to the subway was a plus (0.3 miles), and the location was great. You can make it to midtown (Madison Square Garden and Times Square) in 5 or 6 stops. Host was very responsive during our stay and flexible with our schedule. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC.

Xenia is a great host. Although she was not in the city while we arrived, she asked her friend to welcome us and arranged everything every well. She responded very fast and answered all our questions. Her place was very cozy and had a good location. Highly recommended !!

Rosalind informed me that it was her first time hosting a guest from Airbnb, and we both took a gamble in confirming this reservation. Yet, the host was very kind and friendly. The price is reasonable, and the host is willing to waive extra fees from additional guests and also the cleaning fee since she had no time to clean the room. Overall an awesome experience and highly recommended. Thank you for the comfortable stay!

Anitra was a great host! She was very patient with our changing schedule, and made sure we had everything we needed. She had a list of local bars, and restaurants nearby for us to visit! The home was cozy, and comfortable. Will definitely be staying there again when I visit NYC!

I had good communications with Lily from the beginning. haven't met her but her roommates have been really kind. very good location, just in front of the park, near to the train station. park slope is a very nice area.
Stephanie was really easy going, and a great host. She left us some welcome chocolates.
Great neighborhood, Hoda made us feel welcome.

The location is great. It is the only reason I chose this room even though it is much expensive than other options. I came to NYC for an intern so convenience is my priority. The building is old so the heating system is not functioning very well. But thanks to host's roommate Alex, the apt is tidy and cozy. The sound-proof of the apt is not good, I can hear sounds from other apt every night. My room was cold when it was getting cold in NYC and before the storm coming. So I have a bad cold and I haven't recovered. I didn't meet my host in person and we kept in touch through phone. Alex is very considerate and friendly, so as Ana( another roommate in the apt).
The place was very clean and near metro stations. There are many shops nearby that open till 12 midnight. Anusheh was also really helpful with the tourist spots to visit and eat outs.

This was my first airbnb experience and I can say that it was very satisfying. Rachel's apartment is exactly like in the pictures and she was really helpful by leaving me a well crafted map of the area with insights on where to go. That kinda thing really makes you fell like you did a good thing staying there. The room is upstairs which was good because one of the roommates smokes (a lot by the way) so having a place for myself was really great. Rachel seems to be a great girl and I got that sense by talking to people downstairs (there's a great bar right next door.) everyone sad good things about her. The only thing I did not like about ir was the location. Even though it is close to the subway it can be really scary at night and the trains are not so reliable. It usually takes about 20 minutes to arrive. Also it will take about 45 minutes to get to places like Central Park for example or Times Square.  To sum up if location is definitely not a problem I would recommend Rachel's apartment.

Frank's place was an awesome place to stay for 8 days: cool warehouse feel, easy access, close to the East River, good coffee, nice cat, friendly housemate. 

If I could live there, I would. 

Thanks

Awesome !
The apartment is great and Ian always answer my questions asap !

Fraser was so helpful and talked me through everything! Her place looked just like the pictures and her room mate was super cool we knew the area pretty well but if your not familiar with it everything you'd ever need is on this street. Great host great place would defiantly stay again !

The apartment was just as described. We arrived late but Elizabeth had set up a way for us to get our keys. The apartment was clean and tidy for our arrival and Elizabeth had even written us a note suggesting places to eat and grocery shop, as well as the nearest subway st. Very helpful and a very nice apartment - perfect for 2 people travelling together. The neighbours were very helpful as well, and we enjoyed the neighbourhood. We will definitely recommend this place to others.

Cozy, lovely little studio! GREAT location, so close to the park and tons of adorable restaurants and shops. Tamara and David were kind and responsive and did a great job at curating a comfortable and charming space.

We had a great time in NYC and Jessie's apartment was perfect! Her place is exactly as described and pictured. The complex is very safe and quiet ... The location was perfect for what we needed as well. Would definitely book again in the future.

Just as described-Bright airy room. Helpful roommate and neighbor if needed. Kitchen available to make meals. Towels and toiletries provided if needed. Elevator in building and same floor laundry available. Close to the 4,5,6 subways into the city. And bus lines.  Quick walk to Central Park. Thanks for loaning your space Karla.  Highly recommend.

This was a great Airbnb! Wonderful location, right next to public transit. And a lot more space than I was expecting from a Manhattan room. Pieter does have a cat however and sometimes late at night it did smell a little bit like fish but that was a very miniscule the inconvenience. Overall great stay, great location. I would love to stay again!
I didn't meet the host but her roommate James hosted us, was a good host.

I absolutely love this location smacked between Williamsburg and Greenpoint. It's an excellent escape from the hustle of Manhattan, and close to some greats bars, shops, and eateries. Lots of great, kind folk walking the streets, too. The apartment space itself was nice-- two stories, high ceilings. The room was upstairs, and one would have to access it through a narrow, spiraling staircase (I wouldn't recommend it if you're lugging heavy baggage or have any back/knee troubles). Bed was comfortable, no closet but I was pretty nonchalant about the latter. Supposedly, hot water would only be available in the upstairs shower at certain portions of the night. I tried to no avail, so I had to resort to using the downstairs bathroom that was shared between the other (Hidden by Airbnb) . Needless to say I had to go in with a can of lysol and clorox wipes-- but hey, at least the water was warm! Still, kind of inconvenient. (Hidden by Airbnb) didn't interact all too much, so if you prefer going about your business then this might be a plus. Walls were pretty thin; I could hear the next door neighbor blasting his/her entire 90's playlist. Come with earplugs, just in case. During the weekend you are bound to get a sampling of it.
Nice place
Great place, great location, very friendly roommates! All in all, a fantastic stay! Thanks :)
The apartment was everything it was expected to be. The room, area and host were all great.
Nice room in great location. House is a bit dark and not very social, but the room is nice and Morgan is super great at communication. Overall pretty good!

I had a great stay at Emily's apt! I recently moved to NY and needed a place to stay until I found a permanent spot. She was accommodating to my tight move in schedule and enjoyed the company of the other housemates. Would definitely stay again!

This apartment is in a great location
Yes it is compact but we were 4 and we were comfortable 
It's a good price so you can't expect the Ritz 
It's at top of 5  flight of stairs but it's quiet 
Great options on TV with Netflix and Apple TV 
No towels provided but Negar warned us in advance so wasn't a prob

The room is super nice! As depicted in the picture. The room is also spacious for two people. The host and his room-mate had been very nice to us when we stayed in the room. They were super friendly and always available if any of us need help. The bathroom is always kept clean. The kitchen and the utensils (the fridge, cutlery, etc) were available for us to use. The location of the room is also very convenient as it is only two blocks away from a NYC subway station. So transportation would not be a problem. Besides that, the flexible time for check-in and check-out is very convenient. In general, it has been a pleasure to stay there and I am looking forward to staying there again if I happen to visit New York City in the future.

Lauren was absolutely amazing! We didn't actually see her, but her room was clean, beautifully decorated, and perfectly suited for our needs. She was even so kind as to leave towels for us! The location is right above a Starbucks and in such a quaint neighbourhood filled with great eats and delis. Not far from a subway station and easy access to the rest of the city. Thanks Lauren!

The room was at a great location, it was close to multiple metro stations which made it easy to move around. We didn't have the pleasure of meeting Simon as he was out of town, however,  he was very helpful and attentive at all times.

This is a great local neighborhood in Brooklyn. Plenty of nice stuff nearby but more chill than a lot of other areas. Easy walk to transportation, dining, Brooklyn Botanic and Museum. We had a car and were able to find easy parking on street with no problems whatsoever. This unit has been extensively updated - great little kitchen and decent bath. Really everything you need. Samantha sent an very helpful guide to the apartment and the neighborhood. We were very happy.

This place was amazing and super clean when we arrived. The space bigger than you think and the host was very easy to contact and deal with. The location is awesome amongst some amazing restaurants. Overall we had no problems and would definitely stay here again!
We really enjoyed staying at Claudia's place. The apartment was spacious and clean. It was exactly as in the photos. We had no issues with check in or out. We would stay there again!
Loved the room and the apartment building! Really nice area of Greenpoint with cool restaurants nearby. The building has really cool amenities. The room has an amazing view.

Mark was a very welcoming host!  Helped show me around the neighborhood and introduced me to some local food spots.  The apartment was as advertised - clean, nicely decorated, and in a quiet neighborhood with easy access to Midtown via express subway.

Our stay at Katherine's was fantastic. She was very helpful and gave us quick feedback and good information. 

The bedroom was really nice and it's consistent with the pictures. We visited in January and it was easy to sleep at night because the bed was comfortable and it was pretty quiet on the streets around. Also the temperature was fine even though it was winter. The only negative is that it's on the fifth floor with no elevator, but it gets easier after a few days. 

The location of the apartment was excellent for our purposes. Amazing restaurants and bars in Lower east side, design shops, coffee and breakfast places in cozy Nolita and a five minute walk to the shopping streets in SoHo. It's also close walking to the subway stations, 2 Av (orange) and Bowery (Brown).

Andrea did a great job as a host.  Her place was beautiful and very comfortable. I felt very "at home" during my stay.  I was very happy that she responded quickly whenever I had any questions about the house and/or area.

Great place to stay in Brooklyn!  Real close to the subway and a few cool little coffee shops, pubs and eateries. The 24 hour Gourmet Grocery store also came in handy.  I definitely recommend this spot to a couple or a few friends who want to explore NYC.

Great location in Midtown East, easily walkable to all big tourist attractions in Manhattan. Nice spacious apartment as well with plenty of room for 3 guests. Host (Alfonso) was helpful with check-in and check-out but was hard to contact during my stay, not that it was anything urgent so that was fine for me. Will be good to have a vacuum cleaner in the apartment though, as it is an extended stay apartment and I like to keep the places I am sleeping in tidy! Overall would happily stay here again.
Good price, and location was not so bad. But house was dirty. House conditions were not good. We didn't have any microwave even. Sheets and pillows were dirty.

It's an amazing place to stay. Really near to subway, easy to connect and many bars and restaurants around. The room is just perfect, sharing the apartment with a friendly roomate and everything you need in the kitchen.

Totally recommended, alexandra cordinated all and she was there in case of anything.

I stayed 5 weeks there. The apartment is beautiful, the room is bright with 3 big windows, and the apartment is fully equipped with washer, dryer, and dishwasher !! 
The only problem was a leak and noise of the heat. But the leak was fixed and worked after that.

Guillaume and his 2 roommates were very nice, I loved staying there ! 
Thanks for everything.

Josh was out of town during my 1 month stay. His roommates greeted and helped get me settled. They were great hosts and all around cool people. I'm a Brooklynite, but have never lived in Bushwick.
If you're looking for an hip, authentic, and convenient Brooklyn experience, this spot is for you.  You can literally see the Subway platform from Josh's window. Also a couple steps away from anything you could possibly need... restaurants, juice bar, organic grocery, etc.
Great location!
Nice apartment and nice location. Joshua is very friendly.

Very stylish apartment in a great location! Gunner the dog was much fun and really made me feel as if i was at home. Aushra is was very helpful and nice. Highly Reccomened staying here as Williamsburg is a great area to live.

Dawn, Thank you so much for your help and hospitality, I was very confortable with you and Sarah. The apartment is very nice and really fully equipped. The neighborhood is very safe and it's near of the subway and all the people can help you if you need anything. Dawn, Sarah and Craig was very friendly and communicative. 
Thank you so much!!! *=)

Doug was great about keeping in touch and being available whenever we needed to talk to him or had a question. He checked in regularly to make sure everything was okay.  He was also very flexible about our check in and check out time which was a HUGE plus. The apartment is in one of my favorite neighborhoods in NYC and a great location. Roku was included so that was nice to have whenever we got home from a long day of being out all day.

The apartment was fine for my friend and I since we spent most of the time out and about and were only really home to sleep. It has a minimalist style going and really just has the essentials but given the price point, location and the fact that it was for NYE weekend made is okay with us! The apartment definitely looks different in the pictures than it does in reality. The set up is different and it is a bit more bare than the pictures appear. But again, we were there for NYE and usually out so we weren't concerned.
Amaaaaazing view! I miss it.

Booked the apartment for my parents on their CNY vacation. The space looked exactly like the photos, spacious and neat with many wonderful designed details. We enjoyed the location, surround sound entertainment system and well-equipped kit hen. Jason and his friend Melanie looked after us attentively throughout the stay. Would highly recommend this apartment!
Whitney is so nice, we got some good snacks and beverage in the house. Also, the place is near to station, just 5 minutes walk. It's a wonderful experience to stay in Whitney's house and NY.

This is a gorgeous hotel, we really enjoyed our 3 days at the Henry Norman. At the front desk, they gave us a quit and very comfortable room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I have recommend this hotel to my family and friends.
I was very welcomed, and the apartment is exactly as described. Spacious room, comfortable bed, private bathroom, and laundry available on that very floor (albeit at the cost of a few dollars).

Gorgeous apartment and neighborhood just a few blocks from the L train. 1 stop into Manhattan. I didn't get the chance to meet Dymphna.  She was on holiday in Europe.  However she was very responsive to my inquiries. If Willamsburg is the place where you want to be...this is definitely the spot where you should stsy!
Although I didn't get to meet the host, he was very helpful through the phone. Good location. Nice apartment. Nice neighborhood. Minutes away from subway. We enjoyed the stay.

Staying at Yehua's apartment was an absolute joy. Though she was out of town during our stay, her friend was very patient to wait and give us the keys and towels even though we had a problem with our flight and arrived at 9:00pm... Yehua's apartment is just as the images show, clean, organized, and has an extremely comfortable bed. The fridge kept our food super cold, and the addition of the gas stove was great when we didn't want to spend too much money on dinner's out (though it only has high gas level, no simmer or low). The neighbourhood of Park Slope was AWESOME. Very quiet at night, friendly people, great selection of supermarkets, delis, and coffee shops, and close to the subway. My boyfriend and I loved the bars around the neighbourhood, needless to say the nightlife in Park Slope was excellent and wild. Overall, staying in Yehua's place was delightful- I will 100% stay there again if I'm lucky enough to book!

I stayed at their place for about a month. Hosts were really nice that they often asked me how I'm doing. The apartment was very beautiful that I felt I want to live. It was only 3min walk to Queensboro plaza station which is just a station away from Manhattan by N/Q train.
Very flexible check in and check outs so you are not in rush...i loved it.
Nice apt in incredible location. Very convenient. Good communication - it was a snap. Thanks!!

Ayten's was great, she was super easy to communicate with, even though she was travelling and in a different time zone.  And her place was perfect, really cozy and in a great part of greenpoint.  Would definitely stay there again!
Good location. Very helpful in checking in and had her friend check in with us over the weekend to make sure everything was okay.
Had a very nice stay for a month. Quiet and comfy, and really well located

The room is great! Perfect for solo traveling and the apartment is very nice. Plenty of room to spread out, good location, and Isidora was very helpful at responding to a few maintenance requests even though she was out of town. Quiet and perfect to stay in while working a job for a few days.

Unfortunately we didn't met Frances in person, but she was available all the time, no matter what I asked she prompt to respond very quickly, the apartment it's  very nice and cozy, also have everything to cook, very relaxing and enjoyable to stay all day. This apartment won't regrets to stay, very close to 911 area, Statue of the Liberty all walking distance, very accesible subway (just in thr corner) have all kind of restaurant around and some of them are 24 hrs. Definitely will stay again if I come to NY.
very friendly host. I stayed at this place for one night and get very warm welcome from Joy. She is a very bright girl. The neighborhood is nice and convenient. The room is tidy and clean.
She is a great host; kind, responses quickly. And the location is also fine cuz it is near by train station.

Jessica was so lovely and helpful, I made an extremely last minute booking and she was very accomodating and welcoming. Jessica's house was fantastic, I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful NYC home - it is even more stunning than in the photos if you can believe it! The area is awesome, my favourite in NYC for sure. It was so easy to get to Manhattan too. I'd definitely stay here again!
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Consummate professional.
Scott place was great. It was clean and very spacious.  It was an easy check in and check out process.  I highly recommend it.

Don's place is an oasis of calm in the heart of Brooklyn. If you need to be near community life, what's hip and what's tasty, this is the place to be. Don is punctual, communicative and he manages this wonderfully private  property very well. The place is impeccably clean and with the renovations he's finishing we clearly got great value for the money.

Han's place was very nice. We had a bedroom with a private bathroom, which was REALLY nice. He was EXTREMELY nice and accommodating regarding both check in and check out time! He also provided us with travel tips and showed us how to get from place to place on the map, while making some really good suggestions for where to visit. The room was a nice size with plenty of space to accommodate me and my daughter. The location was also nice, on Roosevelt Island, just a short subway or tram ride from Manhattan, with a free bus on the island to get you to the subway or tram. We really enjoyed our stay. THANK YOU Han!
Ashley Everything ok, thank you very much
It was an amazing experience. Everyone was so welcoming and helpful from arrival to departure. loved everything about my stay. This is officially my New York home. Will stay here next visit.

The apartment is pretty small but comfy. It is placed in a really nice neighborhood full with bars, pubs and good place to eat.
Only negative point it is at 4th floor with no elevator.

The perfect location-in the heart of SoHo, around the corner from Dominique Ansel's Cronus, walking distance to great restaurants and a convenient subway. We even walked to the 9-11 Memorial. Quiet elevator building and clean and cute apartment. Everything you need for a perfect NY getaway. Would definitely stay again. Helpful and friendly hosts. An easy choice!
The apt is large and at good location! Add and her friends were very helpful. Definitely enjoyed my stay here!

The neigborhood was great! It's a bit of a walk to the nearest subway system but I didn't have a problem with it at all. 
The apartment itself is amazing
The house was pretty big (but no cat haha). Really great location with lots of food nearby. Kelly was not around but her sister was there to help us with everything we needed. Great experience!
The neighborhood, and vibe was great of the place I've stayed. The room was well lit and near the subway. Adam's girlfriend was amazing and she made sure I was comfortable at all time.

Really lovely bedroom in a nice flat in a very cool area! Description is clear and Connie was kind enough to go into more detail about the apartment. She definitely knows what she's doing and had all my possible questions answered. Very good value for money.
Connie's flatmate let me in and gave me a spare key - the whole process was very easy.
My one and only point to mention (because everything else was perfect) is that there is no curtain or blind on the bedroom window. The window faces many other windows from different apartments in the building and I ended up draping some of my clothes over it! Other than that it was great! I should also mention the bed is really comfortable! Thank you Connie (and Justin her flat mate!)

This place was super chill. Very close to the train and various corner stores. The locks were hard to open at first, but never fear! After spending a few minutes figuring out the "trick," it was smoothe sailing. Also they have a great shower head and steady warm water. Their cat is adorable and the other roommates are easygoing and pleasant. Would recommend.

Really nice host! We got new towel and fresh sheet and Ginji also provides us with fruits, snacks and all everything we would possibly use. The location is also great, many sights are in the walking distance.
Very nice apartment in the best area in NYC. Totally recommended.

I had a perfect experience staying at this beautiful west village apartment. The location could not have been better, and the large interior space was an added bonus. Comfortable bed, and very nice shower/bathroom. Thank you so much for sharing your home with me :)

Very nice room and very comfortable bed, calm and clean flat and a nice neighbourhood. Even though I did not meet Beto personally, everything went smoothly and reliable. I would love to come back any time!
Great neighborhood. Amazing space and rooftop patio. Didnt meet Nicholas, but everything was arranged easily, communication was quick, and it was an overall great experience. I recommend!
Julia's place was gorgeous, and the Bed-Stuy neighborhood was nice. Julia was really communicative and made everything super easy. I would definitely recommend this AirBnB.
Mohammed was very welcoming and helpful and ensured we had everything we needed for our stay.

Just follow David instruction carefully and you are all set to stay at the historical financial district of Wall Street! I had a great time to network in NYC and impress my friends who visited me in David's room

She was great. We lost our keys and gave to us a pair without any complain. Even though we didnt meet her in person, her roommate was really nice as well. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was pretty decent. The internet sometimes didn't work. We really enjoyed our stay.

amazing home located in a nice area. easy to go everywhere in New York. The flat was very clean and comfortable. really good bed. we had a great time there. Anthony made everything so easy. highly recommend.

Rose's place was spacious quiet lovely and very clean. My daughter and I where met with the warm greetings,  she wait up for us when our flight was delayed.  As a host she checked on us  often  and gave recommendations of places to go. I felt like the place was my own. The neighborhood was fabulous with a park down the street a lovely and clean grocery store with everything one might need and plenty of restaurants and activities right around the corner. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend my family and friends as well.

The appartment is very convenient for young travelers. Craig and his roomates are very helpful and welcoming. The appartment and the room are spacious. 
The appartment is closed to a subway station, so it is very easy to go to Manhattan and the neighborhood is lively and you can find whatever you need. 
I had a good stay in Craig's appartment.

Annie was the BEST HOSTESS EVER! The room was just as the picture showed, with plenty of space, new bedding and towels, and plenty of privacy. I met Annie on the second day, as most of the time she was at work, so it was like having the whole apartment to ourselves. Annie was SO sweet and made us feel even MORE welcome, in offering us the use of the entire space. Her words, "Make yourself at home. The couch even pulls out so you can lay down and watch T.V." The location was one block from food, stores, and the subway, which was about a 20-30 ride into Manhattan. Both my daughter and I REALLY enjoyed our stay here! THANK YOU ANNIE!

Nice, warm and comfortable apartment, 
The position is perfect: very close to the subway, it's super easy to reach the midtown. There's plenty of nice locals around.
It was very easy to talk and make arrangements with Sam, she answered promptly to every email and message.

It was first time when Ariel or any one of his roommates rented this room. The room is little small but I guess it is a good size for NYC specially at this price. His roommates were very friendly and you get complete privacy as well.
It was an okay place. It was a bit dirty, but overall it was average.

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful few night's at Madeline's place. Madeline was incredibly helpful and considerate while we were organising our trip and made the whole thing seamless. Both Madeline and her roommate were away while we stayed which suited us great as we've been to New York lots before and enjoyed the independence very much - but we had her number in case we needed anything, and her response time was super quick throughout the process. 

The apartment was great - loved the decor and it was plenty spacious for us. The bed was very comfortable and we slept really well. The living area is beautifully done up and the bathroom is really clean and well kept.

The local area is fantastic for wandering around, finding good local food spots and there are plenty of great amenities. We pretty much spent our time there just strolling on foot, but the nearby subway station is also very convenient for getting around and makes getting Manhattan really easy too. 

We loved our trip and would definitely stay with Madeline again!
The place was perfect. Madonna was accommodating and very nice.
We did not meet directly but the roomates are kinds. The apartment is very well placed and has all the necessary. I recommend!!

Great location for park & natural history museum lovers! Walkable distance to midtown too across the central park.(if you don't mind to walk more than 20 mins) Room is quite spacious and minimal, but I loved Maeve's sense of interiors with lots of plants. Also it was very bright in the daytime. There were many good restaurants around. I love to stay again if the room is available when I visit to New York next time.

Steph and her place are the bomb. Her apartment in Brooklyn is super lovely. It's tidy, clean and welcoming. She has everything you'll need. It was summer in New York so Steph even left me suncreen (I allways forget to put any on) and aloe vera gel just in case a got burnt (which I did).
Her place is close to subways stations 5mins to the G and 10mins to the C (might be the other way around, I don't remember!). The area has everything you need close to the apartment with grocery shops 10min walk away in pretty much any direction, it's New York. Ubers are always super easy to get in the area also.
Had the best summer in New York and can't wait to get back!
Thanks Steph, hope you're well xx
Rachel was great! Communication was great. She left of Brooklyn for us that was very helpful! The apartment was clean and easy to find whatever we needed.
Amy is good as a host.
Great hostess! Very accommodating an flexible to some last minute needs.

We had a wonderful comfortable stay at Omar's place. Looks exactly as pictured and the kitchen was well equipped. The bed was very comfortable. There was really good communication and I felt at home. We enjoyed the benefit of streaming movies as well! It was convenient and close to shopping and stores.
The staff at the complex were incredibly attentive and helpful and all our needs were met with a smile.
Good experience in NYC. It was a clean apartment, and the household was very hospitable. We felt very cozy to stay here for a few days.

All in all we had a really nice stay at Mary's, who was a friendly and open host! We enjoyed the area a lot, especially since it is very close to the beautiful Prospect Park and to lively 7th Avenue. The apartment itself was fine nevertheless we did find it a little bit dusty/dirty in all of the rooms including the bathroom. It is definitely a place for cat lovers! Check in and communication were easy and without any problems thanks to Mary's flexibility.

My stay at Georgi's place has been amazing. The apartment is very cozy, gets a lot of natural night and is warm even if heating is not running. It's furnished with everything you may need for your stay. Wifi internet works well and is fast. It's very quiet both daytime and nighttime. 

The apartment is located in possibly the very center of the nicest area of Astoria, just 5 minutes away of subway, Broadway ave and Steinway street with all the restaurants and shops the area is well known of.  There is a well furnished Keyfood grocery store just one block away, pharmacies, diners, bodega, plus all the usual brand restaurants commonly found in NYC.

People from Europe will be especially interested in knowing that just one block away you have 3 real family run bakeries where you can buy day fresh bread and pastries.

All in all 5 stars. Wish it was my apartment when I was living in NYC :)
