5 Star! Love everything about her room + apt. I wish Isabella airbnb'd her place regularly but that would mean she would have to give up her lovely room. Isabella's room is sooo cozy + she has a full internet cable tv. Roommates were great.

My stay at Chelle place was just amazing ! This was my first time and it went very well. Chelle was vet nice and courteous , she was helping me in finding address  when initially I had some troubles locating it.  I am highly  recommend to stay at her place at any time if she is decides to rent it out.  Good luck and enjoy your stay!

We had such a pleasant stay at Pipa's. Home is cozy and organized. She is also a great host! Tips from transportation, restaurants and visits were given to us. Subway transportation is 4-6 blocks away, but there is plenty of buses around. We'd certainly stay there again.

My friends and I had a lovely stay at K's. The apartment was quite spacious, very clean and new. The four of us had plenty of room to hang, get ready, etc. If you are going to be in east village this is the place to be. We were steps away from theater 80, Mamoun's, PDT, etc. The location is great! K is very accommodating and responsive and has great suggestions as well. We enjoyed ourselves very much!!

I had a better experience than I ever could have hoped for staying at Steven's place. The room is huge, the kitchen is fully equipped, the location is prime Bushwick, and the roommates are super kind and fun. Steven went out of his way to provide me with coffee shop and restaurant recommendations, put me in touch with a few people in case I needed anything (I'm from out of town), and made sure I was completely set up, all when he had a plane to catch just a few hours after I arrived. Just unbelievably great. If you need to stay in Brooklyn, this is the place to do it.
Very friendly and very welcoming. He communicated clearly with us and told us everything we needed to. Had a wonderful weekend in Rob's apartment and I would do it again!
Even thou Vincent was away for the duration of time I stayed 5 stars all the way comfortable quiet and anything that was needed his roommates made sure they helped thank you so much

I subletted her room for a month, and it was a great place to stay. Well connected and quiet enough. The room is big and private. The shared space is big, two livingrooms, two kitchens, never had to wait to cook or something like that. People are really nice and they give you privacy if you need it or they hang out if you feel so. Always respectful and always asking when they have a visit.

Lisa was traveling but she was always available for any questions.

Really good place to stay overall.
Just stay for one night at Johny s pace but he was very nice and helpful and the area was perfect, the best location in Williamsburg

This is the apartment Samuel Beckett would have had as a college student, if he'd lived in NY. Seriously. The books in this place are so perfectly curated, I purchased a few used copies at a book stall myself before I left NY. 

Mark and his apartment-mate Josh were great. Very sweet, respectful, easy to contact. Place is a cozy oasis nestled within the hustle bustle of China Town. Perched right in the top floors of a Buddhist temple. 

Know there are 3 flights of stairs (no elevator), and after dark it can get a little "interesting" by the outside door. If you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs and you'll be just fine. Super close to subway, etc. Lyft and cabs were available in a flash. Bed + bedding are super comfy, slept like a baby, felt very safe as a solo female traveler. :)

Luigi's place was great! Perfectly clean, neat and inviting. The apartment is gorgeous and on an awesome street. So many bars, restaurants, coffee, shops - great vibe all around and a really lovely walk to the train.

Check in and check out were seamless and Luigi answered my txt within 10 minutes! I would totally recommend this place to a savvy or new New Yorker - you'll love it!

Simon is very welcoming when we arrived. The listing description of the bedroom was accurate and it was AWESOME. The Masters Bedroom with the private bathroom inside. The neighborhood is very safe, you can walk alone at night. There is a lot of Deli Stores and very close to the Queens Mall, Target, Banks and Laundry Shops. We would definitely book the room again and recommend to our friends.

We had a wonderful time at Sharra's -- we stayed for several weeks with our 8 year old son. The neighborhood is fantastic -- one block to beautiful Prospect Park, great restaurants and coffee shops, and one block the the subway.  Also just a quick walk up to Park Slope. Their apartment is perfect, sunny and neat. Sharra and her family are warm and helpful. Everything we wanted.

The location is extremely convenient to the subway. Adam keeps his place neat, clean, and tidy. The laundry in the building comes in handy, as well. You can sit back and relax, while watching movies and shows on his huge television in the living room. I would highly recommend his space!
Excellent stay, nice neighborhood, convenient access to the M train and friendly roommates.  Would definitely recommend.
Really nice appartment near central park and near the metro! Really cosy and a superb patio. The host is very kind and helped us a lot to find good places to eat. Thank you very much for the stay!

Check-in was quick and easy!  Vian was very responsive and communicative throughout the process.  He provided a welcome basket that included a subway map and toiletries - which was very thoughtful and the map came in handy.  The apartment was as listed, it is a great space and we had plenty of privacy!  Street parking is available and the location is close to the subway (#1 red line) and the metro north train.  The neighborhood is clean and there are several parks along with the beautiful Manhattan College campus nearby.  There are several food places on the block and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

A couple things to note for interested travelers: The BR has an A/C unit which was a plus to help filter/block some of the street noise below from the restaurant patrons and workers.  The cool setting seemed to work best for regulating the temp.  The bed was quite firm (just an fyi).

Overall great stay!

Julio's place was an extremely convenient place to stay. It was right outside of Manhattan in a great area. Julio was very accommodating. I would definitely recommend to others and hope to go back to NY soon.
The wireless was lightening quick and the fuzzy pillows were definitely a next level indulgence. The place was neat and Nia was an outstanding host, making this booking a lovely experience
it was amazing.

We were completely happy with our stay at Mike's place. Location is very good, cute neighbourhood close to the metro. The apartment is clean, well furnished and everything works.
Although we did not get to meet Mike, e was extremely kind and solicitous in our email interactions.

This place has great potential if only some minor tweaks are made, with the most important one being the broken mattress which needs replacement. 
The area isn't bad, but neither good. We didn't feel comfortable walking after sunset. Perfectly fine during the day though. 
The apartment itself is spacious and well equipped. 

The hosts are friendly, flexible, and did their best to meet our needs given the circumstances. 
No doubt they will improve on the points we've discussed publicly and privately. 

Overall, once the mattress is replaced this apartment will be great value for money.

Ohad and his wife were great hosts (with great taste). Getting in was super easy and the directions were excellent. (Communication was great before and during). The place looked great and there was a bottle of wine and a welcome note when we arrived. They had good coffee with excellent instructions to make it. The apartment is in a great location with easy access to the subway. The neighborhood is pretty quiet. The backyard looked inviting but we didn't use because we stayed inside with the air conditioning. We would definitely stay at their home again-- we had a great time.

Emily & co. were the best! They were/are super-friendly, super-chill, and super-generous. The bedroom I stayed in is HUGE and has a COUCH. And the apartment is right off the Steinway Street R stop, which is incredibly convenient to all of the awesomeness of a) central Astoria, and b) everything else, via the subway.

Chris and Audrey are amazing hosts, and finding their place was such a relief! After a not-so great experience air-bnb experience prior to their place, I was so happy to this gem and they made sure my transition to their place was smooth. The neighborhood is great, their place is a short walk to the train, and the apartment is very welcoming and cozy. Astoria (the neighborhood) has a lot to offer, and it is just a short subway ride into Manhattan. The bedroom itself is as pictured, with a twin bed that pulls out to become a queen, and it is such a nice place to come home to after a long day. Their place is always very clean, the room has lots of space and storage, and they have a washer and dryer in unit!  All in all, I would very much recommend staying here-- Chris and Audrey are very kind, welcoming, and just great people! I'm so glad I found this place, and I know anyone who stays here will enjoy it!
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Samantha's apartment was perfect. Chelsea is a great area, and her apartment was exactly as described. Communication was excellent; check in & check out very easy.

We had a really great time in New York! Ben's flat is in a perfect location: close to Soho, the neighbourhood is very cool. We walked to many places: China town, Greenwich village, Union Square...
The flat is ok for not demanding people. It's big and has 3 big double beds very comfortable. We didn't cook at the flat because there isn't a good place to sit and eat for 6 people, but in this city you are the whole day outside so it wasn't a big problem.
Tip: the Diner at the corner in the street serves the best breakfast ever!

Great place with everything you need. Very comfortable and incredibly clean. In walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops and downtown Brooklyn. Fiona and her family were the perfect hosts - extremely considerate and welcoming. Would highly recommend!

Courtney couldn't be there but she prepare a great welcome. She gives us advice about places to go, places to eat, and about the 
neighborhood. Besides, her housemate was really nice, attentive and helpful. 
The room is really big,and you have privacy.
His housemate was really nice, attentive and helpful.
I recommend this place.

Michael is a great guy! He was very responsive to my texts and queries, which made me feel at ease even before going to New York! The location is also really good, very near cafes and restuarants, and the subway is just a short walk away!

I had no problems at all with the noise but if you are a light sleeper, the house is quite near the bridge so you will hear the trains very often. 

Michael ensured that I was able to check-in without problems, and his roommate, Anna, was very helpful and hospitable. And he also has a super lovely and adorable dog, which provided me greatness company during my trip!

Overall I had a really great stay :)

Great stay. Accurate listing, everything was exactly as advertised. 
Area was great, food and transit in every direction. Anthony was fun to be around. And the dog, Brooks was fantastic, we really bonded. While I was packing up, he was watching and you could tell he was upset that I was leaving. Tempted to take him with me.

Overall highly recommended

Daves place was fantastic! Close to everything  and super convenient. The nearest subway was super close as well. The room was really tidy and neat, plus it had all the room you could need. There were plenty of bars and cafes located right on the street below as well.
Like my own private apartment.

My parents were visiting me in the neighborhood, and they liked living here. Faizal was an efficient host and checked in with us periodically. The apartment was very conveniently located and the place stayed quite cool during an intense heat wave.  We had a wonderful time overall--great for two-three people without feeling cramped. Highly recommend this place.

The place is really good. Great location, walking distance from most of the attractions, and a subway station 3 blocks away.

Ivan was a very good host, very communicative and helped us a lot before our arrival.

We completely recommend this place

Thanks a lot, will try to come back some day to NY, amazing city.

I'm a little bit jealous that you're thinking about staying here! After my stay at this beautiful Windsor Terrace apartment, I truly feel it's my home away from home in NYC. First off, Cathy and Tim are fantastic hosts. They responded promptly to every inquiry and supplied everything we needed, including a hair dryer and an air mattress when it turned out my teenage son was too big for the second bed.

The apartment itself is exactly as pictured. Very clean and well-appointed.  The rooms are very large, especially by NYC standards.  The owner of the apartment is a yoga enthusiast who has decorated the space with eastern decorative elements that evoke calm and serenity.  I had my mat with me and had several good practices in the master bedroom!  Bed was medium soft and comfortable.  The kitchen had everything we needed to prepare our breakfasts and lunches. Gas range and stove.  There is even a formal dining table where you could easily serve eight.

The neighborhood is family-oriented and quiet.  This is not the place to stay if you want to be near the clubs and the "action."  It is the place to stay if you want to be close to town but not in it (great subway access with F and G trains), want to have quick access to a beautiful park (Prospect Park two blocks away), and have all the conveniences close at hand (great grocery and drugstore half a block away).  I had no problem parking my car on the block.  I also felt very safe even coming in late at night by myself (46 year-old female). Cathy and Tim have two dogs who only came out to meet us after we asked to see them.  Other than that, we never heard them!

This is a great home. I will definitely stay here again.

I had a really nice stay in Ariel's apartment! Her roommates were very welcoming but also  worked so everyone was quiet at night- perfect for unwinding after work and still getting a good nights sleep.  The room had everything I needed- comfortable bed, drawer space.  I had a really nice stay here!

Great place and location! We loved the views and balcony access. The apartment was clean and the room was very comfortable.

Just a short walk to the nearest underground station, and walkable to East Village. Many delicious restaurants nearby. Would definitely recommend.
The room is so comfortable and the rest of the apartment has a great atmosphere

Matt was great to communicate with and his friend who met us to pass the keys was as well. Very clean and comfortable apartment. Matt gave us plenty of space for our belongings. 
Can't beat the location!
We loved our stay. Thank you, Matt!
Critical details, such as address (!) were left out despite my request to confirm that, in particular, in advance.
Great small pad in a great location.  Big downside is no Wifi.  Other than that apartment is clean and host is great to deal with.
Cute and small apartment. Has everything you need. Subway is close by.
Victoria was very friendly host.  Excellent communication, and the apartment is very nice as described.
Great experience

Gabrielle welcomed us with open arms and she was a great host. She took care of us during our stay. We were so amazed of the art work that was displayed in the room, and we felt comfortable to spend the night with Gabrielle. The room definitely gave us a lot of privacy. If the place is available I would highly recommend you to stay with Gabrielle!

Matt was a great host, his space provided us with everything that we needed in order to enjoy our stay in Crown Heights. The listing was accurate and we enjoyed the neighborhood and the amenities that came with Matt's place. Would definitely stay there again.
The host canceled this reservation 41 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 21 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We very much enjoyed staying at Stephen's place. The apartment was just as described, and the neighborhood was quiet and lovely. The 2-minute walk to the subway was extremely convenient, as was the 2-block walk to the park. Highly recommended.
It was an incredibly convenient location and the host was super accommodating. Had a wonderful time :)

Matt was a great host. He was very accommodating to my needs and great in communication. The description was very honest and I received exactly what I expected. Would do business with Matt in the future.

Austin was so wonderful! His space was incredibly clean and it was pretty accurate to the listing. He showed me into the apartment and via telephone, he was accessible throughout the course of my stay. I asked him for suggestions of things to do in the area and he provided me with a list of his personal favorite restaurants and bars. I really appreciated this personalized touch! I was especially pleased that the laundry machine system was INSIDE the actual apartment...and for free at that! After some extensive traveling, this was so nice to use. A fully stocked/clean kitchen came in handy for storing my left over meals from a nearby restaurant and making a quick breakfast in the morning. I'd definitely check out Austin if you are coming to the area. You won't be dissatisfied!
Very good apartment for New York standards. Good space, good price, very clean and in amazing location. Also, Josiah was very helpful and responsive.
host was goood welcoming,

This was such a great trip . Cristina's home is quite welcoming. It has a calm serene feeling. Zen almost . very clean the neighborhood and building were relatively quiet, but the Harlem community is always bursting with energy.  Cristina connected with me a few days before arrival. Her communication was warm and she checked in with me on the day I arrived .  very helpful in letting me know places available in the area. 

The master bedroom would be enough for two adults to sleep in.  The. Two other beds were twins were decorated for two young girls.  The room is cozy.the listing is verrryyy appropriate for a family .  its super cozy . I was really quite comfortable. The next time I'm in the city, this will be the first place to check and see if it is available.  Thank you so much!

What an AMAZING HOST!!! This was my first time using Air BNB and needed a place ASAP. Our host was VERY detailed, informative and quick to reply to any questions. All the details where laid out in and email to the "T". Very nice views from the apartment, Quite and peaceful, place to stay. And the Desk Crew was absolutely PHENOMENAL!!!! They where so helpful and pleasant to deal with when asking ANY Questions. All in All, this has to be one of the BEST places to stay in NYC. Where where treated like celebrities at a 5 STAR hotel . We will definitely be coming back to this host if available on our next trip to NYC.

This was my second stop in NYC and much like my first stop, it did not disappoint.  
Coming from AK I wasnt use to the subway systems and I boarded the express instead of the local.  That being said, Zach was kind enough to stay a little later than what we had planned.
He is a nice guy, well mannered and his place is awesome.  
I have nothing negative to say, it was a great experience and I would request using this space again because it's right where a lot of things are happening and it doesn't take very long to get anywhere.
Thanks for everything, Zach!  I hope our paths cross again soon.

Rachel's apartment is in one of my favourite areas of Brooklyn. Location is very convenient, as it is very close to the Brooklyn Museum, Public Library, Prospect Park, and two metro stops if you need to get anywhere else. There are lots of grocery and restaurant options in the area so you can pick and choose how you want to eat.

I loved the apartment itself, it is small without being cramped. There is lots of natural light through the large windows, and the radiator kept everything nice and warm. I had no problems with using the appliances in the kitchen or bathroom. Just a heads up if you are used to a very quiet house, there is some noise that comes through from the hallway and street, but it's nothing out of the ordinary for a big city.

Rachel was very friendly and easy to coordinate checking in and out via text and email. Unfortunately I had to cut my trip short and leave early, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if I had the opportunity again!
Great place, the location is amazing, near a lot of transportation and the Central Park. Felix is nice, he recommended me some places to visit and ways to commute. 100% recommended
I would like to thank you . The apartment it is beautiful and we anjoing very much to be there. I'll recomendent.  Thank you

This was my first AirBnB experience and it couldn't have been better. Allison was a terrific host who made me feel right at home from the start. I told her it was like visiting with an old college friend. The room is spacious, clean and surprisingly quiet considering it is on a busy street in Bushwick. There is access to a washer and dryer in the apt which is a nice perk. You also have your own private entrance which makes it feel like your own place. The subway to Manhattan is conveniently located nearby (about a two minute). There are numerous little bars and restaurants in the area. My favorite was OMG Pizza which has everything from breakfast to dinner and the pizza is pretty tasty.

The house is located on 5th floor and very big windows with nice view. It was my business trip, so with a lot of suitcases going up and down with no elevator wasn't very good idea, but perfect for people who are light pack travelers. the neighbor hood is very nice and convenient t to get around the city. Overally the house was clean and very nice but the kitchen was not very useable and not really clean compare to the other areas.

Everything was great. The place was clean, the neighborhood was close to Times Square, restaurants, and bars, and Nate was very accommodating. Very good stay. The place was exactly like the pictures and we had no complaints. Would recommend to a friend.
Very nice apartment!

Its is quiet and secure appartment in the Upper East, with a nice view 
The bed is in the wall, which give you a small place. The separation between the bedroom and the dining/living room is just  a sliding door with glass, so you can see both sleeping room and living room, which does'nt give you much privacy (as already discussed personally with Alan during my stay)

Magdalena wasn't in NY when whe stayed there but she was very helpful to provide what we needed. Her roomates where also friendly. The place is very convenient at only 3 blocks from the L subway (20mins to manhattan). Recommanded.

Theresa was a most wonderful and gracious host. Her apartment was amazing, quiet, immaculately clean, and extremely well furnished for my stay. There is literally nothing more I could have asked for that wasn't already provided to me by Theresa. She was always available for questions and concerns and never hesitated to make my stay as comfortable as possible. 

The neighborhood is perfect for almost any needs as a guest. The trains are close by and while the neighborhood provides many options for excursions and adventures, it is quiet and peaceful at all times. 

I can't possibly overstate how perfect my stay was on all fronts, and comes with my highest recommendation for any guests interested in a lovely, quiet stay with easy access to Manhattan as well as all the many, many lovely possibilities in surrounding Brooklyn.

The place is really nice and surprisingly spacious when you get inside, also the train station is an under 5 minute walk and gets you into manhattan via the L in no time. I would recommend this location to anyone and would visit again.
I may be biased, but Maya's place is a gem, as is Maya. My go-to spot in NY.

Eugenia is very lovely and a great person to stay with! Her place is in a very convenient area of Williamsburg that's super close to multiple subway stops and a very easy ride into the city. Plus, there are plenty of great restaurants, stores, and more within walking distance. She's easy to communicate with and helped make my stay comfortable. I highly recommend Eugenia and her place.

Hadley's place was perfect.  The apartment is decorated with such personality and charm, with heaps of little details that make the place very special.  Everything just as described or I could have wanted.  The neighborhood is fantastic, anything you could need is a stone's throw.  Neighbors are all warm and welcoming.  Hadley was easy to communicate with and made picking up keys smooth.  Highly recommended.
Comfortable room in a conveniently like cared part of Brooklyn in between super charming Park Slope and Cobble Hill. There's a great bbq place right down the block!

I was lucky enough to be Geraldine's first Airbnb guest in this apartment, and I am so happy I got the opportunity to stay here. It has a great location, just off Bedford Avenue which is the main drag in Williamsburg. No noise, and a block away from the subway that takes you to Manhattan in one stop. Spacious room, comfortable bed and nice and clean bathroom. Great communication with Geraldine before, during and after!

Paula's apartment is very nice and cosy, we found everything we needed for a convenient living there, and the building itself and location are just perfect! The apartment was very clean, and Paula stayed in touch with us. I had a great experience of living on Upper West Side in this apartment and would highly recommend it!
Very lovely hosts! Nice and clean place also.. I would definitely recommend !

Allison mi pronajala svuj pokoj, protoze odcestovala do Evropy, takze v byte jsem byla s jejimi dalsimi tremi spolubydlicimi, kteri byli velmi pratelsti a napomocni. Cely byt je skutecne prostorny, hlavne obyvaci pokoj-kuchyne. Idealni, pokud si chcete sami varit, protoze je skvele vybavena. V byte jsou dve koupelny, takze se po ranu nestane, ze byste museli stat ve fronte na sprchu. Citila jsem se tu skutecne skvele, diky krasnemu prostoru i moc milym spolubydlicim.
The description was accurate and the host very welcoming and accommodating. Really quiet space, comfy bed and in a trendy neighbourhood. Would highly recommend staying here!

Adam was a great host - all the information he provided was accurate and the place was great.

He was also extremely accommodating once I got settled in - checking in to see if everything was okay, asking if I needed anything, etc.

Great experience
It's a lovely and tidy flat. Me and my boyfriend had a very wonderful experience in there. It's very convenient to go to SOHO and Chinatown.

Emily was a fantastic host.  Her apartment is perfectly located in South Williamsburg, right in the middle of things without being overwhelming or too crowded.  The place was clean, the bed comfortable, and the balconies are great to watch the world go by.

Ashley reached out to me a few times prior to my trip to finalize logistics, which was greatly appreciated.  She was very flexible about arrival time, and arranged for me to pick-up the keys near the apartment upon my arrival.  Everything went very smoothly.  The room and apartment were exactly as described in the listing and shown in the photos.  The room was bright and quite spacious, and there was a chest of drawers available for our clothes, as well as a table/chairs and comfy sitting chair.  The bathroom was small but definitely sufficient and very clean.  It was so nice to have a private bathroom during our stay!  All necessities were provided (towels, soap, shampoo, etc).  The bed was very comfortable, and it was amazing how quiet the apartment was given its location.  This location truly is in the heart of Williamsburg ---- there are tons of great shops, restaurants, breweries, and also music venues just steps from the front door.  The apartment is also very close to the L train, and only 1 stop from Manhattan.  We hope to return on our next trip to Brooklyn!

Calvin and his roommates (particularly Harry) were incredibly inviting and warm. I felt very comfortable and almost felt that I was one of their roommates!

Awesome place for exploring HK and other places.
Clean bedding & towels, flexible checkin/out!

The place was clean but very lived in. It honestly felt like you were intruding on someone life without their knowledge. There was even clothes hung on the door, tampons under the sink, Chargers still plugged in the wall. I stay here with my two year old and I literally spend the whole time in the place trying to keep her out of the hosts things. The closets didn't have doors...just curtains and there were baskets and boxes with stuff in it everywhere. So I would not recommend this for someone with a kid. Besides that it was nice to be able to bring the dog. The location was perfect with a grocery store and Duane Reade less than a block away. It also is NOT a two bedroom. The second bedroom is an open area between the living room and bedroom. I almost had my brother stay with me and I am glad I didn't or he wouldn't have had any privacy. It was good for the cost and to be able to have the dog.

Although Liz was away throughout my stay, she left me a plethora of helpful advice. The room itself was incredibly spacious (even more than the pictures) and the apartment was only 40 minutes away from Lower Manhattan, where my internship was. The neighborhood was safe, quiet, and somewhat lively, with a few bars and restaurants. Overall, Liz was a fantastic host, her roommates were very accommodating and nice people, and I would recommend this listing to anyone looking to stay in New York.

Alessandro's apt is not far from subway only 5mins walk.. There are everything i need in his apt and also He is very good host.. Quick response to my message. Francesso is also nice:) I had a good time in Nyc. I wish to come back to NYC again.. Ciao Ti a mo Flamingo
Fantastic! Very clean and nice!

Perfect apartment, perfect location and perfect host. 

100% recomendable

From the initial communication every things was top notch.  This is a beautiful apartment with tons of amenities.  The location is perfect.  Right across fro the Empire State Building.  Just a few clocks from Time Square.

What a wonderful place and lovely hosts. One more time, I had a really good time in this loft. It' a perfect place to visit NYC. The place is really clean and we had good tips from Liz and Chian. Do not hesitate. You have to stay here ;)
Lisa was an amazing host and provided everything that I needed for my 10-week stay. She made herself readily available and acknowledged all of my requests that I needed.

Staying at Elena's apartment was absolutely wonderful! I was there with 2 friends for a couple of weeks and it was a great base to explore NYC. The key exchange was easy and Elena communicated with us very efficiently from the moment we booked to the moment we arrived. The apartment is in Washington Heights, in a safe neighborhood with grocery/convenience stores very near. It is incredibly spacious compared to what I've seen elsewhere in NYC, and feels very warm and homey. The A/C subway is right downstairs from the building, and then it's a 30-40 minute subway ride needed to get downtown. This might seem lengthy to some, but to me, the size and quality of the apartment made it definitely worth it. Great for people who want to be able to relax at home and cook a meal like real NYC and enjoy a good night's sleep as well as hop around the city.

Paul met us at the door and made us feel very welcome.  The room was just as described, bright, spacious and sunny with a queen bed with lots of pillows and a new duvet.  Paul filled us in on all the best restaurants, coffee shops and stores in the neighborhood, and the nearest subway station, just a short one block to the G train. Anything you might need is within walking distance.
    The apartment is in the middle of a very peaceful street. We were surprised by the quiet. No noise all night and only birds in the morning.  The location is just 3 blocks from the East River with a beautiful and iconic view of the NYC skyline and  easy access to the East River Ferry/water taxi to Manhattan.  Great neighborhood!
   Our host was most accommodating, available to answer any questions and help meet our needs. (even an off hand comment about a night light was immediately addressed)  

We would definitely return. This was such a convenient, clean and comfortable place to rest our heads. Calm and spare in a chaotic city.

Staying with Brandi and her family in New York was a wonderful experience! They were courteous, friendly, and always helpful. I had my privacy and felt welcome to use the amenities in the apartment. I loved the neighbourhood and would highly recommend others to enjoy their stay with this splendid family.
Allie's place was great... My buddy and I are working in NYC so we needed a place quick and close and his place knocked it out of the park... Thanks again Allie!!!

Andrea has a lovely little 1 bedroom in Astoria, very close to the amenities on a commercial strip on Broadway. The place is clean, comfortable and has a great view. I would recommend this airbnb and Andrea as a host.
Super welcoming hosts - Eda and Anthony went out of their way to make me feel at home during my stay. Plus its a great location right next to the 1 train
simple basic flat with 2 decent beds in a nice area. the place is pretty basic but as we were barely in it did the job!

Sandro's listing is a beautiful studio on one of the most vibrant, popular streets in Chinatown. Across the street are some of the best restaurants and coffee shops in New York (An Choi -- best pho) and blocks away are some of the cheapest, freshest grocery stores (Essex St. Market.) All accommodations were in order, including an incredible industrial-grade kitchen; the studio also features sky-high ceilings and a kick-ass record player. As a long-time New Yorker, I couldn't believe how nice AND well-located this flat was! Sandro greeted us at the door and went out of his way to make accommodations for our departure. All in all, a wonderful, stress-free experience in one of the most livable neighborhoods in Manhattan.
Genevieve's place was great. Such a great Brooklyn Gem. I would certainly recommend to others.
Clara and Luigi were extremely friendly, welcoming, and helpful. The room, closet, and overall apartment are very spacious, and the bed was comfortable. The room is really bare, however.

Sarah was a great host. She was easy to get in touch with and she provided us with excellent details about the neighborhood that were very helpful getting around.  Sarah was out of the country when we arrived, but her friend was able to meet us with keys.  He was very nice, and even offered to help us carry our bags up the stairs (only 2 flights) which was a great! The apartment is just as advertised and provided lots of space. We happened to be there during very hot days but the large fan and small air conditioner provided adequate amount of coolness the times we were inside. We also enjoyed the wifi and appleTV. The area and apt felt very safe. It was very easy to access local transportation (2 min walk to bus and 8 min walk to train). It is a quite neighborhood with a few little markets and cafe/restaurants.  It is a quick train train ride to more nightlife activities. We left an item in the apt, and Sarah was kind enough to mail it to us very quickly. I would stay here again if/when I return to NY.
The place was super cozy and in a great location. My whole stay was fantastic.

Kelly was great with communication for arrival and departure, and gave us several suggestions of places in the neighborhood. We went to her favorite 4 and 20 Blackbirds twice for breakfast, best pie I have ever had! We were also lucky enough to stay with her two kitties Lilly and Smokey, vacation cats! The apartment has been renovated with interesting historic details and was certainly charming. Thanks again, Kelly!
All great
Excellent location to explore Williamsburg village and Brooklyn in general. Coordination with Erin was easy and the place as amazing as expected.

Alicia was very helpful and friendly. The studio was exactly as described - spacious, comfortable, and sunny. There's plenty of good food within walking distance and only a ten minute walk to the subway station.

We loved our stay at Meg's place. The house is immaculate beautifully renovated with all comforts and conveniences, and Meg was thoughtful and generous in presenting the house. It is in a lovely neighbourhood, our kids particularly enjoyed playing at the local school, and walking distance to shops, subway and Brooklyn pier park. We could not have asked for a better haven in New York in the hot July.

My friend and I spent a great time at sohit penthouse. The place was clean and tidy. It's super convenient for visitors who want to explore the city.The host responds extremely fast, really appreciate that. The view is also amazing.

We had a fantastic experience in Brooklyn with Dominique as our host. She was very hospitable and friendly. I felt right at home! If I go to Brooklyn again in the near future I would definitely stay here again.

Latrisha's place was absolutely amazing and beyond my expectations. Communication was speedy and very helpful! The apartment was a lot more spacious than what we expected. It was a 10 minute walk from the 1 train 145 St Station and we were able to get into midtown Manhattan in around 20 minutes. The apartment is right across from Riverside Park! There was an ample amount of sleeping space, she even had an impressive array of teas at our disposal. Lastly, she was very understanding with timing and other hiccups. If you are looking for a place to stay in New York for a good value, I would pick this place!

Our friends from out of town we're coming in for NYE and stayed at Tara's place. They had a very comfortable stay. The location was very close to where we needed to be. I had no issues obtaining the key and communication with Tara was great. She was very accommodating. I'd recommend Tara's place in the future.

He needs to be responsive, and ensure that before he confirms a reservation, the apartment needs to be available. That's was not the case. He contacted me once I already arrived to the apartment and told me that it was not available. Not only that, but it's been a week and I'm still trying to get a refund from him.

What a perfect place in a perfect location. The place is quaint and very comfortable. Plus they have a killer record collection! Simple comforts and great restaurants, bars and coffee shops all a block away.

Swan was very quick to reply and easy to communicate with.  Her apartment was in a great location in the heart of financial district, and was walking distance to excellent restaurants,  cafes, shopping, and train stations.  It was very spacious and clean.  Excellent heating system and wifi.  I had a great time in new york thanks to Swan!
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Juan is a very sweet host who goes out of his way to make his guests comfortable!  The room is tiny but comfortable and the apartment is neat!  Juans family was generous and  kind, offering us pancakes as we got home from a long day in the city.   This apartment isn't for someone without city experience as it is located in Harlem. Free parking was a perk and the subway station is super close. What a great experience
Good location. Clean place and no nonsense. The massive flat screen in the room as well as the living room certainly didn't hurt. Jeremy was responsive and straight forward. Will stay again.

I had a great stay at Marissa's apartment! The location was fantasic, only a 10 minute walk to time's square. The room was very comfortable and matched the description.  I had to book this on somewhat short notice and Marissa was very helpful in answering questions and working with me. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking to explore Hell's Kitchen or NYC in general!
John was great his place was amazing in the East Village with a private patio which in the city is unheard of. We love the location on St marks.

They are a great host, they are kind and friendly. In the place everything was clean, quiet and the bed too cozy. Excellent place and great location, Central Park is close, safety and you can find many options to eat really close , the place is between Broadway and Amsterdam avenue. I was traveling with my son and he loved the place the same as me. 
I recommend take the opportunity to meet them and stay there.

The room William had for us was really comfy. It was clean, big and with ventilation. There were no windows, but we only stayed there during the night, so we liked the quietness :) The house itself was also clean and the two housemates were very kind. It was also nice to have breakfast in the garden. The location it close to different subway stations, many cornershops, laundymats and coffee bars. We really enjoyed the stay and nice neighborhood!
Jessie was fantastic, house was exactly as advertised--clean, well lit, very inviting.  Great location and lots of fun!  Host was very responsive to questions, would absolutely stay here again.

The studio apartment is perfect if you wanna be independent and have your own little island in Brooklyn. The bed is very comfortable! And we were very glad to have our own kitchen. The neighborhood is nice, it was no problem to walk home even late at night.

Lisa's house was beautiful and in an incredible location. The room was comfortable and immaculate. Lisa was a very relaxed and gracious host with lots of useful local knowledge.  I recommend her highly.

Even though we did not meet Young. His place was amazing. Very spacious and clean. More than we could've ask for. There was a gift basket waiting for us when we arrived. With snacks, magazines, and maps of NYC to help you find your way around town. With many restaurants, bars, stores, and attraction near by. Alot within walking distance.  Katz Deli only a couple of blocks away. Also found a great bagel and lox close by also.  His place was very comfortable and homey for us. Subway was about a 10 minute walk, but didn't seem that far to me. Parking garages were all around. Again within walking distance. When we come back next year, we'll be looking for Youngs place again.

Kaitlin is THE BEST host I ever had on Airbnb, and I've been to something like ten other places before hers.

The place itself is really clean, comfortable, pleasant, well located in a great neighbourhood, in short, all what you need for really recharging your batteries after a day of work or a day exploring the city. And Kaitlin is SO nice she tops all of that.

She was so attentive and accessible I felt spoiled hahaha. From writing me instructions about where to find coffee and how to use the French press when she noticed I'd only wake up after she was gone, to leaving an umbrella at my door when she noticed it would rain, I couldn't have felt more like I was at a friend's home who really cared about how I was doing. 

Kaitlin's place should get all the positive reviews I can possibly give, and I'll definitely look forward to stay there again if it's available on the next time I'm in town.
Great apartment and location

Kay was a fantastic host! She was quick to respond when I booked her place and had a very friendly personality. Kay was happy to answer any questions I had and continually made sure that I felt comfortable and had everything I needed. It was my first time in New York so she helped suggest places to go and things to see which was super helpful. The room was super clean and the home itself felt very homey. The location of this place is right in the heart of the new and upcoming city of Williamsburg. It was a great location, not far from the L train. I would definitely stay here again.

Tanya was super nice, very accommodating, and her place was spotless. The apartment was beautifully decorated, and I really enjoyed my time there - she even sent a great list of recommendations of things to do in the area! Overall 5 star review

Stefano & Sylvia offered peace and quiet throughout my stay. The place was very clean and livable. They shared their homemade desserts and backyard herbs & greens! 

The place is very close to the E,M,R,W,N trains and very safe at night. It's about a 20 minute commute to midtown manhattan.

Katherine was wonderful! She wasn't even in the country at the time of my inquiry and she responded and pre-approved me within an hour. She was very quick about it and allowed me to show up within 30 minutes after booking. There were already clean towels out for me and folded clean bedding as well. Her roommate greeted me and gave me the keys. They were all very understanding and hospitable. I cancelled my previous booking due to safety concerns. I'm a 24 year old female and I was travelling alone. I fekt completely safe walking to and from the subway at Katherine's. It's a block away from some express trains, 2 blocks away from Sugar Hill Cafe (great atmosphere and tasty coffee), and on the same block as a pharmacy/grocery store. It is in a very safe, convenient location. Also, the view from her room is beautiful and the bed was pretty comfty. Katherine's place was perfect for my stay. I'm so thankful I found it on such a short notice, but I wish I would've found it sooner so i could have stayed my entire trip there.

Enjoyed our stay in this comfortable home. The listing was very accurate, and we found everything to be very clean. Host was very helpful and all amenities provided. Very quiet and private neighborhood, I would return

I had an icreadible stay with Sushanti! She was very kind and welcoming. The room was very big and located 3 min from the train to Manhattan. I would definitely come back and stay at Sushanti's place again!!!

Andrew was the perfect host, he was very considerate throughout my stay, organised and communication was excellent. His apartment is beautiful and spacious, the room itself is huge for nyc standards! The apartment is located in a very cool, low-key and convenient part of Bedstuy that has everything you need - cafes, bars, plenty of corner stores. It is also right between two subway lines which made it super convenient to get into manhattan or for exploring other parts of brooklyn. I would recommend Andrew's place to friends and family in a heartbeat.

I was visiting for my birthday, the process of Airbnb was easy. When my choice to stay with SaeHo, this is what a traveler experience should be!
Perfection to the nine, hope to stay here again with more in my party

Molly was super nice and helpful. She guided me to some great places to go around Bushwick. The room was clean and the bed was big and comfortable. She and her roommates were nice and trustworthy. The place is really close to a lot of local stores and also the trains. Only complaint is that there isn't a lock on the door and it doesn't close all the way.

We had 6 nights here. Shawn was so nice because our flight delayed and we checked in so late and we can leave our luggages at his place although we already checked off. This place is really near subway less than 5mins. We felt safe there. But the room was too small only fit for 2luggages. And there were too many people stay there and our room had no lock so that's a bad thing we want to complain. Anyway this place is worth to pay cause it's cheap and good location.

The apartment was very good and the location and neighbourhood perfect. The place was clean, spacious and bright and the host was easy to communicate with.

I would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in New York.

The welcome was very easy as we found the key under the mat, the room was as picture it didn't say which is the 5th floor without elevator.

In the House there is the stench of fried because the roommate was eating fried food every day and not cleaned the dishes so that leaves bad odor in the House for 10 days she never cleaned the bathroom we did!

Paul was very hospitable and repeatedly wrote messages to know how was your stay.

The area is very central and good metro is about 300 meters and 10 minutes walk from Udo not square in area bars and restaurants open late.

I was welcomed by Okay. The listing description was accurate. In summary I felt like home in a way that all things I needed was just flew blocs away, and Okay was offering to help me every time. He gave me quite some tips and support, regarding New York Manhattan daily life, the best restaurants around, movie theaters, the supermarkets and so on.

A really nice place to stay i would reccomend to anyone.
The room is comfortable, spacious and furnished well, the separate bathroom is bright and clean. The shared living room and kitchen are spacious and eqiped well.

Location of the apartment is really good. There is a nice park nearby, in the area there are several nice restaurants and bars. Coffee shop, grocery store and laundry almost the next door. Citybike parking is in only 50 meters, and subway station is in 5-10 mins walk.

It was pleasure to communicate with Sasha and Brian, always open to dialog and helpful.

These was my first experience using AIRBNB. It was ABOVE EXPECTATIONS. My host was great, friendly  and nice my flight was delayed I arrive late and she gladly understood.nice room comfortable bed and everything super clean. She let me stay couples of more hours than anticipated because my flight was at night. The room is exactly as shown, Great  neighborhood , I would highly recommend these place for everyone it was worth my two weeks stay will definitely stay here again.
Preeti was super helpful and accommodating as a host. Brooklyn Heights is a beautiful and safe neighborhood. The apartment is spacious and clean but definitely note the fourth floor walkup.

My stay at Nicolas's place was perfect!  If Airbnb had an award for best hosts, these guys would totes get it.  Firstly, the apartment is even more lovely in real life than the photos! Its spacious, well appointed, and spotlessly clean!  Nicolas and his roommates are awesome, super friendly and fun and were so helpful and accommodating.  They were all very communicative and made the whole process easy & stress free.  The neighborhood is very quaint and quiet.  There are some good restaurants/bars and a bodega at the end of the block.  Its two blocks to the A/C utica ave stop, which gets you to midtown in about 30 minutes, but its not so close that you hear the train while in the apartment.  I enjoyed my stay so much that Im extending it through the end of June in his roommates room while she is in France!  Seriously can't say enough good things about these folks!

I really enjoyed my stay. The neighborhood has a lot of great places and Jessica was very kind to inquire about my comfort throughout the trip. I only wish I had time to experience more of the area with the host!
Amazing place! Well worth it.

I had a great time at Freddie's large and cool furnished  loft. The Subway to Manhattan is just  a 10-Minutes-Walk away, there is also the Bus 62 around the corner to Marcy Ave.
A kosher Supermarket is nearby, also the Urban Market of Williamsburg. I did not meet Freddie  in person but the Communication was perfect, she was  reachable whenever I needed help. Thanx.
Everything was as we expected. We had a problem with the shower, but it was solved during the day. The room was clean and the bed was very confortable. We loved Izzy, the cat!

The apartment was exactly as described and depicted - if anything, it's bigger than it looks in photos and was immaculate!  The bedroom was back off the street so was really quiet (for NYC).  This is a great place to stay especially if you want to get a sense for what it's like to live in Manhattan with the subway a short walk, great eats in every direction, and Central Park just a block away.  The host reached out to me ahead of time to make sure we had all the information we needed and was very friendly.  I would highly recommend this location and host!!

Ok i'll try to write a review. First i should say Becky's room was great. I didn't meet Becky but whenever i had questions she was easy to reach and replied quick. What else should i mention... mh ..yeah ..her roommates are awesome !! Thank you Emilika and Rebecca for some sweet drunken nights and talks . I am happy to live in the same city as guys now and  looking forward to Mac DeMarco ^^. Ahhh yeah i really need to meet Becky too.

-drew
got what I paid for.  Friendly host!

Laura was easy to work with understanding and accommodating to all of my needs for my stay. The place was Exactly how it looked in the pictures and looked even better in person. 
 I was in the perfect location walks away from Central Park, Time Square and Empire State Building.  there's a great corner store right up under the Wyndham that has excellent food and anything you may need.
 I would definitely stay at Laura's place again.... highly recommended !!!!

This was a great spot. Helped me out when my arrival times changed (and changed again). Great bars at either end of the street. Close to L. Right off the living room but feels extremely private. Ton of space and light. I was cautious of the smoke friendly room but the sheets and fabrics had no trace of smell, space is so well kempt, my allergies did not bother me once.

Very nice and comfortable (Website hidden by Airbnb) to the north of central park,so it's very convenient for you to have a walk in the park when you wake up in the morning. Just one block away from the nearest subbway station.And Evangeline is a very kindhearted host, always reply the message very quickly when I have questions.Next time when I come to New York,I will choose this room again.

Graham was positive and upbeat, and made it a point to welcome me as one of the household. The bedroom is a comfortable size, with a splash of modern art on one wall, and the bathroom is "en suite" for maximum privacy.
We had a very beautiful stay in his apartment. Andrew was always available if we had questions and he made us feel very welcome.
We stained in New York for one week. Hannah had a nice and clean room very near to the subway.
The listing is just as described. The room is very nice size and cozy. Nehprii makes guest feel very at home while offering great privacy. I love it! she is a very friendly and charming host!

Eliza is very a good host, she took care of us even if she wasn't in town during our journey. She is very helpfull !

The flat is great, as in the photos. The beds was very comfortable, the kitchen is very usefull. The flat is good located (about 7 mn by walk to the subway station and about 15-20 mn to Manhattan ). The neighborhood is really safe and there are good restaurants near to the flat

Everything was good, we really appreciate our trip, I really recommand the flat !

Thank you so much Eliza !
The room is clean and spacious, the price is average for the area, and the whole apartment was quiet and clean!
Very cool apartment in an enviable location, literally overlooking the High Line! Jon and his partner were kind and generous hosts, along with Cotton the dog of course ;-) Would very much recommend

We had a great stay at Andrew's place. The room was very clean and comfortable. Andrew was careful to make sure we were received and handed the keys at the time of our arrival.

The other 2 people living in the house (in separate rooms of course) were very kind, friendly and respectful at all times.

The bathroom and kitchen were always very clean.

A very important thing about this place is how close it is to a subway station (just across the street, the time it takes you to get there only depends in the time it takes the street light to change and let you cross), which is very convenient, and it's just one stop away from mid-town Manhattan on some of the trains.

I would recommend this place to anyone looking to have a great stay in New York City.
I had the best time staying at Allison's place - she and her roommate were awesome. Clean apartment, safe neighborhood, super easy to get to Manhattan - 10/10 would recommend.

I spent a very good time there. The location was great, near Central Park and very close to the underground station. The room was very big with everything I need it. Rem was very nice and let me a charger for my phone also. I never meet him personally cause he was on holiday, but we always kept in touch for any other questions I had. He also responded quickly and on time. I was almost alone in the flat, I just seen him housemate for a few times a few minutes and that was all. I really enjoyed the flat/room!
Shadab is a kind, friendly and helpful person. That's all I can say!

Great experience, room was nice and cozy. Didn't get to see Our host directly but she remained in contact with me whenever I needed her. Roommates are nice and keep to themselves. Me and my girlfriend had a great time during our stay.
I stayed at Jackie's place for 4 nights. evethough my english skill is bad, She is very kind kind kind!. If i have an opportunity to go to New york, I will be staying there again. Thank you Jackie!
We spent a wonderful week in NYC in Kim's appartment. Kim is very kind and responsive and the location of the appartment is great, close to Manhattan and in a lovely neighborhood.

This was a perfect solution for staying near my daughter in her small one bedroom - Donnell's place gave us proximity without being on top of each other.  The apartment is perfect!  Clean... well documented and Donnell was very responsive.  Plan to go back.....

You could not ask for a better location:  a short walk to 2 major subway lines, central park couple blocks away, Whole Foods couple blocks away, restaurants, shopping, etc.

The apartment:  spotless, spacious, open layout, wall of windows, comfortable bed, amazing roof-top views, nice shower pressure, nice full kitchen.

The host:  the best! Vida is so welcoming, warm, fun, accomodating, responsive.

I was fortunate enough to be able to book with Sandy the same day I needed a place. This reflects her eagerness to communicate well with people who stay at her place - something very important with a good host. Her place is really nice, large and comfortable, and her roommates were kind to me.

The apartment is beautifully decorated in a hip vintage style with a lot of original furniture and art pieces. The room itself was spacious and clean, with a super comfortable bed! The hosts were great!

Evan's apartment is in a great location--near lots of restaurants and shops, a few blocks from the Bedford L stop. There was bustling nightlife in the evenings, but the apartment stayed very quiet. The neighborhood felt quite safe.

Evan had good communication about my stay, how to get in, etc. He was flexible and offered to let me check out late in the evening.  He left soap and shampoo for me to use.

The description of the room is accurate. The room was small and basic (and windowless), but it was clean and had what I needed. There's a desk with plenty of power outlets, and a place to hang up clothes. The bed was firm and comfortable.

I didn't use the kitchen or living room, but they seemed modern and nice enough. I met both roommates and they were helpful and nice. The shared bathroom is also used for storage and as a boiler room, so it felt a bit cluttered, but everything (shower, hot water, etc) worked well.

We rented this room for my son who did an internship in NYC for 6 weeks. The location is very good and very close to everything (subway, shops, etc.) The room  was pleasant and was exactly how it was described. The communication with the host was timely and accurate. This was the first time we rented a space in NY and liked very much this experience.

the building is incredible, which is why I chose it. Louis said there was someone sleeping on the couch, I didn't mind. I wasn't provided with pillows or blankets and there was no toilet paper. I had to buy these boys toilet paper. I was very disgusted by the condition of the bathroom. looked like it had never been cleaned, let alone for a paying guest. and when I left my shower things in the bathroom, I went to use them the next day to discover someone had used them, and left a BAND AID on my bar of soap. I tried really hard to not get upset about the condition of the apartment, because the host and his room mates were very nice. but I cant overlook these things. not replacing the toilet paper put me over the edge. sorry Louis.

Caitlyn was an amazing host who is very knowledgable and responsible. Her love for this city really shows in her excitement to share her beautiful home, which is filled with amenities (amazing sound system, projector screen for movies, and outdoor space). The apartment is warm and cozy and is beautifully decorated. The room itself is small but has all the necessities and is very comfortable; let's face it though- if you are staying here, you should be out exploring! The apartment is right around the corner from the "1" subway and minutes from the W 4 St subway station, which is as good as it gets for getting around at all hours of the day/night.  But despite being located in the heart of the West Village, which is what many consider to be the cultural epicenter of New York City (ask any New Yorker and they will tell you to stay in West Village vs. midtown or UES/UWS), the apartment is quiet as it faces away from the main street (W 4) so you can get a restful night's sleep. I would highly recommend Caitlyn's home!

Josh was awesome. He wrote back to me quickly and was very hospitable. The private room I was in was very clean, very comfortable bed and big. Plenty of closet space and brand new hardwood floors. Great view from the windows facing the street. I could see the Freedom tower from my room. Very clean apartment and very close to everything you could need in Williamsburg including off street parking.

Great apt at the center of the city. Walking distance to Times Square and the park and close to all major subway lines. The hosts were very communicative and easy to get along with. Would definitely stay over again next time.

Asia's friend waited for us, even though we were about half an hour late, without making a big deal out of it. The neighborhood is as good as you can get in New York without being downtown. There are a couple of grocery stores nearby and the subway station is really close.

This is a fantastic room in a classic east village apartment on a quiet block in one of the greatest neighborhoods in nyc just three blocks from the L train and Thompkins Square Park.  Phil is very easy to deal with and the apartment is high value.
Jonice was a great host! Fun person with cool friends :)

I was in this apartment for a week with my daughter 10 years old. The position is perfect to visit NYC, it is close to the subway and to the columbia university. The neighborhood is safe the day and night too. The apartment is simple but very confortable, silent and bright. The kitchen is not very equipped but a microwave oven is available and many stores opened 24 hours are close to the apartment to buy all the cooked food you need. The apartment was not very clean. I didn't know Shruti but she gave me all the information for the chech-in, chech-out and for the use of the apartment. There are bed linen but no towels and no air dryer but Shruti advised on that. Surely I can suggest this apartment to who wants to visit the city without spending a lot and staying in a simple and confortable place.

Rose was extremely responsive throughout my whole trip and that's one thing I really appreciated! The place was indeed tidy, transportation was closeby, and there were many food options around. The room also smelled nice and so did the sheets and towels!

Everything was as advertised. Great location & lovely furnishings. Marty met me on my arrival and showed me everything I needed. The apartment is to the rear of the building so its a bit quieter than the street, but also means there isn't much to see, just the sides of other buildings.

The location is good - close to Central Park and some nice bars. Its a good spot for getting away from the crazy hustle and bustle of mid and downtown Manhattan. I would only recommend this place if u are passing through though or if you don't plan spending much time inside. There is no air-conditioning and no fresh air coming into the bedroom.

A house with age, splendid decors and unique location. 
If you want to enjoy Brooklyn and NYC, and want some advice from decent New Yorkers. This is the place

We had a great time in NewYork.
Apartment nice and very clean. The best location you can wish. 2 blocks from time square.
Vincent and his wife are very helpfull in giving tips and trips.
I will recommend this apartment.

This apartment was beautiful, cozy, clean and a really nice place to stay, only a few steps away from the subway and Central Park! Allison and her family made us feel very welcome and helped us a lot during our stay.
Corey was a great host. He was available to answer questions, checked in with me periodically to see if I needed anything or if there were any problems, and was a nice guy. Good host.
The host was great! Place was clean and quiet. Area is next to the bay.

My stay in NY was the most perfect, mainly thanks to her lovely room, in a spacious, comfortable and quiet appartement. The area is very pretty and multicultural, very well connected to transports (one has to take anyway, NY is so huge!!). 
I deeply want to thank Jen for this wonderful experience!!
She knows everything and everybody to do with RedHook - who needs wifi when you have Kristine?!
Charlotte was wonderful! She was so welcoming and thoughtful! She even checked in to make sure everything was going alright. I would have Charlotte as a host anytime! :)

Even though I never got a chance to meet Michael personally but I enjoyed my stay in his apartment. Communication was very clear.  The neighborhood isn't that fancy, given its a bit uptown. Its very close from 1 and A metro lines. Overall my experience was good !
The place was really nice in a spot on location. The host was helpful in whatever way she could be. The studio was clean and well maintained.
Katie's apartment was spacious and comfortable! We had a really great stay and the location is super convenient with bus stops and the subway near by.

This was a totally great place to stay-- sweet, calm and very quiet apartment, with perfect layout for 1-3 people, comfortable bed,  really nice decor, great  location, proximity subway, diverse neighborhood, Brooklyn Museum etc. Mark was totally elegantly hospitable, checked in with me, generous. I feel lucky to have been a guest  here.

Nicole is such a great host, her response is very quick and she's very responsive. Her place is very spacious and just the same as listed. Easy to access location, right by the station and there are many restaurants/bars nearby! She has a very cute cat called Lucky; he's super friendly and charming. I would definitely recommend Nicole's place.
It was a great apartment in a great area close to the trains, museum, cafes, ferry.
I liked this apartment, it's very comfy especially for business trips. Great location (right near the CP). And thanks to Marion for being a great host!

Katie was a great host and always made sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed. The room was amazing - really large with a private bathroom. The kitchen had really nice appliances and the living room was a comfortable place to relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of the city. The building itself was also great - doorpersons, elevators, and even a gym. Everyone was super friendly, and it was a great environment in a great location. I would definitely recommend this listing!

Diane was a wonderful host. She made me feel at home immediately 
Great place to stay. Private entrance and doormen were great
An over-priced room--noisy, dirty and tiny. The host even gossiped in front of our room, making it more irritating. Will never consider living here again.

Viola's place was cozy. She has many plants that brightened up the room. Her place is about a 10 minute walk from the metro, and she was very good at communication. I would definitely recommend for a not-too-long stay in NYC!

I wouldn't recommend this listing to others because the host had some unrealistic expectations for visitors. He wanted me to install a window airconditioner by myself (I didn't know how to do that), and the listing didn't suggest that in order to get AC, I would have to do an install. The listing also said there was a hot tub, and there wasn't. Most importantly, the top lock on the door was broken when I got there, and was never fixed during my one month stay. It was very dangerous. The owner tried to be nice but his expectations for guests were unrealistic and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone else.
Great place!

Mervin and Sommer were amazing hosts! They were extremely accomadating, easy to get ahold of, gave you your space if you desired but were very friendly and inviting. It was a beautiful apartment within walking distance to some delicious food, Randall's Island and Central Park. I would definitely recommend staying here! My boyfriend and I would like to stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

Fantastic. 

Execellent in all ways. An amazing month xxxxx thank you saskia !

Kim is a really good host ! She really make everything for you to be happy in her place. It's really close from the subway (1 min), but a little bit far from the downtown  (45 minutes), but there is subway 24hrs a day ! We were happy to stay there! Thank!
Diana is a very nice host, her home is clean and full of great energy.

Great room, great area. 2 minutes from the N/Q train to Manhattan, bagel shops and supermarket around the corner, Astoria Park just a 5 minute walk away. Apartment is quiet, clean and well-maintained. Wonderful!
Keith is a very friendly guy. He helped us providing good information and tips about the city. The bed is very comfortable. Thank you very much!
Wonderful  apartment with close proximity to restaurants, bars, subway, and shopping.  Great and speedy communication.  Very thoughtful hosts.

Rene welcomed me and walked me through everything I needed to know.
I spent a week in Rene's apartment and had a very pleasant and comfortable stay.
The apartment was clean and cozy. The location was perfect and close to central park.
I definitely highly recommend his apartment.
Great Host. I wish him all the best.

I enjoyed my stay at Arthur's place. Arthur was travelling during my stay but I met him when he returned. He is a really nice guy as well as his roommate Vish. They are both friendly, uncomplicated and hospitable and were very understanding when I issues arised with my schedule at the end of my stay.

The apartment is spacious, modern and clean. The room is a nice size with a comfortable bed, desk, a portable wardrobe and three windows overlooking Fort Hamilton Parkway.

The D train is only 2 blocks away. There are some grocery stores and delis close by.

The apartment is close to a hospital so there are ambulances driving by that can get noisy sometimes.
Gina was warm, welcoming and accommodating. Her place is perfect for a short stay in NYC.

I was looking for an apartment 15-20 mins from the city by the subway. Krishan's place is what I needed. Krishan was not home (he has a roommate on the first floor, who was rarely at home). He has arranged all kind of amenities. I had my privacy for my (Email hidden by Airbnb) ing home late was not a problem. Staying all day at home was also great. And also it was nice to have the backyard where I spent some time working. Will come back in the summer for a longer time.

The listing was exactly as described.  It was really easy to find, very close to the subway.  Any time we had a question Andrea answered messages quickly. Her roommates were really helpful giving us ideas of places to eat and visit.  We would definitely stay again.

Iris and her husband Rafi were great host.  They welcomed us and responses very quickly all the time we need their helps.

The place is gorgeous magnificent loft and very clean.  Also the Sonos music system, IoT a.c, Netflix and all of the automated system made our stay very easy and comfortable.  The kitchen is spacy and prepared with anything you need to cook.

Their place is surrounded by awesome neighborhood in Williamsburg, so you can access to any good restaurants by walk.

I love this place and definitely want to come back again!!

Fotini was a great host and very welcoming and accommodating throughout the trip. She was always a text message or call away. Her home is great value, far more reasonable than the NYC Hotels and it also lets you feel like you actually live there for a week instead of visit. All amenities are there. There is a laundromat on the ground floor that is a boon since alot of Brooklyn apartments require you to go out for washing or hand wash. She even gave us a card to use for the machines. I'd recommend this to anyone who's thinking about staying in NYC.

Bay Ridge is one of the nicest parts of Brooklyn and safe too. You're simply a block away from stores and restaurants. I'd recommend going to Uncle Louis or getting rainbow bagels too to top off that authentic feel.
Apt was very convenient for me during my 4 week stay and Yohan was very prompt in responding to any issues. Would recommend staying here again!

Kelly is a phenomenal host. She was very accommodating and coordinated a worry-free key dropoff as she was already out of town by the time I got back to town. The apartment is typical of the city in terms of quality, noise, etc., but Kelly has done a great job making it feel like a home.

Charis and Will were really warm and welcoming. The master bedroom we had booked was spacious and clean. We had the opportunity to meet Will a couple of times and he was very friendly and helpful! We had enough privacy as well. Overall, a pleasant experience and we'd love to stay here if we come to Harlem again!
Had a great time! The place was clean and slept all five of us very comfortably. Nick was great and it was a really enjoyable weekend home in New York.

Oge and Andrew are great hosts.  Very responsive and were quick to check-in on the quality of my stay.  The neighborhood is located right next to Riverside Park and a 2min walk from the 1Train -- and about a 5min walk from the A/C trains.  

Also, City College is very close and provides a decent alternative setting to the fats-paced life surrounding it.
Great host, and convenient location near the subway!

Ian's place was in a great location. It was convenient and close to the L train, restaurants and shops. His flat mates were very friendly and had excellent coffee and restaurant recommendations. "Gimmie coffee" is amazing and about a 5 minute walk from their place. The apartment was clean and warm and the bed was seriously the comfiest piece of furniture that I have ever slept on. Overall great stay!

George's apartment is lovely and clean. I felt very welcome there and I recommend this place if you want to be close to all of the great Upper West Side sites like Central Park and the American Museum of Natural History.

Unfortunately, I haven't been able to see Mira during my stay, because she wasn't here. But, always she was available and kind by phone to answer my questions or to know if all was ok for me.
The roomates was cool to.
Great place and host!
Had a great stay!

Kseniya's place was very clean and spacious! It is also super close from the metro station. She made sure that our stay was comfortable. The night that we stayed in Brooklyn was unusually cold even though it was mid-May, and she didn't have any extra ones, and she gave us her own blanket! 
She has a cat. 
A minor setback would be that the door lock is very difficult to open with the key, but other than that everything was great!

I stayed at Robbie's for over two months with a couple of friends (we're students who needed something affordable). It's small, but not unmanageably so. Robbie actually bought some new shelves and a wardrobe for my friends and I to put our clothes and things! So sweet!

The sleeping conditions are mainly a futon bed, couch (and he bought us a floor mat which we were also grateful for); so not the greatest for a super long amount of time, but especially for a stay shorter than two months, it's fine. 

The location is really great! It's quieter up town and a short walk from the subway. It's maybe a 15 minute train ride down to where time square is, 20-30 to Ground Zero and Soho. It's not hard to get anywhere in Manhattan from his apartment. It's super close to Central Park (North West) which is really nice if you want to get out of the apartment. 

Robbie was out of town for those 2 months, but even with him away, he was available to answer questions and handle any difficulties we had with the apartment. He was really good about keeping up with us!

If I go back, I'm definitely hitting him up again!

The room exceeded my expectations. It was just as shown in the photo, a great respite from the heat wave that was hitting the city. Chris and Zaneta were extremely welcoming. The neighborhood is close to restaurants, coffee shops, and Prospect Park with easy access to Manhattan on the F Train. 

I had a great trip. I would love to come back and stay longer.

The neighborhood (Brooklyn Heights) is famously interesting:  good streets, lots of people, lots of food, an East River promenade looking over towards Lower Manhattan.
    The apartment was pleasant, quiet (on the back garden side of a rehabbed 5-storey bldg), and well equipped.  Good shower.  Pleasant light.  One flight up.
The host was pretty nice and the room was also cozy:)

Marian was extremely kind and welcoming! 
Her place is very nice,cosy and comfortable, and just one block away from subway, easy access to get to Manhattan. 
The place was very clean and had everything I needed. 
I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for nice stay in New York:)

Jerry's communication from day one was great. He made the whole process so easy. Their place is spacious, clean and in a fantastic location in Greenwich Village. He offered good suggestions for transport (Uber and subway), food and nightlife. Nothing was too much trouble - so I want to thank them for such a wonderful stay.
