Our stay was very good for the new brooklin building. The ad description is according to the site. Good structure in the apartment , air conditioning, bathrooms, full kitchen and bedroom. 
We cook at night a few times and made breakfast. The host a young American is a friendly person and we talked a lot and he gave us many local tips. It was an amazing experience. The place is very calm and quiet, close to the subway , market and restaurants. The bed is a bit of noise when you move , but we have not been much of a problem because we were always too tired . It really was very good and the money excellent for NYC.

Amazin! Apartment in a prime location!

We loved staying there!

Ania was very welcoming!

Alicia was such an incredible host! She was so helpful and attentive whenever we needed anything. Her home is absolutely darling! It's so cozy and warm and virtually spotless. The room is huge for a New York apartment which we loved because we usually feel like we are crawling over eachother in most places we stay in the city. It's so important to emphasize that the room is SO quiet. We planned to wake up early but slept in until 10am. When we finally woke up we couldn't believe how dead quiet it was. We thought we were in a cabin in the mountains! The neighorhood is lovely and a short 15 minute walk to several subway lines. We highly recommend staying here, if just for the pleasure to meet Alicia, she is so darn sweet and is sure to make you laugh!

For my trip I was looking for a cheap place to sleep and that's what I got. John was very nice and welcoming! Less than ten minutes to the metro and the nearby street has a huge variety of bars and places to eat. Would definitely recommend if a bed and shower is all your looking for.

Really enjoyed ourselves for the weekend we spent at Max's wonderful penthouse apt in Brooklyn. It was conveniently located 3.5 blocks away from my son's place and in the heart of Williamsburg. The terrace and rooftop deck are fantastic - we took advantage of the great space with family and friends. Max was a great host and even helped to try and find my sister's lost retainer - unfortunately, unsuccessfully. We were 6 adults and the space worked great and the location couldn't have been better. Wouldn't hesitate to rent again!
Quiet apartment block with a very pleasant host. The room is spacious and light, and the apartment has nice decor as pictured.
Great host and very accommodating, nice location close to a lot of sight seeing. I would def come back! Thanks Carlos!

Thanks a lot, Elena, for perfect hosting. Everything was good, rooms are clean, everything as on a pictures. The location is also very good, many cafe and restaurants there, close to metro station. Elena was very kind and help us a lot, especially thanks for charger for MacBook:) I kindly recommend Elena and for sure will stay again in her apartment, when will come to NYC again.
Very flexible. Great host.

I just want to thank Amy! Me and my girlfriend loved the house, neighborhood, was close to subway and she was very helpful! If I come back to NyC in our top of mind will be Amy's house!

Thank you Amy!
John is a wonderful host with a great place.
Had a really great stay at Naomi's place! Beautiful house and great location, would love to stay there again :) Naomi is wonderful!

Feliz's place was the perfect spot for our quick weekend down in NY. The Brooklyn Heights neighborhood is not only full of great spots, but at night its super quiet and we slept like babies. Check-in and out was easy, the apartment was clean, and fresh linens/towels were abundant. Feliz responded to messages almost immediately. We will definitely look up Feliz's studio next time we're in town...that is...if its not booked up by then!!

I stayed here with my family to 23th from June 16. The United States was the first time and also New York was the first time. I was worried because of my poor english but Jacob and his wife was really nice and has provided us with all the conveniences. Thanks once again about the friendly descriptions and a lot of care for us. If you had a kids and planning a family trip to New York I would recommend this place without hesitation.
This is part of a secure residential neighborhood, and there are various marts and restaurants and amenities nearby. The slowly 5-minute walk is enough to the nearest metro station. And 15 minutes to Manhattan can reach enough. Dislike the busy street and the noise and want a safe residential neighborhood this place is a great place if you have kids I would like to recommend this place more. Clean and equipped with all the necessary things in life. After a week I felt like this place is my home. I have not met Jacob and his wife, but they gave a note of the points of interest and restaurants nearby for us. Before departure, they had kindly answered our many questions.. I would like to tell again and again for their kindness to thank. By chance, to know them happy and want to go to that place again.. They are the best hosts. Jacob, heeyoung. I was grateful. Please always happy!
Great host and experience in nyc, for solo adventure i think the position and the roomates is so perfect! alex is very polite, friendly and clean. apartment is very comfortable.

Our host sure did make us feel welcome in how he prepared the apt for us and greeting us on-line and in person. The accommodations were sweet. It had a real European feel to it and was quiet and full of alot of light. The kitchen/dining was a good size and great to sit at breakfast and enjoy the view of the backyards. The sofa bed was very comfortable to sleep on and hang out on in the evenings. The whole place was very clean. You could really see how he took alot of care to prepare it for us and make it feel like a home.

It was very nice welcoming  - she bought very delicious cakes.
The apartment is sunny, cozy, artistic and it is in the good area near the big park and a lot of night life bars and restaurants.
Couldn't choose a better place to stay in New York.   Absolutely lovely hosts, great location -- trees out back.  Still convenient to Manhattan while having a much saner pace.

Everything went smoothly and Warren accommodated our schedule making both arrival a departure very easy.  It is a very comfortable, attractive space and was exceptionally clean.  The description is accurate.

I stayed in Dallas' place for 2 nights. First of all, the location is very convenient. It is close to the subway stations and there are many nice cafes around. Her apartment was very clean and comfortable. The room that I stayed in had everything that I needed. She had provided me with towels and an extra blanket. I care a lot about the cleanliness of the bathrooms in the Airbnb houses that I stay. I can easily give their bathroom 5 stars for cleanliness. I didn't meet Dallas until my last day but she gave me perfect instructions about how to get into the apartment and where to find whatever I needed. I am quite content with my stay in this place.

The host was very nice and helpful. Had a little issue with locating the place, but thanks to a treat communication on behalf of the host it was quickly resolved. 
Loved the location of a place close to the beach and easy parking.
Very clean and comfortable.  2 blocks away from the subway.  Fast internet connection and within walking distance to several shops and restaurants. 10/10.

Francisco was a great host. Although he wasn't in the city when we were staying there, he was available to us for all our requests. Checking in was simple as was checking out. He gave us some suggestions for local bars which was very thoughtful. In terms of location, the apartment is close to the station and makes traveling to Manhattan easy (maybe 20 mins from the station). We didn't stay in the apartment too much and usually arrived late in the night which was always quiet and safe. The apartment itself is simple and has what you need.

I am a local and I stayed at Jays place while work was being done on my apartment.
The location is awesome , you are literally a two minute or less walk from anything you could possibly need or want - it's a bustling neighborhood and the best location in Astoria.
The building is older but the apartment has updated finishes and is very nice, reasonably clean, very comfortable and very sunny.

The best thing about this place was the value. I had an entire apartment to myself for less than most rooms in the area. And Jay is very helpful and will get back to you immediately via text, he knows all the best shops and restaurants - when there are so many options nearby it's nice to have some guidance

The apartment is  a walk-up so if you can't do 3 flights of stairs this is probably not the place for you.
Peter was a wonderful and accommodating host. Thanks for everything!
Place was amazing to stay it and it was everything from what I expected it to be would stay here every night if I could

It was an amazing space to live in despite its proximity to Manhattan. The neighborhood was very safe and offered just about everything from Delis to Parks. My housemates accommodated me very well and provided me with all the help I needed.

The apartment was spacious and has a very nice kitchen. Thr host, Pedro, was accomodating. Initially, there was an musty odor in thr apartment but after one of the other guests left the odor cleared so we suspected it was their belongings. The linens had hair on them and did not appear freshly laundered. However,  we washed them ourselves with the washer/dryer in the apartment tgat was very convenient. The building seems to have some not sobclean tenants which creates issues as we saw roaches in the stairwell. However, the apartment itself was clean and didn't have a huge problem. (This is NYC... so a roach here or there comes with the territory). Overall, we really did enjoy our stay

Stephanie's place was just as described. It was bright, clean, and conveniently located. After a day in Manhattan or in beautiful Astoria, it was a pleasure to come back to the apartment, which was just a short walk from the train station and a major street in Astoria. We ended up having the place to ourselves, but Stephanie was a gracious host and texted us periodically to make sure everything was fine. All in all, we were very comfortable and felt right at home I definitely recommend staying here!

Eli is fantastic, he was very helpful and he made everything easy. I totally recomend this place. The apartment feels like your own place, I had a very nice time there. Coney Island beach is just 1 minute walking from the apartment and if you want to go to Manhattan, there is a metro station close by the apartment as well.

The room was nice and as expected, but the surrounding house were a mess. Had a nice stay though, as we met several of the other "inmates" and had nice talks. The owner of the house is a nosy old hag. Aga did her best to make us feel comfortable. If you don't expect luxury, but need a place to stay, while you explore NYC, this is OK - and relatively cheap.
Everything went very well. Thank you , Heather and Jammal!!

The host gave me all the details and information I required for my stay. I didn't have any problems with the place. It was nice and cosy. The location was good. Ideal for doing tourism in New York. Near two subway stops. I really enjoyed my stay there.
Zac was a great host and super helpful. His apartment is located in a great location and is close to th (Website hidden by Airbnb) L. I would definitely recommend it!
We were so grateful to stay at Jessica's place! She was communicative from far away and did everything she could to help us have a great time.
Sufficient for single traveler who does not mind going elsewhere for internet or using loft bed layout. Sami is quick to respond about concerns and was a pleasure to meet.

Lauren is a great host. She made us feel very welcome and at home in her apartment. She also set messages to check we were ok throughout our stay which I thought was very good of her. 
The apartment was very clean and larger than it appeared on the photos, it was very comfortable and in a great location. There are some great places to eat and drink nearby for when we wanted a night closer to home, it worked very well for us. I would definitely stay again!
Nabil was friendly and accommodating.

Salima was amazing! She gave us tons of details of where to go, how to get to the apartment, and was simply wonderful all around! The apartment was super clean and felt extremely home like. I could not give her enough thanks and praise for doing so amazing!

Private room-check.  Desk-check.  Good internet-check.  Nice building-check.  Everything for a business traveler not looking for luxury but a functional place to work for a couple days that won't break the bank.  I would come back.
The listing description was accurate.  The neighborhood was very safe.  I often came back late at night and had to walk a few blocks to the place.  I never had any fear.
The description was accurate, highly recommended.

Great apartment and great location.  Safe area with tons of restaurants, close to museum mile, Central Park, grocery stores, pharmacies, public transportation, movie theaters, and parks.  Rachel made check in and check out as easy as it gets.  She checked in by text  to make sure everything was going right, too.  Take this apartment if it's available, you won't be disappointed.  No complaints here.
Stephan and his girlfriend were awesome! Their apartment was nice! They were also extremely helpful, always answering texts!! Thanks again guys!

Imogen was a wonderful host! She was fast replying to messages before the stay, was there to welcome me, and gave me great tips about local places to visit/eat etc. She was really quite wonderful! Thanks

Large and spacious apt, super huge as far as New York standards go, nice safe building with lots of amenities like laundry and grocery store. Really lovely area with lots of good local restaurants and delis close by.  Really convenient for subway with the a stop only 4 blocks away, on the 6 line. Great stay, great apt, great host - great find.

John is a very chill and flexible host, always addressing any concerns I have as soon as he can and always willing to help.

This apartment is really nice and roomy with a perfect location around anything you might need as far as essentials. The room is very cozy and surprisingly quiet, perfect for any length stay (as long as you don't care about the view but it is worth the peace and quiet).

Overall great place with a great host, would stay again.

Sarah's spot was great.  It was easy to access; just a shortish walk from two subway stops.  The building was lovely and modern with a cool looking lobby.  The two bedrooms were well suited for our party of four.  We didn't use much of the cute kitchen, but the kitchen/living room area was nice to hang out in.  The apartment even has a balcony with stairs down to a small backyard.  Sarah was very quick to respond to questions, and had plenty of tips about the neighborhood.  I highly recommend her spot!
Khalil was an incredible host. He went out his way to make my stay comfortable and help me out with whatever I needed. My stay was really easy and great and I would like to say, thank you!
Sarah communicated clearly with us and the apartment was nicely decorated. Her place is good base for a stay in Bed-Stuy.
Thank you
The place was very clean and quiet.  Matt was a responsive host.  I would stay there again.  Thank you Matt!

Great stay. The room is as beautiful as the photos are, spotless and spacious. The Host was very accommodating and responsive. Train station, supermarket, and laundromat are all just a few minutes away. Would definitely stay again!

Elena was an amazing host and answered all our questions within minutes (even though she was abroad).
The lovely apt is located in the UES, whit a lot of amazing restaurants around, absolutely recommending the bottomless sangria brunch at Boqueria!
We definitely felt like home and would highly recommend Elenas place. Thanks for having us.

We spent a really great time in Karin and Evan's appartment! 
They are really good hosts and make us feel like home thanks to their great tips and information on NY and their place!
Thanks again for this nice week in Chelsea! We'll definitely come back!

First, a disclaimer: I knew Mark from college before I stayed with him, but I will try to be unbiased in my review.

Mark's apartment was great - it's right in the heart of the East Village with many places to eat, drink, and play very nearby. He had the place professionally cleaned before I arrived, and the apartment is spacious, with high ceilings and a wall-sized projector setup (we watched Game of Thrones on it!). Both Mark and I were pretty busy, but we'd usually have a little time to chat when I got home.  

If you're staying with Mark, you should know that the apartment is on the fifth floor and there's no elevator. I regularly walk up five flights of stairs to get to my office, but you should be ready for that exertion.

Benjamin was great in getting us set up in his place. He was quick to respond and really accomodating with our needs. He even ordered some kitchen stuff and a baby gate for us. The location is perfect, close to everything, Brooklyn Musuem, Children's Musuem, Library, BBG and Zoo!
Nice place to stay. Only con is little far from subway station
Quick response! And really cute apartment!

We really enjoyed this nice and cosy apartment!

The location was perfect, it was really close to the Central Park and the Riverside Park and it was good connected with all the interesting places of the city.

Maura was not in the apartment when we arrive but we have a good comunication and she answered all the questions we needed. 

It's a great place to stay if you want to have a great experience of New York!

We had a nice stay at Michael's Apt. in the heart of Brooklyn. The Metro is near by and you can find Grocery stores, Restaurants and coffee shops near by (check out "Supercrown Coffee Roasters" around the corner). We could explore NYC and had a good stay in this modern Apartment with a nice view from the rooftop.

Great and welcoming hosts with a comfortable, well appointed, clean and perfectly located apartment.
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in Alex's home and would love to return to it on my future NYC trips.
Thanks for having me!

Tiffany's place is a great find and such a wonderful gem with true Brooklyn vibe in a convenient and safe neighborhood. I stayed at her place when she was on vacation so I only saw her the day I moved in, but she was still an incredibly accommodating host, and her (Hidden by Airbnb) were no less.
Getting around is very simple, but takes some getting use to. It's about a 5 min walk to the G line, which is a couple stops away from a transfer to the ACF lines. Sometimes it's faster to take the bus, which is even closer than the subway.
The place itself is homey, well-decorated, and clean. It's above a grocery store and within walking distance of countless restaurants, a farmer's/flea market on the weekend, and a couple bars. There are washers and dryers in the basement of the building, so laundry isn't an issue.
I stayed through the month of July and, at times, it got a bit hot as her room is furthest away from the AC unit in the apartment. However, it wasn't unbearable and she provided a small fan which helped cool the room at night.
If I ever need a place to stay, I will definitely try to book Tiffany's place again. The ambiance of the apartment makes you feel right at home, and she and her (Hidden by Airbnb) are always willing to help out.

had a great time there with stunning view of Manhattan and location is very nice because it is calm town comparing to Manhattan. Got every kitchen appliance, wide HDTV with FiOS cable TV and Apple TV, bedroom with queen size bed and washer and dryer. All good but there is lack of space for my clothes for a month.

Sarah was awesome, the place was just a few blocks away from what I had going on, and the apartment was nice and quiet in a nice neighborhood.  I literally couldn't have had a better setup.  Sarah was never more than a couple minutes away as far as communication went, so everything was smooth sailing.  She even met us upon arrival and gave us the tour of the place.  Nice clean apartment with a back balcony and backyard.  Would definitely stay there again, Thanks Sarah!!

I personally did not stay at Skye's (Website hidden by Airbnb) father did and he enjoyed all 9 days. Skye's mom was very nice to him and he was more than comfortable. My Dad's stay was a last minute thing and I am so happy that I found them and  they were so gracious to him...almost like family. Thanks to Skye's mom

the comunication with johnny was really easy und he was very helpful.
the room was like in the describtion, quite small but ok.
his roomates are really nice and we had great two days in NY.
the location is really great. you will be in manhattan within 20 minutes.
Justin was a very accommodating host. The place was spare but clean and super convenient.

My boyfriend and I have stayed at Janea's apartment for four days in June. We haven't pleasure to see Janea but her brother Lamant have met us and made a small tour around an apartment. He is easy going person, very polite and hospitable, who lives in another apartment at the same floor. He was always ready to help us or give some advice.
The apartment looks totally like at photos and it is surprisedly big even. It is comfy, enough clean and quiet. We have enjoyed our stay.
The apartment is real home, where people do usually live. So it gives the opportunity to discover how some Brooklyn's people do live. We appreciate this point so much.
The area where the apartment is situated gives the chance to see a bit of carribien culture, there are a lot of authentic restaurants, music and so on. However it is real quiet, calm and safe district.
Metro station (lines 2 and 5) is just in 3 mins by feet so you can easy reach any borough of NYC. 
But Brooklyn itself is interesting also with the differences of its districts. 
For example great Prospect park, Brooklyn Botanic garden, Brooklyn zoo, Brooklyn museum are just in 20-30 mins by feet from the apartment. And of course these places are available by public transport.
Also there are some nice grocery stores in 15-20 mins by feet from the apartment.
I can recommend Janea's home because of its hospitable hosts, quiet area and experience to try native people's life which gives that apartment.
Thank you
Mikhail and Irina.

Thomas is an excellent host. The room was as it was described on the site. He was very helpful in introducing me to the neighborhood, and also extremely fast in responding if I had any queries during my entire stay. The room was very neat and so was the entire apartment.

The place was very cool in a great part of Williamsburg. The room was clean with a private half bath. Dianna is really responsive and is helpful when asking questions about the area. She also has a roomate who is pretty friendly but mostly stays to himself. Good place, I would definitely use her place again.
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Kirsten was an excellent host and provided everything necessary. Despite being away for business reasons she was always a text away to provide any needed help. The place is very cozy and perfect for one or two persons.

Despite being away for travels, Masako was a wonderful host. Her home was hip, spacious, yet very cozy and comfortable to relax in between our travels. The Williamsburg neighborhood is a goldmine of great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and buzzing vibes. We loved how close we were to the Williamsburg Bridge, which we enjoyed the view from on Citi Bikes many times! Would definitely stay here again.

We had a wonderful time at Carli's place! The apartment was exactly as described in the listing. There are high ceilings and skylights, so the apartment is very bright. The roommates and the cat were super chill. The A/C was a blessing and I especially enjoyed the waterfall shower head. We had full access to the kitchen which includes a dishwasher. The apartment is located very near two subway lines, so it's convenient to travel to Manhattan or elsewhere in Brooklyn. The building is also near grocery stores, a laundromat, coffee places, etc. The neighbourhood itself is pretty bustling and interesting--there's plenty to explore within walking distance. It was a breeze to check in/out. There was an info sheet in the room when we arrived as well as a bunch of restaurant recommendations which were very much appreciated. 

The room and the bed are on the smaller side for two people, but it was still comfortable. The neighbourhood is a little noisy (you can hear the above ground subway passing by every so often). 

Overall we had a great stay and would recommend this place! It was a great deal for a week-long stay in NYC.

Everything about Rosey's apartment was perfect for our needs! The location is fantastic, with tons of restaurants and stores, plus the park, nearby. The apartment itself was very comfortable and completely as described, and Rosey was a great host, making sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommended!
Nice place to stay

While Adriana was away for the summer I stayed in her room for 3 weeks while taking summer credits at a school in Greenwich Village.(the apartment is super close to the 1 and A train which is pretty convenient to go downtown) Since Adriana wasn't there her roommate Karla was there to welcome me. Karla was super friendly and always asked me about my day when I returned home late at night from school. I wish I would have been able to get to know her a little better but I was so consumed with school. I found the apartment to be really clean which was nice to come home to after a long day in the city. The apartment building has a key code entrance which made me feel safe. The Latino neighborhood is very lively and full of friendly people. Two little boys that live in the apartment across the hall would often be outside playing ball and give me a high five as I walked into the building which made me feel welcome and a little more at home. Throughout my stay Adriana kept in contact with me via Airbnb messenger to make sure everything was going smoothly. I would recommend this room and would stay again. Perfect for students or a solo traveler in NY.

Daniel and I worked out my arrival to a time where I could meet him at his place. He showed me the ins and out of his apartment and answered any questions I had. He was also lenient with my check out time as well.

The apartment itself looks exactly like the photos. Zero discrepancies. I was very pleased with that. The dishwasher is nice to have. The size of the apartment is perfect for one or two people. My stay was 3 about weeks long.

Fantastic stay! The apartment was at a very convenient location, a 3 minute walk to a subway station, followed by a 10 minute train ride to union square! Free parking was easy to find around, didn't have to move for the whole stay. The apartment itself was very large, well decorated and cozy and the bed was quite comfortable. Although we never met, Penny seemed like a lovely person and always made sure we felt at home by placing fresh flowers around the space and answering our messages swiftly even while she was on her own vacation. Definitely recommend staying there, would visit back in a heartbeat!

The apartment was perfect, very central location, we found it convenient to get everywhere even with my parents in their late 60s, we used the subway and a couple of taxis but almost everything is within a short walk and there is public transport closeby to get anywhere in the city. A good way to save on transport! There are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, and there is always someone on the street due to the proximity with NYU - it felt really safe. It's a nice, quiet, residential neighbourhood next door to a beautiful square. It didn't feel like NYC on the street but it's only a few blocks from Soho.
The apartment itself was exactly what we wanted - a home rather than an empty apartment or hotel. The vintage furniture, the wooden floor, comfy sofa... We felt at home, so we even spent a couple of evenings just relaxing! My parents are getting old and it was nice to have a comfy place to go back to, especially on the cold days where it was super nice to be warm :) I was worried that it being a big apartment it may be cold but it was perfect for us.
It is a very big apartment, very well furnished, in a perfect location... which comes at a cost, perhaps we wouldn't have needed so much space, or could have picked a different location, but it was just what we needed and I was glad to have selected this place in the end. My parents loved it too. I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

This lovely cozy apartment made me and my family feel right at home. The host, Shirley was really accommodating  and very sweet. Everything was clean and organized as well. Lots of parking space. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. Would recommend this to everyone.
Great apartment, awesome location!!  Laura has great communication and local suggestions!!

Teddys apartment has an incredible location. It has everything you need for a lovely stay in ny! Peter, his friend, was oncredibly nice and helpful. Really a great place to stay! I hope to stay there again in the future .

Although Radiyah was not able to greet my friend and I upon our arrival, she made sure that her roommate was available for our check in. The room was just as she had described so there were no surprises. It was clean and the bed, so comfortable! We were granted access to the common areas (living room, kitchen/dining) and while we did not utilize them, it was nice to have the option.

The location was in walking distance to restaurants, stores, the Apollo, and so much more. Also a plus, she's not far from the police station (if a little added security is desired).

Throughout the stay, Radiyah was in constant contact with me, ensuring that our needs were being met. She was even able to recommend a good local restaurant to watch the game. On our last day in Harlem, I head the pleasure of meeting Radiyah and thanking her personally for the hospitality. If I am ever again in Harlem and her room is available, that's where I'll stay!

Landon was great!!he is so kind and he helped us in everything we wanted to do.the apartment was beautiful and the location is very good!the subway is very close and shops  are all around the house!i recommend it!

I booked this room for my girlfriend and Sylvia was an amazing host and had a lovely room for her.  The apartment is beautiful, close to the park and transportation and was a great value for a week's stay.

I had a great stay at Allison's place. Although Allison was traveling, she was always reachable by email and easy to communicate with. Her housemates were also very helpful and made my stay comfortable. The house and room itself were really good - the room was slightly smaller than I expected, but overall it was nice and as described.

We had a wonderful time at Elizabeth`s apt. The apartment was really comfortable and great location. I love her kitchen! Elizabeth must love cooking and she had a lot of cooking items. My kids loved her apt and they would not go home. 
I would love to stay her place again when we go back NYC.
Ana was very kind and she gave us everything we needed. Although we didn't meet, her roommates were there and were also very kind. Nice room in a very nice apartment.
Amazing location.  Amazing host.  Thank you John, you made our trip!
The apartment is about a block from Prospect Park as well as the subway.  Jill was great about communicating, getting into the apartment was easy and the place was really nice.  Thanks!

Five stars out of five.  Jack's cozy apartment is perfectly located for your trip to NYC!  His flat is located in the lovely upper east side; thirty seconds from bars, restaurants, coffee shops and markets.  There are bus stops two minutes away and a subway within ten minutes.  The Upper East Side is very safe, so I didn't feel at all insecure walking home alone at night.  Jack met me the night before I was due at this apartment to exchange keys and we had a quick drink together.  I found him to be pleasant and welcoming - and when I arrived I found a letter from him following up on our conversation about places in NYC I might be interested in visiting and what to do if anything in his apartment was to stop working - a small gesture, but one that made me feel welcome and gave me a sense of security should something go wrong.  Jack and I kept in contact via email throughout my stay as we updated each other on life in different places in the world.  I would definitely stay in Jack's apartment again and recommend him for your trip.

The apartment is in a great part of NYC and of Astoria with a thriving s buzzing feel to the neighbourhood ... easy, quick and convenient to get into Manhattan on the N & Q trains, short walk to the restaurant strip in Astoria and right next to Astoria park ...  it's great!!

The apartment itself is light and airy with a huge bedroom and even bigger lounge room.

The A/C was great on steamy NYC nights.

Id definitely recommend staying st Megan's apartment and hope to stay there again on my future trips to the big apple.

I did not eventually make it to sleep there but all else was good with him. The communication was great and he even waited up for me past midnight. Unfortunately because of work, i was still burning the midnight oil.

Ruby's place was great!! I didn't meet her in person, but she was very easy to communicate with and I felt she'd be attentive if anything came up. Her roommate was awesome and so incredibly easy to stay with. It was clean and the bed was super comfortable! It's also really close to what's in my opinion the best subway line to get to Manhattan and not far from another line as well. I'd definitely stay there again if I needed a place in the future! A++
Great location. Perfect place to stay for a weekend in which you know you're gonna be out the entire time and you just need a bed to crash.
Great value for money. Andy's room was neatly organized and comfortable and he provided easy entry instructions.
The host canceled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Joel was a fantastic host. The apartment is in a great location. It's decorated nicely & has a very homey feel at the same time. I highly recommend a stay at the Greenpoint Oasis.
If you have a chance to book this place.... Do it. Pictures won't be able to do this place justice. Amazing loft, hospitality and location.

My boyfriend and I needed a place for the month of July as we were both working in the city. Benzi was very responsive to our questions and welcoming from the start. The apartment was even bigger than the pictures made it look and was the perfect space for us. Easy commute to the city via the R or F trains, and the perfect location in Park Slope. Would highly recommend staying here!

The room was lovely big and bright, just like the picture. However there weren't any blinds and as it is on a top level it was very hot in summer with no air conditioning 

The roommates were really nice. And it was in a great location in Bushwick.

However it was pretty dirty around the room/bathroom
David was very helpful and friendly and gave me great tips for visiting NY!!!

Nice and clean room, perfect location and walking distance to absolutely everything in Manhattan. Matthieu responded quickly to all our messages and made sure someone was in the house to welcome us.
Eventually a bit loud at night as on the 23rd Street, but had a great time there overall.

Antoine was a fantastic host! Extremely available and helpful for my mum and I. He explained everything, left a lovely bottle of rose and was totally helpful when we accidentally left something behind. His apartment was gorgeous - great building, amazing view. Highly recommend to anyone!

Reynaldo was a wonderful host and communicated excellently all throughout. We were unable to meet in person due to conflicting schedules however he was flexible in allowing me to make arrangements to have a friend pick up the key. The apartment itself is absolutely wonderful. It's very modern, spacious and has everything you need. This was my first time using AirBnB and I couldn't have asked for a better experience!

Ivan and Emily provided everything we could need, and were very generous in allowing us to use their home. It was great to have a real apartment with kitchen, etc. Location could not be better -- close to subway, buses and in the lively Park Slope area. They were especially accommodating in coordinating arrival and departure so we could get and return keys in ways that fit our travel plans.

Petros' place is nice, clean and cosy. It has everything one might need for a short stay. Petros made the arrival and key pick up very convenient to me and communication was smooth. The area is great, plenty of bars, shops and restaurants around. Highly recommended!

Great place! Absolutely perfect location for my business trip to NYC. Will was super communicative about everything, he made it very easy to get the key on my first day and was flexible about the check out time. The main area in particular is really beautiful and perfect for relaxing after a long day in the city.
amazing apartment, the coolest neighborhood in new york

Carlos was a perfect host and communication was always great. Apartment was just as described. Unfortunately we spent there some of the hottest days in summer and we could not rest much due to the high temperatures. The fan was not enough to cool the living room and opening the window was not the solution either. I would recommend the place if you have a limited budget.

I had a very good time in Daniel's place. The appartment is 30-40 mins away from the financial district by subway, which was perfect for me. I didn't really meet Daniel but he wrote me detailed instructions about everything in the appartment and how to reach the house from the airport. I met his flatmate Rani, who's been very helpful and gave me lots of smart tips to get around in the city. The neighborough was quite safe and full of families' houses. The house was quite clean but very, very hot. The air-conditioning in the room helped me a lot but i couldn't leave it on during the night because it was noisy. The wifi was a free one but it worked very good.   The kitchen had everthing you could wish for cooking but there weren't a table nor a chair for eating. Anyway, if you plan to be outside for eating and use this spot to sleep and have breakfast, it'll be perfect. In the room Daniel also has got a big comfortable sofa and some speakers to connect your laptop or smartphone. 
I'll recommend it.

Nicholas was great and so quick to respond! We booked the place last minute and he was more than accommodating. He went out of his way to make sure that we were able to get to the place alright and sent through lots of great tips for local spots. It was so easy to get around and we enjoyed our stay.
Just perfect place where to stay in NYC

Astrid is a great host! She was extremely helpful from the first time I contacted her until I moved out. She really cares about his guests which makes staying at her apartment a great and pleasant experience. The neighborhood (a residential area) was very quiet and safe. All in all, a great place to stay with an easy commute to Manhattan/Times Square. I can definitely recommend this place!
Host was very nice, his place was exactly how it was described, would highly recommend it to anyway wanting to stay in midtown Manhattan!

Seohee's apartment was small, but efficient. The sofa bed is a bit small, so it may not be suitable for taller folks. The building is a 10 minute walk from the subway, which we didn't mind since it gave us an excuse to cut through Columbia's campus. Although the neighborhood is residential, there are restaurants and parks available nearby. Overall, I would recommend this listing.

Cute and cosy two bedroom in the heart of Williamsburg, within spitting distance of the Bedford Ave L stop. Good for the price and an unbeatable base to explore the city. The apartment is very small and definitely older (watch out for those NYC roaches, bit of a flooding problem in the shower on our last day) but it is beautifully decorated and the girls were absolutely lovely to deal with. Thank you for having us!
Perfect place to stay if all you need is a comfortable bed. Josh was a great host, quick responses. Friendly roommates as well!

Ashton's apartment was really nice, cozy, clean and comfortable. We had a great stay. It was close to a metro station and a bus stop. Very convenient to get around. There is a train track out of the building and it didn't bother us much. After walking around the city for hours, we just passed out and didn't hear a thing while sleeping. We liked the neighborhood too. Very friendly neighbors. :)

We had a great stay! Dori and her boyfriend are friendly and communicative. They made the bedroom and bathroom clean and tidy. The kitchen and living room are well-equipped and there's 24h parking nearby.

Keryn was extraordinarily helpful and hospitable! She took time to go out of her way and help meet our schedule and on top of that, she even sat down and explained all of the great things to do around her fantastic neighborhood.
I stayed in Austin's room while he was traveling for a month. He left the room very clean. His room mates were awesome and very polite! Thanks a lot for everything!

We were very happy to stay in Edwards home. He responded quickly when we had questions and he was very helpful. He made every effort to make us feel at home and he had lots of tips as where to go and eat, where to by groceries and etc.
Our host was very nice and forgiving of our later than scheduled arrival time. He was friendly and talked with us but also didn't impede on our privacy in any way.
Great value for money

Accurate description of the accommodations. The building is located within very close proximity to many subway lines making travel throughout the city easy. 
Immediate area isn't the best, but isn't bad. Many good lunch places nearby and close to South Seaport area with good restaurants and bars. 
Would highly recommend.
Kate and Anthony were fantastic hosts and I couldn't have been happier with their lovely apartment. They were super accommodating and made things so easy.

Mariam had everything laid out for us on our arrival, she was prompt in her responses and was lovely. It's a great area, close to everything we needed and felt totally safe. We felt like she went out of her way to accommodate for us as there was 3 people staying. The apartment itself was clean and welcoming.
Maggie and Ahmed are amazing hosts!!! They were helpful and very pleasant to communicate with. I really enoyed my stay in their nice and quiet apartment!! I truly recommend it to you :)
Friendly host who provided us with breakfast. Super nice area. Thanks.

Linda is very friendly and responsive, her place is in a very clean and safe buiding with 24 hours doorman. More importantly, the location is so great, right next to the heart of lower manhattan, extremely convenient for tourists.
We really enjoyed staying  at Lauren's place, it is in a great location with great views, very close to everything.
I loved staying at Gina's place! The room was very comfortable and clean. Her roommates were so nice with me, I felt at home! Thank you Gina.

Aiden and Amadeus were great. They were friendly and helpful. Everything went great! The room was exactly like the picture and everything was kept clean and organized. The kitchen was well Equipped. Great location. So in conclusion the stay was smooth and comfortable.

Despite some initial chaos due to the fact that this was a super last-minute booking, it all worked out fine in the end. Sarah gave a lot of great suggestions on things to do in the neighbourhood, and was super responsive and helpful whenever we had any questions. Her roommates are cool, and overall, we had a great time staying at her place.

I had a good stay in Bushwick. Close to lots of food options and comfortable coffee shops. Only a 5 minute walk to the L, which made it easy to shuttle into Manhattan. Although I didn't have a chance to meet Jessie in person, she was quite responsive given the time zone difference in Australia. I had trouble sleeping some nights because other guests or roommates were up late and there were no agreed upon quiet hours. And the bathroom sink was completely clogged. Otherwise the space met my needs during my stay.
Ali made me feel welcome and this was a nice spot, close in to the city to be at while I was in New York. Everything was clean and he was real responsive during my stay.

El lugar esta super bien ubicado, esta junto a una parada de buses, a un par de cuadras de muchas estaciones de metro con conectividad a practicamente todo NY, incluyendo la linea que conecta con el aeropuerto. Hay bastante comercio, restaurants, etc... Lo mejor sin dudas es la cercania a todo. Como departamento, es bastante comodo, bien equipado.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Jason was very welcoming; he met me at the flat and took care that all of the facilities required were in place.  Given my needs, the flat was very convenient for my activities this summer; I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the neighbourhood was.
I had an amazing experience with Kelly! She was very communicative. Everything was exactly as described. The neighborhood is very safe and lively.

We had a wonderful time at Leah's.

The apartment is basically what you see in the pictures. Internet worked perfectly and the kitchen was fully stocked with all necessary cooking equipment, utensils, herbs and condiments.

Shower is great and the bed is comfortable. There are no shades so if you are a light sleeper remember to bring your eye mask.

Perfectly located near multiple metro stations in a hip and happening Caribbean neighborhood with lots of stores, delis, restaurants nearby and most importantly one of the most beautiful parks in the New York Metro Area, Brooklyn's own Prospect Park, with tons of paths, great tracking, exercise areas and playgrounds for the little ones.

We highly recommend for the solo traveler as well as couples and even those with kids.

One thing to have in mind is that the apartment is on the 4th floor and there is no elevator.

We will probably reach out to Leah again when we return to Brooklyn,

I didn't have the pleasure of meeting Javier, but he was quick to respond to any messages I sent him.  The day before we left on our trip he sent me a lot of information on the area, how to get around, and even hospital information.  Even while we were traveling he sent a text wondering how the trip was going and seeing if we had any questions.  When we arrived at the apartment we were surprised at how big it is.  The pictures don't really do it justice.  There are actually 2 bedrooms, one with the king bed and one with the bunks.  Very comfortable accommodations.  Javier left an envelope with some menus from local restaurants and we were able to take advantage of that.  He warned us ahead of time that the garage was a tight fit.  We were in a midsize car and didn't have any problems but if you have a large vehicle it could be a problem.  Quite a few subway stops within 10 minutes walk so we were able to get anywhere in the city that we wanted to with no problems.  He also recommended an app for navigating around town that worked great.  This is someplace I would definitely return to if I ever visit the city again and would highly recommend it.

First of all, the photos of this place do not do it justice. It's beautifully decorated and it is a huge apartment. The kitchen is stocked with an abundant array of appliances which was much appreciated as we love to cook. The apartment even has a dishwasher! Which is a hot commodity in nyc. The sofa is long and very comfortable in the sitting room and across from it is a large tv with chromecast (very handy for netflix and chill). There are many gorgeous plants dotted around the apartment and the ceilings are very high. The apartment is in a very safe, family-orientated neighbourhood. It is about a 7 minute walk to the train station and there are lots of lovely cafes and restaurants in the area  (must recommend Brooklyn Commune, Lea's and Propellerhead). Our favourite thing to do in the morning is to stop in brooklyn commune and grab and coffee and a bagel for 5 bucks before heading into manhattan (around 20 mins on the trains). The apartment is also about a 3 minute walk to the beautiful Prospect Park (beats central any day in my opinion). There are always activities on in the park and you can even rent out boats in the lake. Anna herself was extremely accommodating and was an absolute pleasure to deal with. She was still easy to contact despite her travelling in Europe. Eric, her husband, gave us the tour of the apartment and even let us leave our bags in the apartment the night before we were due to move in. Overall, it was the perfect airbnb experience - both host and apartment exceeded our expectations and beyond.

Great hosts, very welcoming. 
The appt. is fantastic and very conveniently located. We had a wonderful time.
Godo location and flat. Paula is a good host.

While Albert wasn't present as a host (it was his room being let out) he was very attentive over email and text before and during my stay, as were his roommates. The room is windowless and gets hot, but this is comes with the territory in lofts in this area, and there was a big bright shared living space. Excellent books on the shelf, two bathrooms, and a clean and well equipped kitchen. While these blocks of apartments have a reputation for being lively, I had a very quiet and peaceful stay here. Good laundry facilities on the same floor. Subway L stop 2 minutes walk away. No complaints :)
This was a great room, great apartment, great host. Would definitely recommend!

Very welcoming host !
The room is not the biggest but it's nice and perfect for someone who wants a place to sleep while visiting New York.

Asika was a great host and her place was the best of the best places that I have stayed in the NY area. Everything was great and felt very private. If I could have rented longer, I would with no hesitation. Forest Hills area is very safe, gave me that home away from home feeling. Lots of grocery stores and everything you could want on Austin St.
The host canceled this reservation 6 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Theodora made all the arrangements for my late arrival. Her instructions are excellent. Wonderful host and perfect place to stay in Manhattan. I really enjoyed her loft and amenities. She is one of the excellent host.

YES, the owner was very gracious & welcoming.  Since I grew up in Queens, and have often visited my relatives there, I did not need any assistance in getting around town, nor in learning about nearby activities.  The listing was accurate - this was a small bedroom, which did not surprise me.  The 2 windows & fan were very helpful in making my summer experience in humid NYC much more bearable than I had expected.  The owner offered to plug in the window air conditioning unit, which I declined (knowing how noisy that would be).  The room fan was great!  The closet was large enough for my needs. The desk table & swivel chair were fine.  The secure lock on the front door with the pushbutton code worked fine!  When I knew that I would be an hour late in arriving (because of car traffic), the owner was understanding, and promptly met me at the appointed time.
it was nice place to stay in NY.

David met us outside the apartment to give us the key and the lay of the land, at pretty random times (late and night and early morning) so we appreciate his flexibility. His apartment was pretty large, clean, efficient and in a good location. Great food and drinks right around the corner.

Although we asked for the apartment with a very short notice, Faisal did everything very fast to have us in the apartment and even accomodated both the entry and leaving times. He was very attentive and responsive.
The apartment was great. As announced, it had almost no furniture, but it did have a very confortable air bed, a small table, and a table and four chairs. The kitchen and the bathroom were well equipped, and it had A/C.
The location was awesome, just 2 blocks from the Empire State building, and closer to literally everything.
We absolutely recommend Faisal!

Such a great location.  Super easy check in and Mandy was great at accommodating a late check out as well.  We were delighted at the note and wine that she left for us to kick off our trip.

Both rooms have AC which was a lifesaver during the summer and the space was perfect for hanging out after a day out exploring the city.

This was a true 2 br with a living room and kitchen which was also great for having privacy from friends if you wanted.

Beatrice was so welcoming! I would definitely come again. Her house is an ideal New York brownstone - not to mention the appeal of Harlem. High ceilings. Wonderful hardwood floors, large airy spacious rooms, nice amenities - I really felt like I was staying in a historic home - right out of the Harlem Renaissance.  Indeed, the amenities were exactly as she described them. And how I love the neighborhood of Harlem - central, easy to get to, and with such character! I look forward to coming again!
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Joey was incredibly helpful and made sure we were taken care of and set up well. The place is clean, cozy, and just what we were looking for. It's easily connected to public transport. I'd definitely stay again when in town!

The listing matched what was seen on airbnb listing page. There was plenty of parking on driveway and street. Neighborhood was quiet and family friendly. Elena welcomed us on our arrival day and showed us house and gave us tips about neighborhood and NYC. The house and beds are clean & tidy. Kitchen was spacious and has necessary stuff. House has Wi-Fi and two smart TVs. Elena kept in touch with us during our stay to make sure we are doing OK. Elena was very welcoming and vert responsive. For our part, we will definitely look to see if this place is available if we come back to NYC and will recommend this place to our friends and family.

Eleni is a great host. Communication was excellent and she made my arrival super easy by meeting up near the subway. The room is located in Greenpoint, about a 10 minute walk to McCarren Park and all the good things that Bedford Ave in Williamsburg has to offer. Easily accessible by the Greenpoint Ave. and Nassau G metro stops as well as the Bedford Ave L stop.

The room is clean, has a beautiful view, a very comfy bed and a nice desk. The roof access was a nice plus - a great place to catch an epic Brooklyn sunset.

The common space was not nearly as well kept as the photos show on this listing. There was a good amount of clutter / piles of stuff in corners, dishes left out overnight, etc. and someone seemed to be living on the couch. This isn't a deal-breaker for me, but not what I expected. They seem to be new to this, so they'll figure it out. 

All in all, a positive experience, a great room and a convenient location.

Great Place in Williamsburg, very close to the subway (I was in Manhattan in 10-15min). The hosts were also very accommodating of my arrival/departure plans and had everything ready for me when I got there. Thanks for the stay :)

Jillian was an absolutely wonderful host. She wasn't in town at the time of our arrival so she mailed us the keys in perfect timing for our visit. She checked in mid week to make sure things were going well. The apartment was extremely comfortable and felt just like home. The location so close to the Brooklyn Bridge was wonderful!
Great stay - Lucia and the room mates were super nice and always made sure to check I was comfortable and had what I needed :)

Positives - The apartment is in a very nice part of Chelsea - easy to walk to all kinds of stores and restaurants and touristy things! 
Negatives - no coffee pot, no place to put my suitcase other than up on the furniture, which I didn't want to do. No instructions for operating the tv or Internet - and so much personal stuff around - I felt like I was intruding in the owners life. No dedicated closet or drawer (Website hidden by Airbnb) towel in the bathroom...just not set up for a visitor.
Noreen was best host whit whom i was.  It was my first visit of NY and she gave me good information about city a she helped me whit transport. The house is clean and confortable. Thank you Noreen. :)
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Garron left a welcoming bottle of wine, which was very kind. The location was perfect and the building was fairly quiet. The neighborhood is lively and there was no shortage of things to do. I would have hoped for more towels during my stay. The apartment is perfect to host 1-2 people comfortably. There were not many dishes but the basic essentials were provided.

Alex was fanastic -- was right at the property to meet and greet me -- and delivered on all the items for the apartment. Felt very comfortable in his home -- and he was an exceptional housemate. Hope to come back again in the near future.
Great place.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Clean Place
Great Location (very near Groceries, Pharmacy, Starbucks, Subway)
Very Safe

The host was the best host you could ask for. She was courteous, patient, friendly, informative, easy going, and most of all she made you feel like home. These are the type of experiences that separate Airbnb from the any hotel or hostel. The quality of being welcomed by regular people.
This listing is conveniently located near groceries, entertainment, dining, and the train. We shared the apartment with Jana's flatmate Mirka who was super friendly and helpful.
Very Bad experiance! No recommendation

I enjoyed my time in Eddie's place. The apartment was really well located and the room quite big ! 
I'm not sensible to cleanliness but if you are, you should know that the building is quite old.
I had a big time in this lively neighbourhood !
everything was good!, nice room, good metro connection. Zachary was helpful even if he wasn't at home:). Thank you!
Great stay very helpful.
Thanks to Azoil ans Liz for everything, they were away when we got there but they made everything convenient and easy. Good neighbourhood, i would go back ! Thanks

The location was absolutely wonderful. Close to everything you want - subways, parks, tons of restaurants, convenient stores, bars and a lot of cool places. 
The apartment is great and welcoming, the hosts were just outgoing, easy to communicate and did everything they could to make my stay the best it could be.
Great host and lovely, modern apartment. Location is great and central to many walkable restaurants and fun locations. Host was always communicative and accommodating.

Located just a couple minutes' walk to the 1 Train, which is a straight shot to downtown, or a couple minutes more to the A, B, C, and D trains. The neighborhood is a cool mix of the old and the new: still largely Spanish-speaking with plenty of longstanding businesses, but you're also never far from a nice cocktail lounge if you so desire. I never met Emma as she was out of town, but in our communications she was always very quick to respond, and her roommate Henry is a sweetheart. We had fun sharing a bottle of prosecco while watching the Democratic National Convention on the Apple TV. The apartment itself actually feels bigger than it looks in the pictures and is quite nice, and the bed you'll be sleeping in is very comfortable. My stay was in the middle of summer, and the A/C units had no trouble keeping the place cool (or even cold) when the sun was blazing outside. Overall the best value I've found on Airbnb. So yeah, you should book the place if you can.
Hugh's apartment is top notch. Great location with all the amenities you desire as a traveler. Communication is super fast and host was super flexible. Ty mate!

Chaima's place was fantastic. Honestly, the photos don't do much justice for the wonderful room she has. It was far bigger than we assumed it would be. Our arrival was smooth; despite her traveling abroad, Chaima made arrangements for us to get in easily. So while we never got to meet her, she communicated well and her roommate was super friendly. The area was the best part of this place. Its located in a sweet spot between Bedstuy and Prospect, which we loved. So many shops and cheap food stands. If you're travelling on a budget, be sure to hit up the $1 pizza place around the corner. Everything was just great. Hopefully we can stay again when we come back to Afropunk fest.
Great location! Ella was out of the city, but very supportive, helpful and friendly. We had a great experience!

We loved staying at Amy's apartment.  It was perfectly situated near our son's apartment.  It was spotless and very comfortable.  The information given was very clear and helpful. We will stay here agai, if available.

Yasir was amazing in his response to any of our questions.  The bed was  a super comfy memory foam mattress. Having 2 full bathrooms was luxurious.  Great location, huge TV screen and apple TV all made it a memorable stay.

Overall we enjoyed the apartment despite it being in a super busy area. It was super convenient To walk places, but I got a fan to drown a little night noise out. 
Very clean, modern, good for 2 people. Amazing terrace.
Communication was perfectly ideal. It made our stay extremely easy and comforting.

Scotts 3 bedroom place was a great place to stay.  Very easy to get to via highway/public transportation. It was also quite large for a 3 bedroom apt in New York City.  The bathroom was not as clean as Id like but overall it was a great place.

As a foreigner it was very great to have american roommates to discuss with. The room was very spacious . Emmie took the time to answer my questions, I am very glad about that. I changed twice the booking dates and she accepted each time. A great experience!
Great house, and great hosts! House is very spacious and has a awesome vibe. Back porch is a very pleasant place to relax. Within 5 minute walk to two different stations to get you into manhattan.

The apartment is in a great location to explore Williamsburg and only about 20 mins to Manhattan on the subway. The flat was spacious, comfortable and charming. Sophia, Shannon and Devin were always quick to respond on emails and left us with some great recommendations for local food. Definitely recommended!
Colin was an excellent host. Would recommend him to anyone interested in traveling to NYC. He gave me great restaurant advice and made the overall trip very enjoyable.

Everything about my visit at Nena and Jonny's place exceeded expectations. The room and bed were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was awesome, great shower!  The neighborhood was easy for parking and convenient to my work. And best of all,  the hosts were interesting, welcoming and kind.  Thanks to both of you!

Hattie's place was a great stay. The room was Spacious and clean. Hattie was out of town that weekend, however she was friendly and easy to communicate with. There are also roommates but I rarely saw them, which gave me plenty of privacy. The place was easy to find and for my first time on Air B&B simple instructions were left on the fridge for guests. It was accessible to get to the city on the J train. I would definitely stay again. Thanks Hattie!

Tal is a kind and helpful host. He and his wife provide sincere and instant help and reminders for us. They reply all our enquiries quickly even when they were out of town. Their place is lovely, roomy and just warm as home. It is located at a safe and convenient location for just one street to MTA, riverside park, Starbucks, restaurants and Columbia University. Thanks again for all the helps and lovely greeting by Tal!

My boyfriend and I were in a pinch because our previous AIRBNB canceled on us the day before we were coming to NYC. Janet was able to accommodate us with a very late check in and offered very quick responses to all my questions. The neighborhood was safe and very trendy. We felt comfortable walking to the subway, restaurants, and bars at all hours of the day and night. Room was comfortable once I asked Janet the best method for working the AC/Fan in the setup. She made space for us in her closet which was great because we had a lot of luggage. The only surprise we encountered was that the host had to pass through our bedroom to get to hers. It didn't ruin our stay but kept us a little more on edge than we would have liked. Overall, it was a great stay and we were happy we booked it.

Claudia was a wonderful host, she made everything very easy for my arrival and stay.
Her home is a wonderful refuge and quiet spot to explore the neighborhood. I'd love to stay again, although longer! 
Thanks again Claudia, hope to visit again soon...

I had a fabulous stay with Emine, though I did not meet her, she responded immediately and friendly to my messages. Her roommates were very nice and invited me along to different activities. The space is great, especially the outdoors area. The apartment is close to good subway communications. If you are looking for a nice Brooklyn experience, stay here.

I met Abbey briefly and she was very friendly. Prior to arrival she gave me her phone number so I could easily communicate with her, which I appreciated since our travel plans were dependent on traffic. 
The neighborhood was fine and had everything we would need. We didn't spend much time at the apartment, but when we did it was comfy and quiet. We were alone most of the time that we were there.  Abbey was super helpful throughout the stay when I needed anything.

Anais was a really nice host, communication was easy and always friendly. The apt is small but there is everything you need. The location is good, especially the connection to the metro is very good (F,M,J,Z).
The only thing that could have been better is cleanliness but we came to an arrangement with Anais. It's the first time that she let her apt so no hard feelings :) 
All in all it was a nice stay in NY.
Place was great! It was clean, spacious, and air conditioned! I would definitely stay there again.
It was a comfortable stay, house is clean and feels homey. the train station is 1min away so it was very convenient to get around.  Highly recommend when in NY.

This is a lovely apartment in the best part of town, great bars and shops within walking distance - this is a real gem! Will was a fantastic host, lots of communication, very considerate and went above and beyond to make our stay as good and easy as possible.  I couldn't recommend this apartment or host more highly.
The host canceled this reservation 17 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Just a background: I reserved this place on behalf of a friend who was visiting from Japan. I only know what she told me, but everything she told me was great. Mary was very generous, kind and accommodating. She did her best to make my friend as comfortable as she can be. 


Thank you Mary!

The apartment was excellent, very spacious, and extraordinarily clean.  The locations was perfect and central to many hot spots in Manhattan.  The family left great directions to the wifi, air conditioning, and other amenities the house had to offer such as a steam shower.  I would recommend this apartment to any respectful travelers who want an elegant place to stay in Tribeca.

Nicole was an amazing host! Her place is adorable and in the heart of the Upper East Side. The area is quiet and the building is modern and new. Nicole was very easy to communicate with and I enjoyed staying in her flat. Thank you again Nicole for hosting me last minute!

Sherese did a great job communicating & went the extra mile to help us book. She lives on the most charming Brooklyn street - they even had one of their famous Brooklyn block parties during our stay. Plenty of free parking.  I would definitely stay again!
The host was very welcoming and super available. The description of the house was exact. The neighborhood was not as expected and very noisy in the morning.

Great place with a great location! In addition to having our own privat terrace, we also had access to the rooftop terrace with an amazing view of the Manhattan skyline. The apartment was clean and tidy, and host was very helpful. Would highly recommend this place to others! 
A great stay!

Claudia was an excellent host. She welcomed my friend and I into her home and showed us where everything was. She guided up on how to use local transit. Her home is in a quiet residential area. She also helped us when we forgot to take the keys!!! Overall very nice family and home. Thank you!
this is a very nice new place with a private bathroom across the hall. it's a quick uber trip to go north into the city or jump on the subway

Note - I'm borrowing the account of my bf's mother to write this review

We've spent 4 nights at this place. It was on the 5th floor and the area is not that tourist-friendly but the house itself is actually nice. Yet, I'd have to say the manner of the host extremely upsets us. The husband was nice but the wife was unnecessarily rude. Not a single smile she gave from the very first encounter to the very last. Far from friendly. I'd say one nice thing she did was letting us check in super early - and that's pretty much it.
- We asked for 2 sets of keys when we arrived. She provided them to us but not without constant complaints
- She tried to kick us out before the actual checkout date. She strongly claimed her document said we must leave on 19th, luckily we had a confirmation email that said we were to leave on 20th. After I told her, she raised her eyebrow and frowned noticeably. Then she demanded that we leave early. She complained 'this is too much'. (We were barely home and not noisy at all. What exactly is too much?? And din't we agree on chechkout date in the first place?) You might say it could be a misunderstanding, but her manner showed it all throughout the period of our stay how much she wanted to kick us out.
- 2 rooms: one with ac and the other with a barely working fan. The room is unbearably hot for sleeping. When we talked to her, her answer was 'You get a very cheap price.' So...? We were not staying for free in case you forgot. Cheap or not, you're supposed to let us know beforehand - showing honesty.
- The bathroom! I'm not sure if it's totally normal in NYC but opening a bathroom door even though you know perfectly well there's someone in it is extremely unacceptable to us. My bf's sister was having a shower when she, out of nowhere, just opened the door and walked in.
- She came and knocked the bathroom door loudly every morning - waking us up. The bathroom is right next to the bedrooms. And it didn't happen only once in each day... 
- When we asked how to open the apartment door, instead of teaching us, she gave us an annoying glance and just said it's easy. That's it. Not teaching us how to at all

I'm sorry to say this is the worst airbnb experience so far. I'm honest though. We did not expect 5-stars service but kindness and friendliness would be appreciated rather than a constant frown and ceaseless complaints.
Sean's place was always clean and they were a great host. Large room with a huge bed gave me all the confirm I needed for the entire month.
I think everything is good there , only a bit problem about the key.

Shunan's place although isn't that spacious is definitely very cozy. It's a great option if you're traveling alone and my stay was great. The host is very approachable and helpful. The only downside of this posting is that the place lacks wifi. It should be said that the guests bed is in the common room (which didn't bother me at all but can be an issue for somebody else). 

p.s.: Shunan's cats are absolutely adorable!!

The room was exactly as described, big bed, AC, all clean...
We didn't get to know Sarah personally but she did all she could to organize well our arrival, her roommate is very nice and educated, and made us feel comfortable.
The localization is very close to the subway in a vibrant part in Brooklyn.

We really enjoyed our stay at this studio in Williamsburg. We visited during a heat wave and Max was nice enough to leave the AC running so the apartment was cool when we arrived. He also made sure picking up the key was easy. We were very familiar with the area before visiting but this would be the perfect place for people visiting Williamsburg for the first time because of its central location.

Thanks a lot Andrew, we had a pleasant stay at your place. Your apartment is nice and really convenient to access by train. 

Thanks!
Daniella's apartment was clean and cosy, the hostess communicated with us consistently and even had toiletries and such available for our convenience.
close to shops,access to transport,good eating houses

Our stay at Charlottes place was great! The apartment was very clean and the kitchen was well equipped. The location was nice and in a quiet part of uptown manhattan with lots of families and near by restaurants and supermarkets. The apartment building is ridiculously close to the metro station which was great and very convenient! The only negative was that there was no elevator which made carrying our luggage upstairs a bit of a hassle but otherwise our stay was very pleasant.
Wayne was a wonderful host. The apartment is quaint and have all the necessities. Great value for an extended stay in Hell's Kitchen or Manhattan in general. Definitely recommend.
George was very friendly and respectful. He responded promptly each time . His room was in a safe and beautiful neighborhood. I suggest his place.
Hands down the best airbnb I've ever stayed at in this area. Would def stay here again. Thanks Will!

Had a fabulous time at Melani's flat for the month of October. First off, Melani is super friendly and quick to respond to messages. The apartment is really lovely and I found it extremely clean when I moved in. You've got everything you need in this self contained studio (including an in-unit washer dryer - very useful!). You also get your own private terrace which is amazing. Every time you walk in the door you're greeted by the friendly doormen and, as a solo traveller, I always felt safe and secure in this building. The location is also excellent, just seconds away from a grocery store, with everything from homeware (Bed bath and beyond) and clothing (chains like Anthropologie/Zara) within easy reach. Highly recommended!
Beautiful and cozy house, but with some cat furs

This was the perfect place to spend the holidays in New York City. Centrally located in the heart of Chelsea, you can easily move around the city by foot or on subway. 
We fell in love with the apartment. It was so comfortable, clean and new. Having a washer/dryer in the unit also made everything so much more convenient. 
Although Ryan and Carly were not in the city, they were there anytime we had a question or needed to reach them which really put us at ease. 
We had zero issues with the wifi connection and there was a comfortable TV room for when we felt like staying in and lounging. 
The kitchen is quite beautiful and fully equipped with all of the essentials (we like to cook). There is a Whole Foods around the corner and you are a short walk away from Chelsea Market.
It was such a pleasant stay. Definitely recommend it!

Amazing and clean apt located 1 minute from the subway which takes you to Manhattan in 15 minutes. Prospect park is on the corner of his place. The room is huge, bigger than the average places around NYC. Nacho was traveling during my short stay but he has a sweet roommate who was so helpful and friendly. Everything was perfect and I would definitely recommend his place.
Accurate description and great location for our purposes!
We felt like we where staying at our own home. It was amazing.

I was in New York for a conference and Maria's place  was perfect with the distance and comfort. I was not able to meet Maria in person but her roommates was kind enough to help me in check in and giving me the 411 in living in their apartment. 

The apartment is in a brown stone. No elevators/lifts. No doorman. It's on the 3rd floor (European standard). Best for light travelers and those who don't get balance issues as the stairs are a bit crooked. The vicinity is next to nice dining places and bars --- so expect some noise at night. Luckily they also gave me some ear plugs. :) 

Had to cut my stay short though as I didn't feel safe because of a break in the apartment below. I traveled with my equipment you see. 

All in all, it was OK. 

Thanks, Maria.
I like this little cozy room, very friendly roommates! Thank you, Rohan! :)

JP was such a great host. He waited outside of the building when I arrived, and even offered me his parking spot right in front of his building. The apartment itself is very clean, well decorated, and in a great location. It took 2 mins to walk to a Starbucks, subway station, food, and Central Park. The location is phenomenal. JP has great communication skills, and had answers to all of my questions. 10/10 highly recommend staying here. Thanks for such a great Airbnb experience!

Scott and company made my stay comfortable and easy.  Communication before, during, and after was great and they did a great job making sure I felt welcome and accommodated.  Also very clean, in a great neighbourhood, and close to a subway and many restaurants!  Would recommend to anyone!

Our host is an excellent person. She was attending all of our necessitys and she did all things that her could do to help us.
we are so happy with her attention, the place has much alternatives to buy and it's near to subway, that it's so great for the visitors.

I really enjoyed staying at JJ's place - the description of the place is accurate overall; the bedroom is very large & the living room spacious; whole place was clean and very tastefully maintained. 

His (Hidden by Airbnb) Richie & Eric were super cool. Locationwise this is 2 blocks from the Bedford (L) so was very convenient for a quick travel into Manhattan. He left his keys at a 'key cafe' near his flat so I could collect it anytime I wanted - everything was seamless overall.

Jacob's place is a wonderful home for anyone! It was close to public transportation and restaurants. The apartment was comfortable and in a really quiet/residential building. A perfect place to stay! Definitely would recommend this place for anyone.
