Although I did not get the pleasure of meeting Anya, she arranged for me to pick up the keys from her friend. The location was great and the roof top sitting area was great. Anya's apartment was clean and everything in the listing was accurate. I plan on using her place again!

Isabella's place is exactly as shown in the pictures, neat and cozy. The shower/bath tub is a bit old but clean. Location is perfect - it's 10-15 minutes walk from Columbia University, 3 minutes walk from the subway station and near to many restaurants. 

Isabella is a great host. Although we didn't spend much time together, she was very helpful and responds to my questions very timely.

Perry is outstanding host. He made sure that I can easily get the keys, even late at night. His house is well equipped and comfortable. Apartment is located in the best area off NYC at the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge. Manhattan is a 20 min walk over the bridge. Thanks to Perry our stay in NYC was more than good!

Jenn and her roommate Teressa were gracious and accommodating hosts. I had to modify my check-in time, and appreciate their flexibility.

The place was clean and welcoming. My friends and I all fit comfortably. It was easy to access and a quick walk from the near by train station. Great neighborhood, I would recommend it to anyone looking to be close to Manhattan but looking for an affordable place.
I didn't stay long, but it was cool.  Not is one of the most lair back people I've met in a long time.
Carolyn is an amazing host! So kind and helpful!! You should definitely stay here to explore NYC!!

Located in midtown east, Elka's space was within walking distance of many amazing restaurants and tourist destinations. Elka's place was very clean and spacious providing very modern furniture and a large TV in front of the bed. As a host, Elka was very kind and hospitable. She went out of her way to accommodate my requests and answered whatever questions I had very promptly throughout my stay. I would rent out this room in a heartbeat whenever I'm in Manhattan. Her room is great and I'd recommend it to anyone who plans on staying in New York.

Rachel is a wonderful host. Communication is easy. The rooms are lovely and really make you feel at home. If you are looking for a comfortable home away from home, this is the place for you. 
Location: The Q10 and Q37 run very frequently, giving easy access to JFK airport, the casino, and the A (Lefferts/Ozone Park, one of the A's last stops so you can catch the express train), J, and E & F (Kew Gardens/Union Tpke). The bus rides can be a pretty long, but Q10 has free wifi and usb charging on the bus. If you have a car, the free parking on the premises is also ideal.

The communication was effortless, checking-in and out was also easy, and I had an excellent stay! The place is comfortable, clean and quiet, plus the bed was comfy too. It had everything I needed and I would definitely stay there again if given the chance.

Overall I have a good staying experience. It locates in a safe community and close to Austin street where you can enjoy a great variety of food. The studio is quiet, comfortable and clean. There are towels and some of the toiletries provided. Although I didn't have the chance to meet her, her friend Frank is nice to show me around on my first day. Both of them answered my question promptly. Highly recommend this place.
Good experience nice neighborhood- I'd recommend.

Though we did not meet, Shuchi was a wonderful host. She coordinated our arrival and key pick up details in advance, and she promptly responded when we had a small issue with the keys. The apartment was extremely clean and nice; the photos don't do it justice. We felt very safe in the apartment building. The apartment is very conveniently located just a few blocks from the subway station. However, because only one line (the Q) services the station, be sure to account for the time it will take you to get to and from Midtown (about 40-50 minutes each way).

I didnt meet James, but he seems to be a kind person. He left a present for me in the apartmen. The communication was easy and in just few messages we arranged for check-in and check-out.
The apartment looks like in the pictures, the bed sheets and towels were clean. However the apartment is keep in a very poor state:
-the floor was covered with dust and dustbunnies, thanks also to a decaying carpet
-the kitchen, fridge, pots and pans were covered with a greasy, sticky film, and the rest of kitchen supplies didnt look much better
-the shower curtain and part of the bathroom walls were literally covered with mold stains
-the garbage bin has been left full and smelly.
I cannot recomment a stay until a proper cleaning will take place.

Chao was incredibily friendly and welcoming! Throughout our stay, we kept in close contact. We had a personal emergency in which we reached out to him and he got back to us very quickly, giving us very helpful advice. He also provided us with all the essentials that we needed for our stay. The location of this listing is very safe and quiet. It is also very convenient, not only because the buses and trains run very frequently but also there are a lot of stores and restaurants nearby when we didn't want to go too far to get our meals. This listing is a great deal for it's price!
David was an excellent host. He made sure I hade everything I needed and more to feel at home. He's very social and helpful.

Anthony rent's his room out in his apartment when he's out of town. It's a nice small room. He gives you access to his xbox and HBO go, etc. The apartment is nice, I never saw the other roommates, but because of that felt a bit weird using the kitchen or anything. 

Be aware, it's near enough to the above ground subway you can hear it, and close to a major intersection so you get a fair amount of ambulance siren noise at night. It wasn't a problem for me, but if you're not used to New York, it could get to you.

Ben was great! Very easy to communicate with him and very helpful at showing us the way for going to his place and giving subway explanations. He suggested us places nearby where to eat and drink, and he gave us some advices about the best things to do in NY. The house is very nice and warm, the kitchen has everything to cook and the room is spacious and cozy. The location near the subway makes easy to go around and explore Manhattan, the neighborhood is quiet and safe, you can find everything nearby and enjoy walking around Brooklyn. 
I couldn't ask a better place!
Nice, quiet and safe neighborhood. Belaid's place was great.

We had a great time at Ryan's place. Ryan and Ayanna  were extremely helpful and friendly. They were fast with their responses and flexible with requests. The apartment is located in a nice safe locale with plenty of South Asian eateries and stores around. We loved that it was a short metro ride to Manhattan. The apartment is tastefully furnished and had all the amenities advertised. We would definitely recommend this apartment.

The apartment is clean and we have access to everything we need including anything in the kitchen. It is also conveniently located to many grocery stores and laundromats. Andy is always ready to answer any question and respond to any requests. Highly recommended!

We had a lovely time staying in Peter's apartment. The place is in a great location in Williamsburg, near lots of subway stops, and is a clean, comfortable, warm apartment.

Peter was extremely helpful with any problems we had, and we would heartily recommend staying with him.

Staying at Tonys was a very pleasant experience. He's a very accommodating host, and his knowledge about the city is unrivaled. Once again thank you for assisting in making this trip very enjoyable one.
The perfect place to stay thanks!
As a solo traveler this room was perfect for me. The area has lots to offer and puts the rest of Manhattan at your fingertips. Ryan and his housemates were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend!
Great & cozy place to stay, so close to the wonderful beach & everything. Refreshing surfer's vibe. + Owners are really kind :)

I wanted to stay in Soho and experience the city away from a hotels and the normal tourist thing. Nolan was the perfect Airbnb host and made us feel like friends borrowing his flat, the location of this spot is definitely like being in a movie. Great space with a nice kitchen and modern appliances. The bedrooms don't have adjoining walls which we really appreciated and the cute fire escape was like something right out of a Friends episode. We didn't spend a lot of time in the apartment actually since it is so centrally located with great restaurants everywhere. We would take our breakfast in Washington Square Park sometimes or hang out in one of the many cute cafes on the block. The unit is on the third floor and the building doesn't have an elevator, Nolan helped bring our stuff up but it really wasn't an issue.  This is a perfect spot to experience the real New York City.

We absolutely had a most WONDERFUL experience staying in Sami's beautiful apartment. His place is exactly as in the pictures and even better. It's spacious, with lots of light, great decor and all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay.  

We loved the location!  It's a few steps from the L line, which connects you with Brooklyn and Manhattan. There are many trendy cafes, bars, restaurants, yoga studios, markets a short walking distance. There is even a Whole Foods and Apple store close-by.    

Communication was great from the beginning to the end. He was always readily available and attentive. The check-in & check-out with Michelle went very smooth.  She was very accommodating and helpful. 

THANKS Sami for the wine bottle and for allowing us to use your olive oil, condiments and pasta. You go beyond the call of duty! It was a pleasure staying at your place and we HIGHLY recommend it!

Stayed at Bert's place for 9 nights and had a really good time! The place itself is spacious and very clean & tidy, the bedroom is really nice, cozy, clean and well lit with 2 windows. One of them leads to a fire stair for the original NYC feeling :) 

The place is located in east Williamsburg with trains, cafes and stores right around the corner or within 5-10 mins by foot. Loved the neighbourhood!

Bert is a very friendly, uncomplicated host (we haven't met since he was away) - everything was well organized and he was available via phone when needed. His housemate is friendly and helpful when she's there - all in all a really good experience and I'd come back anytime! 
Thanks again and see u next time ;)

The place is great! Incredible view of the Manhattan skyline as advertised! 5min walk to the very convenient L train. The place is clean and comfortable (oh god that couch...)

Alex is a wonderful host. He was very helpful, pointing out great food/drink spots in the neighborhood, explaining how to use the laundry equipment. And best of all we hit it off pretty well, became best bros and hung out loads xD

So yeah, highly recommended :)
The host canceled this reservation 35 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Kyle's place was great. It was exactly as described. It was close to all the transportation we needed to move around Brooklyn and his roommates were so welcoming and inviting. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for nice place to stay while you're in nyc.
Everything is perfectly alright... I don't have words to explain my feelings.... My family very happy and comfortable...... Feel like a home...

Excellent location in the East Village, with plenty of great restaurants and bars all around. Short walk to a range of subway stations. Apartment has plenty of space and hosts are friendly and helpful. Not a new place, but comfortable. It is six floors up (no lift), so be prepared for a bit of exercise coming up and down. Overall, good value place in the Lower East.

We enjoyed our stay at Hayeon. It was very comfortable, clean, nice, and stylish. The journey to the train station was a bit much for us considering it was a brisk winter. I loved being in the kitchen even though there was no microwave. She even left us a welcome card with candy and guide to Brooklyn's sweet spots.
Saba & her two housemates were really lovely, and the room was as pictured - great neighborhood as well! Couldn't have been better.

Place was super clean, comfortable and convenient.   Awesome food within walking distance, (sampan for Chinese, Neptune Diner for Greek and Duzan for Middle Eastern), short stroll to subway.   Apartment is super quiet even though it's so convenient to everything.   Raul was a great host, easy check in process.  I would definitely return.

Tyler's place was perfect for me. If you like a minimalist, utilitarian atmosphere then this may also be the spot for you. The layout is quite spacious especially for a city filled with tiny apartments and the location is good, just short walk to plenty of food options as well as the L train.

Me and my girlfriend stayed for four days at Heather's marvoulous place. The appartment is clean, her housemates  are kind, helpful and respectfull. Since Heather was in vacation during our stay, we haven't had the chance to meet her, it's her housemates who helps us (espacialy Tydha) when we arrived and they where terrific. Our train had a 12 hours delay and she greeted us wormly at 7am instead of 8pm as planed (thx again for your comprehension). Finally, I strongly recommend Heather's place because it's perfectly situated (almost every metro line are at a 5 min walk distance), her rooftop is marvelous, and her place is clean, eco-friendly and comfortable. Thx again!

De gehuurde ruimte was schoon, comfortabel en exact zoals op de foto's weergegeven. De verhuurder was zeer behulpzaam en flexibel. Ook de voorzieningen in de buurt zijn zoals beschreven in de advertentie.

Brandon was a great host. Although he was out of town for the duration of our stay he made sure the keys were readily available and left good instructions for navigating the flat. He also provided us with a laundry card, some meals and recipes on the fridge, and a token to use the city bikes. 

The apartment was clean and self contained with nice furnishings, a big bed with comfy pillows, and fantastic views of the city. 

We would definitely choose to stay here again given the opportunity. Thanks Brandon.

My stay at Margaux s home was great! she sent us lot of good advices for bar restzurznt grocery in the area.Brooklyn. the g
Flat is nice sunny and clean.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Dan's and had a great experience for our first time in NYC. It was super helpful that his place was right outside the J train which made it easy for us to get around. Although Dan was abroad during our stay, his friend Vivian was kind enough to let us in and he was still able to communicate with us pretty frequently. He also gave us awesome recommendations for what to do in his neighborhood in and in NYC in general! Overall sweet visit!

I needed a place to stay in NY while my apartment was renovating and
had a great time at Victoria's place. Location was absolutely
amazing...close to tons of galleries and restaurants I love and right
around the corner from the subway so getting back uptown was super
fast and easy. I appreciated how clean the apartment was and loved the
little touches like fresh flowers. Victoria was really sweet and her
neighborhood recommendations were spot on, too (Vanessa's Dumplings =
sooo good!). Highly recommend!

I traveled to New York for a concert and debated on getting a hotel, meanwhile a customer at work mentioned that I try out Airbnb. After reaching out to a few individuals the most helpful one seemed to be Sharon. Although it was a last minute thing on my end, she did not mind. We had set a meeting time for 7 P.M. and I did end up being a tad bit late due to the fact I do not know the city. Thankfully, Sharon only being a phone call away was able to help and guide me towards what ended up being  a magnificent parking spot right near my concert destination and her home. Upon arriving at her door she was smiling, polite, and very friendly. She made everything very comforting. Sharon, my friend, and myself went upstairs to her home and I was entirely blown away. I did not expect that we would be staying in the equivalent of a 4 or 5 star hotel. Her home absolutely beautiful. She offered us all the amenities possible and it was fantastic. I did not for a second regret my decision to get an Airbnb. I think because of Sharon I will use this site again in the future, and when I do travel back to Kings Theatre I will hopefully be staying  at her residence once again.
       Just to give you some insight as to what I loved about her place. It was clean, she was an awesome host. I felt very comfortable and secure at her place. The bed my friend and I had stayed in was hands down the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in my entire life. I could literally lay there all day long. With the hot summer heat, the air-conditioning made it perfect. Although I did not watch the TV it was there and easily accessible for those who choose to watch it.
      Sharon was very knowledgeable about activities in the area. She told us great bars to go to, wonderful spots to get the best and most authentic food. Overall I could not have been happier with my stay. Everything was picture perfect and I have her to thank for that.

We had a wonderfull time in New York! The loft, we have rented from Sam, was exactly what we needed there. It was clean and there was enough space for 5 people to sleep and take a shower. It is located in the middle of Manhattan! 
Thanks Sam, when we need space in Manhattan I will found you! 
Kind regards, Fransje

Lauren's apartment was very tidy and inviting. The location is great; it is a short walk from all of the amazing East Village eateries, and also very convenient to a subway stop for those who want to venture out of the neighborhood. Lauren was a very helpful, accommodating, and communicative host. I would definitely recommend her apartment!

Mary is such a nice host. She had everything ready for making our stay comfortable and easy.  I loved the little details in the apartment.. she has coffe and some snacks for us.. She gave us great tips about the neighborhood, like places to eat or where to go and in general everything was good. She made it a good experience for us and we enjoyed meeting her for the little we talk! She had clean towels and all kinds of thing for the hair which was nice to have. I will definitely recommend this place!

The perfect Airbnb experience! We loved staying at Adam & Tammy's place; it's a lovely, clean, comfortable apartment, in a great area of Brooklyn. We couldn't have asked for a better arrangement. Though we didn't meet Adam in person, he was quick and friendly in his replies, and his roommate Tammy was incredibly helpful, interesting, and fun to share an apartment with for a few days. This is the type of experience that makes Airbnb special and great. Highly, highly recommend, and hope to stay again soon!

The flat was perfecto located dor young people. A little bit far away from metro station but in a nice neigborhood, with a lot of pubs and restaurants, moreover you can go anyway walking. The boys are so kind and friendly. Really easy to contact with them, we arrive 3hours late and they were waiting for us. All the facilities in this place, really recomended.
Hypha's place is in a very accessible neighborhood

The stay was very pleasant and the place was just as described. Laurent has been super attentive to arrange our reservation and plan our arrival. We didn't get to see Laurent but his roomates made everything they could to make sure we had all we needed and answered all our doubts. The neighbourhood was very calm and we had easy access to metro and small shops close by. Absolutely recommended, very good price-quality spot if you plan to visit NYC!

Anita rented her place for the first time and we had very good communication. She welcomed us with a very kind postcard with christmas greetings! Thank you Anita:) Also her roommates tried to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Bathroom was dirty before it was cleaned after a week. Public transportation is just a couple of minutes away. Would recommend the place for young people who like to explore the city.
Had a wonderful stay at Eren's place. Great location and beautiful apartment. Would recommend to anyone.

To start he is very welcoming and his home is cozy and chill. He doesn't have a tv but it's perfect if you want to jst have a romantic evening. Super friendly cat with amazing eyes too ! I recommend this home 100%

The apartment is just like the pictures, everything is nice, a small bed, big private bathroom, the neighborhood is nice and quiet,  a very open apartment with lots of lights and Lorenzo is very cool, had no problem to get there, or the instructions when he was at work.   I stayed for 2 weeks and it worked really well for me because the apartment it's very close for school,
Thanks to Michelle and Tyler for being such attentive hosts. The studio is really nice, well located. We really enjoyed our stay! Perfect place to enjoy few days of vacations!

Thoroughly recommend this place. Ahmed is responsive to any request and the photos match the reality. Also, it was great to stay in an area that was completely unlike what we are used to at home in Australia in terms of the surrounding residents. Also, great to have easy access to great food and cheap clothes shopping - as well as having easy access to Manhattan and all its attractions.

Everything was perfect, I couldn't have asked for a better stay! Eric really went above and beyond to make sure I had a comfortable stay - always easy to reach, very nice, and super accommodating.  Flexible in terms of check in/out, too!  Room/apartment is clean and Eric made sure I would have everything I needed before I arrived. Neighbourhood is calm and quiet, and the apt is only a few mins from the subway. Would highly recommend this room to anyone staying in NYC !
I had a nice stay at the apartment, very good location and room is as described. Taran was helpful and the price is great for Manhattan! Thanks for a nice stay!
Cem is a nice guy
Shauna was not there but the stay was good had a fun time
Danielle apartement was great! Everything clean, very sunny and the location for us was perfect! Beautiful apartement with everything u need and a very comfy bed!

Michael and his girlfriend were adorable and very welcoming. Loved te artistic and creative vibe of the place and great location, close to some cool places on Manhattan Ave and two nice parks for my dog. The room was a little hot at times but nothing more than to be expected in midsummer. Was on biz trip so nice desk area for sitting and working on a few things, good value

Staying at Byungdo's place was absolutely ideal. The room itself was as advertised, clean and convenient. Byungdo as a host was outstanding: super responsive (at any time), accommodating and very helpful. I would stay at Byungdo's again at anytime!

Arshad was a excellent host and his place was amazing. I really appreciated Arshad's communication skills, he was very helpful with any questions that came up while also being a hands off host. The place was so awesome, great location in Manhattan by the water/piers, High Rise with a great view and access to rooftop lounge! Very spacious Apt, close to many great food locations and the Time Square scene. If you like living like a boss I highly recommend this place!
Great stay! Super close to everything!

Melena communicated well with me which is very important to me.  The house was clean with towels, sheets, some non perishable food items, and tissue and napkins.  The noise level in the neighborhood was low, even for such a busy weekend.  Finding our way into the house was a little confusing as there are many doors and the keys is a little hard to use.  The parking spot was unavailable to us because the person living downstairs was unable to leave the house when we parked our large truck there, but overall we had a very comfortable stay.
Loved this place! Owner of the house definitely got taste. One of a kind Airbnb experience and would definitely return.

Mani and his wife are a wonderful couple who made me feel truly welcome and hopefully we will remain friends for a long time. We shared several meals, favorite snacks and conversations. The room was one of the largest i've seen and it's a very nice location.
Thanks for having me and being a great host!
Bekah was easy to communicate with and was more than helpful with getting us acquainted with her place. The location was very convenient and we couldn't have asked for a better value for our stay.

I had a fantastic time in Labib's appartment. He was very welcoming and acomodating. The appartment was great, exactly like in the pictures, great locations, close to subway and lots of things to do in the neighborhood.

We had a great time staying here!  Our hosts were very helpful and accommodating, it was easy to pick up the key and they were very quick to answer any questions we had.  The home is was very comfortable and in a great location, would definitely recommend it to friends!

We had a great 1-week stay at Stan's place. The apartment was centrally located in Midtown East, next to a bunch of excellent restaurants and bars. The amenities were standard for a typical New York apartment, and the space was roomy for my wife and me. Stan was very quick in replying to any messages we sent him, and we did not have any trouble getting in/out of the building. 

Just note that you'd be staying on the sofa bed in the common room, as the private bedroom is locked. Otherwise the entire apartment is available for your stay, including the kitchen and a hallway closet.
Recommended 1000%

Ekanem was a great host and very helpful throughout my stay. She created an atmosphere that was comfortable and cozy as she mentions. Ekanem has a great personality and definitely knows the area well enough to help with activities and events that may be of interest. I would definitely stay here again. Awesome place !
Great place with a fully stocked kitchen.  Slept really well here and he provided great communication in order to find the location.

Our stay at Nathaniel's room was great!
His roommates were super nice and good hosts. The area he lives in is well connected (2 minutes to subway), has several supermarkets close by and some nightlife in the evening.
Most importantly, the room was quiet at night and had a good AC unit. The bed was also very comfortable. 
What can be improved:
The cleanliness  of the whole apartment could be (much) better. 
However, we are confident that this will not be an issue next time.
Pretty good place, a little bit cold in the room.

Jared is really accommodating and quick to reply. His place is not to far from the city and perfect for both business travelers and leisure activities. The apartment has two large bedrooms, a nice bathroom and a well equipped kitchen that suited our needs. If it is something you want in the apartment, Jared is very helpful and very quick to get it! 

The area has cafes, restaurants, grocery stores, laundry and the metro with within 5-10min walk. 

If you want a good host and a nice place, I can recommend Jared. He even came and picked up us, and he drove us to the next destination when we checked out. :)
So cute apartment in a good location, totally suited all our needs :)
Heather was so nice!! She was so patient with any questions, and always responsive and kind at the same time!
James place was spacious and well designed. Neighborhood is perfect. Quite and residential but also walking distance to all the charms of Williamsburg
consider this for NYC medical professionals
Had a nice time there really fun place.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Super nice hosts!! Easy to find the place and close to transportation. Room was just like the pictures. This is in NYC so expect street noise, but the AC/fan easily covered it. I would definitely stay here again.
Very convenient and comfortable stay. Would recommend to anyone!
I love Natasha's choice of linen for our bed. Place is safe and secure!
The room was comfortable. However too small and there is not a place to keep your clothes. The neighborhood is not for walking during the night

This studio is amazing. It is perfect for a photo shoot and is conveniently located - one stop to Brooklyn and West Village. 
Zi and Alex were amazing hosts. They opened the studio on time and made sure everything was ready for us.

Great place, conveniently located next to alot of diffrent types of cafes and restaurants. Very warm and cozy place with a nice balcony and greatly decorated for Halloween. Responded and booked within 30min for stay that same night. Awsome

We had a great stay at Adam's place! 
He was a good host, easy to reach, helpful with questions, gave us some advice and helped us out where he could. 
Great location, too!

Nicolas did a great job at making sure that everything was set up and prepared for me and my friend. We had no issues with finding the apartment, and locating everything that Nicolas described in his welcome message. The 2 roommates were great, and the dog Buddy, I'm going to miss him. The room felt like it's on studio apartment, it was spacious and the decor was very nice. The train was less than 3 blocks away, and made it very convenient for our travels into the city. Thanks again, and I would love to Airbnb at Nicolas' place again.
Everything was great! The space was gorgeous and well-equipped. You and George were excellent hosts. I would definitely recommend this to friends or family if they host any future parties/events.

The place was wonderful to stay for a few nights in Brooklyn, nyc. The house was clean and the only high rise building in Brunswick. The Manhattan skyline view from the apt is superb. although if it's 2 guests it can be a bit difficult to adjust on the bed. Would stay there again.
Everything was perfect and convinience

Hillary is really sweet and she home is clean and sweet also
I love there

Most New Yorkers don't live in the snooty, overpriced southern half of Manhattan, and you shouldn't stay there either. Stay at Porsha's and discover Kingsbridge, a chill, friendly corner of the Bronx. This huge apartment is lovely, and only a few minutes' walk from two subway stations, a Metro North station, and local bars, shops, and restaurants.
It was a pretty decent stay but the property just had a weird stenche for some reason but other from that Thomas seems like a nice guy
Amazing and clean place. I'd definitely recommend.

Jason was such a sweet and friendly host. He made me feel very welcomed in the apartment and gave me great tips on what to do and where to find what I needed locally. 
The room was very small and cramped. It was obviously someone else's bedroom who had been out of town. Their stuff was all over the room and in all of the drawers so I didn't have any space for my clothes.

the place was very nice and close to the metro station J, that can connect pretty much all the others, Shawn was very nice same for his girlfriend, his roommate and the beautiful dogs Cash money and Spartacus! the room was nice and the bathroom clean, I can recommend this one :)
It was a pleasant stay for us. He was very helpful with the check in and out. Thanks.
Very nice house in a pleasant, quite area. Natalie was very welcoming, organized, and easy to contact!

Dan was an amazing host. He made great effort to make our stay as nice as possible. He gave us tips on transportation and even stayed awake late at night to wait for our arrival. The apartment is very nice, clean and well-located. Just a few minutes walking to the subway station. We definitely recommend Dan's listing :)

The Apt is Spacious, Quiet and One block away from Everything Restaurants, bars, shops etc. Joseph is Personable and Very Easy going host Made key pick up/drop off as easy as possible good communication responds quickly .
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Gillie's place is just perfect if you are looking for a very authentic NY and Brooklyn experience. The apartment is very comfortable for 2-3 people, warm and tidy, and the kitchen has everything you will ever need. The neighborhood is safe but characteristic. Connections to the very heart of Manhattan, even at night, are easily available via subway B and Q trains, whose stop is just a block away. I would definitely recommend this place for medium and long stays.

We had a fab weekend in Brooklyn staying at Robert and James's apartment. The location was perfect for us (three girls visiting from the UK), a nice quiet area with great cafes, and close to the subway linking straight into Manhattan. The hosts were in touch to check we were ok, and helpfully flexible with checking in and out times. The best bit of course was Franklin the cat who we adored! Thank you for a great stay.

Laura's room was a perfect match to me! I loved the fact, that I had my own bathroom in my room. Clean room, AC and big enough for one person or a couple. The apartment is nearby the L or F train and within 20min you are in the city. I enjoyed the stay at Laura's apartment very much and I wish her all the best in future!
Samy was extremely helpful and responsive. His place was very accommodating and it was located in a great location. I would definitely stay here again!
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I loved staying here. It was a few blocks from where I needed to work and there was a fun beer-garden/burger place right on the corner. Exactly as described and very clean -- the building is great (has a gym).

A very nice and spacious accommodation that is perfect for business travellers such as me. Everything is provided for your stay. I would urge you to visit the 33rd floor "owners lounge" as well for the views and in the morning, it provides a peaceful place to work from. I will be coming back soon.

The Studio is cozy, beautiful and very clear...Could not be in better neighborhood...East Village is magic and very cool.
Claudette is very friendly and always ready for anything. Communication was terrific nod very easy.
Super Recommended !!!

Hanley's place was pleasant. It was clean, but despite that, there were roaches in both the bathrooms and the kitchen, courtesy of the old brooklyn building.
His roommates were very cool and shared their experience of NYC.
The room in itself was clean, but the absence of curtain on the huge windows made it difficult to sleep past 8 oclock. Also, in general acoustic and thermal insulation of the apartment aren't good. Plus we weren't lucky, there was a party somewhere around the building on the first night (until 5 am), and it was as if we were in the party itself...
On the good side, the bed was comfy and we slept well on it.
Also, we had the keys and we could come and go just as we pleased.
To finish, the apartment is extremely well placed, just next to Morgan Av (L Train), and close to lots of cool places (Roberta's, shops, etc).

Wow! Everything I'd heard about your beautiful home was true. And then some.
You were a truly wonderful host and between that and your apartment, it truly enhanced my visit.

Warm welcome. Perfect location: near train but away from traffic noise. Lots of little extras to help with settling in, like clean slippers and spare beauty products. Delicious coffee. Home away from home. I love it here, and can't wait to come back!

Great place to stay during my rotations at St. John's. Close to A train and the Q22 bus which can take you up to the beach and grocery store. Place was clean and has everything you need. Quiet study space too. Highly recommend!
Very clean and nice inside , neighborhood not very safe but parking and apartment itself was great

Tonga is a great host. We were told where to go for main attraction and excitement. She even had a gift waiting for us upon arrival for the New Year holiday. We had a good time. Her place is quiet, close to restaurants and shops. Also right off the subway train station which is important when staying in New York City. We would definitely stay here again.
This place was exactly as described. It was such a beautiful little Brooklyn apartment with en-suite private bathroom that met all of my expectations!
place was clean and just as i expected it
It's a really good room. It's really convenient. The roommate is very friendly. Thx!
We stayed here for a weekend, had a really good time. The house is located in a very good location, lots of good restaurants around and very close to the subway.
PERFECT IN EVERYWAY....AND SARIA IS VERY KIND AND HELPFUL!

The best staying experience in NY. Host Eugene is super friendly, considerate and helpful. His home is very stylish and the location is close to the subway. If you plan to stay around 7 days, staying here and buying a weekly metro pass would be a convenient and cost-effective choice! You can also experience really local living environment here!

Leticia was an amazing host! The living arrangements are lovely, spacious, and clean. The back yard patio was so cute! Transportation is close and easy to maneuver. Any questions I had, Leticia answered right away. If I need a great place again in Brooklyn, I definitely hope Leticia will be available!

Ali & Dorrie are the loveliest girls ever. They made us totally welcome, the apartment was fantastic with great views of manhattan & everything was cool.
The bed was comfy, the cat was great fun & we would totally do it again anytime. thxx guys.
Maria and Kolbi are very nice (and their cat and dog were friendly, too). The apartment was clean and I liked the location. There are subway stations just a couple of minutes away.
excellent
Muy bien. Lugar
Excellent location!
Great accommodation, Nichole really lovely and helpful too.
All great everything.
good

I was visiting New York from California and I can honestly say that Katya was a wonderful hostess. She was super welcoming and understanding considering I had some transportation issues. Her roommate was also very sweet and offered some great advice on places to visit in the city. Overall had a great experience and loved the coziness of the apartment!

I absolutely loved staying at Chen's place in downtown Brooklyn. The apt was clean, modern, and quiet; and had everything you would need in a home away from home. Even a little outside balcony that wasn't mentioned in his description. 
The apartment was situated in a great location, walking distance to the subway and the Brooklyn Bridge, and to many good places to eat, drink and shop.
I definitely would stay here again, in fact, I didn't want to leave! 
Many thanks to Chen who was very helpful and easy to communicate with when I needed his help. 
I highly recommend this apt to anyone looking to stay in Brooklyn with easy access to NYC.
Great experience. I hope to stay here again in the future.

This small studio is perfectly located in the West Village right in the middle of everything. I didn't have contact with Germaine but Eliot from MetroButler was wonderful, he even responded at midnight when I arrived to help me find the lockbox for the keys! Would recommend this place for anyone looking for a place to explore Manhattan for all that is has to offer away from the touristy hustle and bustle.

When I first checked into the apartment, I was shocked.
It looks so much better than the pictures!

It's quite a large apartment by NY standards, with a big kitchen (though no microwave), a bedroom including a beautiful canopy bed, and then a living room with a sofa, big-screen TV, etc.
The entire apartment is designed in an incredible eastern style, with a little meditation corner, lots of greenery, floor cushions, and the faint smell of incense everywhere.
It all combines to create a magical, relaxed atmosphere.

The apartment is on the 2nd floor, so not too much trouble going up the stairs, and the building also has a little back yard you can access.

Catherine was definitely a courteous host, and was even quite flexible with check-in/check-out times, as well as agreeing to extend the original stay (after I saw how amazing the apartment was, I had to add a few more days).

The only small downsides are that the location isn't very close to the subway, and that the apartment is filled with so many things that storage space for the guests is more or less limited to one closet and a couple of drawers.
However, neither of those should be that big of a problem for most people.
Had a wonderful stay at Christina's apartment. The apartment is spacious and in a great location. Really friendly doormen as well. The views from her apartment can't be beat.
Great place, 5 minute walking to a subway station, Perfect for couples with kids, very peaceful neighborhood. The size of the tv is impressive.

This place was amazing. It had a very unique Brroklyn feel with the gorgeous exposed brick inside and the funky art. The hosts were very friendly and accomodating. Next time I am out in Brooklyn I would love to stay here.
Thomas had the cleanest apartment- extremely spacious- all the amenities you could ask for and the best stay of all air bnbs ive ever stayed in before- would reccomend 100%

Fantastic place in a great location. Kevin was very helpful with tips and advice. The local bars are great! The key safe system is easy to use and the sound system and chrome cast came in very useful!
Andre was a great host, everytime I had a concern or question he responded momentarily. Nice spacious bedroom.

They left me a card to welcome me to NYC which was so sweet. I felt welcomed and my first experience with Air Bnb went well. Even though I was late getting into the city my hosts understood and accommodated me.

It's very good, clean and comfortable apartment in nice neighbourhood. I'm so glad to connect with Justin for subletting his room! And he always asked me if I need something, helped with any questions, gave good advices about restaurants, bars, shows in New York. Actually Justin is good musician so if you love music you can visit his shows. 
If to summarize, I'm happy with the trip to 100%!
Una perfecta estancia, Justin no pudo ser mejor host, de las mejores experiencias que he tenido en airbnb, lo recomiendo totalmente tanto por el host como por el apartamento. Gracias Justin!
AJ and Matthew are great hosts! They are very helpful, responsive, considerate and accommodating.
Staying in Suzanne's house was super comfortable and easy. Highly recommend it.
N/a
The room was clean and the location is not that far to Manhattan. Near Jazzy's house, there are a lot of restaurants and markets as well. The reasonable price for staying few days :)
The place is very clean and close to restaurants, shops and the subway.
The location is good, but sanitation is a big problem. It did not seem to be ready when I arrived. Marva was very friendly and nice.

Great and unbelievably spacious for NYC. A good location for a stay in NYC. Next to 4/5 Train, 1 block from R train and 2 short blocks from 1 Train. Close to shopping areas like Century 21 Dept Store and Westfield shops. Close to Wall Street, One World Trade and WT memorial sites. 
The apartment itself is nice. Very clean and spacious 2 bed 2 bath on 2 levels.  Not alot of character, as it seems more like a blank canvas. Its great for 2 couples or families looking for a home base to explore and experience NYC. 
I never met Shelby directly, but we spoke through messages and her responses were mostly quick (within a few hours), and helpful if I needed anything. Picking up the key I had to go slightly out of my way, but that was because I was late. All in all a good weekend stay :)

Thanks Nan for having me and my bf at your comfy room! The room has a GREAT view! The bed is also so comfy. The location of the condo itself is so strategic, near 24 hour restaurants, near some great restaurants, shopping area is only two-three blocks away and in overall is so convinience for many interesting places to visit in NY. Nan has a roomate who really appreciate our privacy during our stay! Thanks so much!!!

Cristina made us feel very welcome in her home. The key process was easy and she stayed in contact throughout our stay! She was extremely helpful with the surrounding areas and catered to every need we had. I would definitely recommend staying here and its seriously so close to central park ! Next time we visit New York Cristina will be the first we call !
Mash was a great host I would definitely recommend his spot. Bed and couch was super comfortable and the place was very clean.

Communication with Nick prior to the stay was great and he helped us when we got a wee bit lost on the way to his place. Nick provided some local knowledge of where to visit. We were out a lot seeing the sights of New york but Nicks (Hidden by Airbnb) were friendly. The room was small especially with our two big suitcases but expectedly so in a big city.

Rebecca's apartment is just as described.
The neighborhood is great, close to shops and restaurants. We'd love to stay here again!
We had a great time.

Nice place for 4 people to stay if you need a cheap place to stay near the city! The hosts were great, and they give you fast replies too if you have any inquiries. The place is a couple blocks away from the subway station so it was really easy for us to go to the city via subway. The neighborhood is quite lively too with shops and restaurants along the street.
Caroline & Georg were amazing! They are really really friendly and the apartment is very clean. The room was enough for two and comfortable bed. Place was close to the train only 1 min walk.

Lauren was very responsive to emails before we arrived and during our stay. It was easy to pick up the keys and pick up time was flexible which was great. Her roommates were kind and courteous - we didn't end up meeting them until two days into our trip but then spent an evening chatting with them and Lauren herself! All in all, great hosts, excellent room, as advertised and would stay again.  We were even able to leave our bags after checkout to keep exploring the city before leaving.

This is a very nice room in a nice apartment, and a nice building. The room is clean and fairly spacious for the price. There are no curtains - if that bothers you. There is not too much going on in the vicinity, but there are fairly convenient ways into the city.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Very nice experience of my first trip in NYC, along with very nice roommates, highly recommend!

What an amazing and lucky find! My original spot fell through for a weekend trip to NYC, to where I was literally messaging airbnb requests from the airplane. Jeremy and Heather responded immediately, and I'm so glad they did! 

Heather was out of town all weekend, however Heather's boyfriend Jeremy was an incredible host on his own - certainly one of the best I've ever experienced through airbnb. He was kind and understanding when my bf and I arrived an hour later than expected from the airport, despite our last minute booking and his having plans that evening. And it only got better from there - from procuring an emergency sewing kit to leaving post-hangover vitamins on the kitchen counter for us the morning after we attended a wedding, Jeremy went above and beyond to ensure we had a comfortable stay! He was a friendly and easygoing conversationalist, a truly interesting and engaging personality, and an immensely kind and thoughtful host.

The room is small but decently sized for NY standards, and it was comfortable for two people. I really enjoyed the bright and airy light in the morning, through an ivy-fringed window that we could keep open all day while still having privacy. The apartment is beautiful and had all the amenities one could need. The Clinton Hill neighborhood is adorable (Jeremy had a lot of great recommendations), and its a super quick walk to the G and a very comfortable walk to the C.

I would recommend Jeremy and Heather's place to anyone looking to stay in Brooklyn - amazing hosts, great location, comfort and value make it an airbnb gem!
A fantastic place.

Sarah was an amazing host and was very gracious and helpful. She made sure our check in went smoothly, gave us some tips around the city, and even had maps/handouts ready. I would definitely recommend staying with Sarah!
Everything went smooth.  Place is in a great location.  The only con was the 6 floor walk up.

Trevor's bedroom/office was exactly as described, but in addition he's got some really cool stuff in that apartment. Great art and artifacts from his travels abroad. He's a super friendly guy and very helpful. The room was more than big enough for me to hang all my clothes and put away my travel pack and feel moved in. The bathroom is clean and the shower gets hot. There's also a cool view from the roof. 

There's a really great pie place right now the street that's perfect for breakfast, not to mention the neighborhood is gorgeous and the park is really close by, which is also gorgeous. Really can't recommend this highly enough!

The description and the pictures are the same than the reality. We were very good, feeling like if we were at home. The location is good, but the bed is upgradeable. It is on 4th floor without elevator. Also, the bathroom is very small.
Adam/s apartment was great. The living room and bedroom are spacious. He has a great collection of records that he kindly let us play.

The apartment is really nice, roomy, and very clean. Alberto and his roommate were both very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect - very close to Times Square and the Javits Center. Metro stops are also easily accessible. I was really happy with my stay and will absolutely book here again!

The place is totally different from what is posted, furniture looks old and dirty, the room has a weird smell, combination of alcohol and tobacco, it has no fridge, tv or any kind of view. To get to the apartment she took us through the back of the building and ask us to not tell anyone that we were there. When we arrived at night and asked about the view posted on one of the pictures, she was rude and ask us to leave the property. Not recommendable at all, worst experience ever.

VERY DISRESPECTFUL AND UNETICAL
I strongly recommend Not to book a stay at Sergio's place!
I have booked a room a month prior to our trip and Sergio did not answer to my phone calls and messages on the day of arrival and did not even bother to cancel the reservation on Airbnb. Which was very annoying as we arrived to Brooklyn in the evening on one of the coldest and busiest nights of the year. It took me few hours to be able to talk to an airbnb representative and find another place to go.
Jennifer easy to work with, pleasant.  Great location, basic necessities.
False Advertisement!!! Property needs cleaning. Not hot water in the showers... had to take a cold shower on Dec 31 in New York!!!! If I could I would ask for my money back!!!!
Great place and centrally located. Very clean and accurate in description.
Lovely apartment, it was very clean and orderly. It is close to the subway and a wide range of restaurants and shops.

This space is in the best location! The view is awesome and the wall to wall windows are sunny and beautiful. The private deck is amazing - great for photo opportunities. This is my favorite neighborhood to stay in- hip and centrally located- walkable to great stores and restaurants. Big, open floor plan and Megan / Matt were easy to communicate and rent from. Would definitely recommend!

This is a great little flat with the cutest personal touches. I felt right at home in Priscilla's home.

Minor things to be prepared for: 

There is no curtain in the large window facing the street, so if you're used to sleeping in the dark you might want to bring a mask. Fortunately, I travel with running bandannas and simply tied one over my eyes and slept fine.

There is no hair dryer.
The room is spacious and was clean.  The location is good, 10 min walk to the subway and 45 min from Manhattan via subway.

Alvaro's Williamsburg studio loft was perfect for a weekend get away in the city! The apartment was spotless, had super comfortable bedding, lots of natural lighting, plants, and a beautiful outdoor patio with a view of the BK Bridge. 

Perfect location if you're looking to an experience an authentic, down to earth, and livable area of NYC. There were charming restaurants, bakeries, cafes, shops and street art murals everywhere you turned. Close enough to the city that you could head into Manhattan in 30 min on the Subway. 

Great host- quick to respond and very friendly. Would definitely recommend and stay again!

The apartment is ideal for two people who are using the space as a place to relax and watch movies after a long day of site-seeing (as it boasts a large tv)

There are a number of good shops and eateries nearby not to mention the train station which is about half a block away.

The fold out sofa bed wasn't too comfortable but it was adequate for one person to sleep on.

Overall, we enjoyed the amazing location of the apartment, it was good value for money!

A beautiful and tasteful apartment on the fifth floor of a walk-up, situated on a quiet street near Prospect Park. Lovely large living room with open kitchen. Nice, private bedroom. Misha gives ample space for you to unpack your things and is easily reached for questions. The Park Slope neighborhood has great shops, cafes and restaurants, and is not far from BAM and the Barclay Center.
It is what you pay for
Great simple spot!

I had a great stay at Jared's apartment. The location is great and very convenient. Jared was very helpful and willing to go the extra mile for any thing needed. I would highly recommend this listing to anyone.

Great location. Justin's apartment was located in heart of Williamsburg, 3 minutes walk from Peter Luger restaurant. It was clean and cozy. It was a little bit noisy, because there is a subway next to the apartment. Other than that, it was awesome experience over all! Definitely worth it for the price.
Excellent and confortable place, with incredible ubication. You will enjoy it!
Great place in great lovation

I stayed at Shanam place for one month and  I loved every single day spent to her house. First thing she is really a delight, always ready to help you beyond the typical host duties.. we had great time together speaking about everything! She also really care about the cleansing and the style of the house (she hand-made some home accessories!). The communication was great, I could trusted her from the very beginning of our conversation. The apartment is really nice, with nice style and the rooms are bigger compare to the new york average. Moreover the place is in the deepest center of the city! only a few blocks of Bryan Park, Time Square and the Empire State Building ( on the rooftop of the building you'll find a stunning view with the empire state building in front of your eyes). Despite its location, the apartment is veeeery quiet and you can sleep well. Only one day was very sad for me,when I left this house!
Great location. Great people. The place was very quiet and peaceful, as well as clean and comfortable! Definitely would love to go back!

We loved staying at Aubrey's Fort Greene apartment. It was exactly as pictured - cute and quaint and plenty of room. Very tastefully decorated- we felt like true New Yorkers! Not only was it was perfect for exploring the city sites, but also it was very enjoyable to relax like a local and walk to the corner coffee shop with a book!
Hosts were great.

Lovely place as described (spacious, transport links etc.) Was really close to bus and subway links and right in the heart of Brooklyn. Denise kept me informed throughout and was flexible to my requirements. Really liked the place!!

Excellent luxury building apartment with all modern amenities. If you know a little bit about apartments in NY- you pay for thre location and amenities.  So plan accordingly and enjoy. I would stay there again, that's for sure.
Cute place, clean,  and good location.
Had a good time
The place was as described, and in a safe neighborhood. Max was a great host who accommodated me very well.
Modern, clean, and great location. We would go there again!

Zak was a great host and he was very welcoming and hospitable 
The apartment is super clean and the kitchen is fully equiped, makes you feel home 
The location is perfect very close to the subway and there are many resturants and delis in the area
Also, there is Netflix and games if you want to stay at home you won't feel bored
Overall, 5 stars service and if we come back  we know where to stay
Again, thank you Zak and Nick
Cleanliness, Location & Great Hospitality. Both hosts were very welcoming and accommodating. My stay was comfortable. Highly recommended

Jaimie's apartment is a stylish and cozy Upper East Side retreat - pictures almost don't do it justice!  She has any amenity you could need for a trip to NYC, and communication was easy.  In a city with tons of options, I'd choose to stay here again in a heartbeat.

We had a lovely stay. The place is close to subway and main attractions in Manhattan. Host is friendly, and the apartment is a good place to lay your head at night.

All-in-all - Don't expect hotel standards - but a great value for the buck.

Even if I never met Linda in person, she communicate really easy and prompt. I had no problems and no one came to bother me during my stay, I had a totally freedom and control over the place, which is perfect when you are in a new city and you can not follow  a time schedule. It s a sunny apartment with beautiful plants. The subway is near and with a good connection to Manhattan. Nice coffee places around.
Perfect location to get anywhere in the city! I had little trouble with checkin (my fault) and host resolved everything in matter of minutes. I had great time in New York!

I have loved it, starting in Brooklyn.
The location was perfect for me. During the day into busy Manhattan and in the evening the more quiet Brooklyn with great cozy places to have a bite to eat or drink.
The pizza place around the corner is amazing, best pizza ever!

The room is very spacious and cosy, there's good heating, a really nice view of the area, good commute to manhattan and Coney island, the shower is amazing and the whole house itself is spacious. There were a few moments of misunderstandings but nothing that you don't expect and every worry was resolved so we felt like we could approach Ariana if anything went wrong.
Overall, it helped us with enjoying our trip and feeling at home :)

Angel was extremely flexible around arrival/departure time, and could not have been a more gracious and helpful host. The room is plenty comfortable, with great views of this part of Williamsburg and space to unpack a bit. Super-convenient location close to the J/M/Z, the G, and the L make this an ideal place to hang out if you're going to be exploring the city, and lots of food and bars are nearby if you just want to chill in Williamsburg.

I stayed at Angel's for 4 nights. He was really helpful answering all my questions before I arrived. He met me when I got there quite late and showed me around. We didn't cross paths again until I was leaving as we were just on different schedules but was extremely friendly.

My room was a good size with lots of light. It's over a main street, so if you struggle with noise, it might be too loud. I found it fine and I normally struggle with sleep.

The location is fab. Very safe. Close to a few different subways that'll get you into Manhattan very quickly.

Walkable to many foodie spots. Definitely worth a smoothie at Grass Root. Excellent coffee at Devocion and The charterhouse. Interesting drinks at The End. Good brunch at Sugarburg.  Fab dinner and natural wines at The Four Horseman. So many more places I wanted to try.

Will definitely be back to NYC and if I'm travelling solo I'd stay here again.
Amazing place, great location.

I'm so happy I found this cozy Air BnB. My flight to NY got cancelled and Juli was wonderful about accommodating last-minute change in travel plans.The other roommates were so sweet and the apartment was clean. I can't say enough positive things about my stay.

Wonderful apartment, great location. A little street noise from the busy intersection, but our hosts were very honest about that and that's just how the neighborhood is, not a problem for us. Proximity to the express train is fantastic! The accommodations were lovely, Marina and her husband are very thoughtful hosts with great taste in decor to boot. Highly recommended!

Marina and Jake were excellent hosts and very easy to communicate with. The apartment was conveniently located near Central Park and the subway which made it an easy commute downtown, within minutes. It was a lovely stay and I would definitely recommend it and stay there again.
Excellent

Max was a very good host he answered within 24 hours whatever question we had. The apt is good just need a bit of cleaning. Neighborhood is quiet with bodegas and restaurant all around train A and public transportation 2 minutes away close to broadway Hudson River and George Washington bridge if I come to NYC I would definitely stay at Max place again. Thank you Max for everything you did for us we appreciated. Oh I almost forgot to tell you my son was delighted with all the games you have he had a blast and he too plays the guitar :)
The host canceled this reservation 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We had a good stay, and everything was as described. Pre-visit communication was quick and easy, as was check-in, and help/ support during our stay. Location was excellent, and close to a variety of amenities and public transport. Whilst in no way a surprise, it is worth noting that this is very much the hosts' full-time living space, so this is at the 'staying at your mates house whilst he is away' end of the AirBnB spectrum, and living amongst someone's every-day belongings. Worth noting too that there is no access to a kitchen area, so no fridge, kettle, iron etc. There is also minimal natural light (important for make-up, so I am told!). All in all, an enjoyable and stress/ trouble-free stay.

Kasia and her sister are absolutely amazing! They're place is so beautiful; it's cozy, clean and very bright and spacious. There are beautiful big windows and skylights throughout the house: there is one in the room which was great, it made the room feel really open and bright. We felt so welcomed from the very start - it was very much a "home away from home". They have two cats who are both so cute and friendly, we loved them! Kasia and her sister were beyond helpful and we couldn't be more thankful for all their suggestions and help with directions to trains, restaurants, etc., without their help it would've been a much different experience - they really helped make our trip the best it could be. Kasia was super flexible with the check-in and check-out times which was amazing. We will not be staying with anyone else for future trips, they are both so great there's no need to stay with anyone else! I would definitely 100% recommend staying here, it will make your trip so much more enjoyable!
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

It's an old and ok place to stay. The host is AWESOME.. And he will do anything to accommodate your request. All beds are air beds..but I requested a normal bed as I got back pain after one night. He did get one for me. So 5 stars for that. He does come and open the door as guest don't get a key. He provides water, toiletries and towels. Noise is an issue. Walls are thin and you will bother others if you watch a movie. Basically be careful while watching movies or doing things . Location and price is good for New York. With low advertised prices my total was ~$80 per night, which is good for NYC I guess.

I booked this Airbnb for my parents, who were visiting me here in New York (I live here) for a full week over Christmas. Here's what they  had to say about their stay:

We just spent a lovely week at the airbnb of John & Siri in the Bay Ridge area of Brooklyn, NY. It is located on a quiet, beautiful, tree-lined street in a row of brownstones. The apartment is on the ground level of the brownstone making it very accessible for people who may have a problem with stairs as we do. The apartment is lovely, clean and spacious with a large living room, eating area, bathroom, kitchen and bedroom.  The owners were very kind and thoughtful to leave us a nice bottle of wine, chocolates, coffee, milk, bread, butter and eggs as a starter and let us use any of their condiments we needed. With the use of Uber, we found it very easy to get around Brooklyn and to the city. The subway was only a block or two away also. Also nearby are all the shops we needed within walking distance. 

Thank you so much for allowing us to stay in your home for a week. We enjoyed it very much and hope to use it again in the future.
Anna has a great hospitality. She provided us whatever we need immediately.

We couldn't have asked for a better Air Bnb for our first 10 days in New York. Jocelyn and Adam we super friendly, kind and helpful hosts who gave us loads of recommendations and made us feel right at home. The room was beautiful with loads of light, comfy sitting area and great amenities too! Would highly recommend to stay with Jocelyn and Adam.
Louise's place is really nice and she was very helpful during the entire stay. It's a 5 minutes walk from the Subway which takes you to about anywhere in NYC in 20-40 minutes.

Very accommodating and helpful. Highly recommend. Street was dark at night and there wasn't a door bell/buzzer but I can live with that. Couldn't have asked for a better host. Felt awful that I could have cleaned up better.

Chloe is an awesome host! She is super nice and helpful! She gave us bunches of tourist sites and told us where to get cheap ticket for broadway show. Basically, she is a superwoman! She knows everything. We chatted quite a lot. She always know how to make people feel comfortable! About the room: it is pretty neat! It locates at the neighborhood of black and Caribbean people. It only takes you less than 12-15 to get to the subway. Anyway, Chloe makes everything look better:)

Location was perfect. Small walk to Time Square. Plenty of restaurants and bars. Clean, cozy, modern feel. Jennifer was very flexible with our schedule. We will definitely consider booking again on our next trip to NYC.
Very good location, right next to Time Square, Michelle is such a good host, rooms are clean and spacious.
Marina was always contact me if I need something and questions, she was very nice. She make me feel like her friend!

Undine hosted us marvelously well. Ours was a last minute booking. For the quote we got, the place was as indicated on AirBnB, breakfast arrangements were made and the space was private and very clean.

To anyone it may concern, Chayla's place was beautiful, clean, spacious, modern, fresh and in a perfect lively and walkable area to all the best attractions of NYC.  Best of all Chayla was the perfect balance of professional and personal, and beyond accommodating to make our stay in NYC perfect.  She went above and beyond for us, hearing that we had previously had a bad experience with an AirBNB which was misleading and threatened to ruin our Mom's 60th birthday experience, especially being her first time in NYC.  Thank you to Chayla and the lovely staff @ The Wyndham.  We would not hesitate to recommend her to others and her place!
It is A really pleasant trip,the room is clean and is big enough for our five people,I really appreciate!
The host, Sam was traveling in Europe but she still communicated very smoothly and made sure that her roommates let me in. My overall experience was excellent. I would definitely stay again.

This was the perfect space to rent for my friends/family coming into town. It's in a great location and close to Rockefeller center with many subway lines. There was some time share discussion on check in but they really left you alone. Overall very clean and great spot!
Great place and location!
The place was very centric!! It was very easy to check in, and the staff at Wyndham were very friendly and helpful, I highly recommend this place, I know I will come back again to this spot!!!
Really enjoyed my stay here, nice location on a quiet street. Greenpoint was really cool and the room is nice.

Paolo's room is even nicer in person than in the pictures.  Gorgeous view, tons of sun, and very elegantly furnished.  Paolo was exceedingly accommodating, even going so far as to leave hand written notes with his favorite spots for me to check out around the city.  The place is super conveniently located right next to the 1 on 86th, which makes getting anywhere a breeze.  The only thing I'd warn others about is there is some noise pollution, it is the city after all.  I wear ear plugs so it wasn't a big deal for me, but if you're used to perfectly quiet nights in the country it will be something to adjust to.  Anyway, would recommend! Thanks again Paolo!
Overall stay was ok. Apartment size is good enough to for 4 people.
exellent accomodation,Alex is responding promtly and is very nice. The location is very convinient for visiting Manhattan. Loved the place and will come back

Senya's place has a great location and was very tidy. We faced some real communication issues, and the bathroom ran out of toilet paper. I would guess that the confusion we faced was a one time occurrence, but the stay definitely wasn't worth the price we paid.

The apartment is located in a safe, family friendly neighborhood, with three grocery stores close by. Christina's apartment is beautiful- well appointed,  immaculate, incredibly spacious  and comfortable.  We highly recommend it!

The apartment is located on the fifth floor of a warehouse; no elevator. Lots of graffiti on the walls up the stairwell, which kind of add character to the building. The place itself is artsy with a run-down feel, but has basically everything you need. The lighting in the bedroom is kind of dim. Brian was really accommodating of my friend and I sharing the room for the month, and even added a mattress to the room for us. He was gone for most of my stay there, so we actually had the apartment to ourselves most of the time. He has a black cat that is very sweet but looks sickly - apparently, she has a condition that just makes her sneeze a lot and is not to be too concerned about. The immediate neighborhood is a bit dead, but the place is walking distance to the subway.
These were no house keys when I showed up, other than that, things were good.
Un piso genial, tranquilo pero cerca de tiendas y el metro a 5 minutos. 10/10

This is great place in a fabulous location - we are Brooklyn locals and we were staying at the loft while our home in Oarj Slope was being renovated---with our 4 cats!!! Ramsey was a kind and responsive host, and he responded instantly whenever we reached out. 
The neighborhood is FULL of great places to eat ( Meadowsweet, Diner, Loosie's Cafe, Marlowe & 'Sons, a wonderful Italian place Barano are all within a block or two) as well as great markets , juice and burger joints and  bars, places to dance and see live music...a few blocks away is the river and the Ferry and a few blocks in the other direction is the JMZ subway . A great base for exploring all that Brooklyn and New York City have to offer!

Danielle was a wonderful host. Super kind and welcoming. (Upon our arrival, she had a bottle of Moscato for my husband and I to enjoy for his first visit to NYC.) Her home was quaint, quiet (even though you are super close to the above ground subway train - its literally a 3 min walk), and lovely. She has everything you could need to prepare something, although we rarely used the kitchen... there was WAY too much amazing food for me to be cooking, and Danielle also has a list of her fav restaurants and take out food in the area. This came in handy on our late and exhausting arrival to NYC. The place is PERFECT for a couple looking to getaway. The shower/ bathroom is amazing!! And she even offered bathroom necessities, such as soap, bubble bath, etc. Also, if you were to leave anything at home, you are (again) a 3 min walk from a Rite Aid, a beauty supply, and a REALLY good coffee shop (I wish I could remember the name!)

The home IS Danielle's home, but she was kind enough to clear everything away, so that my husband and I could use her storage areas. Literally, the ONLY thing I would make a comment about is the bed. It is definitely a firm mattress. If you own a firm mattress, that will not be a problem, but for me being that we sleep on a pillowtop, it took a bit of adjusting. However, I would DEFINITELY recommend Danielle's place a 100%! I hope she continues to host! Everyone she experience her loveliness and her little Bushwick Retreat.
Great location!!! Great host!!!!!!

My girlfriend and I had a lovely stay at Amara's place. Amara and her housemates were super friendly and helpful and the house was clean and well equipped. Close to the 3 subway line and in the middle of a lively and multicultural area. The place has so much class and artsy charm that the cat drinks water out of a martini glass. Will definitely look to stay here again if we find ourselves in New York in the future. Thanks Amara!
Our stay at Lynne's was very pleasant. The place was neat and comfortable. It was easy to get around. Also, Lynne was very kind. Overall, it was a lovely experience.
The place is great, roommates are nice people and it's a fast commute down to midtown

First and foremost, Maxime is a terrific host. He was attentive, helpful, and totally focused on making our stay into a wonderful experience. The location is also superb in many ways; it's right next to both the subway and within walking distance of a terrific set of restaurants (mainly soul food). On the other hand, the apartment is also near a hospital - and so the main downside to its location is that the neighborhood is a bit noisy, even for Manhattan. Our stay was a bit unusual in that we used the apartment for BOTH lodging and work. So during the day, we used the main showroom (that's pictured in his profile) for a strategic planning meeting, and it proved to be a terrific and creative space for us - which was a huge bonus.

We had a wonderful time staying at Ella's place for the New Year's eve. Ella is very friendly and easygoing. Check-in and check-out was easy and smooth. The room is a bit old, but cozy, well-decorated and artistic. Sometimes we heard load noises upstairs, but probably it's because of the New Year celebrations. The neighborhood is safe, lively and very close to metro. We loved the Bagel Pub a lot, and it's a great place to grab a cup of coffee and fresh bagels for breakfast. Overall, I definitely recommend staying at Ella's place.

Unfortunately we had a terrible experience with this rental. We rent a large room for up to 4 people. We were in 3 and there were not enough beds for everyone. We tried to contact Chaila, but we only got contacts after a long time. We were tired from a long drive, and in NYC it's not easy to find somewhere else. When we got in touch with her, she had the urge to offer us a discount and at that discount we bought an inflatable mattress. THE PHOTOS DO NOT CONDIT WITH THE OFFERED SITE! THEY ARE FALSE. Absurd. After a long time she got a room in the same building, however who was going to be my wife, my 12 year old daughter and me. We had to sleep apart.
Regarding the place itself the WIFI was awful. The other items were good and new. The location is good too.

Just left my FANTASTIC stay at Russell's 2 bedroom apartment in Williamsburg. Location was RIGHT ABOVE the L stop at Lorimer Street. Let me say that this alone made my trip so much easier. I was in Manhattan in midtown Manhattan 10 minutes from the time I got out the door. You literally take the stairs up from the subway and the door to the apartment building is right there!!!

The location is simply amazing, so many places to eat and grab drinks just within 2 blocks of the apartment. This is the really "happening" area of Williamsburg.

Apartment is long which I like since I was with another couple, made sharing the unit very easy! Everything was very clean, updated, and to my expectations. The apartment was large relative to many others I've stayed in the area. Bedrooms were massive and really didn't feel cramped up at all.

Metrobutler was our contact and the service was exceptional. They sent me a welcome email that covered everything, greeted us at the apartment, answered all my questions, and I had a contact the entire time to tend to any concerns.

Can't wait to come back!!!

I've spent 4 Nights at Sebastians place. Access to the apartment was very easy and we found everything as expected. Sebastian was easy to communicate with also he made our stay as comfortable as possible. If I travel to NY again, I would like to be his guest again, too.
1st class service. Courteous, friendly, clean, above and beyond the best.

I had a great time staying at Leah's place, she communicated very well with me and made sure I was okay throughout my entire stay. Her place is cozy, very modern, close to restaurants and nightlife and fairly close to the subway. Would definitely stay there again!
Great place and location - hope to be back soon!

Marie is a super nice person, very helpful, i have accident in my plan cause my arrived time delay to midnight but Marie had me sorted and made me a smooth check in. the apartment is clean and comfy, very close to subway station and park, my wife and i spent a morning walking through neighborhood and across the Brooklyn bridge, just a wonderful experience.highly recommend!
We had a wonderful stay at Mady's room! The location and her place was good - clean and comfortable.
Very much enjoyed staying here. An affordable option and convenient location that we were easily able to hop on the subway to the city if we wanted.
Nice and clean, located in a good area. Just be aware that there is a dog there if you have any allergies.

Had a fantastic stay in Brooklyn! All communication with Sandra was great, didn't get to meet her in person but met with Brendan her housemate and he was a superb host and gave us great tips on how to get around and things to see! Would be more than happy to stay there again!

Great experience. I had my cousin visit the city, and this place is amazing. The location is premium, supermarket downstairs, steps away from the train station. The room is spacious with all the furniture ready. Samer is a great host who's very helpful and friendly. Overall a great experience.
