Location is perfect, everything you need is within walking and the subway station is less than a block.  It's the perfect little spot in a great location.  Thanks, Emily!!!
Judith was an awesome host! Everything was more than great. I do really recommend her place.
Great place to stay
Large, open room with a good view and close to the subway.

What a great experience ! Petes boat is clean comfortable and he is very experienced and (Email hidden by Airbnb) munication was great throughout and is was nice hanging with Pete as I was traveling solo. I felt comfortable and safe staying on Petes boat and would highly recommend booking this if you are looking for a different safe and awesome way to travel. Thank you Pete I look forward to sailing with you again

This is a spotless home that you ever experienced! Perfect location, quiet and everything is just great! Jehsohn is a really nice guy, helpful and generous. I have never stayed a place like this. Highly recommended to everyone!
Overall nice home and very nice hosts
Good.
Good location, good price.
Great gem, safe and convenient to all that is needed.  So many bar and restaurant options.

Kosuke's place is efficient but down-to-earth and artsy. It is a comfortable, small apartment located on the second floor. I found it very easy to walk anywhere in the East Village and the L-train was only five minutes away. Furthermore, check-in/check-out were quite simple. Kosuke was always very friendly, responsive and attentive during my booking and subsequent stay.

Tal was very responsive and the check in/check out worked out well. The neighborhood is great and the apartment is conveniently located very close to the metro. The apartment lacks some light, but it's very usual for NYC apartments. Overall good experience!

What a beautiful place to stay, we loved this place! 

ever since we got in the luxurious lobby we knew we made a great choice, the attendants were very nice to us.  When we stepped in the apartment we could feel the warmth, It's so beautifully decorated, clean and smells delicious, just like home.  Caio (our host) was very nice and kind to us.  We really felt welcomed and comfortable with him, but what i loved the most from this experience were the NYC views from the bedroom and the Rooftop, absolutely breathtaking! We're now leaving NYC with many memories in our minds and our hearts full of gratitude with Caio for making our stay so pleasing. thank you!
Excelente

Caios place is amaaazing! His apartment building is beautiful and has roof top access. I found that the view from the roof here was better than any roof top bar I could find. It was such a comfortable stay. I would recommend his place for anyone. It was our first time in NYC and we felt so fortunate to have booked his place. Thanks again Caio!
Very nice place, surrounding. Masha was very helpful.

Ronna's space was perfect for our family holiday party, which included about 15 adults and about 8 small children. There was space for adults to sit and relax and enjoy a meal with kids playing on all sides. We also were lucky to have Ronna prepare an incredible holiday feast for us. Everything was perfect.

An easy walk to the subway station making this a good location to see New York. Easy check in and out. The space is a little bit tight, but to be expected in New York. We like the neighbourhood for restaurants and shops.   Good value.

Basic accommodation, great value for the price. Excellent location near Central Park and many restaurants and stores. Easy to walk to subway or bus lines. Nishant was very attentive to my many questions about staying in New York. Know that he shares the apartment with 2 of his friends. I would recommend this to a friend.

This is the most beautiful loft located in the heart of Williamsburg. It's surrounded by cafes and nightlife and close to public transit. Even though it is in the center of everything, it's very peaceful and quiet inside. Every detail in the house is special. One of the rooms is actually a nursery but has a cozy single bed. Couldn't say enough amazing things about this place. Josh who looks after the Home is also very cool and accommodating.  Wry grateful to have stayed there!
goede communicatie, gastvrij

Kasey is a great guy. Super friendly, smart, and easygoing. He also has great taste in music, so if you get the chance to get recommendations you should. His apartment is really big for the rent, and the neighborhood is a great community. Really close to the laundromat and a nearby grocery store. It may seem far from Manhattan but the A and the 1/2/3 are reliable and fast. If you get a chance to stay with him don't turn it down!
Great place, very friendly host, fast check in, and great location!
Probably the best stay I could possibly have :) Clean room, 30 seconds to the closest subway, great communication
Great location. Near bus and trains. Lots of shopping areas for groceries and dining or drinks.  Home away from home.
Really lovely, clean, kind house and host.
Absolutely wonderful. Great communication.

Great place, Rico was a wonderful host, so funny and have sense of humor, was always around for any help. The flat was so clean and comfy, the room is same as pictures. Close to subway and easy to go to anywhere. Neighborhood is so safe even late at night. A place to recommend for a one traveler who likes to stay as a local. Thanks Rico so much, definitely will book it again next time.
Great location, friendly host.
The host canceled this reservation 3 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Marissa & Enzo were very welcoming. The place is located right near a subway station and lots of places to eat. Very easy commute to and from Manhattan. They have the sweetest cat. Thanks guys for a great trip in NYC!
Very nice apartment with a lot of sun, good commute to Manhattan (1 minute to 7 subway), very nice and safe neighbourhood. I really liked it!
Everything was clean. Andrew was very responsive and it was the perfect space for somewhere to stay for the night.
Clean and spacious, good location close to the seaside. Allen was really helpful. would stay again!

Chang is really nice. She made sure that I have no problem of getting into the house. The room is big. The house is close to grand central station. The area is pretty safe. I have no problem walking back around 11pm. After all, nice apartment. I enjoy my stay a lot. Thanks so much.
Justin's place was great and as described. Communication with Justin was excellent throughout, Id have no hesitation to stay at his place again!

Steven's apartment is all one could wish: comfortable, clean, extremely well located. Steven is a very nice and helpful young man and so was his friend Nastascia. I recommend this place highly! My overall impression was a very positive one, no negative points at all!

I stayed in Sigi's apartment for six weeks renting her daughters' room. I had a wonderful time, the apartment is spacious and stylishly decorated with object from all over the world. Although Sigi was travelling at the time she was most helpful communicating and her co-host Jenny made sure everything ran smoothly for me. Thanks to Sigi, I had an awesome NYC summer.

Initially I was feeling unsure about how this space would be (sharing a studio apartment), but I was pleasantly surprised! It was much like staying in my own room with no door. The apartment has great windows and a bathroom, kitchen, and in the building, laundry facilities. It's close to times square and above a starbucks, which is convenient. I stayed with Jessica's roommate, and she was friendly and helpful.

Overall I really enjoyed my stay and recommend this AirBnB!
Super friendly and helpful couple! Great terrace and really comfortable place to stay, always clean, with washer and dryer! Many thanks to Ale and Arturo!

Zoe's room is really clean, tidy and comfortable. When you're used to a futon the bed is comfy too ;) The apartment is pretty close to public transport and it was easy to find my way into Manhattan and back. During my stay Zoe was not there, so unfortunately I never had the chance to meet her. But the communication beforehand was good. I met her roommates but they where both not really interested in chatting, so can't really say anything about them.

Ben was a fantastic host. He was extremely accommodating in the check in process ensuring that everything was handled smoothly. Ben is a responsive host and the apartment is very clean and in a great location. Would highly recommend!

Easy walk to the C train, great bedroom, good kitchen space, kind and helpful roommates -- great place. Move in & move out were smooth, and communication was good. Would recommend to anyone looking in this area of Brooklyn!
Excellent comftable place in perfect location. Katerina was great at communicating.

We were one of the first guests to ever stay at this Airbnb. Host was great , always kept in communication with us and the process was very easy.  The apartment has a great location, walking distance from J and L lines as well as shops and restaurants. It's a great stay for people who are gonna be out and about and don't plan to spend much time in the apartment.
Cecilie's place was comfortable and accommodating and was just what I was looking for in Williamsburg. Great location, perfect for a thrifty stay.

this place topped my expectation. i thought it was a room i booked, it was to my surprise an entire apartment in the basement. i felt very peaceful there and had everything i needed. my own bathroom, my own kitchen and a private entrance. i felt very lucky having found that place and i can recommend this airbnb stay to everyone who appreciates privacy and tranquility. Thank you much, Jasen.
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Ludine is a awesome host! I got some tips about New york from her. She respects privacy of guests. The location is good, peaceful neighborhood. 
Only one thing, there are no curtains and blinds in the room and there is stairs outside of the window so it can be seen by neighborhood.

Donald's place is located in a great area close to all the "must-see" attractions in NYC. You have Lincoln Center, Times Square, the Pier, etc all within a blocks walk. The subway is a 2 blocks walk. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area as well- you can eat something from another part of the world everyday in the area. Donald's building is new and very modern- A/C  and washer/dryer are a great help to a traveler. He has all the other amenities as well. Donald is a great host, providing you with amazing recommendations of places to eat and see. This is a must stay on AirBnb!

We had a lovely stay at Laetitia's apartment in Brooklyn. The apartment was very clean, cozy and minimalist - exactly what we had been hoping for during our first visit to New York city. It was extremely accessible by subway, only a minute walk away. We enjoyed the area - within short walking distance there were plenty of grocery stores, hip coffee shops and restaurants. 
We did not have the chance to meet Laetitia in person but she was always prompt in answering any of our questions before and during our visit. She gave us many helpful suggestions and tips about the area.
All in all, we had a wonderful experience staying at this Airbnb and would recommend it to anyone seeking a true Brooklyn experience!

Book it! The house is at a great location, everything at a walking distance from the house ( subway, restaurants etc). The host Louiza, was very helpful with suggestions and tips. While she was away, the landlord ( lives next door) helped us with what ever we needed.
Beautiful apartment, so clean and confortable. Very well placed, close of subway, supermarkets, bars and restaurants. The owner is very attentive and he is aware that everything will be perfect.

I had a great stay at Xela's place! It was ideally located, close to great restaurants, cafes and bars. Also it's only a 2 minute walk to the subway stop. 
His place is super cool too! Lots of light and really cozy. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a little bohemian paradise.

I highly recommend Caitlin place. The bedroom was very clean. I used the kitchen and the shower every day. Everything was working. Also the neighborhood is awesome, I loved the vibe on Bedfort street.
Great location and local feel!

The room and the apartment are very cozy  and comfortable! Close to the subway
We had some problems with settling in an apartment, but the hosts tried to solve all the problems as quickly as possible!

Amalya was super nice and everything worked out perfectly. The apartment is close to the subway and a lot of bars and restaurants. Her flatmate was very friendly as well and the room fit Amalya's description. The shower and floor were not very clean, but who lives with (Hidden by Airbnb) should be used to it. We would come back!
Lo recomiendo..
Excellent cozy studio. Great location to all the New York City sites !!!!
This is a nice place to stay with kids to enjoy Brooklyn and NYC.

I enjoyed my stay with Rosa and her husband. Quiet neighborhood, very peaceful at night. Great communication with Rosa. They made me feel comfortable  I recommend this place. The location is great. 
Thank you for being my host Rosa.

This was my smoothest, most worry-free, and most accurate Air BNB stay so far.  The apartment was immaculate.  Check in was stress free.  The doormen welcomed us into the building family on day one.  Beautiful kitchen and home we might choose if we moved to the city.  This allowed us to pretend like we were real New Yorkers.  The Metro was very convenient and we used it daily.  You'll want to get an unlimited Metro pass for the duration of your stay. The location isn't in the heart of major tourist sights but Central Park is just a short walk away and it is spectacular.  Being on the upper West Side makes for quieter streets yet still innumerable dining options. This living, breathing home is exactly the from which I like to experience a city.  By the last 48 hrs of my one week trip people were asking me directions in the park, on the street and on the subway.  That makes this stay very successful by my criteria.  I cannot recommend this property highly enough.  You won't be diappointed.  Ideal for a families because of 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms and modern kitchen.  Nice urban neighborhood.

Phil
Nice location at reasonable price. The sofa bed is just right for me. No noise issue. Will certainly recommend to travelers who want to get around NYC.

Terrible and dirty place. Roommates nagged about water on floor while the whole area is covered in black hair, and toilet is not flushed properly. The room is terrible, dirty. Kitchen is completely impossible to cook or eat unless u are okay with food poisoning. Shower wearing some shoes unless u want an infection. Also, make sure your towel does not touch anything unless u are not disguised by the condition of the bathroom that had not been cleaned since December 2016

He cancelled on us the morning of our reservation. He said it wasn't available and offered no assistance. Just a one line email. Then he told me to cancel- do NOT cancel your reservation if he does that! Contact AirB&B and they'll take care of it. Show them your correspondence and they will help you. They were great. I would never attempt to rent from this guy again.
Eric was accomodating with arrival time. His place was close to the subway. The place had beautiful art and was LGBTQ-friendly. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Jenny's place is at a good location, within walking distance to many places to visit in the city. Jenny left us clear instructions for our stay, and the room was clean and comfortable. I only hope that the common areas of the apartment are maintained a bit cleaner in the future.

Perfectly clean apartment, Nneka responded quickly, easy in and out, friendly roommates, free toiletry basket of goodies was so clutch!  This stay made running the Brooklyn Half Marathon so less stressful.  I would stay again.

Suri was amazing! A previous airbnb did not work out so I booked Suri's place the day of and she was quick to respond and very helpful. Her place was very clean and cute. I just needed a place to sleep and shower. It was a few blocks to walk to the train station and then 20-30 min to manhattan from there and very close to Williamsburg by Uber.
Nice apartment in a great area.
Great apartment in a great location. Felt right at home.

Roosevelt Island is so much calmer than Manhattan it's very refreshing. The room is a nice size, the desk and bed are cute. My favorite feature of the room was definitely the huge window looking out to the river. I loved being able to come here after work everyday. One of the roommates, Lisa, was fantastic! Very accommodating and showed me around.
Quiet, comfortable neighborhood. The backyard was a bonus, although we didn't use it nearly enough. The house was very clean when we arrived and the entry instructions were simple and easy to follow.

Our family had 2 weeks at Kimberly's place. The apartment was spacious and had all we needed for our stay. 
The beds were comfortable (with the exception of the sofa bed) and there was plenty of room to hang clothes in the upstairs bedroom. We enjoyed preparing meals in the large kitchen. The massive dining table was spacious for us. 
Kimberley was quick to respond to any request. The hairdryer broke and a new one purchased the next day! 
We met Kimberly and she was very hospitable and friendly. 
During the stay 2 couples (at different times) had booked the additional room meaning that 7 people were in the apartment at one time. This didn't seem to be a problem as our schedules didn't clash. The downstairs toilet was helpful. It was great to meet fellow travellers. 
Initially the heating was very efficient however as the temperatures dropped and a snow storm hit we felt the cold. 
The noise from tenants from other apartments was the only other downside. The wooden floorboards were loud and the music and conversations could be heard from the bedroom. 
A short walk to the Metro and around 20 minutes into Manhattan. We didn't really explore the area but spent most of our time in the city. Uber was cheap to use also.

Had a great stay at Meredith and Yong's apartment. It's a lovely neighborhood with trendy bars and restaurants, and the apartment has a backyard. They are kind and generous people, who were responsive to questions and troubleshooting.

When I say the pictures don't do it justice that isn't an overstatement. It's HUGE- super cool, comfortable, elegant...kinda perfect.
Arina was amazing- their staff fantastic, fast, reliable, sweet. Beds are so comfortable, pillows & sheets soft, towels fluffy. Kitchen gigantic, washer & dryer awesome, sofa for 5, a SWING!!!! Fast internet, giant tv's- an elevator to your own floor...
I feel like a jerk because there isn't anything even slightly critical to say. Right in between East & West village- too bad CBGB's is gone...that's the only bummer...but hardly their fault.
 (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
The place was amazing as advertised and location was great too. Thanks Lu.

This was my first airBnB experience. I couldn't get a chance to see the host but her roommate was very welcoming the apartment. I had a really good time there. The room was clean. Subways was 3mins away. It's worth spending time there!
Nice place on a main street, close to public transportation, parks, restaurants. Roommates are quite. The only issue was ac, but I think it will be fixed soon. Good experience overall.

What a wonderful lady! The location is so convenient. I'd stay here again for those two reasons alone. It's literally a half a block to the bus to the Ferry, so I was in Manhattan in 25 minutes.      

The neighborhood is totally safe. You can walk around at 3 am in this very racially diverse area, much like where I grew up, so I felt at home here. There is a laundry mat a block away next to a grocery store and Rite Aid and a rent a car (but who needs one!)  A few blocks the other way there are a few 99 cent stores and great places to eat. I loved the Wig store! How fun. Great prices and friendly people. Bought 3 wigs! The other areas of town are close by bus as well, and the train station is close by. I do a lot of Airbnb, and this was by far the best place to stay, as far as transportation, in all my history of traveling.     

This is an old building built in the 1920 and in need of repair, so do not expect polished perfection. She is working on fixing it up. I love old buildings, was raised in one, so it was great for me. Felt like home. So much character. She has the room on the first floor and Airbnb on the second floor. Tenants on the upper floor, but I rarely saw them. I stayed in the shared room, but no one was here at the same time so I had the whole second floor to myself. The bed was comfy. I especially loved the big claw foot bath tub. So nice to soak in!     

There is a fridge and freezer in the tiny kitchen and a gas stove. Yay gas! And a microwave and toaster oven and bottled water. She provided snacks, and so I barely needed to buy extra food except for dinner as I tend to be a snacker anyhow.      

So I will be staying here again. A wonderful lady and so convenient to get around. Give it a try!

The place is surrounded by beautiful old Brooklyn architecture and huge old-growth trees lining the streets. The walk to the subway is very pleasant, indeed! There are also lots of interesting restaurants and cafes in close proximity. The apartment itself is lovely, with hardwood floors and overlooking greenery. Elena and Artur are both very friendly, welcoming and helpful. It's very easy to get a hold of them and they are very responsive to inquiries and requests. I highly recommend them as hosts.
Pictures better than reality.

Haya is a charismatic, selfless and just fun host. She's very inviting and the times spent talking with her and her roommates were very jovial. As for the place, it was very clean, exactly as described and nicely decorated. Haya included everything you'll need to make yourself comfortable and is always communicative in case there was anything else. The location is very convenient with a 5 minute walk to the J/M subway and being right next to Broadway it's very easy to grab some toiletries or late night cravings. This was a great experience and I highly recommend Haya as a host!

Way cool creative living space. Hip young ppl in a relaxed atmosphere. No tobacco is a real plus. Cute pet turtle. You can be yourself there. Close to public transit, affordable groceries and funky-little shops and stuff.  
Do it!
Great place for a short stay.  Location was perfect and Cameron was an outstanding host.  He was responsive and accommodating, and his place was super comfortable.  Highly recommend

This spot was just perfect, new and clean and central location (across street from MSG and Penn station) Melissa was more then helpful and hospitable and easy to communicate with too!! I would come back here anytime I'd be doing something in mid town Manhattan...Its also across the street from most public transportation and again Melissa was a pleasure to deal with from start to finish!! A++

Jamal's a very friendly & kind person. The room is indeed located in a great, up & coming neighborhood, which I loved. There's easy access to the subway, a million restaurants, several pharmacies and many grocery stores. If you are not familiar with the area, please note that this is NOT Manhattan or Williamsburg. It has a very different vibe. 

The building has a minimal gym for basic exercise and has a decent place for doing laundry. 

In the apartment, there is a strong smell of incense which some may like and others not. 

My biggest concern was cleanliness/maintenance in general and specifically that the apartment floor, kitchen counters and bathroom were not very clean. They appeared not to have been seriously cleaned recently, with large amounts of dust, water stains and occasionally other unpleasantness.
a lovely spacious place with wonderful views and very private. Special for New York

It's a great place to stay if you are moving to the city and need a place to get you on your feet or if you are exploring the city. Quick access to neighborhoods in Brooklyn and Manhattan! The place is super nice and Veronica is super helpful!

Saxon's place was a wonderful base for a week in NYC. A lovely bright apartment with great amenities. Would definitely recommend!
Superbly located: half an hour to JFK, half an hour to Manhattan, in a great neighbourhood with plenty of nice bars and restaurants, as well as Prospect Park a stones throw away.
Excellently equipped: Great kitchen utentsils and tools for the evenings in, extra towels and bedding if required, and really comfortable furnishings.
Super Communication: Saxon was great at making everything clear from arrival to departure, and gave some great tips on good places to go in the neighbourhood.
Ro was a fantastic host! Communication was great, checking in and out was easy, and his home is beautiful and comfortable.

As a medical student, it was a great place to stay close to Maimonides Hospital. Quick to the hospital and easy to explore Brooklyn. A bit far from Manhattan, but easy enough with the Q train so close!

Thanks Alyssa!

I think she had good intentions, but this is not a place that should be rented out for long term stays. Firstly there was a fly problem that may have been caused by the multiple leaks in the ceiling. The kitchen sink was not suitable for cooking in the way that common kitchen sinks are. Also there was  a dust problem with the air conditioning.  Additionally the shower water pressure was bad so it was not ideal for someone who wants to stay for a month at least. And the shower also leaks a lot. Furthermore the air conditioning had to be on at all times because the windows couldn't be opened. Also one of the air conditioners was leaking and it got on all of my clothes. I was also expected to personally pay someone to come clean the apartment which isn't really usual for airbnbs. Sometimes people will charge a small cleaning fee but take care of that themselves. And there was also the added expectation that I take care of her plants but I wasnt told soon enough to be able to properly care for them.
So some things just need to be changed. Overall, the apartment is a nice size, nicely decorated, easy to keep clean, and close to transportation (for the most part). It was nice that she allowed pets. She also has a giant bookcase for those who like to read.
Thanks, very Good

Great place for location and value. 
Very easy access to subway. Walking distance to many cool locations.
Very approachable host. Sent us a new heater on a quick notice.

The house was clean, and the housemates were quiet, courteous and considerate. I'm a sensitive sleeper and appreciated that the house was located in a relatively quiet neighborhood with little traffic noise. Zeeshan was a friendly, helpful host.
Great first time in New York city thanks to this place
Great place to stay at manhattan

The apartment is well located, close to subway stops, shops, restaurants and bars. It is well decorated, it is small but the bedroom size is alright. 

It is provided only a small frying pan for cooking and kitchen cupboards are closed. 

For clothes it is provided only one box in a drawer and some hangers in a closet shared with their stuff.

Daniel was always available on the phone trying to help.

Nice, safe and secure location, supereasy commute to downtown. However, pictures are fake, the apartment is smaller and alot darker than it appeals in the pictures, the room is narrow as hell Although it looked bright and spacy in pictures, not for claustrophobic. During warm days the room can get almost 90 Degrees hot. Ac was not set properly, ceilinglamp didn't work. Door was so flimsy so it just opened on its own by draft. Kitchen and bathroom were dirty. Whole apartment smelled like dust. Wi-Fi password was unclear. Connection is Ok.
Nice flat and great host  ! (sometimes it can be a little noisy, but it was ok)
Elisabeth and Anthony will be there to help you out any problem you may have. Great people
Stacey was extremely communicative and quick to respond, friendly and accommodating. Thanks Stacey!
Responds very quickly.   Very helpful and friendly.  The house is exactly as described.

I couldn't have been happier about Pat's apartment and my stay there!  She is the most amazing hostess I've had (easy check-in, lots of tips about places to go and things to see and how to get xyz done most quickly and easily). The apartment is on Upper East Side, very conveniently located near subway lines and buses, walkable to Central Park and Carl Schurtz and East River.  It is a nice and comfortable place with all amenities.  The rooftop is spectacular!  An added pleasure!  And the doormen were extremely nice.  It was good to have an added sense of safety and peace of mind knowing they were there if I had any questions. A wonderful place to stay!  I'll definitely return often.

The location is perfect! Right off the 1 and the C trains and in the middle of everything. Hells Kitchen is right there, so is you want some night life or dining. The place was exactly as described. I enjoyed having the security of a concierge and the gym was a plus! Bryonha pretty much left me alone unless I inquired and she was prompt on getting back to me. Check in and check out were a breeze! I would stay here again.
Nice place, very close to MSKCC/WCM/NYP. quiet neighborhood, highly recommended.

Hsiao's place was clean and the perfect size for two people. She was very quick with responding to messages and left us wine and access to her Netflix and Hulu accounts. We were too busy to use any of this, but it was a thoughtful touch. Her place is right next to a great coffee shop and a short walk to Times Square. The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, but overall we had a great experience.
Kanyis is one who is the best kindness and considerate I've ever met. He always thinks about us. Thank you so much.

I stayed Alanna's place for 2 months with comfortable. Great neighborhood and other room guests. I worked from late night to early morning, but I felt safe from closest L line station to my place. Thank you, Alanna! I really enjoy to stay your place.
Great studio in a perfect location. Walkable to restaurants, bars, a convenience store next door. Steps to 3rd Avenue, walkable to Times Square/theaters/subway.

Ellena is the best! Such an amazing host! She's extremely kind and accommodating and made me feel very comfortable during my stay. Her apartment is so charming with a clean room and comfortable bed. I loved staying there and you will too!

The place is centrally located and walkable from Broadway 35th street and Empire State building.
The subway station was just two buildings away.
nice crazy shared flat
Great location near everything!
Nice studio , closer to many shops and subway !)

Raymond's place is beautiful, spacious and the location is great, we enjoyed the garden very much. It's walking distance to restaurants, stores and museums. We would definitely like to stay here again when we visit NY!!

Heather saved us from a difficult situation. The original place we booked cancelled on us, and we needed a new place to stay last minute. Even though Heather and her family were about to leave for their holiday, they accepted our booking request and got their home ready for us. 

I couldn't have been happier with the way things turned out! Especially with the cold spell that NYC experience while we were there.

Heather's place is right around the corner from the C train and just two stops away from transfers that will take you wherever you need to go in the city. We were grateful not to have to walk far to get to the subway or buses. It was also helpful to be able to run to Fulton St for quick errands and food. The location is wonderful. 

Heather's home itself is also great. As soon as we walked it, we were struck with how light and airy the apartment felt (while being wonderfully warm!!!). The space is well used and easy to navigate. It is beautifully decorated, so that you feel like you are home (or at least the version of home that you always intend to create but don't ever seem to have the time to : ), but not overwhelmed by someone else's stuff. Everything was clean and comfortable.

Thank you for a wonderful stay and a great end to our trip back to Brooklyn.

This was a comfortable stay and primary issue was a wifi problem that was resolved eventually and difficulty having host, Nicole, relay information to non-English speaking roommate. Probably best for a vacation rather than work related trip. Roommate is extremely kind. This is a great neighborhood and building is clean and quiet at night.
Rly was really nice, very responsive throughout the stay and the apartment was very comfortable for one.

The stay at niki airbnb was amazing the place was clean and comfortable and not only that niki is very cool she is a great conversationalist and she is a pretty good artist to boot so to all who might come across her airbnb you surely will not be disappointed.

Parth was an amazing guest - super friendly, with a great sense of humour and super resourceful. I couldn't have had a better stay even at one of the top hotels in Manhattan. His automated home make it an extra special place to stay. I cannot recommend him enough and will definitely be staying over next time I'm in NY.

I definitely don't recommend this apartment. That was my first (and I hope last) bad experience of renting on Airbnb.
Our host (his name is Tal) wasn't at the apartment the time when we (me and my boyfriend) were staying there. It couldn't be a huge problem if he helped us to solve all the problems we faced there. And we asked him to help us. He said he couldn't do anything cause he was not there! So instead of 2-months staying we decided to cancel the second month.
Now I want to list the main problems we faced at that apartment.
1) Dirty bathroom. 
The floors, the shower were really dirty. No one cleaned it before our arrival and during our stay there. 
2) Noise, smoking marijuana and nonstop partying even at the night time!
Guys who live there had noisy parties in the kitchen every single day! They smoked marijuana and that smell was even in our room! We also cooked our food while they were smoking..
3) We had to buy the small pull-down table to eat in our room. Cause the kitchen was always full of people: the people who live there and their friends.
4) We couldn't cook pork and shrimps.
The host didn't report beforehand (and didn't mention this in the description) that they all did eat kosher food. So we couldn't cook it. 
5) The host texted us not to use the big trash can in the kitchen cause we didn't throw the trash away. But we haven't used it at all.
6) He also texted us not to use the main barthroom (except the shower). So we used the main barthroom only to have a shower.
7) We couldn't use the dishwasher (it was in the description) cause the guys of the apartment asked us to wash the dishes by hand. It wasn't a big deal for us, and we washed it after every single use but the host put the info about the dishwasher in the description.
There were not all the problems we had at that place. I just listed the most huge ones. 
The place was totally uncomfortable and unsafe (we didn't have the key of our room. And the apartment was full of many people every day).
Monica is great! She went the extra mile to ensure that I was able to access the building in her absence. She is Very flexible and accommodating also.

Great location, right by transit so it was easy to get around.  Perfect set up for family of 4 with 2 growing teenagers.  Very comfortable.  Be prepared to walk up stairs, it's a great work out.  Loved the roof top spot. Two beds have the memory foam toppers.  Thanks, I would stay there again

I'm really glad I stayed here for my first time in New York! I did a long term stay for an internship and felt at home right away. The apartment is really clean, cozy, and in a great location. Very close to the subway and bus stops. There are a ton of good restaurants and bars in the area as well. Before arriving Gaby communicated really well and offered to (Hidden by Airbnb) since my stay was long term. Gaby and Grant are super nice and very welcoming! They know the area really well. Always gave great suggestions on where to go and what to see in NYC.  They also have the best cat!
The location was excellent for traveling to Manhattan
Great location and price. Host keeps her place very clean and is super helpful and communicative.

Michaels place was excellent. The room was bigger than I expected and it came with a night stand and a dresser. If you're aware of New York City prices, there's no denying his place a deal. Micheal was a wonderful host, really easy to get in contact with. I truly enjoyed my stay. 

Additional note: if you are a meat eater, there is no cooking meat in the kitchen.
no comment
Lindsay made our stay very accommodating and welcoming. She was very communicative as well, which always helps make trip-planning smooth and easy. Would absolutely book her apartment again.
Pretty aggressive host when things don't go her way. Totally fine until she's not, in which case she'll immediately kick you out.

emilia and zak were both very helpful and accommodating. they answered all questions we had and even replaced the AC window unit while we were there because there were some unanticipated warm days. while the garden level apartment was cool without AC most days, it was so awesome that they were concerned enough with our comfort to go out and purchase a new unit. we stayed for a total of 35 days, so our experience was unique, but we really got a sense of the neighborhood and the locals during our time there. we could not have been happier. navigating the city with a toddler was difficult, but it was great to have a safe, VERY CLEAN, and comfortable place to come home to after long days! 

emilia and zak's place is in extremely close proximity to some great neighborhood parks, and just as close to the L train. getting to manhattan was a breeze and the commute time was great. if you're interested in an authentic brooklyn experience, helpful hosts, a ton of living space, an awesome back patio and an all around wonderful experience, this is place is definitely a winner!  plus their sons are adorable!

Shawn is a really nice host. He's friendly and easy to get in contact with if you ever need anything. The apartment is nice, quite and clean with a great little backyard where you can eat your breakfast. There's everything you could possibly need at he's place. We had a really amazing and easy stay here.
Lorenzo is a super host !!!
Kind hospitable people! +Home cooking

I stayed at Sarah's place for a week and it was great! Check in and out was super easy and flexible. The apartment is great and nicely decorated, bathroom is super clean and the shower is great! Sarah's roommates were extremely nice and respectful. I would reccommend her place to anyone!

Alessandro is a great host, his place is beautiful, super clean..and he's an incredible 'roommate': quiet, thoughtful & generous. He's always willing to help out with any question or doubt you might have. This is a great apartment to stay in. And it has a washer and dryer that you can use...which is AMAZING in NY. I highly recommend staying here. It is definitely great!
todo estuvo perfecto
Tim's place is in a lovely, quiet neighborhood overlooking a beautiful park. The furnishing is tasteful and cozy. Tim was very easy to communicate with! Thank you Tim!

I reserved what looked like a lovely place - and may be! - but Jarren never responded to queries on how to check-in. I finally called AirBNB less than 24 hours before check-in and AirBnB informed me Jarren was cancelling the revenue.

Great location near the subway and lots of food spots. Osama and his roommate Mike were super accommodating. The bed was comfy and you can control the air in the room, which was great for when I stayed in the peak of summer. It's worth noting that the apartments is on the 4th floor so be prepared to walk a few flights of stairs with your bag(s).

Joseph's home is warm and welcoming! I loved all of the books in the living room and the HUGE balcony. 
Despite it's great UWS location, the apartment is super quiet at night.
I highly recommend checking this place out if you are lucky enough to find it available!

Our stay at Rudy's place was absolutely perfect. The appartment is very well located, and really nice. It looks exactly as the pictures. Plus Rudy was always reachable and very flexible for checkin/checkout. We definitely advice to stay at Rudy's appt, perfect place to stay and be in the middle of the Big Apple! Thanks again Rudy!

Such a beautiful and comfortable house in the best New York borrough Brooklyn - Prospect Park area .. everything was perfect .. the house, the check in, the contact during the stay ..etc .. if you have the opportunity to stay in the house ..Please do so!

Joey was a great host and a nice guy with great knowledge of the area as he grew up in Brooklyn. His home was very comfortable and had great light and lots of space. He recommended amazing tacos and Jamaican food all in within a few blocks. Great trip to brooklyn! Great stay in joeys room! Thanks joey!
The room is big and clean. Location is very good. Great experience

Convenient location close to subway lines that take you all over the best and most visited places in NYC. The apartment was clean, modern and in a safe location - perfect for couples and families. The hosts were friendly and hospitable. Overall a great place to stay!

WOW! This space was great! Paulina was INCREDIBLY helpful and accommodating to any requests we had. What a great, cozy, space. Although it was a bit of a walk to the nearest train station, there were plenty of restaurants around the area to keep us fed! Would definitely return in the future!
Great spot for business or leisure travelers. Centrally located to transportation and park.

Bonnie was an excellent host. She went out of her way to make sure I could check in early, and was always available to answer any questions I had. I especially appreciated the care Bonnie put into her apartment, she came by often during my extended stay to clean the common areas, which is definitely above and beyond for an airbnb host. Her place was a great value, my only comment is that it is a little bit far from the trendy areas of brooklyn and manhattan.
The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 73 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great space in a great location! Thanks Marie-Louise!
The place is GREAT!  5 mins walking to Central Park, subway and super market, the price is very good in Manhattan! perfect choice
Exactly as advertised.

This place is one of the best living spaces that I have ever lived in. The owner is welcoming, the backyard is spacious, and I have all the basic amenities that I need in the house (e.g. AC, kitchen etc). I became friends with the people that I live with, which is probably the highlight of my stay, since everyone has interesting backgrounds. This place is very close to the L-train, which is very convenient for me to get to Manhattan. I would recommend this place to any longer-term young traveler!
Amazing unit. Alyssa was very helpful in everything! Unit looks amazing in person! Will definitely book again!
The room was very clean and Tito the host was remarkable. He made my visit great, I will always book with him when I go to NY.

Masud's place is very neat, train station, grocery shops and almost whatever you need is within walking distance. He's always available to assist when you call or text. Will definitely recommend this place. Awesome hosting.
Clean spacious space with all the amenities you need including laundry in the unit. Ample work space. Big screen TV includes access to Netflix. Comfortable beds. Responsive host. Highly recommended.
Good location & friendly host; however, the house definitely requires more cleaning  (esp. the shower) to get rid of all the vermin in the house!!
We had a great stay at Vicky's. Location was perfect as it was close to family we were visiting. Vicky's roommates were very nice. The accommodations were as described.

3 friends from high school and I stayed at Irvings place. It is in a sweet location, easy to get to the subway and walk to the park. This place is great for the price and his roommates are very nice. There was definitely enough room for the 4 of us for the week.
It was a very convenient place and comfortable, it was a shame the window was broken and therefore no AC but we had a great stay and would probably stay again if in New York

Nice place to stay with great people and Mum the dog :)
comfortable and exactly how it is describe. Very well welcome by Lindsay and roomates, very nice people. ++ for the warm towel, I appreciated after a long travel.
Very nice and clean apartment.

Amanda's home was lovely and just what we were expecting only enhanced by a larger than expected backyard, very comfortable bed and a roof deck! She was great at communication and very understanding when we accidentally lost her only set of keys locking us out! Her home was clean, large TV, updated kitchen and most of all, super close to beautiful Brooklyn Bridge Park. A beautiful place to visit and stay the week.

Great location: right next to Morgan Ave. L train that takes you in just 15 min. to Manhattan (Union Sq.), close to great restaurants/bars/coffee shops in the area. The place is a beautiful spacious loft with large window, lots of light. Peter was a great host. Perfect stay if you like Bushwick or never been there and want to explore this area.

This is an adequate option for lodging, however be aware this is a primarily Hispanic neighborhood with few options for dining / entertainment.  The lodging itself is a large room directly on Broadway, somewhat noisy with no AC.  Close to the trains is convenient.  I did not meet Morgan but she made easy arrangements to enter the location via her landlord located in the bldg., and was available via phone/text.    The cleanliness could use some improvement.  I don't think I'll use this option again.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Rick is a good host. 
Good communication and instructions

I thought all was good that I found such a cheap and accommodating place to crash while I visited my friend in the Ridgewood area of NYC and reserved a couple of days in advance. When my flight landed around noon, I messaged the host stating I was going to grab lunch and then head over to check in but she said she just saw my reservation to stay at her place and that she would not have the room ready until 8 pm that day. I gave the benefit of the doubt since I paid only a few days earlier and all I had was a backpack, no luggage, so I did not mind moving some plans around to check in later. But then she said she had a date at 9 pm giving me a narrow check in time and not being accommodating towards me whatsoever. She said would call me when she was heading home. 8 PM came and no call was ever given, I tried calling the host and she did not respond until I got Airbnb involved and I had to cancel the stay. She finally said that a mistake occurred and that she was out of town for the weekend, forcing me to find another place to stay late in the day. I am not exactly sure how the room and location are but I would be more understanding if the host had canceled on me in the beginning when she found out my reservation got accepted somehow, but she was unprofessional and I find it unacceptable how I was treated.
Host was very kind and welcoming.
I enjoyed my stay! Highly recommended.

Beautiful place in a perfect location! 

Highly recommended!
Weiwei's place was exactly what I needed.  Its a perfect spot for someone who is looking for a nice simple space to have as a homebase.

The building is better than previously thought. It has elevator and doorman, and more important, spectacular river view. The room is a suitable size. The only downside is that the room and the bathroom can not be locked properly .

Great location! Away from the tourist crowds, but 5 mins walk to the subway. The apt is super-spacious and the kitchen updated. It is a 4th floor walk-up, no elevator, so keep that in mind if you have mobility issues. Pierre and Bicqui were very responsive and very flexible about the check-in and check-out times to accommodate our arrival and departure flight times. Great hosts, and great apartment!

Balca's place was exactly as pictured/described. Perfect for our needs, enough space for 4 adults - 2 grown boys in bunk beds & they were happy. The area is lovely plenty of eateries and nice shops great for breakie/quieter time on way home from exploring Manhattan etc. Well connected with subway routes too. I would highly recommend booking for those who like places with a bit of charm, interest and space to relax and those who want to experience 'living' in NYC. We didn't meet but all our - many - questions were answered fully and promptly and a relative met us on arrival and answered a few texts too. Great stuff - thanks again Balca

Kim has a beautiful and LARGE space in Tribeca. It is very close to world financial center/Brookfield place where my husband works and ground zero/the oculus. There is just so much to do, see and eat in the area. Ultimately, we chose Kim's Airbnb because we needed two bedrooms and a washer/dryer while traveling with our 16 month old. The second bathroom and huge living area were an added bonus! The older elevator was a touch tricky for us with a stroller but at least there was one. There is a no shoes policy which I appreciated because we don't wear shoes in our home either. It kept the space super clean and tidy which is always a concern for us with our toddler who gets into everything. My husband travels to NYC often for work and the next time we tag along with him, we would certainly consider staying here again!

This is a great place, and is exactly as it is described.  It's conveniently located, the inside contains a lot of great art, and Jenni is an excellent host who communicates well and makes all necessary preparations.  I will be checking its availability if I'm in the area again.

The flat is well located, really close to public transport to be able to go to Manhattan and the line gives you access the all the other ones. The flat is clean, next to a park, air con is working (important for the summer) and has all equipment needed.

I would recommend the place and will probably book again if I go back to NY.

We found the apartment very dirty, with no effort made to even put things away. We felt a bit gross walking barefoot in the bathroom and the sitting area was not usable as there were piles of stuff on the couch etc. I'm guessing this is a shared place with several roommates, but we had no idea who else was staying or if the other bedrooms were Airbnb guests as we never met anyone and just came and went with a door lock key by ourselves. This didn't make us feel secure about leaving any of our stuff, so we just left in the morning and toting suitcases around to breakfast. It also doesn't seem reasonable to leave a pet cat without the owner being there...we have cats and are very used to them, but I didn't expect to be left with someone else's pet. Although he was very sweet, he woke us up all night wanting to come in and out of the room as his owner wasn't around. This felt more like borrowing a key to an empty frat house than an Airbnb.
The host canceled this reservation 50 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Excellent location. Super close to public transport. Free parking! Great communication with host although we didn't get to meet. Only downside would have to be cleanliness. Could have used a wipe down of floors and bathroom. Overall great location and value.
Very good im communication. Close to the train. Diverse neighborhood

The apartment (with a gym and a rooftop seating area) was clean, spacious, well located and equipped but the best of all was that the host was extremely helpful with my stay (e.g., spending time showing me around the building and extending my late check out)...... and charming =P.  Thank you Mike!

Tashya was an excellent host! Seeing that this is her home, she takes good care of it and expects the same from her guests. She communicated clearly and frequently to make sure we had everything we needed. It was great to feel at home while so many miles away.

The location was also perfect. It was a quick block walk to the subway with a few restaurants and Prospect Park up the street. It was easy for our large group to navigate each day. While we didn't explore their neighborhood too much, it was in a convenient location that got us around the city and to popular attractions in 30-40 minutes.  

 I would definitely stay with Tashya again!

Had a nice stay over New Years. Sofia is very friendly and always promptly replied to communications. The location is in a quiet neighborhood and only about a 17 minute walk to the subway. From there you can get to Times Square in about 20 minutes. The room was clean and spacious.
Excellent

This was the worst Airbnb experience ever, no person should be able to host with apt in such condition. Place was dirty, there was some trash on the floor, place hasn't been swiped for like a year. Strong unpleasant odor and candles don't mask it at all. Bathroom in horrible condition, with mold and dirt. No one should live in this conditions not to mention become an airbnb host and charge  $100 for this room. "You will NOT love this room"!! No self check in possible, no parking on the street. Just worse experience ever I had to leave immediately.
Amazing location. Lital is very nice and the apartment is very clean and close to everything downtown.
Narmeen was a great host, super friendly and caring. She helped me every step of the way and I would stay again if this booking is still available in soon!
Great place very artsy
It's a dirty place (the kitchen and bathroom specifically) but if you don't need the kitchen it's okay. Close to many places and the station is a 5 minute walk.
Zack was really great with communicating with us from day 1. The place was beautiful, clean and convenient. Had an awesome time :)
I had a great experience staying here! Maddy is a great host!

Jason's apartment is located in a prime and lovely location surrounded by markets, restaurants, coffee places etc. It was really easy to find everything and information provided was really informative and simple.  We really had a pleasant stay.
Lisa's place is in a great location, very close to multiple train stops. The apartment is very clean and Lisa was super accommodating. Definitely recommend staying here!

My stay with Louise was phenomenal. The apartment was beautiful, in a perfect location and overall 10/10. Louise was amazing with communication and wrote out crystal clear instructions for everything from the wifi to things like the shower. Thank you Louise!!
This place is everything in the description. Note that the 2nd bedroom is upstairs. It's a great location with a nice view.
Wonderful location and Twist was a great roommate. Had a great time.

Noah's place was great to stay! He is very close to public transport (can be in Manhattan in 15mins), his bed is super comfy and the place is very easy to access. Noah was also very quick to respond to any questions I had and very lovely to deal with. I only met one of his housemates whilst there, but he showed me in and was very friendly and helpful. From this location you can easily head to plenty of restaurants/bars etc in brooklyn and also make your way to Manhattan to explore. I would very happily stay at Noah's place again :)
The place was great, located in nice area with bars/restaurants. Adam was very helpful and communicative. I enjoyed my month long stay.
Shannon offers a clean, beautiful private room that was perfectly located to NYU medical center. She was easy to communicate with and made me feel right at home for my visit.

Molly was a fantastic hostess. Responded very quickly to any questions I had. The garden was so great to have. I had breakfast out there a couple of times. The place was clean and quiet. Would definitely book a stay here again.

I had a wonderful experience staying at Joe's.  The neighborhood is nice and their apartment is fantastic, the room and bathroom were very clean and updated.  They supplied my room with complimentary snacks and water bottles and made me coffee with a cute coffee and cream/sugar set up each morning.  The small touches were welcoming.  I highly recommend staying with Joe!
Great value and location!
It was phenomenal. The room is so comfortable, the roommates are great and the location is perfect. I have nothing bad to say about my stay.
This apartment is in a great location, and is ideal for a couple wanting to explore New York.
Everything was great, location was amazing. Communication and hospitality superb.
Cosy apartment only 2 blocks from subway. Vivianne keeps it very clean and did everything she could to make us feel comfortable, always respecting our privacy. I would definitely stay there again!!!

Bill was a phenomenal host! His place in Williamsburg had everything I needed, it was super clean, it's down the street from the metro stop, and the outdoor deck is unbeatable. Bill was also an excellent communicator,  he let me know what times he would be around, gave some awesome rec's for food, and is just an overall great guy. Having a clean, cool apartment to come back to after a long day of sightseeing was crucial. I would absolutely stay at this place again, and highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.
Hangi'a place was clean and so comfortable to stay at. Would highly recommend!

Stephanie and Sarah were absolutely wonderful hosts! They went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was as welcoming and comfortable as possible. 

Communication with the two was extremely easy - they went above and beyond to make a group chat so that one of them would always be able to answer any/all questions at whatever time. We let them know that we couldn't find their blow dryer upon arrival, so they made sure to stop by while we were out and surprised us by leaving it in a noticeable spot. This simple gesture was more than enough to show what kind and sweet hosts they were. 

Their apartment was absolutely beautiful - plenty of space for the three of us to stay, and everything was cozy and inviting. The location was just a few minute walk to public transit, and there were plenty of local restaurants, delis and shops nearby as well. 

I will definitely be booking with them again whenever I return to the city! Thank you so much Stephanie and Sarah for making our stay so easy and enjoyable!
The apartment was very nice and clean. It was also easy to communicate with Sebastien regarding any questions and he was very friendly and helpful!
My stay was great. The apartment is very well located. It is confortable, clean and cozy. Benjamin was always checking up on us to see if everything was fine. I highly recommend it

Amazing location - tons of restaurants and bars in the vicinity.

Very clean, modern apartment with a very nice newly renovated bathroom! 

Will be sure to visit again!

Stephen too is a great host - very prompt with communication and helpful too!
The roommates were nice, its about half a mile walk to the metro

This thing (dirt, bugs, smells,dust, night noise) could have been fun if I could have shared about alternative art and culture with the host (what you can expect with the description), but as I've been confined to the basement (no kitchen, no fridge, no towel even if you ask politely), it was not possible to meet these people. I had to leave this place early and lose money. Very disapointed. Close to the subway.

Jenna was an amazing host, although I didn't get a chance to actually meet her But she was quick to answer any questions I had. Great location definitely recommend staying here you can't beat the price for the location your in!

HaaJar was an AMAZING host! 
Very friendly and accommodating 
Apt is exactly how it is described and very close to public transit
Thank you for having us! Can't wait to come visit again

We were in New York for the US Open and we enjoyed Fabrice's apartment.   We found it larger than expected with two large bedrooms on two levels.   As described,  it has a nice yard with a barbecue grill.   Fabrice was nice enough to leave us coals for the grill.   The apartment has a well-equipped kitchen combined with a dining room.  There is no living room per se.   The neighborhood is lively with outdoor cafes by the park.   The street is very quiet but close to a commercial street where one can find everything.   The subway station is around the corner with easy connection to Manhattan and the US Open.   We did not meet Fabrice in person but he checked with us by phone.   He had a friend waiting for us when we arrived and she showed us around.   Everything went well.
Great value place close to public transportation. Short commute to Manhattan.

If you are traveling on a low budget or wants to have a kitchen, ask the host about their studio room if its available (i highly recommend since you got more privacy and have own bathroom as I've read on previous reviews that  you need to share bathroom on the other rooms ) Location is very convenient since its  3-4 blocks (10min walk) away from the mall, restaurants, and subway.  There's a dining table, dresser, fridge and kitchen was complete with plates, pans, and silverware BUT PLEASE clean it very well or boil on a hot water since kitchen cabinet has a lot of baby roaches.  (literally killed 6 of them) There's a 1 full size bed and two sofa beds.  It was 3 of us so host was very kind to buy an extra bed for the 3rd person instead of letting him sleep on the sofa bed. Wifi connection was good as well. There's a TV but we couldn't figure out how to make it work since remote was not working or we just don't know how to set it up but no big deal. Bathroom was clean but the shower space was too small so the water keeps on leaking from the door so it makes the bathroom floor wet and they don't have extra floor towels. Lots of hangers. Ask host to bring garbage bag upon check in. Our stay was awesome. Will definitely recommend to my friends if the room is available. Gave $50 deposit which I think there's no need for future guests.

What a perfect place to stay! From the minute we checked in everything ran so smoothly and we were delighted to arrive to such a clean, stylish and cozy home. It's just a short walk to the subway and there's a convenient small deli nearby with all the simple foods you could need. They even make fresh vegan sandwiches! We couldn't have asked for a better place. Highly recommended!

Laura's place was the perfect spot to stay. She lives close to the train and a lot of bars and restaurants if you don't want to travel too far. She was a gracious host and a fun person to talk to. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone planning on visiting Astoria.
Amazing HOST!!! By far the best experience you can ask for when traveling on a budget. I was in a rough place when I was met by the MOST generous host I have encountered on Air Bnb.

Keianna's space is very nice and cozy. The mattress you sleep on is very comfortable. The living room (which is your room) is a good size with a desk and coffee table. Keianna really respects your space. It almost felt like I was in a studio apartment. The kitchen is very small but there is everything you need there to make a meal. The bathroom is in Keianna's bedroom so you have to go in there but she is happy to let you in whenever. She does have a cat that likes to explore which I found slightly annoying but not really a big deal. The apartment is a few blocks from both the A and 1 trains which is very convenient.  However, when going out, communicating when you are coming back can help prevent you having to wait outside since the door is hard to open. Any problems you have, you can go to Keianna and she will try her best to resolve it! She is a great host and has a wonderful space. There are some minor drawbacks but my experience there was well worth the money. I would definitely recommend staying there.
Maria was a wonderful hostess. I would definitely stay again.
Nice quiet crash pad near the trains with close proximity to shopping and good restaurants. Easy check-in. Great communication. Hassle-free stay.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The host canceled this reservation 11 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I had a great time staying in the private bedroom at Haozhe's place. Even though I shared the apartment with three other guests, it felt very private, and I was directly across from a shared bathroom which was clean and had a great shower. I was most happy with the quietness of the room, the A/C and fan, the comfortable bed and great pillows. Plus very fast internet. It was everything I wanted and suited my needs perfectly as I was working only one block away. Subway access was good too, with several train options about a 5-8min walk away. Lots of great food dining options in the neighborhood as well.

Krystin's place was perfect. Everyrhing was clean and ready when we arrived. 

She was very accomdating and helpful throughout the stay.

The neighborhood was fun and easy to explore with tons of great things to do only blocks away.
Very homely and nice people to share the space with would recommend to a friend.
Erik is a very king person. His apartment is well located and clean.! I'll recommend!
Nice location  close to the subway n bar. Ofer is nice !

At Stephanie's I had a perfect month in a most welcoming environment -- and by that I mean the host, the flat, the other residents, and the neighborhood! After long days in the city I looked forward to coming "home" for solitude on some days, and enjoyable conversation at the dinner table on others-- Stephanie makes the shared living experience something to look forward to.  In addition, the location -- between  three distinct neighborhoods, each with unique, useful and enjoyable offerings . . . and never far from a metro was ideal.
The host canceled this reservation 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The rooms are very small, like cubicles with no private ceiling. If you're taller than six feet, you won't fit on the beds. That said, it's very convenient to other things. I'm glad I tried it but probably wouldn't stay there again.

David was very friendly, the room was floor but a nice flat overall in a great location, convenient and not far from the subway. Would recommend for short trips and people who just want to spend their time outside enjoying NYC

Great host. Stayed late so we could check in which was highly aporeciated. Astoria is a nice area that I always enjoy visiting. Place is close to the N train which makes it easy to head into Manhattan.

Dalis has a very nice apartment. Her place was clean and she has quite a nice book selection and that piano is great. I'm from the Bronx but have moved out of NY 12 years ago and I completely forgot about the parking issue. 
 I had to drive around for 40 minutes looking for parking.  Next time I will take public transportation or call a cab.  Dalis was a good host and her neighbors were nice...they even invited us to a birthday party!

Very modern and hip setting, quiet neighbors, and a very convenient distance from the train. Location is also great to reach any other burrough in NYC within a reasonable amount of time. Cleanliness wasand superb and the windows are in a key area facing the sun to make sure you dont oversleep and can make the most out of your trip.

The bathrooms are filthy. Roommates were rude, would speak Russian all hours if the morning when coming home. Inconsiderate. I had to change rooms due this. Highly do not recommend for anyone seeking a clean space to simply wash your face brush teeth.
The room was exactly as promised, and Remi was very responsive.

Richards room was an amazing place to stay! Location is unbeatable, right in the midtown, building was great with all the amenities. Clean room, everything was provided. Would definitely stay here again
Our stay at Ali's place was a great experience. The place was clean, spacious, quite and the host was really helpful responding on time to all our inquires. Great time in New York.

Adam is a good host, although the place isn't too comfy, he did all he could to make it better and with a little more improvement, its a good place to crash if you are alone, backpacking and need something less expensive.

Brama's room is relatively big! You have a good connection to Manhattan, as the train station is nearby! Furthermore a cool and save area!
I liked staying my 10 days. The only thing you should be aware of is that it was loud sometimes as you will be living above a bar but I was cool with that. Ygvg

We stayed at Debra's place in July 2017. Debra is a great host, she was very responsive, friendly and helped us quickly when needed. She helped us arrange a small AC when temperatures reached 35'C at night as it gets very WARM in the apartment - I highly recommend to get a place with proper AC if you are not used to this type of temperatures - and fixed sudden issues with the internet rightaway. 

The apartment itself is on the third floor (no elevator for those who care) and spacious, but rather dated and in need of a bit of a refresh. So if you are looking for a spotless shower/clean modern bathroom, this won't be the right place for you. 

The location is fantastic, it's in the heart of Brooklyn's Park Slope area, right on 7th Ave, with everything walking distance, loads of restaurants, independent stores and cafes. The subway (7 Av) is a 5 minute walk away which takes you direct into Manhattan within 20-30 mins.

Amanda was a great host. She was attentive and available if I have any need or questions. She was easy going and everything was as stated in her post. Place was close to transportation (subway) and safe.
Great stay, great location, great host!
An awesome location and a very kind host. Really helps into having a true NYC experience.

Stayed one night.  Host was very accommodating and friendly.  Room and space was comfortable and clean; had a lot of nice touches.  I would return.  

Thanks!!!

Great price for a great location. The apartment was styled very nicely, very comfy furniture, fridge was stocked with ice too. Lots of nice restaurants nearby in walking distance. Free Netflix on the tv and a nice comfy bed with a big shower. Only bad things were, you can hear everything going on down on the streets since the window has to be open for the AC unit, dragging our luggage to a separate location to pick up and drop off a key was a bit of an inconvenience too. It was hard checking in and out bc there's no elevator in the apartment building, so we had to lug our bags up several flights of stairs which was pretty tiring. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend to a friend.
I don't think they will rent it out longer. Always ask for pictures from the living rooms etc.

Staying with Dori will be welcoming and comfortable. She is a fantastic host. Don't be daunted by the area. It is very quiet, safe, and welcoming. The continues are very near whichakes it easy and quick to get to the subway. A very comfortable stay.

For those who are looking for a place near TimeSquare for a reasonable  price, Meredith has the ideal option. The house is 4 minutes from the Subway and it's very easy to reach the tourist areas of NY. On the other hand, Meredith is very attentive, clean and tidy. The apartment  has creative spaces that reflects the good design taste of those who live there.
Clean & tidy room/apartment. Communicative host, nice roommates, easy check-in. Close to the train. All good :)

This loft is in a great location on the lower east side of Manhattan. There are many things to do in the nearby area. The other people that live in the building are great and understanding. This is a great spot for a large group of people that are looking to have fun. The hosts are easy to communicate with and are very accommodating!

Great place, super convenient to bus and train stops.  Easy route to work and to the city.  Super safe area, and convenient to local grocery and liqueur stores... everything is bought separately here!  It is truly a basement apartment, so windows are taller, apartment is cooler and there are several stairs.  though, for the purposes i needed, this place is perfect.

Reuben is a great host, very welcoming and easy-going. He made sure I had everything I needed. His house is very nice; quiet, clean + comfortable. Very convenient, easy to get to the ferry -and a nice calm place to rest after the activity of Manhattan.

What a wonderful stay! i had an Amazing time at Margarita place , she is supe nice and helfull and the apartment is is clean spacious , fully equipted and the location is very conveniet , close to subway that takes you to Manhattan very quickly ! highly recommended to enjoy Brooklyn like and be close to Manhattan as well ! thanks Margarita !!!

Sherrie's place was an A+ choice! They offered a comfortable stay along with a few amenities that I couldn't live without! I was offered freshly made breakfast every morning--hope you like bagels and scrambled eggs. Yum! LOVED the early morning wake up call, it really allowed me to get the most out of my time in NYC. The 24 hour corner store is a wonderland full of fun snacks and kombucha (that's even on SALE!!). Since I was in town for business, I didn't know a whole lot of people in the area, the hosts were gracious enough to take me out and even get dinner + drinks with me. What great service! I surely won't forget the hospitality for years to come.

Carolyn's place was exactly as shown.  It was a rather large space for a NYC apartment. The beds were comfortable and the apartment was clean.  The Bed-Stuy location was perfect for where I needed to be.  The apartment fit 4 of us comfortably.  Communication was easy, prompt and the key exchange smooth.  On street parking was ample and not an issue.  I will definitely see if this apartment is available again the next time I am in the city.
Elaine was very friendly, accessible, and easy/quick to communicate with throughout my trip!
You have a great apartment, I really liked it, I recommend it!

The apartment was exactly like the photos. Alexander has a wonderful sense of style. It was spotless and we had a very comfortable stay. The building was clean and quiet and there is a grocery store right around the corner and a Starbucks across the street. The apt was listed as not suitable for children, but he let my nine year old daughter stay. I took my daughter to NYC for Christmas and to our surprise he had a gorgeous Christmas tree set up. It made our experience that much more special. I can't thank Alexander enough.

I drove from Los Angeles to NYC with no job and no house. The only thing I had was so money to pay for a month of Airbnb so then I could manage to re-locate successfully in NYC. Little did I know that I was going to spend a month with some of the most kind, gentle and nicest people I have ever encountered in my life. Not only they showed me the best places to eat and drink, but Sidra actually helped me prepare for my job interview, which I got an offer from them. I was extremely intimidated by moving to NYC, but Chelsea and Sidra made my life so content that I was ready to chase my dreams and goals in NYC. After a month of living there I have now successfully landed a job, a place to live and comfortable life. A big part I attribute this is to Chelsea and Sidra. Thank you so much for everything and I look forward seeing you around Brooklyn again. Take care!

Sarah's home is outstanding- the location in BK Heights cannot be beat- steps to the subway, the pier, the promenade, and the restaurants on Montague and in Cobble Hill.   Her spacious home gets beautiful light and is fantastic for families with a crib and high chair.  Sarah is a wonderful host- very responsive and made check-in/check-out super easy & clear.  You won't be sorry if you pick Sarah's home!
Smells like smoke. There was a cat that we did not know about. She was not there when we arrived, leaving us outside for a while.

Anne's apartment is located in a very nice and lively neighborhood. It has all kinds of shops for everything you need and also metro station. You arrive in 15 minutes walking to Central Park making a delightful walk. The apartment is small but very comfortable and cozy so that you feel like in your own house from the beginning. In the evening you can go to restaurants that offer live music and there is a nearby bar (Brandy's) which has a particularly picturesque musical show every night. It is a luxury to stay there.
Anna was a great host. She was flexible and worked with our schedule with the check in and check out. Very accommodating and friendly! The bed was very comfortable. I definitely recommend!

This lovely, comfortable and spacious apartment is only a block away from the S line subway stop and is so convenient to all of the Prospect Park and Brooklyn area attractions. We had a fantastic time! The bed was super comfortable. A well-stocked grocery store is a block away. The neighborhood is very safe. The home is very well stocked and our hosts were so gracious.
She was so sweet, her place was super neat and has the cutest cat. She was very hospitable. We can't wait to stay here again!
Nice and affordable place, I would come back.
Ozlem was very nice when we arrived. In fact, she alloed my brother to stay one night. Very easy going. We did not meet her again. Thanks for making everything easy.
The room was cozy and great.
this place is proper.
The place was big and especially the room. It's very near the subway, restaurants, and grocery stores. You'll have space to cook and move freely.

Easy access neighbourhood with a subway stop a 5-minute walk away. Pictures in the listing are indicative of the room size, not the spaciest yet comfortable enough to crash for a day or two as long as you're not planning to spend the day indoors (and why would you, in New York?).

Ideal for the budget traveller, may not be the best for families. Host was responsive and helpful and was fairly flexible with check-in check-out times.

The space is as advertised, really nice place with a lot of character. Great for people looking to get that real NY vibe. It is a bit of a walk up the stairs but nothing to rediculas. Area is trendy and people are nice, there are a group of people hang out in front if the building but their very nice and respectful just wish they didn't smoke  right at the door.
