In summary, I highly recommend this listing for any length of stay.
Everything was perfect
Matt was a great host.

Had a great time staying at this Airbnb!  Super convenient to the G train which is two blocks away.  Very clean! 

Brady was also very communicative and quick to respond to questions.

This is a cute, clean, and cozy studio right in Chelsea with a great location and an excellent host. Brian is quick to respond and gave clear instructions for check-in and check-out... Everything was easy breezy and I'd highly recommend Brian as a host and this studio for your NYC stay!

Very nice apartment. Good neighborhood and just five minutes walk to the subway.

Christina provided us with everything we needed, even two sets of keys.
Alyosha has very spacious apartment in an interesting and lively neighbourhood. I can definitely recommend this airbnb.

I was in NYC for work the month of December and needed a centrally located place that wasn't too close to the office (at Rockefeller) but close enough I could walk. Stan's place fit that bill nicely. Additionally, it was quiet enough that I was able to sleep and it was close to many bars and restaurants. Would definitely stay again. Thanks, Stan, Happy New Year!

The place was actually larger than we were expecting with a floor plan that allowed for conversations in the living/kitchen area without disturbing nappers in the bedrooms. All rooms were large and kitchen had all the requisite appliances and equipments. Views of the city were great. Brian was a terrific host... answered questions and was very timely in his correspondence. The icing on the cake is the doormen... they knew we were coming and we never felt that we were out of place at the building. Felt welcomed by all we encountered. Would definitely use this rental again. Just a note that the elevator is small, as can be expected in Manhattan rentals. It was a tight fit for four people plus a single suitcase or a stroller.
Not luxurious by any means, but the value is unbeatable. A few blocks away from the relevant subway stations. Definitely large enough for 4 people. Would stay again!

This place was fantastic!  If you are taking a trip to NYC this is a very good location.  You can get into the city from a close subway.  There is also an express train that stops at another subway which is just a bit further away.  Both subway stops are super close!  There are probably more, but we primarily used two with the exception of the time we walked to Barclay Center station because we had to do a bit of shopping.

The parking wasn't difficult.  I found a spot immediately when we arrived.  During our visit I had to call AAA because my vehicle would not start due to the cold temperatures (my vehicle sat without running for a few days).  I drove it around the block a few times and found an even closer parking spot after helping the battery recharge.

Check-in was super quick and easy.

The bed was very comfortable and the apartment was warm.  We felt safe there.  We walked around after dark without a worry in the world.  The neighborhood is safe.

We ate pizza from delivery places around the apartment.  We also walked to an Italian place called Cataldos (amazing!).

The apartment was clean and felt very cozy!

If I ever come back to NYC I'd most definitely stay here again.

Rachel was extremely accommodating on a last minute booking and kept a good line of communication throughout my stay. The room and apartment were clean, warm and very comfortable. The neighbourhood felt safe enough for me to walk from the subway station at night as the route to the house is busy and well lit. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again.
awesome place, great location, we had a good stay at Vik place, very cozy apartment...

The time we spent where Ria was very comfortable and pleasant. The lodging has everything you need to feel at home. The location is very good since it is easy to move on the subway and the neighborhood is safe.

I booked this spot for my family when they came to visit, and it served as a perfect home base for us to enjoy the holidays from. As a resident of the neighborhood myself, I can say that the location is prime Williamsburg - far enough from the Bedford bustle that it's quiet, but close enough to the city that Manhattan is just a couple stops away. 

Matt & Kat are incredibly accommodating and responsive hosts, and their home is very cozy. We especially loved watching movies together as a family on their huge flat screen. There's also the benefit of having 2 full baths in the apartment! I have zero complaints, and am hoping for a chance to revisit Matt & Kat's place in the future :)

This place is perfect for 1-2 people looking to explore what New York has to offer in and to experience what living in the city is really like. You can walk to a lot of places or catch a subway pretty easily.

Ashley and Zoey are amazing hosts who made sure my stay was as comfortable as possible - they gave me great food recommendations and provided everything you could need and then some! Their personal touches made me feel at home immediately. If I have the chance to come back to the city for a long trip I would love to stay here again.
She is great. Very helpful. Nice room quiet environment.
Gracious host and perfect location in NY. Access to all of it.
Great apartment and a convenient location.  It was perfectly clean and just as advertised.  The host was very responsive and the restaurant tips were spot on.  we would definitely stay again.
The apartment was beautiful and just what we needed for the weekend!

We very much appreciated our stay at Amelia's place for New Year. The communication was excellent and the appartement is ideal for groups of two to to four people thanks to the 2 bathrooms and 2 toilets. Very well equipped kitchen. The building is located next to a subway station to Manhattan and there is many restaurants and bars in the area.

the appartment is located close to the central park and times' square. there live two more persons in the appartment. there is no door that closes the room,only a curtain. there is no table or chair or hook on the walls. only 2 beds.the kitchen and bathroom are convenient and comfortable. after we cleaned the house,it was a good place to stay.

Clean modern space with a number of hotel amenities in a safe and quiet area of Chelsea.  Easy access to the High Line, Intrepid museum and the subways.  24 hours CVS is near for those last minute needs.  Plentiful towels, great communication and thoughtful neighborhood recommendations.  Easy and flexible check-in/out.  Can't say enough great things about the experience.
Sam place is beautiful and 2 blocks from transportation which is perfect,and he has lots of place to hangout and eat at in walking distance.

Alexandra welcomed us into her beautifull apartment with a bottle of wine and tips on what to do in the neighborhood. The apartment is not only gorgeous, clean and in a very nice building (with a gym), it is also very well located, just a couple blocks from Columbia, subway stations, central park and riverside park. We absolutely loved it and hope to stay there every time we go to NY!
Great neighborhood! Lovely place! Clean and well furnished rooms. Great decor. Silvia was very responsive and made sure we had everything. Would definitely stay here again when I visit NY.
Best Airbnb I ever had!
Great host!

Lots of light, very clean and nicely decorated. The communication prior to the check-in, during the stay, and upon check-out was excellent. The place is located just a few steps from plenty of great coffee shops/lots of ramen spots/grocery stores, also it's right by the subway station and the backyard space is quite big. The heating and water pressure were up to par. Would definitely stay again!

Pictures don't do the space justice. This is a large 1 bedroom two blocks off of a very busy and lively district along Broadway. Super close to the metro/subway and getting around was very easy. Very comfortable environment and Sheila was helpful and accommodating as far as the timing of check in and check out which was a big help.

There are a lot of reasons to love this apartment, but my favourite part of staying here was that, even though it's in the heart of one of the city's most characterful neighbourhoods, close to amazing restaurants, boutiques and bars, it's so quiet and comfortable inside. The interior design is gorgeous and having that iconic view of the East River and Manhattan from both the roof deck and the little park five minutes away really made it for me. Bridie and Harry are considerate, friendly hosts who have lived in the area for years and also travel regularly, so they understand what visitors need. Highly recommended. I'll be back!

We had a wonderful time at Geo's apartment. His roommate was very helpful and she provided us with great information during our stay. The bed is really comfy and the apt itself is located a 5 minute walk away from the Atlantic Av. station, enabling you to travel the whole city with ease. Would recommend anyone to stay here during their stay in NY!
This was a great glimpse of life in Brooklyn, it's close to lots of cool spots, Wholefoods and the subway. They are a great bunch and the kitchen is well equipped. Really glad I stayed here!

The space was clean and comfortable and great value for the privacy and convenience. It is just as the description says. Sarah was very responsive and clear with the instructions. The ceiling is a little low as she described so not the best space for a tall person, but it worked great for us and was very cozy in the cold winter. Sarah has comfortable furniture and a small but functional kitchen. I will be looking to book again in the future.

Very comfortable and cool. Very nice people who are so hospitable. I enjoyed my stay and genuinely can not thank them enough. 
Close to metro and food and vintage shops. Loved It.

Rod's place was elegant, a sitting room out of an Merchant/Ivory production. At evening, one could sit in his living room, with warm light, comfortable chairs, and classic design. This apartment can be an oasis in a busy New York trip, or a place to retreat from the outside world. It is spacious (by Manhattan standards), with a separate bedroom. It was clean and organized. While on the fifth floor, there was an elevator. Interesting books, TV with Amazon Prime and Hulu, and a Nespresso machine. There was plenty of hot water, a full tub and a bathroom that was big enough for two people. The location is mid-town incredible, literally steps to Central Park, a few blocks to the subway and stores. This is a place for a vacation with more personality than a hotel.

This was my second time in new york but this time was very special! Vibha was super helpful and kind , was very easy to talk to . Her place was perfect for me , cozy ,private , at the 27th floor with full view to the city ,gorgeous! The apt is a few steps from the subway , all around you have all the facilities as banks ,supermarkets, restaurants, pizza open until late night :) . So it was a perfect trip! Thank you Vibha !

It was all wonderful !! the place is very central! next to times square, close to restaurants, shops, farmaria, subway, bus station, etc! Kim is very receptive, responds quickly, helps a lot! the apartment is has 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room and table to eat! Anyway, it was wonderful, thank you Kim !!

David's apartment was perfect for me. I was in town for three weeks, and I couldn't have asked for a better location, space, and amenities for one. There is a little kitchenette, fridge, desk and ample space if you have large luggage. Located just a couple doors down is a perfect little coffee shop and PLENTY to all within walking distance. Great access to trains and food, and is quiet enough at night for a good night's sleep. My favorite stay in NYC so far!

Kylie has a spacious and stylish apartment that my family of 6 was very happy in. We slept comfortably and cooked two meals in the kitchen, which was a good size and had everything we needed. We absolutely recommend both Kylie and her apartment.
Kindest people in Brooklyn and awesome place!

Joey's apartment is just like the pictures. The beds are big and very comfortable. The neighborhood is nice, and you can find several groceries and pharmacies near the apartment. The kitchen has everything you need regarding plates and spices. We were four adults and a kid, and we all found Joey's place a nice place to rest and prepare for another day of touring. Joey was not present but he answered very fast the couple of mails that I sent him. Camila, was the person that received us, and she was also very kind and attentive.
Muy respetuosa y platica agradable

David is a very considerate host. He answered our question quickly and thoughtfully.  He was very accommodating to us and we have a six year old who loved the space - "very cool place "daddy were the exact words :)
Location in Williamsburg Is prime.  My family really enjoy our time - we will be back:)

Check in/out was easy and the house is well located, spacious and tastefully designed. We didn't meet Julia, but dealt via text & email with the person she had managing the place who was generally quick to respond when we had questions - while we were there. After 2 weeks, we're still waiting to hear back about some jewellery left behind, but we're hopeful it will be resolved. We could have used a little more instruction on where to find things like linens & toilet paper but what we couldn't find was promptly delivered thanks to Amazon ;)!
Abby's apartment is a quiet haven in a busy city - excellently located in a quaint neighborhood with easy access to a number of subway lines. We enjoyed our stay there.
It was very clean and pretty place :) I can stay comfortable during my trip. I recommed this home really!! Very good
Angelina is so nice. The room is clean. So many grocery shops, Starbuks, pizza shops, gym in the neighborhood. Enjoy your stay;)

Our stay at Chris's place was all around 3 out of 5 stars.  Chris made it easy to check in and out of the Airbnb, although he was not around during the duration of our stay.  He was easy to communicate with and would respond to any questions within 48 hours.  The individual room was clean with fresh sheets, however the common areas such as the kitchen, dining room and bathroom were on the dirty side with food being left out from other guests and dishes in the sink.  The bathroom did not have towels, shampoo, conditioner or body wash for guests to use so guests were expected to bring their own.  There was a hairdryer for guests to use.  The beds did not have the most comfortable mattress and were on the thinner, harder side.  What I loved most about this place was the location! It was extremely convenient walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, plenty of restaurants and bars and much more! Overall, the place was a great price compared to other hotels for what was provided and the location.
Jen's place was wonderful.  It was large for a place in Midtown and close to everything I needed. Jen was super responsive and helpful as well.
A very cute room and a very helpful and welcoming host. Near the very nice neighborhood of bushwick and not far from the subway it was perfect for our littke trip !
Was a nice place to stay for the price. She was very responsive to any questions.
Love the location.. Jaz was very kind. :)

Various members of my family have stayed with Louise on multiple occasions over the past two years. Her guest spaces are each unique, well designed, and comfortable. Louise is consistently a great host. This visit was no exception. My family really enjoyed the Turret Retreat as it provided space for them to spread out. The separate room with the TV is a plus as it allows those sleeping to not be disturbed.
O
The location is pretty good and Mr.Moises is really nice.
A wonderful place! SO CLEAN! SO WARM!  A lovely comfortable room with an even lovelier host. I feel like the pictures didn't do the space justice. HIGHLY recommended.

Amelia has been a great host for this week end in NY! I was with my parents and she has been very comprehensive when my parents asked for an extra night at her apartment. 
Had a little water leak problem that wasn't in her control which appeared during our stay. We immediately told her and she handled the problem while letting us stay in it. 
Very kind.

nice small clean n cozy place for a Manhattan stay.
value for money.
bathrooms, kitchen n rooms were clean.
easy access from city
El departamento esta en excelente ubicacion, Sandra es una hoster muy atenta. Lo recomiendo 100

Ola's place was exactly as described. The neighborhood is great and it was super easy to get to the city. In, what I think, was the second coldest temperatures that New York ever got, we were always cozy and hot at the studio app. Very affordable as well, bearing in mind that New York can be quite an expensive city !
Unfortunately we didn't get to meet Ola personally but she is very communicative and helpful and we had no trouble at all contacting her.
She trusted us her home and her cat which took some time to get used to but worked out ok.
I am thankful for having run into this place !
Thank you very much.
Antonio.

This is a very spacious and comfortable place.  The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable.  The deck would be especially tremendous in the summer but we did not venture out for very long because it was so cold.  The apartment also had everything we needed to eat breakfast there in the morning, plenty of towels, and also a nice location that wasn't too far away from main attractions.  Max was very hospitable, answered all of my questions in a timely fashion and called in advance to discuss our stay.  He was a wonderful host!!  We really enjoyed staying at his place.

AMAZING. I had a 80 person holiday party with clients. Very cool loft space - vintage with modern. Amazing service - staff were very professional and helpful. Highly recommend to anyone hosting an event.
Great host and great apartment
The view is glorious and Rasmus is the perfect host. He made me tea and adored my dog. Will always stay here when in NYC. What every airbnb should be.
Great host and a nice room, the S train runs very nearby though so it could be a bit noisy at night.

Katelynn was totally accommodating on very short notice after another host cancelled on us two days ahead of time. The apartment had everything we needed. We barely even needed to leave. Her cat was a total sweetheart. The neighborhood was a bit loud but, hey, you don't go to NYC for quiet time, right? Katelynn was available with a timely response any time we had a question and everything was just as she said it would be. Overall good experience.
Super apartment with very comfortable furnishings, fully equipped and  with modern decor. The hosts were very responsive and attentive. Thank you!!

We enjoyed our stay in Chris' place. As a born and raised New Yorker, I enjoyed staying in this Harlem location. It is a convenient location to the subway and buses if you want to travel throughout the city. Chris' place was cozy and had everything and more we needed. I would definitely plan to stay here again if needed.

Adrianne's place is a cute, small, typical NY apartment and you couldn't ask for a better location if you wanna stay in Harlem. You can get midtown or downtown on the 3 train in a giffy if you need too. Was also cheap by NY standards (which is still expensive, of course). But there was no heat in December and I froze my @$$ off.  To clarify, I'm not saying it wasn't heated to my liking, I'm saying there was zero heat. In December. I contacted Adrianne and the superintendent repeatedly but nothing changed while I was here. I know this is not Adrianne's fault, I'm sure it's a case of an old building and a negligent landlord, but point is when you pay what you pay for a airbnb in NY you shouldn't be sleeping while shovering in a tracksuit and a toque, or unable to work on your labtop cause your hands are so cold.  Secondly, the person Adrianne hired to clean the place between my arrival and the previous guests departure did a really half-ass job. Didn't even touch the bathroom, I know cause the trashbin was full and the bathtub had visible grime and hair. Germaphobe's nightmare. Again, I know this wasn't Adrianne's fault, just being honest about my experience.  Other things to keep in mind is that there is no closet space or coathangers and the oven has been converted to storage (there is a toaster however). If Adrianne could ensure her unit was heated in the winter and hire a cleaner who actually cleaned it would be a great spot.

Thank you for hosting us. Everything is perfect, food around here is terrific, traffic is very convenient, the house is nice and warm with sufficient furniture and equipments, people living here are very friendly and always be there to offer more help. It was a terrific experience to be here. I will come again if I go to New York another time.

Bert's apartment was charming and well appointed. Great location in park slope. Subway and Prospect Park are 5-10 minute walk away. Easy to get into lower Manhattan. The living space was actually larger than I expected from the photos. Lots of nice bars, restaurants, grocery stores, etc in the neighborhood. Bert was an extremely responsive communicator. I'd highly recommend his space
Perfect for events. Location is very convenient with a view of Empire State. Building. Owner Pavel is super nice and helpful.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I didn't want to leave. Mon was a fantastic host. The location was near the heart of Flushing and most importantly near the 7 train. The bed was super comfy and everything was spotless. I really appreciated the 9:30pm quiet time.
It was warm and comfortable in the winter, I slept well.
Charlie was super friendly and very accommodating to my pup who was traveling with me. He made us feel welcome and at home during our entire stay.

daniel and stephanie are lovely people, very communicative and helpful hosts who went to extra lengths to make us feel at home//their building however has no ventilation for cooking and is often filled with loud partying transients on weekends/the building itself is extremely cold and the heating in the apartment was insufficient to combat the frigid temperatures during our stay/there are 2 very active construction sites around the corner//still, my kids and I had a lovely time in north Williamsburg
she is nice and helpful always
Amazing location!!
Convenience, good location, student flat.
Zachary's apartment is clean, quiet, and convenient to all things Soho.  We enjoyed our stay.
Awesome place to stay
Super friendly guy. Keeps in great communication as well. Very responsive. Apartment is close to public transport and the room worked out great for us, but the beds were rock hard.

The stay was quite good. The host was very kind and helpful and provided in advanced all the indications about the apartment. The apartment is in a good position, being only three blocks from the train station.  It is also clean and warm. The only problems are the very small bed, suitable for one person, and the strong noise coming from a pipe in the kitchen. The stay was quite good anyways.

I liked my stay in Rafat's place. The apartment is new and modern, and the location is great - a couple of minutes from the subway, which quickly reaches most of the highlights of NYC. I didn't meet Rafat but I chatted a lot with his housemate, who was very hospitable and even offered me to eat from the food she cooked. It was obvious that Rafat is living in the room that I rented because it was a bit messy, but nothing bothering at all. I understand his situation because I was the first guest there and he doesn't have the experience. Rafat was quite responsive and when I shared my opinion took a note. I'm sure the stay of the next guest will be even better than mine. Thanks, Rafat!

Brittney's apartment was a great place to stay. It was very conveniently placed to get around the neighborhood or to the metro. There were plenty of good coffee spots and restaurants close by. The interior was clean and well-kept and stocked with everything needed for a comfortable stay. Brittney even provided an info package to help me find fun places to go and make sure everything went well.
Dali was very accommodating and hospitable, and a super friendly host! Her apartment was clean and the guest bed was super comfortable! It was a pleasure staying with her!
Nice clean space with a great view!
Good place for group of two

Great host! Great communications! What you see is what is what you get (pictures/description accurate, with small exception). Very nice, comfortable, compactly decorated, great utility, great location. I really enjoyed it. Was possible to rest and work and get around. Excellent transportation/location. Comfortable and convenient. The only issue was the bathroom which is old and the shower curtain 'clinging' and not draining properly. This could be an issue for guests. Aside from this issue, which I presume can be fixed, this stay/host/apartment was perfect! I highly recommend!

If your looking fora nice and quiet place to stay. This would be the place for you.   It was a pleasant stay! Jeff, the host was really friendly and welcoming. And I would definitely recommend coming here!! He's a very awesome!!!
Josh was great to communicate with and his room was perfect for the price.

Charlotte was very helpful, she provided us everything we needed. The apartment is quite old and some places were a bit untidy when we arrived. Also it was quite cold inside the apartment, but with the very reasonable price compared to the excellent location and space in the apartment, we could not have made a better choice!

The Appartement is great. 
Near every metro, Train or bus. 
Complete kitchen, free wlan and a super Great view from the Apartment at the 19th floor. Perfect for couples or small families
And the rooftop is absolutly great a perfect view to statue of liberty east river and freedom tower.
The space was great! The bed was comfortable, the apartment was clean, and everyone was friendly. It's hard to beat.
A safe, comfortable and pleasant experience.  Could not improve upon our stay.

Lovely place, perfect to visit Manhattan and surroundings. The neighbourhood is nice and charming. 
Julien is really friendly and flexible. 
We highly recommend this place.
Very close to the subways and right by a local market. She was quick to respond to every question.
Sarah, is great as a host, she gave us tips for our trip that were very useful. The location of the apartment is excellent. You really feel at home.
Clean and cozy place, great location, nice area! Host takes great care of guests and is easy to reach. Would return!
The best!! Absolutely lucky to have Hugo as a host. His apartment is really nice and cozy and in the perfect location. He responds as fast as possible and just a really cool dude over all

Kathrin apartment is perfectly located on Manhattan, it's a 2min walk to the subway and to central Park! The apartment itself is really cosy and well decorated. Kathrin was really nice, she responded quickly to all of my messages, and her room was great! Her roommate Nick was also really cool! I had a great time at Kathrin's place, and I highly recommend it!

Ashlee and her son are such amazing hosts. Exceeded all my expectations! They were both very attentive and helpful, and they made sure we felt like home in her beautiful apartment.
Definitely recommending to everyone I know!

Perfect place to explore New York with the subway just around the corner, the neighborhood offers everything you need to start the day. The appartment is sunflooded and welcoming and Leah answered quickly to any questions about the stay. Very pleasant experience, we would stay there again any time.

Mariana attended to all our needs, and provided clean, cozy, family friendly accommodations in Crown Heights, Brooklyn.  I can recommend Mariana and her home to my friends, and would definitely stay here again.
Great deal! Great location! Great host! Very helpful and curtious.
Jahsun canceled the reservation on the day of check-in, leaving me abandoned in NY city.
Great hoster and very responsive to your queries
Appartamento molto carino a Brooklyn, vicino alla metro e luminosissimo! Proprietario molto gentile e disponibile!

Kenneth is a great host, his hospitality and recommendations helped make it a pleasant stay.
Your apartment is great and the room very comfortable, has an excellent location that allows to visit many excellent places.
I would stay again without problem. Thanks!
Clean cozy room, a stone's throw from the subway for maximum convenience. May get a little noisy occasionally due to children living in the house.

We really enjoyed staying at Katherine's place! The appartment is well furnished and in an amazing area close to every stores and trendy places to go out!
Thank you Katherine

This has been one of my favourite Air Bnb stays. It's less than a 1 minute walk from the subway making it really convenient and safe at night. The pictures are completely accurate and the decor is really nice! The bathroom facilities are always clean and the shower is one of the best i've had! The apartment is a great size for New York and even features a little balcony which in the summer will be lovely. Steph & Guy are really awesome hosts and it felt like living with friends. They are very easy going, laid back and are helpful in giving recommendations on the area! I will miss this place. Thanks guys xxx
Everything was excellent. Very good location and very good host

We visited Brooklyn for 4 nights with our 2 yo dauther. We enjoyed a lot the place, small but very stylish and with personality. The locations is good to explore around, quite close to metro stations (10 minute walk). We totally recommended Kaity's place.
The brownstone was very clean, the amenities were great, the location was perfect, it was safe it was quiet, and a beautiful neighborhood.
Cindy's place was beautiful and spacious. We had a lovely trip and Cindy was very accommodating. I would highly recommend staying with Cindy!
Ana was a great host and the other roommates were great too, The apartment is really well located and so close to all the cool spots in williamsburg and also just a quick subway ride into the city.
Nice hospitable host and very responsive to needs of the guest

Flavia's room is cute, clean and warm and she is so friendly. What I like in her place is she has a living room with a projector so we had a special time after a long day in New York. her place also close to the subway F line. She also responded me quickly every time I have questions.

Thank you, it was my awesome new year
Great host, great place! Mark has a really nice apartment, and makes time for you. Enjoy!

Great place; prime location, good price/value for money, 2 beds [this is rare in Manhattan for this price!], really friendly host(s), place is clean, communication is good [hosts are really quick to respond to messages, check-in very smoothly], flexible check-out time (very convenient), the description reads minimalist, but leaves nothing to be desired.

Loved this place! The best NYC location & Beautifully furnished -We felt so at home here! Kitchen was well equipped, bedding was lovely and we felt like locals exploring the cafes and restaurants nearby. Shops, city bikes & subways were all nearby. We had a wonderful stay & would highly recommend.
Buena opcion
aaaa
Cute and quite spacious apartment, super comfortable and quiet, very handy location, great internet. Enjoyed being here a lot.
Great host, takes time to ensure his guests are comfortable.
RACHEL'S place it's superb and close to everywhere. The roommates are friendly and they help in your staying. I really like the atmosphere.

This apartment is in an awesome location just a couple of blocks away from the L train. Maria was a great host and the cats were very hospitable. If you're a cat lover who wants to hang out in a fantastic neighborhood surrounded by a ton of good restaurants, you should stay here.
Harold's place is really nice, clean and cozy, with great location and lots of great food around Columbia University! Highly recommended!
Great apartment. Thanks Jordan!

Really great location if your new to the city. Super close to restaurants and bars for the night life and Exactly in the middle of every tourist location on the island. Excellent host. Would definitely stay here again.

Tony's place was a good place to spend our nights in, since we mostly spent our days roaming the city. The host was available on the phone, so that was great. The apartment is as it seems in the pictures, just a little bit more worn out and the bathroom is really tiny. Overall, we were happy with our stay there, we just felt there were two issues. The first one, of minor importance, was the heating that did this awful hissing sound all night and day and we could not turn off, so the apartment was very, very hot and we couldn't sleep without the windows open. The other one, though, was disturbing to us, since the owner of the apartment wanted us to assure him that we are prepared to lie to an inspector, he or she may come, that we are renting the apartment for 2 months. He even had a fake lease agreement prepared in case we needed it. Apparently, if we would not lie, we would be thrown out of the apartment and left on the street. Nothing actually happened, but honestly, lying to representatives of the state is not on my list of things I want to do when coming to the USA from Europe, so that was really not up to my taste.

Dennis apartment its just the perfect place to stay, everything is near by, you have all the touristic spots around you.!! Super warm and big, enough space to spend a nice holidays... he was always aware that everything was fine, so definitely I will love to come back there.!! Thank you Dennis
This was a great location and everyone there was very friendly and helpful.
The apartment was really nice,modern and design. the room that we got had a beautiful view. Mara and Brittney were great host, and every time available for us.

It was great for the price! John was very approachable and responsive. He prepared everything for us including new linens and notes. The house is very near to the subway, which was a plus. You can cook and save a lot of money!

Just had some issues. One is that the thermostat max capability was around 60 F when we were here, so if you are not used to that temperature, you would find the house a bit cold. Another is the room might be a bit small for two if you both are overweight. Aside from that, as John said, the housemates just kept to themselves and rarely talked to us. But I am not really sure whether they liked us staying or not. One wrote a bit hostile reminders with capital letters on the white board. Another vomited all over the toilet and left it like that for the whole day. However, it was New Year Eve so we tried to put it into context.

In all, the room was inexpensive and acceptable to us. Things happened just like anywhere and we wouldn't mind living in the place if we visit again!

Congratulations, you've found the perfect Brooklyn Airbnb. This space is not only magnificent, but is a spot on representation of Williamsburg. Christophe was such a good host and was easy to communicate with. Whether you're coming to New York for just the weekend or planning on staying longer, this is the spot for you!
Very clean, apartment, with tons on on street parking. The beds were vety comfortable.

Daniel is super friendly and responds my queries and concerns very quickly (at first I was a bit worried that it was a scam...). During my stay, he constantly checks how my stay is, and chats as a friend which I enjoy a lot. Regarding the place, it is amazingly the same as how it shows in the picture! Stylish and clean! -- Best of all, we have a huge common area and TV & Netflix to enjoy with other guests -- they are all very friendly. I like the location too, which is 5-min walk to the station and 30-min subway to midtown. There is a supermarket and CVS pharmacy next to the subway station -- it's very convenient! Initially I was a bit concerned that it was in Harlem whose reputation is not great, while the area is actually safe -- I feel quite OK even when I returned home at night. It is a great experience staying here!
Great location and wonderful apartment. Looks exactly as the listing says, if not better. Eve was extremely kind and helpful during our stay! Definitely would recommend this place to others.

The place is exactly as shown in pictures. The location is fantastic, in downtown Manhattan, very central, 7 minutes walk to the One world Trade centre. Lots of sights and placed to eat and shop are close by. 

The only thing we had a bit of trouble with was the heating in the room. We stayed at Liv's place during the coldest days of the year. But she was very responsive and prompt to take action on the situation. She ordered a room heater which helped tackle the cold.

Overall a very good option to stay.

The apartment has a really cosy vibe to it but is also very spacious. Great kitchen facilities, bathtub, living room has a projector and sound system to connect like a laptop so you can watch movies and tv programs etc. The apartment has adjustable lights in every room which is great for personal preference. The bed is very large and super comfy. Ryan was extremely responsive throughout my stay and even before hand to answer and questions I had. He left very helpful information regarding travel and restaurants in the area. Very well situated as there is a subway 5 minute walk away which there is direct trains into Manhattan only taking around 25 minutes. Great Greek restaurants nearby. Grocery stores and little shops. Overall a lovely little gem in astoria and very worth it's value.
Location was nice. Home was okay. Host was friendly and easy to reach when there was contact needed
Better than advertised. Perfect for business traveler looking for convenience and access to mid-town.
Russ was a great host. He was very helpful and quick to respond to all my questions. His place was nice and cozy and the view was absolutely beautiful!
Amazing place and a great host!

The apartment is super cozy and can comfortably accommodate 3 guests. Also it is very well located. There are plenty of markets, bakeries and the subway is about a corner away. Me and my family would definitely go again during summer.
Nice clean place in a safe neighborhood.
Vistas espectaculares! Edificio con porteria y muy amables. Cerca de dos estaciones de metro y bus en la puerta. Dova muy amable. Muy recomendable!

Great cozy apartment! Spacious bedrooms & living room. Host is great and offered warm complementary fruits & bread. Location is within 10 mins walk to Q station & 5 station. Supermarket is across the street. We had a nice stay!

Dany is a great host and he is the perfect guide of the wonderful city of NY and Brooklyn: his personal touch and his recommendations make your stay unforgettable.. the place is super cozy, very clean, central. simply excellent.

Host was very responsive. The location very colorful and it is close to the L train, easy access to Manhattan. However, walls are very thin and neighbors kept me up well past midnight during the week.  Also the wifi did not work well and stairs are no joke.
Excellent Host. Great location. Large by NYC standards. Great communication. Very flexible and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.
Everything about the place was great and amazing except maybe the noise the heater made but it's bare able.

Amazing !
The apartment is beautiful and so nice.
The host Agus is so friendly and helpful. You feel like a friend in her place.
All commodities are close. Really easy to go Williamsburg or to Manhattan quickly.
We were in the queen size bedroom and the bathroom is so spacious. Te bedroom get a perfect view on the sunrise.
Best experience ever !
Highly suggested :)

Spent a night here during a brief trip to NYC and had a wonderful experience staying at Jodi's. The space is super comfortable and relaxing; it's in quite a lowkey environment and is kept very clean with a lot of great amenities. The location is also a short walk to the Parkside Ave station so it's easy to navigate around the city. Jodi is a very kind and helpful host who'll ensure you enjoy your stay so I definitely recommend this Airbnb!
Clean and large rooms, good location to subway and supermarket. Host Nguyen is kind and reply is fast as soon as possible.
Great host. Would recommend!

Very poor neighborhood 
Very far from NY attraction
Great place! We needed a place due to an emergency and took a chance on Christie's new listing. GOOD CALL. Wonderful space close to the subway and park, comfy beds, dope neighborhood.

Hosted by a wonderful group of guys. Christina and her friends helped me to fit any necessities. They provided me everything to make me comfortable. Very valuable time and conversations together.
The location is awesome! Close to an important subway station and a lot of useful shops and good restaurants. WiFi connection!
Strongly recommended!

We had an amazing stay in this well design apt.
The apt is close to everything, the location is very central and easy to get around.
It was very clean with a positive spiritual earth vibe. I felt right at home.

Good located apartament in East Village. Plenty of facilities close by. Quentin was a very good host.
We recommend it.
Liz's apartment is beautiful and centrally located!  It was the perfect home to explore New York City for the holidays!  The apartment is clean, safe, and adorable.
Great spot close to the city ! Host was super friendly and her home was very cozy in a great location !
Jen is a great host!
I had a great time.
Great, stylish, sparkling clean place. Loved location and building. Musa was a great host!
Awesome !

We were in New York for the holidays. The first time we rented an apartment in Brooklyn. We really liked the apartment and its atmosphere. Everything was convenient and accessible. The location is very good, all nearby. Near the house there are many shops, restaurants, metro stations. Creative atmosphere reigned around.
Thank you, Anne for everything.

It was 5 of us and host requested IDs from each one of us (read the fine print on his listing). We tried to reach out to him to clarify and confirm how we can send them over to him because my friends didn't feel comfortable sending them over via text to a number they weren't sure it was even his. He was VERY unresponsive. We called multiple times and texted to no avail. Then he canceled on us while we were on our way to NYC due to him not receiving the IDs. Are you kidding me? We were calling you but you chose to ignore us! 
So we had to try and find a last minute airbnb. Horrible experience. Luckily we did find something else and wayyy better and everything worked out. DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM.
Great room and host. Room was nice size and clean.
Great host, with a nice welcome package, and immediate answer to all my questions and or requests.

Andy's place is very close to Penn station, subways and surrounded by many good restaurants. Andy is very nice, helpful and easy to communicate with. We had some problem when connecting to wifi in the first couple of days, but Andy provided us with a hotspot, and eventually addressed the wifi issue.
Nice view, quiet area, close to everywhere we wanted to go.

Great location, half way between Midtown and Downtown and all very walkable. Steve pointed out to me all the local ammenities I would need. Nespresso always appreciated. Check-in/out is always a concern with AirBnb but a 24/7 doorman at the apartment really makes it a super easy experience. Very nice place, I would call this a one bedroom and not a studio.

I had great time here in NY city. Luna's place is only 5 minutes from subway station and 30 minutes train ride to heart of Manhattan. The room itself was really clean and full of morning sun. I've not met Luna, but her roommate was friendly and helped me with minor issues. I recommend this place if you are on the budget and searching for a place not too far from downtown!
Lovely place and very nice staff and doormen. Close to subway and nice restaurants too. Just as noted in the listing!!

Staying at Rei's place was great! His place overlooks the park and is really close to the 2, 3 and 6 trains. His roommate Michael was a super fun dude. We stayed at Rei's place for four weeks. We had an amazing time and would totally stay there again!
Easy check in/out! Cozy apartment! Great location! Awesome view! Had wonderful stay at Sophie's place...felt like Home!
Kseniya's department is very close to the Times Square.
I had an amazing stay at Denise's crash pad, it's kind of people of all nations sharing quality time together. I love this part of Brooklyn too. Looking forward to my next visit very soon.
Lucy is nice, but I think that there is not enough privacy for the guests, and I love the cats but for the guest it is important to know if she has pets.
Oliver was an excellent host that truly went above and beyond the call of duty. Would be happy to stay with him again.
Bedroom was great. Host was great. However, the bathroom was in a terrible state. Shower was broken and did not work properly. Would not recommend unless the bathroom is cleaned and the shower fixed.
Great space. Huge apt for nyc. Great for get together. Good location. Close to subway. Good food nearby

Highly recommended for most any travelers. Rebecca is a fantastic host who is very responsive and takes great care of her space. Spent four nights here with my girlfriend and, while small, the apartment did not feel cramped and was clean and well-stocked. Two blocks from major subway stops and therefore a 18 min ride from midtown.
very good location and very easy to communicate.

I stayed at the nice apartment of Nargis with my 2 daughters. The apartment is nice and warm. Nice bathroom with enough warm water. We used it as a base to discover New York. The G and L line metro stations are about 15 minutes walking. We had a great time in New York. Thank you Nargis.
Stephen's place was great! he was easy to communicate with and provided a guide to the area.
Our host was super welcoming, nice, and friendly. We enjoyed our stay there and he is the best host I've seen yet. The room was spacious and comfy for 3 people.
Great place. Nicole was very welcoming and helpful.

The accommodation is well situated, clean and beautifully decorated. The hosts are friendly and helpful and the cat is lovely. I strongly recommend this place and would stay there again without a shadow of a doubt.

Erics place is eclectic and cozy. Location is amazing just a bock away from amazing waterway views of the Empire State Building. Mattress was so comfy and I really loved this space even though there is no TV in bedroom there is an old radio playing Jazz music and a large plant in the room.
very friendly residents and a very warm apartment in the winter!

If you want a New York loft feel in the heart of Soho, this place is perfect. Probably 25 restaurants and 50 boutique stores within 4 blocks. Also close to the subway that can get you downtown or uptown within 5 minutes. Linsey responded to our texts and gave us great suggestions for restaurants and transportation.  At the end of our stay we had a late flight and she even let us store our baggage until it was time to leave.  It is a small place, but exactly like I expected from what she advertised. Me and my 3 teenagers were able to sleep comfortably in the 3 beds.  The loft smelled very nice, the beds were comfortable, the towels were large and thick and she even had The same shampoo and conditioner used at the Four Seasons. I will stay again if It is available.

Theis was a great first time host. The place was clean and nice. Theis left us a little welcome package, which was nice. The bedroom is very large and nice with a queen bed. The air mattress was surprisingly great. However, this is definitely not a two bedroom. The commute into Manhattan is pretty far at 30-45 minutes. Additionally, if coming in the winter, the heat is VERY hot. The windows open, which helps some, but it is something to be aware of.

Caeli is a warm, friendly and respectful host. The private bathroom is definitely a plus. She's quick to respond to any of my questions or requests--the room was entirely unfurnished when offered to me  but she very promptly ordered bed and some home essentials. Since the room was new and everyone was moving in, I spent some time cleaning the room--using the nice Mrs. Meyer's products which she sent me and I myself love :-)  Surely a very thoughtful and pleasant host!
Two blocks away from subway, lots of food markets offering fresh produce at cheap prices; Although a newly renovated basement apartment, Caeli's room has lots of sunlight, a walk-in closet, and it's convenient for guest to receive mail and courier delivery. Will make a good home for any traveler.
Awesome airbnb! Jenny is super nice!
This place is perfect for it's value, cleanliness and location. The A & C lines to Manhattan are located within a 2 minute walk. I had a wonderful stay and would recommend this place to anyone!
Yoni has a beautiful home. The apartments are just as advertised. There was always someone there to answer any questions I had and they were really helpful and accommodating

Great place! Ashley was awesome!
With in minutes of everything! 5 star!
Awesome location and a really comfortable place to stay! Would stay again in the future if I'm in the area!

We really felt at home during our 1 week stay in Thomas apartment. The place was very clean at our arrival and contained everything we needed. The borough is also very nice and a metro station is just a few blocks away. Thomas is easily reachable and answered all my questions prior the booking. The mattress is incredibly confortable which is really enjoyable after a long day of walking throughout the city. 
I can only highly recommend Thomas and his apartment.
The room is located in an awesome neighborhood, much to do and close to the hub of activity in Greenpoint.

Such a great location. Received a great size suit. Jerry at front desk was so kind ! Everything was wonderful. Didn't have to bother Dorothy about anything, the hotel like service took care of all our needs
Super nice host, nice place to stay for a short period of time.
Very clean house, great location, convenient traffic. Patty is one of the best hosts I have ever met. She helped us with every problem we have. Highly recommend.

This place was spectacular!  Bright, spacious and super clean/tidy. It is even better than the pictures and I would love to stay here again. We were a group of 3 couples and had a ton of space for all of us (2 bathrooms was really nice), such a unique thing in NYC! Comfortable beds. Great neighborhood and easy getting to the city. Thanks again, hope to visit again soon!

Lovely small space and good location as the New York Train system can get you around the city pretty easily from Alvaro's house. Lots of history and culture in this particular location which was good way to see real New Yorkers and culture rather than staying down or mid town with lots of tourists.
Tara-Jo and their roommates were very friendly and helpful!  The apartment is clean and stylish and was great for a short stay!

Skyla's place was exactly as advertised and we had no complaints.

This booking was no-frills, affordable and straightforward with a convenient location and plenty of room for two travelers. Water pressure was good and everything was as clean as you would expect in any hotel.

With that being said, do not expect to have any kind of unique experience in the apartment, like I said it is no-frills, but that's perfect when you're just looking for an inexpensive place to sleep and clean up after a day spent entirely out in the city.

Tina's place is great. You get your privacy as well as some great tips as to how to get around Manhattan. Her place is right next to the subway C and D lines which was pretty convenient and is only 8 minutes away from the 1 line in addition to a lot of stores, restaurants, pubs and banks. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at Tina's and would stay there again if I revisit Manhattan.
A lovely quiet little spot, great for checking out Brooklyn.

Very rad and well laid out living space in NYC! Jennifer and her roommates were super friendly and attentive. The apartment was v warm and comfy despite the cold NYC winter and was great spot to relax and recharge. Probably the best airbnb stay so far!

It is as magical as it advertises. Clean, comfortable with nice little details from our hosts. Bathtub, great teas, comfy bed in the main room and a spare bedroom. The neighborhood is safe, very quiet and nice. It is not the most famous part of New York City, which gives you the truly local experience. The neighbors are kind. You will not want to leave the place ever.

This was a great place to stay for a week in NYC. Very convenient to the subway and a pretty quiet neighborhood. Jillian told me everything I needed to know in great detail before arriving, so had no problem checking in or finding anything I needed while there.
Everything was amazing!

Daniel's 2 bed condo is located right off of Upper West Central Park gate! We stayed there for 8 nights for our family winter vacation and it was great. Many days, we walked cross the park to go to museums in east side. The condo was newly renovated with hardwood floor, sparkling bath, brand new kitchen. All beds were very comfortable and the rooms are all big. The large living room has a electric?fireplace we enjoyed much. We had agreement to feed their cat and she was very quiet and nice. Only one missing in this condo was  no dining set other than kitchen  counter bar stools(maybe it is normal N.Y. city life?^^). It is just bc we like to enjoy our breakfast in table. Daniel was very responsive and we had no major issue during our stay. It was super comfortable.

Had an amazing stay!
Very clean
Very helpful

Joana has been a great host. She was away while we were at her place but she was quick to answer and to solve any problem, she also gave us many advices on how to get to Manhattan and good places where to eat. The house was comfortable and bright, it was a really nice stay.
Good place

Super close to the subway station, literally 3 or 4 houses away. No problems with next door, walls seem thin so you can hear them walking around but it was not a problem at all after 9pm. Don't be wary of the area in Brooklyn this location is at, the local convenience store has kind employees and the people mind their own. I would recommend staying here if you plan on being on the subway daily, very straightforward to figure out and the A/C train lines will get you where you want to be, or you'll only have to change trains once to get elsewhere.
Beautiful space, adorable and friendly cat, incredible location.
Yes

It was my first time in NYC and i could not ask for a better host. Mercedes was so nice and helpful. The room is quite adequate, it has a large bed and a large wardrobe plus the bathroom was right next to my door. It was amazing. The apartment is located in the heart of Brooklyn. It was very easy to find and very close to the tube station Greenpoint Avenue. I felt in very good hands. I highly recommend it.
It was nice trip! My friend and I could spend amazing time in this house! Thank you

First time using Airbnb and couldnr be more happy!!Mercedes was amazing!!she was fast to answer any questions i had, made us feel welcome as soon as walked in,gave us very helpful advices,and was okay with us coming in at late hours. Her house is very chill, and very modern.shekeeps it really clean and organized.would definitely come back when i go to Nyc again
Mila was wonderful! Super communicative and very understanding. Thank you for having us!

Nice location, close to subways,friendly and knowledgable host,  prepare yourself by bringing the following,  your own clean sheets, air freshener, your own pillows, some raid, another helpful hint might be bring your own cooler, and after your vacation through all your clothes immediately into the dryer. 
 Overall the price he charged it's comparable to the accommodations.  If you're looking for a cheap place only to sleep  and don't really care about the cleanliness.   You can take the subway within walking distance from his place and it's only one subway straight to Times Square proximately 15 minutes.

Fantastic location! Everything you need is within a short walk. easy access to public transportation. Central Park, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, Upper West Side, all within a short walk. Several garages within a block where you can store your car. The place was clean, cozy, and tastefully decorated. Communication with host was quick and easy. I'd definitely stay here again.
Very great value for the price

Amos apartment was much more than my expectancies, he has been very flexible about check in and check out times. Everything was very clean and the responses were very quick. The location was the best with subway just round the corner.  Could not have spent better holydays in his place. Monique

Had such a great time at Martin's place. Great location in East Williamsburg, a short walk to the L train, with a small gym in the complex, washer/dryer in the apartment, and a great view!
The room was cozy, with it's own heater/aircon. Martin himself was super attentive and responsive to messages, checking in to make sure I had everything I needed. His flatmate Adam was super helpful with everything too. Definitely recommend staying in this space.

Photos don't do justice - ample, well-equipped flat decorated and cleaned to a very high standard. Prime location, close to 2 subway stations and countless shops, bars and cafes in the vicinity with a fantastic blend of cultures - Kosher, Latin American, Chinese, Vietnamese, all under 10m walking distance.

Anne-Laure is an amazing host! Extremely friendly, knowledgeable of local food and transport, while also being a food connoisseur! Our room was comfortable and the space was exactly as described in the description. We would definitely recommend this location again.
Perfect spot to stay everything within distance of the apartment...place was really clean and comfy....I really enjoyed my stay.....Will definitely book again

Incredible place! It's very difficult to find such new, clean, well-designed bedroom with private bathroom in New York. Tons bars, restaurants and coffee shops in 5 min walking distance from the house. The neighborhood is very quiet and safe. Close to the subway statio (Website hidden by Airbnb) and another station with G line. It's really 15 min to Manhattan. I'm meeting here a lot of great people who really become my friends. I'm come back soon for sure! Highly recommend this place.

We had such a great time at Dani's apartment and we totally fell in love with her sweet cat Lucas. Dani is a great host, she is friendly and helpful, she gave us great tips and answered all questions immediately.

The space was good and clean. There were many good amenities,especially appliances. The location was not so far from the station. And supermarkets or restaurants were near the house. So it will be convenient for you.

An amazing place in Brooklyn!, 5 minutes walk to the G train which can take you into the city or deeper into Brooklyn. The area around the apartment is filled with endless places to eat as well as convenience stores and pharmacies so you can never run out of choices.

Though I wasn't able to meet Aakanksha she was very helpful during the course of the stay, messaging and asking if everything was ok as well as being very very helpful. 

The place was spotless and very clean, plus the neighborhood is really quiet, away from the bustle of Manhattan.

It was a great stay and I would definetly stay again!
Lovely
Danny is great
Logan is a professional and thoughtful host, making the entire stay easy and clear. His apartment is lovely and in a convenient location. Great value, too - I'd stay here again!

Luna's place was lovely and clean, and we got a good night's sleep each evening. It's a great little apartment, very stylish and comfortable with wifi and the apartment block felt very safe. It was also within walking distance to loads of places for food and drinks - we particularly love Champs, and we also visited Skytown for $3 tacos and a popular Vietnamese place round the corner. Very enjoyable, great value and would recommend. Thanks Luna for having us stay!

The place was very nice. Just what we were looking for to tour around the city. Location is PERFECT! You can get anywhere in the city very quickly. It was very tidy and clean. Malcolm also used a service to help us during our stay which was really nice, really good communicators and super helpful with advice! Look forward to staying here again.
Joseph was a great host- he cooked delicious food, lived in a stylish little apartment, and was a funny guy. Would recommend to a friend 10/10.
Great price. AMAZING COMMUNICATION from Kathleen. A bit of a walk to subway but it is manageable. The listing description is accurate. I would recommend this place if you are traveling on a budget.

Lauren's place is amazing for what if costs. The unit is incredibly clean, with lots of style, and an incredible view of the water. It's also a very well run building which is nice and quiet with extra security at the front desk. 

Lauren was very communicative and her place exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay at Lauren's place again.

Our stay at Jeffs place was enjoyable. We spent more time inside that we planned because we got sick before arriving there. We were taken care of. The host was really friendly and he helped us with our wifi problems and was always smiling and joking around. We didn't have a window in our room,  but for us it wasn't a big deal. We had a good bed and enough space for two people and 4 suitcases. I would go there again. But just so you know, it does take over 40 minutes to Times Square from Bronx. It did help a lot that the metro stop was just around the corner.

We contacted Angela and Dylan when another host cancelled for a place in Brooklyn at the last minute. They were exceptional in accepting very quickly our request, even though they were abroad at the time. The house is beautiful, even better than the pictures which already announced a very cozy and tastefully decorated place. Because they were abroad, we were greeted by a neighbor and friend who lives next door and was very helpful with information about the house and neighborhood. The house is ideally located, a couple of street corners from the L line which took us to Manhattan in less than 15 minutes. The house is comfortable and the kitchen very well equipped. The only point to consider for people with limited mobility is the staircases, as the house spreads on 3 floors (4 including the basement), but in our case it was not a problem.  We had a truly great time and would certainly go back.

Marta was an amazing host! She prepared everything in order to feel like us to be at our home, she was very clear in the explanation of the apartment and the neighborhood, she was quick in the communication, she was caring and very kind. We had a lovely stay in a lovely place! Super recommended!

Great :
- modern apartment
- not noisy
- comfy bed
- excellent heater
- close to city center
Less great :
- hair in the bathroom sink and bath
- dust on the floor and we had to clean a bit to keep socks clean.
Great place, fast customer service, fast responses!
Theresa is an outstanding host, christmas cookies and all. great location just blocks from 30th Ave and its many restaurants, shops etc. Convenient to subway and just a few minutes to mid-town.
Awesome place

Tillie and Anthony were cordial host, always helpful and nice. They helped us (to me and my girlfriend) anytime almost on-line. Their appartment is very good located, close to the Central Park and significant stop of subway. The appartment is not so big but comfortable for pair.
Not a romantic getaway but great for budget work travel. Mario was a great host.

Joy is an incredible host. Very open to communication and willing to accommodate. The place is honestly a steal considering the private room and amenities that came with. Simply put, I would have no problems suggesting it to any friends or family.
Would recommend

This was a nice apartment with an amazing location, and Stacy (who helps manage the space) was very responsible and kind! We had a great time staying here, and the value for the location, privacy, and size of the apartment is excellent. We really liked the vibe and layout of the space. One small note is that the queen bed doesn't have a true mattress, only a memory foam mattress topper. We were fine with it, and the place is absolutely still worth the price, but just something to keep in mind.

This was my second time staying at Myriam's place. My second time was just as good as my first stay. The place is clean, check in was super easy and Myriam offered a lot of tips on groceries and restaurants. The building is also very safe with a 24/7 doorman. Would love to be welcomed back! 

Thanks Myriam

Great experience at Adam's place. Great location in the Upper East Side as well as great proximity to transportation via bus and subway. Easy to get to places all over Manhattan. Overall loved the place and loved the stay highly recommend.
Would recommend this location for anyone. Joshua has a beautiful home and was a great host.
The host canceled this reservation 75 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Muy buena experiencia y atencion
Great location, easy access to the subway.
We had all the privacy in the world and staying here made your trip 10x better. It was truly a home away from home!

Todo perfecto en casa de Paige, cerca del centro de manhattan, muy atenta siempre y gradable. Cien por cien recomendable. Boca de metro frente a casa. En tan solo una linea estas en el centro. Zona muy tranquila, y lo que mas me gusto fue la cerveza fresquita al llegar, jjjjj

Apt is perfect for 2 people with a panoramic view on empire and freedom tower.
Pillows and matter are very soft, ideal to relax after hours of walking around nyc. Bathroom is clean and shower spacious. Anyway the whole apt is modern, cozy and clean.
There is also Netflix and Alexa ;) and a condominiums rooftop.
The neighborhood is lower east side LES with a lot of nice restaurants (chinese, Italian, deli, ecc..) and breakfast places (doughnuts, bagels, ecc).
In 2 mins from apt you can reach metro stations (at least 3) to go everywhere (downtown is 20 mins).
I really enjoy to stay and I recommend Lizzie apt!

Beyond having a super cute, well decorated and clean studio, Charlotte also was the ideal host. She gave us a priceless tour guide to the city, especially of Brooklyn. She was responsive although we didn't have to contact her about anything. She left us chocolate and extra beers. Nothing to say but thank you !  Shout out to the amazing Sonos system which made our trip extra fun ! 

xx Nastasia and Karen

We stayed here for the week before New Year's Eve during one of the coldest winters in New York history, so keep that in mind for this review.

First, the good stuff: the location is really excellent; we were able to walk a very short distance to all the subway stations, (very important when trying to avoid the cold), and it's close to Chelsea Market. The apartment was larger than I expected for Manhattan, maximizing main living/bedroom space, but with a tiny bathroom. We didn't use the secondary room at all because it was too cold (there is a cold draft from the skylight), nor the balcony that it leads to (obviously). The WIFI was very fast!

The apartment seems a bit old, heated only by two radiators, which get plenty hot. One morning, we woke up without hot water or heat. A quick text message to Jeanmarc, and he got it fixed by the time we came back. The kitchen is small, but has everything you need.

The bad: We had a harrowing experience trying to get in the apartment itself. Since Jeanmarc was in Florida, we spent a long time struggling with the lockbox, which we never did open, outside in the dark with our freezing fingers. Fortunately, we were able to get a backup key. There was also an Italian restaurant below the apartment which we could go inside for warmth (the pasta al Funghi is excellent). To his credit, Jeanmarc was always available by text and phone, and he made sure we got in that first night. But I would prefer check-in in person for my next trip.

Overall, we had a pretty good stay. We saved a lot of money versus a hotel, but we also sacrificed the hospitality, so it's just about right.
Great Stay!

My family and I were the first people to ever stay at Mukaram's recently renovated pad. It was perfect, and Pierre (who was in charge of checking in and managing our stay) was extremely friendly and thoughtful.

We definitely recommend this place!

Great location, big spacey room, but almost empty with few pieces of furniture , what are really old
Has no curtains on the window, so your next door neighbors can see everything. No tv, no internet, no microwave, Not enough plates even for two people. However the owner is really kind and does his best if smth is requested. 
Id probably rent it for long term, that it was enough time to make it more convenient and comfortable

This cute and stylish place was perfect for our stay. Very clean and the host is very accommodating! It was close to a subway station and walking distance to Central Park! Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to stay at your place
Beautiful Brooklyn apartment, great host. Would love to be back soon

We really appreciate our stay at Laural's flat !!! Laural wasn't here but her friends Maxine gave us a warm welcoming for our first time in Harlem . When we had some question Maxine answered quickly at any time . The flat was like shown on the pictures clean cosy well furnished .  We will come back for sure .a very good experience thank you to Laural and Maxine

We stayed at Agnes' place for the holidays. We wanted to be close to family in Bay Ridge but also be in a neighborhood where we could explore a bit. The place was centrally located, very nice clean apartment and Agnes was available for any questions we had. We had a great time and would recommend!

Amanda was very quick in responding! Her place was not only a great place to stay but felt homey right as I walked in. The space was more than enough for me and my two friends. Loved the place! Thank you Amanda!

Cute and comfortable space. Very convenient 5 minute walk to the subway station that will take you to Manhattan.  Two short blocks to a couple coffee shops and a grocery store for any basic needs. Nice neighborhood. Neat and clean room with a nice bathroom and kitchen area to use. Friendly hosts that communicate well and were very helpful with any questions at all.
Same as already written in the comment to Shahriq and Patty.
Very kind and welcoming hosts. Cute apartment and also clean! I would definitely stay again! Thanks for the stay!

We had a great time at Aliana's place. The apartment is very well located in Chelsea, close to several famius places of NY (Times Square, Bryant Park...) and it was easy to communicate with Aliana. don't hesitate to go there in winter : heating works well !! Moreover, We have felt very welcomed, by Aliana and her parents, thank you very much!
Good place
Great!
Perfect spot walking distance from food shopping and transit. Clean location very quit
Our stay was simply fantastic. Marcelo is an amazing host. Your Apartment is very comfortable and has everything we need. I recommend.
Great place and close to metro station. Stanley is a nice guy.

Gorgeous Brooklyn apartment, literally looks like a place out of a movie! My family and I were very pleased with our stay, as Ashley's place was just as promised including the space, city views and the super easy transportation to Manhattan. She and Ryan were very hospitable, making sure to offer us help when needed and making us feel welcome in their home. They also left us a bottle of wine to celebrate the New Year which was a thoughtful and generous gesture that made our stay extra special!
Amazing host! 100% recommended!
Good

Everything was awesome about our stay!
We had a great time.
Location was great, I loved all the designer touches.

Soel was friendly and truly accommodating when we struggled with cancellation of flights due to weather, lending us her phone and making sure my daughter could stay two extra nights. Unfortunately there is a main complaint to be made about the cleanliness of the place. Floors and the bathroom were the major issues, and there was no possibility of making food in the kitchen.

Geoff's apartment is beautiful, and he is an amazing host. 

The apartment is modern, perfectly clean and on a quiet block.  Geoff met me at the apartment with the keys and answered all my questions.  He even left a few snacks for me.  The bed was really comfortable - really soft sheets and a great memory foam mattress.  The kitchen, living room and bathroom were spotless and there's also a private rooftop with an incredible view! The area is quiet and safe, and it is just a few minutes walk to the subway, which is only 2 stops from Manhattan. In one direction you can walk to South Park Slope, where there are some cute restaurants, bars and shops.  In the other direction you can head into Sunset Park where there is a lovely park and lots of authentic Mexican restaurants. 

Communication with Geoff was outstanding, and he did everything I could to make sure I had a great time.  This is the kind of Airbnb experience every guest dreams of having. Thanks Geoff for letting me stay in your beautiful home and for all you did! I hope to come back soon!
Very conveniently located, 2 minute walk to the subway stop and central park. Emily is a great host, very thoughtful and easy to communicate with. The apartment is super cute!

Emma's place was everything we expected and beyond that a memorable experience. We were a group of 4 and really enjoyed the place to ourselves as it was just exactly as described. Sunny, airy, cozy. The amazing view of the East River and Manhattan Bridge every day was just mesmerizing and inspiring to enjoy our days in NYC for New Year's Eve 2018. It's definitely in a prime location as well in the center of Dumbo with many eateries and shops nearby close to the Brooklyn Bridge Park. The apartment is definitely worth the trip across the bridge just for the view and away from the buzzing Manhattan noise. Also, the host, Emma, kept in touch through text during our trip and answered to any inquiries and questions I had.
Carolyn is a great host with a great space. Prompt communication and I could tell she really wanted us to have the best stay as possible
She was a great host! Would definitely use again!!
Nice stay, everything went smooth. Central living for three guys over the NYC new years :)
We loved the cozy cave.  Our hosts were super welcoming. Great location

This might not be everybody's cup of tea. It's certainly funky. But it's definitely an interesting place with a cool vibe. The hosts were great. The location is fantastic. And don't let the building scare you from the outside. Once you're inside, it's very cool. And it's a quick walk to some great food as well as the subway. Very friendly neighborhood. I'd rebook here again.

The place was so lovely! So much character, and in a way that seemed like an authentic representation of the host rather than a generic attempt to be stylish or hip. It was also soooo close to the A/C train, like three blocks. There's a local market a block away. And there's a Walgreens three and a half blocks away, and Lors of fast food options as well as local restaurant options within one to three blocks, from a Dominican restaurant, to a bakery with some vegan options, to chains for chicken and a Burger King. 

Also, the service was so human and responsive! Really caring people live here, and I'd so recommend it!

Additionally, impeccable value for Brooklyn!

The location is not bad cuz the subway station is not far, so does the grocery store. The place was rather cozy and perfectly decorated. Ji was very nice. We had a wonderful experience by staying here.
No elevator which is explained by host but 4th floor is challenging with luggage.   So very close quarters hard to maneuver in bathroom and shower.

Allan is wonderful to work with and his apartment is delightful. Great interior, wonderful neighborhood and easy to move around the city. The neighborhood has a great jibe, restaurants, bars and shopping. Definitely recommend!
Definitely stay with this group, very nice properties and Kitty is wonderful.

An spectacular apartment for three people, comfortable and well central, just 10 minutes from Times Square and 8 minutes from Grand Central Terminal, plus shopping areas, I did not have the opportunity to meet Min and his wife but my daughter did it and they were very lovely with her. I recommend your room not only because of the location but because there is no noise and it is good to rest.

Despite we haven't met Guy during our stay, he organized it so well. His friend met us right on 24th Dec to  givete keys. We've been absolutely alone in the whole apartment during several days, and then sometimes we met his kind (Hidden by Airbnb) . The apmt has all you need for comfort staying, subway is about 10-15min.walking or 5min.by bus.And it is close to NYC.
This airbnb is very neat and clean.
Good place. Easy to get to New York. And pretty private.

Natalia was a great host! Super easy to communicate with and made my stay even better! The location is super close to plenty of food and transportation is a few blocks away. Would recommend this place to a friend!
Left us stranded when crazy cold on NYE. 0 communications.
Great place. Would totally stay again :)
Very cozy, and well decorated. The apartment location is interesting to say the least. Very close to food and New York attractions. Jason was overall a great host.
Beautiful apartment with amazing view and location! It exceeded our expectations and was a perfect stay.

The photo of Sina's room did not represent what my brother and I walked into for our four day stay. His room was a mess - dirty linens, unmade bed, dirty rug/floor, stained sofa (that he told me someone could comfortably sleep on), dirty bathroom, dirty kitchen, and no toilet paper. My brother and I were extremely uncomfortable at Sina's but had no choice but to stay as it was a busy time in NYC. We could not believe how dirty his apartment was. DO NOT HOST IF YOU CANNOT ACCOMMODATE FOR YOUR GUESTS. We actually had to go out and buy new sheets, towels, bathroom cleaner, and toilet paper it was that disgusting. I absolutely do not recommend anyone staying at Sina's. For the amount that we had to pay for our stay, we are outraged that we did not get a refund.
